``_`` I_PRP have_VBP the_DT honour_NN ,_, on_IN behalf_NN of_IN the_DT Malaria_NNP Committee_NNP ,_, to_TO forward_VB a_DT report_NN submitted_VBN by_IN Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP on_IN the_DT causes_NNS and_CC preventibility_NN of_IN malaria_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
We_PRP would_MD point_VB out_RP in_IN forwarding_VBG the_DT report_NN that_IN ,_, while_IN the_DT report_NN shows_VBZ the_DT condition_NN of_IN the_DT city_NN to_TO be_VB in_IN many_JJ respects_NNS most_RBS serious_JJ ,_, it_PRP also_RB gives_VBZ good_JJ ground_NN for_IN believing_VBG in_IN the_DT possibility_NN of_IN effective_JJ remedial_JJ action_NN ._.
The_DT figures_NNS given_VBN by_IN Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP in_IN paragraphs_NN 66_CD and_CC 67_CD show_VBP the_DT appalling_JJ prevalence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, especially_RB among_IN children_NNS ,_, in_IN several_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT town_NN ,_, while_IN the_DT annual_JJ pecuniary_JJ loss_NN of_IN 13_CD lakhs_NN ,_, which_WDT he_PRP calculates_VBZ the_DT disease_NN to_TO cause_VB to_TO the_DT city_NN ,_, is_VBZ only_RB an_DT indication_NN of_IN the_DT suffering_NN that_WDT is_VBZ inflicted_VBN ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP makes_VBZ it_PRP clear_JJ that_IN the_DT Island_NNP of_IN Bombay_NNP is_VBZ not_RB naturally_RB very_RB malarious_JJ ._.
He_PRP points_VBZ out_RP that_IN there_EX is_VBZ no_DT connection_NN between_IN the_DT disease_NN and_CC climatic_JJ causes_NNS ,_, while_IN many_JJ of_IN the_DT natural_JJ conditions_NNS are_VBP favourable_JJ for_IN dealing_VBG with_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ the_DT highly_RB developed_JJ southern_JJ portion_NN of_IN the_DT Island_NNP which_WDT is_VBZ stricken_VBN with_IN malaria_NNS ,_, and_CC every_DT outbreak_NN that_WDT has_VBZ occurred_VBN ,_, whether_IN in_IN Mazagaon_NNP ,_, Malabar_NNP Hill_NNP ,_, the_DT New_NNP Docks_NNP or_CC in_IN the_DT Fort_NNP Division_NNP ,_, has_VBZ been_VBN traceable_JJ to_TO some_DT clear_JJ and_CC eradicable_JJ source_NN ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT large_JJ works_NNS of_IN development_NN which_WDT are_VBP inevitable_JJ in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ reassuring_VBG to_TO know_VB that_DT such_JJ large_JJ works_NNS do_VBP not_RB necessarily_RB cause_VB outbreaks_NNS of_IN malaria_NN ._.
Various_JJ works_NNS have_VBP been_VBN completed_VBN without_IN any_DT outbreak_NN ,_, and_CC even_RB at_IN the_DT new_JJ docks_NNS ,_, where_WRB the_DT work_NN is_VBZ popularly_RB supposed_VBN to_TO have_VB caused_VBN the_DT severe_JJ epidemic_NN of_IN 1908_CD ,_, Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP shows_VBZ that_IN this_DT out-_JJ break_NN only_RB occurred_VBD three_CD years_NNS after_IN the_DT commencement_NN of_IN the_DT undertaking_NN ._.
Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP 's_POS conclusions_NNS may_MD ,_, we_PRP think_VBP ,_, be_VB accepted_VBN that_IN such_JJ outbreaks_NNS are_VBP inevitable_JJ only_RB when_WRB a_DT permanent_JJ source_NN of_IN infection_NN exists_NNS in_IN the_DT neighbourhood_NN ._.

The_DT artificial_JJ nature_NN of_IN the_DT hold_NN of_IN malaria_NN is_VBZ further_RBR established_VBN by_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT Parsi_NNP community_NN ._.
As_IN Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP points_NNS out_RP ,_, this_DT community_NN is_VBZ much_RB above_IN the_DT average_NN in_IN their_PRP$ general_JJ standard_NN of_IN living_NN ,_, in_IN education_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN their_PRP$ readiness_NN to_TO take_VB advantage_NN of_IN medical_JJ advice_NN ._.
They_PRP are_VBP ,_, moreover_RB ,_, not_RB so_RB liable_JJ to_TO be_VB affected_VBN by_IN a_DT rise_NN in_IN the_DT prices_NNS of_IN necessary_JJ food_NN stuffs_NNS ,_, the_DT effect_NN of_IN which_WDT is_VBZ so_RB immediate_JJ in_IN increasing_VBG malaria_NN ._.
Yet_RB this_DT community_NN suffers_VBZ ,_, as_IN Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP 's_POS figures_NNS show_VBP ,_, far_RB more_RBR than_IN any_DT other_JJ from_IN malaria_NNS ._.
If_IN it_PRP could_MD be_VB imagined_VBN that_IN this_DT was_VBD due_JJ to_TO any_DT racial_JJ susceptibility_NN ,_, this_DT would_MD be_VB disproved_VBN by_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN in_IN D_NNP Ward_NNP the_DT Parsis_NNP do_VBP not_RB suffer_VB more_JJR than_IN the_DT other_JJ races_NNS ._.
Moreover_RB ,_, in_IN the_DT wards_NNS in_IN which_WDT they_PRP are_VBP chiefly_JJ affected_VBN ,_, other_JJ races_NNS suffer_VBP ,_, though_IN not_RB to_TO the_DT same_JJ extent_NN ,_, yet_RB very_RB severely_RB and_CC far_RB more_JJR than_IN in_IN other_JJ wards_NNS ._.
That_IN the_DT incidence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN coincides_VBZ with_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN wells-many_NN of_IN them_PRP inside_IN houses-_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB said_VBD to_TO be_VB accidental_JJ ._.
The_DT figures_NNS in_IN Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP 's_POS para-_JJ graph_NN 167_CD show_NN that_IN 75_CD percent_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT breeding_NN places_NNS of_IN the_DT most_RBS dangerous_JJ anopheles_NNS mosquito_WDT were_VBD to_TO be_VB found_VBN in_IN these_DT wells_NNS and_CC cisterns_NNS ,_, and_CC it_PRP must_MD be_VB taken_VBN that_IN these_DT wells_NNS and_CC cisterns_NNS are_VBP the_DT chief_JJ local_JJ cause_NN of_IN infection_NN ._.

``_`` 3_CD ._.
The_DT necessity_NN for_IN early_JJ action_NN appears_VBZ obvious_JJ ._.
The_DT state_NN of_IN the_DT southern_JJ portion_NN of_IN the_DT Island_NNP is_VBZ already_RB serious_JJ ,_, and_CC important_JJ works_NNS are_VBP in_IN progress_NN or_CC in_IN contemplation_NN the_DT proximity_NN of_IN which_WDT to_TO permanent_VB sources_NNS of_IN infection_NN may_MD always_RB cause_VB another_DT epidemic_NN ._.
Moreover_RB ,_, the_DT development_NN of_IN the_DT northern_JJ portion_NN of_IN the_DT Island_NNP is_VBZ rapidly_RB progressing_VBG ._.
There_EX is_VBZ a_DT constant_JJ stream_NN of_IN migration_NN towards_NNS it_PRP from_IN the_DT southern_JJ portion_NN ,_, and_CC improved_JJ means_NNS of_IN communication_NN ,_, also_RB involving_VBG the_DT means_NNS of_IN spreading_VBG the_DT disease_NN ,_, are_VBP being_VBG provided_VBN ._.
Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP declares_NNS ,_, and_CC we_PRP think_VBP proves_NNS ,_, that_IN the_DT eradica_NN ._.
tion_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ possible_JJ ,_, but_CC the_DT difficulties_NNS of_IN the_DT task_NN will_MD clearly_RB be_VB greatly_RB increased_VBN by_IN further_JJ delay_NN ._.
``_`` 4_CD ._.
It_PRP can_MD not_RB be_VB said_VBD that_IN measures_NNS taken_VBN in_IN the_DT past_NN have_VBP been_VBN such_JJ as_IN to_TO be_VB really_RB effectual_JJ ._.
Although_IN the_DT Corporation_NNP began_VBD to_TO move_VB in_IN the_DT matter_NN in_IN 1902_CD ,_, practically_RB no_DT good_NN was_VBD done_VBN till_NN 1909_CD ,_, and_CC the_DT epidemic_NN of_IN 1908_CD was_VBD particularly_RB severe_JJ ._.
Since_IN 1909_CD some_DT improvement_NN has_VBZ been_VBN caused_VBN by_IN the_DT action_NN taken_VBN near_IN the_DT docks_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT reduction_NN in_IN the_DT spleen_JJ rate_NN quoted_VBN by_IN Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP in_IN his_PRP$ paragraph_NN 293_CD shows_VBZ the_DT beneficial_JJ results_NNS of_IN this_DT action_NN ._.
The_DT Municipality_NNP have_VBP greatly_RB improved_VBN the_DT condition_NN of_IN the_DT Bhandarwada_NNP Reservoir_NNP and_CC are_VBP taking_VBG similar_JJ action_NN at_IN Malabar_NNP Hill_NNP ._.
The_DT Health_NNP Department_NNP have_VBP also_RB devoted_VBN a_DT large_JJ amount_NN of_IN attention_NN to_TO the_DT destruction_NN of_IN mosquito_NN larv_NN and_CC have_VBP reported_VBN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN wells_NNS to_TO the_DT Standing_NNP Committee_NNP for_IN action_NN ._.
The_DT measures_NNS taken_VBN ,_, however_RB ,_, by_IN the_DT Standing_NNP Committee_NNP are_VBP necessarily_RB slow_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT Health_NNP Officer_NNP 's_POS quarterly_JJ reports_NNS indicate_VBP that_IN the_DT rate_NN at_IN which_WDT wells_NNS are_VBP dealt_JJ with_IN is_VBZ not_RB so_RB rapid_JJ as_IN to_TO prevent_VB the_DT spread_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.

It_PRP appears_VBZ to_TO us_PRP to_TO be_VB clear_JJ that_IN more_RBR energetic_JJ and_CC systematized_JJ action_NN is_VBZ necessary_JJ if_IN any_DT real_JJ good_NN is_VBZ to_TO be_VB done_VBN ,_, and_CC if_IN the_DT money_NN already_RB spent_VBN is_VBZ not_RB to_TO be_VB regarded_VBN as_IN wasted_VBN ._.
Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP shows_VBZ what_WP the_DT result_NN of_IN such_JJ action_NN has_VBZ been_VBN in_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT world_NN ,_, in_IN many_JJ of_IN which_WDT the_DT conditions_NNS ,_, both_DT of_IN climate_NN and_CC administration_NN ,_, are_VBP far_RB less_RBR favourable_JJ than_IN those_DT found_VBN in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
It_PRP will_MD hardly_RB be_VB maintained_VBN that_IN action_NN which_WDT has_VBZ ,_, proved_VBN entirely_RB successful_JJ with_IN the_DT backward_JJ populations_NNS of_IN South_JJ American_JJ cities_NNS or_CC in_IN petty_JJ islands_NNS of_IN the_DT West_NNP Indies_NNPS can_MD not_RB be_VB applied_VBN in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
It_PRP seems_VBZ clear_JJ that_IN some_DT legislative_JJ power_NN must_MD be_VB taken_VBN to_TO ensure_VB the_DT entire_JJ prevention_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ ,_, however_RB ,_, in_IN the_DT first_JJ place_NN useless_NN to_TO enact_VB sanitary_JJ clauses_NNS to_TO which_WDT a_DT penalty_NN is_VBZ attached_VBN unless_IN they_PRP will_MD be_VB given_VBN effect_NN to_TO by_IN the_DT magistrates_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT figures_NNS given_VBN by_IN Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP show_VB how_WRB extremely_RB lenient_JJ is_VBZ the_DT standard_NN of_IN magisterial_JJ action_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
It_PRP seems_VBZ further_JJ necessary_JJ to_TO insert_VB some_DT provision_NN to_TO prevent_VB the_DT breeding_NN of_IN malaria_NNS bearing_VBG insects_NNS and_CC to_TO render_VB wilful_JJ carelessness_NN in_IN this_DT direction_NN punishable_NN ._.
Such_JJ powers_NNS must_MD doubtless_VB be_VB exercised_VBN with_IN great_JJ discretion_NN ,_, but_CC if_IN they_PRP have_VBP not_RB been_VBN found_VBN oppressive_JJ elsewhere_RB ,_, it_PRP can_MD not_RB be_VB supposed_VBN that_IN they_PRP will_MD be_VB found_VBN so_RB in_IN a_DT city_NN such_JJ as_IN Bombay_NNP where_WRB opportunities_NNS for_IN appeal_NN ,_, and_CC public_JJ complaint_NN are_VBP so_RB readily_RB available_JJ ._.
In_IN a_DT matter_NN of_IN this_DT kind_NN we_PRP think_VBP it_PRP clear_JJ that_IN the_DT initiative_NN must_MD come_VB from_IN Government_NNP ._.
We_PRP agree_VBP further_JJ with_IN Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP that_IN the_DT Municipal_NNP Commissioner_NNP should_MD be_VB given_VBN further_JJ powers_NNS under_IN the_DT very_RB important_JJ section_NN 381_CD of_IN the_DT Municipal_NNP Act_NNP ._.
At_IN present_JJ he_PRP can_MD only_RB move_VB the_DT Standing_NNP Committee_NNP to_TO take_VB action_NN ,_, and_CC such_JJ action_NN is_VBZ inevitably_RB so_RB delayed_JJ as_IN to_TO lose_VB much_RB of_IN its_PRP$ effect_NN ._.
The_DT Standing_NNP Committee_NNP only_RB sees_VBZ the_DT wells_NNS reported_VBN upon_IN at_IN long_JJ intervals_NNS ,_, and_CC even_RB when_WRB they_PRP have_VBP passed_VBN an_DT order_NN for_IN closing_VBG a_DT well_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ no_DT means_NN for_IN doing_VBG so_RB ,_, except_IN through_IN magisterial_JJ process_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ exceedingly_RB slow_JJ ._.
``_`` 6_CD ._.
In_IN many_JJ cases_NNS objections_NNS have_VBP been_VBN raised_VBN on_IN religious_JJ grounds_NNS to_TO the_DT entire_JJ closing_NN of_IN wells_NNS :_: and_CC in_IN others_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN those_DT of_IN wells_NNS situated_VBN in_IN gardens_NNS and_CC compounds_NNS ,_, the_DT water_NN of_IN the_DT wells_NNS may_MD be_VB beneficially_RB used_VBN for_IN various_JJ purposes_NNS ,_, though_IN the_DT wells_NNS themselves_PRP are_VBP liable_JJ to_TO become_VB breeding_JJ places_NNS for_IN mosquitoes_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ in_IN wells_NNS such_JJ as_IN these_DT that_IN fish_NN of_IN the_DT species_NNS mentioned_VBN in_IN paragraphs_NN 189_CD to_TO 193_CD of_IN the_DT report_NN can_MD be_VB employed_VBN ,_, and_CC especially_RB the_DT kazari_JJ fish_NN ._.
These_DT fish_NNS have_VBP not_RB ,_, we_PRP believe_VBP ,_, been_VBN tried_VBN '_'' sufficiently_RB in_IN many_JJ of_IN the_DT Bombay_NNP wells_NNS ,_, nor_CC for_IN sufficiently_RB long_RB a_DT period_NN ,_, to_TO enable_VB the_DT degree_NN of_IN pollution_NN and_CC of_IN want_NN of_IN air_NN which_WDT they_PRP can_MD survive_VB in_IN interior_JJ wells_NNS to_TO be_VB stated_VBN with_IN confidence_NN ;_: and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ probable_JJ that_IN in_IN wells_NNS into_IN which_WDT rubbish_NN is_VBZ thrown_VBN or_CC finds_VBZ its_PRP$ way_NN ,_, they_PRP are_VBP of_IN little_JJ use_NN in_IN keeping_VBG down_RP mosquito_NNS larv_NN ._.
But_CC in_IN many_JJ wells_NNS their_PRP$ presence_NN has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN beneficial_JJ ,_, and_CC we_PRP consider_VBP that_IN an_DT effort_NN should_MD be_VB made_VBN to_TO extend_VB the_DT use_NN of_IN this_DT cheap_JJ and_CC innocuous_JJ method_NN of_IN dealing_VBG with_IN the_DT existing_VBG evil_NN ._.
We_PRP consider_VBP therefore_RB that_IN wells_NNS should_MD be_VB divided_VBN by_IN the_DT Health_NNP Department_NNP of_IN the_DT Munici-_NNP pality_NN into_IN the_DT following_JJ classes_NNS :_: -_: (_( 1_CD )_) Those_DT within_IN or_CC close_VB to_TO houses_NNS which_WDT are_VBP found_VBN to_TO be_VB polluted_VBN with_IN sewage_NN ,_, or_CC whose_WP$ conditions_NNS render_VBP their_PRP$ successful_JJ stocking_NN with_IN fish_JJ impracticable_NN ._.
These_DT should_MD be_VB ,_, if_IN possible_JJ ,_, filled_VBD up_RP ,_, or_CC if_IN not_RB filled_VBN up_RP ,_, covered_VBN with_IN a_DT covering_NN of_IN concrete_NN and_CC masonry_NN impervious_JJ to_TO air_NN ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) Similar_NNP wells_NNS ,_, which_WDT are_VBP genuinely_RB and_CC regularly_RB used_VBN for_IN religious_JJ purposes_NNS ._.
These_DT should_MD be_VB covered_VBN with_IN a_DT concrete_JJ cover_NN with_IN a_DT trap-door_NN of_IN gauze_NN covering_NN ,_, through_IN which_WDT water_NN may_MD be_VB drawn_VBN ._.
These_DT wells_NNS should_MD be_VB licensed_VBN ,_, and_CC ,_, the_DT license_NN should_MD be_VB withdrawable_JJ by_IN the_DT Commissioner_NNP in_IN the_DT event_NN of_IN the_DT trap-_JJ door_NN being_VBG found_VBN not_RB to_TO be_VB mosquitoproof_JJ ,_, or_CC to_TO be_VB left_VBN constantly_RB open_JJ ._.
The_DT license_NN should_MD be_VB renewable_JJ on_IN a_DT payment_NN of_IN Rs_NNP ._.
5_CD ,_, but_CC in_IN the_DT event_NN of_IN a_DT second_JJ withdrawal_NN being_VBG necessary_JJ ,_, the_DT well_NN should_MD be_VB subject_JJ to_TO closing_VBG on_IN the_DT order_NN of_IN the_DT Commissioner_NNP ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) Wells_NNP inside_NN or_CC in_IN the_DT vicinity_NN of_IN houses_NNS in_IN which_WDT anopheles_NNS larv_NNS are_VBP discovered_VBN ._.
The_DT owners_NNS of_IN these_DT should_MD be_VB required_VBN (_( a_DT )_) either_DT to_TO fill_VB up_RP or_CC cover_VB hermetically_RB such_JJ wells_NNS ,_, or_CC in_IN cases_NNS in_IN which_WDT the_DT water_NN is_VBZ required_VBN for_IN use_NN for_IN religious_JJ purposes_NNS ,_, to_TO cover_VB with_IN a_DT double_JJ gauze_NN cover_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT latter_JJ case_NN a_DT license_NN would_MD be_VB issued_VBN ,_, and_CC would_MD be_VB withdrawable_JJ as_IN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN class_NN (_( 2_CD )_) above_IN ,_, and_CC would_MD be_VB re-issuable_JJ only_RB on_IN payment_NN ,_, or_CC (_( b_NN )_) to_TO clean_VB them_PRP and_CC stock_NN them_PRP with_IN fish_NN which_WDT would_MD in_IN the_DT first_JJ instance_NN be_VB supplied_VBN by_IN the_DT Municipality_NNP ._.
These_DT wells_NNS would_MD be_VB subject_JJ to_TO constant_JJ inspection_NN ,_, fortnightly_RB or_CC ,_, if_IN necessary_JJ ,_, weekly_JJ ._.
They_PRP would_MD be_VB licensed_VBN by_IN the_DT Commissioner_NNP ,_, without_IN the_DT payment_NN of_IN any_DT fee_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN cases_NNS in_IN which_WDT the_DT well_NN was_VBD found_VBN not_RB to_TO be_VB kept_VBN clear_JJ from_IN rubbish_JJ ,_, or_CC in_IN which_WDT the_DT stock_NN of_IN fish_NN had_VBD died_VBN out_RP or_CC become_VB insufficient_JJ ,_, as_IN proved_VBN by_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN anopheles_NNS larv_UH ,_, the_DT license_NN would_MD be_VB withdrawn_VBN by_IN the_DT Commissioner_NNP and_CC would_MD only_RB be_VB reissuable_JJ on_IN the_DT payment_NN of_IN a_DT fee_NN of_IN Rs_NNP ._.
5_CD ._.
Although_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN inspection_NN involved_VBN in_IN these_DT proposals_NNS would_MD necessarily_RB be_VB large_JJ and_CC constant_JJ ,_, we_PRP consider_VBP that_IN there_EX is_VBZ no_DT reason_NN why_WRB it_PRP should_MD be_VB in_IN any_DT way_NN inquisitorial_JJ ;_: and_CC the_DT annoyance_NN often_RB caused_VBN by_IN such_JJ visits_NNS ,_, however_RB inoffensively_RB conducted_VBN ,_, could_MD be_VB prevented_VBN by_IN having_VBG them_PRP on_IN a_DT fixed_JJ day_NN for_IN each_DT locality_NN ,_, so_IN that_DT owners_NNS could_MD be_VB present_JJ and_CC could_MD satisfy_VB themselves_PRP of_IN the_DT fairness_NN of_IN the_DT method_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT inspection_NN was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP ._.
``_`` 7_CD ._.
We_PRP consider_VBP that_DT in_IN this_DT way_NN full_JJ respect_NN would_MD be_VB payable_JJ to_TO religious_JJ prejudices_NNS without_IN allowing_VBG these_DT prejudices_NNS to_TO develop_VB ,_, through_IN facilities_NNS permitted_VBN for_IN mosquito_NN ?_. 3_CD breeding_NN ,_, into_IN a_DT danger_NN ,_, not_RB merely_RB to_TO the_DT persons_NNS holding_VBG them_PRP ,_, but_CC to_TO their_PRP$ neighbours_NNS ._.
The_DT opinions_NNS of_IN well_RB known_VBN Parsi_NNP priests_NNS quoted_VBN by_IN Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP in_IN his_PRP$ paragraphs_NN 395-396_JJ show_NN that_IN there_EX is_VBZ no_DT reason_NN why_WRB wells_NNS should_MD not_RB be_VB kept_VBN in_IN a_DT sanitary_JJ condition_NN without_IN interfering_VBG with_IN any_DT religious_JJ belief_NN ._.
The_DT system_NN of_IN licensing_NN is_VBZ well_RB understood_JJ ,_, and_CC a_DT potentially_RB dangerous_JJ well_RB would_MD be_VB licensed_VBN just_RB as_IN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, an_DT oil_NN engine_NN ,_, which_WDT may_MD possibly_RB prove_VB a_DT danger_NN to_TO its_PRP$ neighbours_NNS ,_, is_VBZ at_IN present_JJ licensed_VBN ._.
Such_JJ a_DT license_NN would_MD be_VB issued_VBN without_IN payment_NN and_CC would_MD be_VB withdrawable_JJ with_IN due_JJ notice_NN in_IN cases_NNS in_IN which_WDT the_DT well_NN was_VBD not_RB kept_VBN in_IN a_DT sanitary_JJ condition_NN ._.
``_`` 8_CD ._.
Undoubtedly_RB the_DT best_JJS way_NN of_IN dealing_VBG with_IN really_RB badly_RB infected_JJ wells_NNS is_VBZ to_TO fill_VB them_PRP up_RP entirely_RB ._.
We_PRP believe_VBP that_IN the_DT objection_NN to_TO doing_VBG so_RB is_VBZ often_RB based_VBN on_IN the_DT expensive_JJ nature_NN of_IN the_DT work_NN ._.
We_PRP consider_VBP that_IN the_DT Corporation_NNP would_MD be_VB spending_VBG money_NN most_RBS usefully_RB to_TO wards_VB the_DT prevention_NN of_IN malaria_NNS if_IN they_PRP agreed_VBD to_TO contribute_VB half_NN of_IN the_DT cost_NN ,_, provided_VBD that_IN the_DT wells_NNS were_VBD filled_VBN in_IN within_IN a_DT specified_JJ date_NN after_IN its_PRP$ being_VBG condemned_VBN ._.
``_`` 9_CD ._.
The_DT amendments_NNS that_WDT would_MD be_VB necessary_JJ in_IN the_DT Municipal_NNP Act_NNP to_TO permit_VB of_IN the_DT measures_NNS suggested_VBN in_IN paragraph_NN 6_CD above_RB would_MD be-_VB (_( a_DT )_) The_DT amendment_NN of_IN section_NN 381_CD to_TO permit_VB the_DT Commissioner_NNP to_TO require_VB wells_NNS to_TO be_VB licensed_VBN ,_, or_CC to_TO require_VB the_DT well_NN to_TO be_VB filled_VBN up_RP or_CC cleansed_VBN ,_, an_DT appeal_NN to_TO lie_VB to_TO the_DT Standing_NNP Committee_NNP ,_, only_RB in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN wells_NNS ordered_VBN to_TO be_VB filled_VBN up_RP or_CC hermeti-_JJ cally_RB covered_VBN ._.
(_( b_NN )_) To_TO allow_VB the_DT Commissioner_NNP ,_, where_WRB the_DT well_NN has_VBZ been_VBN ordered_VBN to_TO be_VB filled_VBN up_RP or_CC hermetically_RB covered_VBN ,_, and_CC the_DT appeal_NN ,_, if_IN any_DT ,_, against_IN the_DT order_NN has_VBZ been_VBN rejected_VBN by_IN the_DT Standing_NNP Committee_NNP and_CC the_DT order_NN is_VBZ not_RB obeyed_VBN ,_, to_TO enter_VB upon_IN the_DT premises_NNS and_CC carry_VBP out_RP the_DT necessary_JJ work_NN ,_, the_DT expenses_NNS being_VBG recovered_VBN from_IN the_DT owner_NN ,_, just_RB as_IN the_DT expenses_NNS of_IN drainage_NN work_NN may_MD be_VB recovered_VBN under_IN section_NN 260_CD of_IN the_DT Act_NNP ._.
``_`` 10_CD ._.
There_EX remains_VBZ the_DT question_NN of_IN establishment_NN ._.
We_PRP agree_VBP with_IN Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP in_IN thinking_VBG that_IN a_DT full-time_JJ establishment_NN would_MD alone_VB really_RB be_VB effectual_JJ at_IN least_JJS until_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN malaria_NN is_VBZ very_RB greatly_RB reduced_VBN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ no_DT doubt_NN a_DT large_JJ and_CC efficient_JJ staff_NN in_IN the_DT Health_NNP Department_NNP ,_, but_CC they_PRP have_VBP extremely_RB onerous_JJ and_CC varied_JJ duties_NNS of_IN their_PRP$ own_JJ ,_, and_CC they_PRP can_MD not_RB be_VB expected_VBN to_TO give_VB more_JJR than_IN general_JJ attention_NN to_TO the_DT prevention_NN of_IN malaria_NN ._.
Moreover_RB ,_, we_PRP are_VBP impressed_JJ with_IN the_DT small_JJ extent_NN to_TO which_WDT blood_NN examination_NN and_CC other_JJ tests_NNS ,_, which_WDT are_VBP invaluable_JJ in_IN detecting_VBG the_DT extent_NN of_IN malaria_NN ,_, have_VBP been_VBN carried_VBN out_RP in_IN the_DT past_NN ,_, and_CC we_PRP think_VBP that_IN the_DT best_JJS way_NN of_IN insuring_VBG organised_VBN work_NN both_DT of_IN prevention_NN and_CC investigation_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP would_MD be_VB to_TO attach_VB a_DT Special_JJ Assistant_NN for_IN this_DT purpose_NN to_TO the_DT Executive_NNP Health_NNP Officer_NNP ._.
``_`` We_PRP think_VBP that_IN the_DT establishment_NN could_MD be_VB arranged_VBN on_IN the_DT lines_NNS suggested_VBN by_IN Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP in_IN his_PRP$ paragraphs_NN 373_CD to_TO 376_CD ,_, but_CC the_DT additional_JJ expense_NN to_TO the_DT municipality_NN would_MD be_VB greatly_RB reduced_VBN by_IN the_DT utilization_NN of_IN the_DT existing_VBG anti-malarial_JJ staff_NN employed_VBN by_IN the_DT municipality_NN and_CC by_IN their_PRP$ concentration_NN in_IN the_DT worst_JJS infected_JJ areas_NNS such_JJ as_IN Dhobi_NNP Talao_NNP and_CC Fort_NNP North_NNP ._.
Moreover_RB ,_, the_DT plague_NN establishment_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ fully_RB worked_VBN during_IN a_DT few_JJ months_NNS of_IN the_DT year_NN only_RB ,_, would_MD be_VB engaged_VBN during_IN the_DT rains_NNS on_IN anti-malarial_JJ work_NN ._.
We_PRP feel_VBP that_IN the_DT staff_NN would_MD work_VB in_IN a_DT more_RBR systematic_JJ and_CC methodical_JJ manner_NN when_WRB concentrated_VBN under_IN one_CD officer_NN than_IN as_RB at_IN present_JJ when_WRB distributed_VBN among_IN the_DT different_JJ Deputy_NNP Health_NNP Officers_NNP ._.
Paras_NNS ._.
428_CD to_TO 430_CD ._.
``_`` 11_CD ._.
The_DT increased_JJ distribution_NN of_IN quinine_NN in_IN a_DT palatable_JJ form_NN as_IN recommended_VBN by_IN Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP ,_, we_PRP regard_VBP as_IN an_DT useful_JJ auxiliary_NN ,_, and_CC we_PRP think_VBP that_IN it_PRP should_MD be_VB adopted_VBN at_IN the_DT municipal_JJ dispensaries_NNS ._.
As_IN a_DT remedial_JJ measure_NN however_RB ,_, it_PRP should_MD be_VB regarded_VBN as_IN altogether_RB subordinate_NN to_TO the_DT necessity_NN for_IN preventive_JJ work_NN ._.
``_`` 12_CD ._.
Finally_RB we_PRP venture_NN to_TO consider_VB that_DT Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP ,_, who_WP has_VBZ now_RB left_VBN Bombay_NNP ,_, has_VBZ submitted_VBN a_DT most_RBS valuable_JJ report_NN ,_, and_CC we_PRP think_VBP that_IN it_PRP should_MD be_VB freely_RB distributed_VBN to_TO the_DT Press_NNP and_CC among_IN the_DT leading_VBG men_NNS of_IN the_DT various_JJ communities_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP ._. ''_''
RESOLUTION.-The_JJ Governor_NNP in_IN Council_NNP has_VBZ read_VBN with_IN great_JJ interest_NN the_DT report_NN submitted_VBN by_IN Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP ,_, which_WDT contains_VBZ the_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT investigation_NN initiated_VBN by_IN Government_NNP in_IN 1908_CD ,_, and_CC conducted_VBN by_IN him_PRP from_IN May_NNP 1909_CD to_TO April_NNP 1911_CD ._.
The_DT report_NN has_VBZ been_VBN prepared_VBN with_IN marked_JJ ability_NN and_CC painstaking_VBG thoroughness_NN ._.
It_PRP presents_VBZ a_DT complete_JJ account_NN of_IN the_DT conditions_NNS that_WDT govern_VBP the_DT prevalence_NN of_IN malaria_NN in_IN the_DT City_NNP of_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, and_CC of_IN the_DT measures_NNS that_WDT are_VBP necessary_JJ for_IN its_PRP$ eradication_NN ._.
2_CD ._.
The_DT investigations_NNS were_VBD conducted_VBN under_IN the_DT control_NN of_IN a_DT committee_NN constituted_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: -_: the_DT Municipal_NNP Commissioner_NNP for_IN the_DT City_NNP of_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, a_DT member_NN representing_VBG the_DT Bombay_NNP Port_NNP Trust_NNP ,_, ?_. 4_CD the_DT Chairman_NNP ,_, City_NNP of_IN Bombay_NNP Improvement_NNP Trust_NNP ,_, the_DT General_NNP Traffic_NNP Manager_NNP ,_, G._NNP I._NNP P._NNP Railway_NNP Company_NNP ,_, the_DT Chief_NNP Medical_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, B_NNP ._.
B_NNP ._.
&_CC C._NNP I_PRP ._.
Railway_NNP Company_NNP ._.
The_DT total_JJ cost_NN amounted_VBD to_TO Rs_NNP ._.
41,662_CD ,_, which_WDT was_VBD shared_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: -_: Rs_NN ._.
Government_NN ..._: ..._: ..._: 32,662_CD The_DT Bombay_NNP Municipality_NNP ..._: ..._: 4,000_CD The_DT Port_NNP Trustees_NNP ..._: ..._: ..._: 4,000_CD The_DT B_NNP ._.
B_NNP ._.
&_CC C._NNP I_PRP ._.
Railway_NNP Company_NNP ..._: 1,000_CD The_DT Governor_NNP in_IN Council_NNP desires_VBZ to_TO congratulate_VB Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP upon_IN the_DT satisfactory-_JJ completion_NN of_IN his_PRP$ labours_NN and_CC the_DT thanks_NNS of_IN Government_NNP should_MD be_VB conveyed_VBN to_TO him_PRP ._.
His_PRP$ Excellency_NN in_IN Council_NNP also_RB desires_VBZ to_TO express_VB his_PRP$ appreciation_NN of_IN the_DT services_NNS rendered_VBN by_IN the_DT members_NNS of_IN the_DT committee_NN and_CC by_IN all_PDT the_DT gentlemen_NNS ,_, both_DT official_JJ and_CC non-official_JJ ,_, mentioned_VBN in_IN the_DT preface_NN to_TO the_DT report_NN ._.
The_DT Government_NNP of_IN the_DT United_NNP States_NNPS of_IN America_NNP should_MD also_RB be_VB addressed_VBN with_IN reference_NN to_TO the_DT assistance_NN rendered_VBN by_IN ._.
Colonel_NNP Gorgas_NNP of_IN their_PRP$ Sanitary_JJ Service_NNP ._.
*Neocellia_JJ stephensi_NN ._.
Myzomyia_NNP listoni_NN ._.
Myzomyia_NNP culicifacies_NNS ._.
Nyssorhynchus_RB fuliginosus_NN ._.
Some_DT results_NNS taken_VBN from_IN Chapter_NNP VII_NNP of_IN part_NN III_NNP of_IN the_DT report_NN are_VBP quoted_VBN in_IN the_DT appendix_NN to_TO this_DT Resoultion_NNP ._.
3_CD ._.
The_DT report_NN is_VBZ based_VBN on_IN the_DT principle_NN that_WDT malaria_VBZ infection_NN from_IN man_NN to_TO man_NN is_VBZ carried_VBN by_IN certain_JJ species*_NN of_IN mosquito_NN and_CC that_IN if_IN these_DT species_NNS could_MD be_VB prevented_VBN from_IN breeding_VBG ,_, malaria_NN as_IN an_DT endemic_JJ disease_NN ,_, capable_JJ of_IN becoming_VBG epidemic_JJ in_IN favourable_JJ circumstances_NNS would_MD disappear_VB ._.
This_DT principle_NN is_VBZ now_RB generally_RB accepted_VBN in_IN dealing_VBG ,_, with_IN sanitation_NN under_IN eastern_JJ conditions_NNS and_CC it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN applied_VBN with_IN unvarying_JJ success_NN in_IN many_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT East_NNP wherever_NN natural_JJ facilities_NNS were_VBD favour-_JJ able_JJ ._.
There_EX is_VBZ no_DT reason_NN to_TO suppose_VB that_DT equal_JJ success_NN would_MD not_RB attend_VB sustained_VBN and_CC well_RB directed_JJ effort_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ the_DT earnest_JJS hope_NN of_IN the_DT Governor_NNP in_IN Council_NNP that_IN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN this_DT investigation_NN the_DT scourge_NN of_IN malaria_NN may_MD cease_VB in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ his_PRP$ intention_NN to_TO do_VB all_DT in_IN his_PRP$ power_NN to_TO further_JJ effort_NN directed_VBD to_TO attain_VB this_DT end_NN ._.
4_CD ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ clearly_RB shown_VBN that_IN malaria_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO internal_JJ infection_NN and_CC that_IN outside_JJ infection_NN may_MD be_VB disregarded_VBN ._.
The_DT disease_NN is_VBZ endemic_JJ and_CC at_IN intervals_NNS ,_, when_WRB conditions_NNS favour_VBP a_DT spread_NN ,_, it_PRP becomes_VBZ widely_RB epidemic_JJ ._.
The_DT facts_NNS concerning_VBG the_DT endemicity_NN of_IN malaria_NN may_MD be_VB briefly_VBN summarised-the_JJ south_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN is_VBZ more_RBR infected_JJ than_IN the_DT north_JJ ,_, and_CC of_IN the_DT former_JJ sub-division_NN the_DT worst_JJS infected_JJ areas_NNS are_VBP comprised_VBN within_IN the_DT Esplanade_NNP ,_, North_NNP Fort_NNP ,_, Mandvi_NNP and_CC Dhobi_NNP Talao_NNP sections_NNS of_IN the_DT town_NN ._.
Taking_VBG the_DT population_NN by_IN race_NN or_CC caste_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ found_VBN that_IN malaria_NN is_VBZ comparatively_RB more_RBR prevalent_JJ among_IN the_DT Parsis_NNP than_IN among_IN any_DT other_JJ community_NN ._.
In_IN support_NN of_IN this_DT fact_NN Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP cites_VBZ the_DT higher_JJR percentage_NN of_IN enlarged_JJ spleens_NNS among_IN Parsi_NNP children_NNS and_CC the_DT general_JJ low_JJ vitality_NN of_IN the_DT race_NN as_IN indicated_VBN by_IN their_PRP$ failure_NN to_TO show_VB a_DT natural_JJ increase_NN ,_, no_DT great_JJ excess_NN of_IN births_NNS over_IN deaths_NNS taking_VBG place_NN amongst_VBP them_PRP from_IN year_NN to_TO year_NN ._.
5_CD ._.
The_DT rate_NN of_IN mortality_NN directly_RB due_JJ to_TO malaria_VB is_VBZ comparatively_RB speaking_VBG small_JJ ,_, but_CC the_DT amount_NN of_IN ill-health_NN caused_VBN by_IN this_DT disease_NN is_VBZ enormous_JJ and_CC gravely_JJ affects_VBZ the_DT economic_JJ efficiency_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN ._.
At_IN a_DT very_RB conservative_JJ estimate_NN Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP puts_VBZ the_DT direct_JJ loss_NN in_IN wage-earning_JJ capacity_NN alone_RB at_IN ten_NNS and_CC a_DT half_JJ lakhs_NN of_IN rupees_NNS a_DT year_NN ,_, and_CC if_IN indirect_JJ losses_NNS be_VB included_VBN ,_, it_PRP may_MD be_VB said_VBD that_IN a_DT sum_NN of_IN twenty-nine_JJ lakhs_NN of_IN rupees_NNS represents_VBZ the_DT annual_JJ cost_NN to_TO the_DT city_NN ._.
It_PRP fortunately_RB appears_VBZ clear_JJ that_IN at_IN a_DT comparatively_RB insignificant_JJ expenditure_NN malaria_NNS can_MD be_VB easily_RB controlled_VBN ,_, and_CC this_DT cause_NN of_IN disease_NN and_CC economic_JJ loss_NN can_MD be_VB eradicated_VBN ._.
6_CD ._.
By_IN far_RB the_DT most_RBS dangerous_JJ carrier_NN of_IN malaria_NN infection_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP is_VBZ the_DT mosquito_NN known_VBN as_IN Neocellia_NNP stephensi_NN ._.
Its_PRP$ most_RBS common_JJ breeding_NN grounds_NNS are_VBP open_JJ wells_NNS situated_VBD within_IN the_DT precincts_NNS of_IN domestic_JJ houses_NNS in_IN those_DT parts_NNS of_IN the_DT city_NN that_WDT show_VBP the_DT greatest_JJS malaria_NN infection_NN ,_, but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ so_RB adaptable_JJ that_IN it_PRP will_MD breed_VB in_IN cisterns_NNS ,_, fountains_NNS ,_, masonry_NN and_CC other_JJ tanks_NNS ,_, tubs_NN ,_, barrels_NNS ,_, tin_NN pots_NNS and_CC other_JJ minor_JJ collections_NNS of_IN water_NN and_CC in_IN open_JJ pools_NNS of_IN water_NN ._.
Larv_NNP have_VBP been_VBN found_VBN in_IN wells_NNS of_IN clear_JJ water_NN in_IN daily_JJ use_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN the_DT deep_JJ reservoir_NN of_IN clear_JJ water_NN on_IN Malabar_NNP Hill_NNP ._.
This_DT mosquito_NN can_MD breed_VB in_IN salt_NN or_CC brackish_JJ water_NN ._.
?_. 5_CD 7_CD ._.
The_DT conclusions_NNS that_WDT have_VBP been_VBN reached_VBN regarding_VBG public_JJ measures_NNS of_IN malaria_NNS prevention_NN for_IN Bombay_NNP are_VBP as_IN follows_VBZ :_: -_: (_( 1_CD )_) The_DT measures_NNS should_MD be_VB directed_VBN against_IN all_DT mosquitoes_NNS ,_, but_CC the_DT suppression_NN or_CC reduction_NN of_IN the_DT species_NNS of_IN anopheles_NNS that_WDT carry_VBP the_DT disease_NN must_MD first_RB be_VB aimed_VBN at_IN ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) The_DT measures_NNS must_MD be_VB so_RB contrived_JJ and_CC directed_VBD as_IN to_TO bring_VB about_RP not_RB merely_RB a_DT mitigation_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN but_CC the_DT eradication_NN of_IN autochthonous_JJ malaria_NNS from_IN the_DT city_NN ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) The_DT more_RBR rapidly_RB the_DT measures_NNS are_VBP carried_VBN into_IN effect_NN the_DT greater_JJR will_MD be_VB the_DT certainty_NN of_IN their_PRP$ complete_JJ success_NN ._.
(_( 4_CD )_) The_DT main_JJ sources_NNS of_IN infection_NN are_VBP at_IN present_JJ localized_VBN ;_: but_CC ,_, failing_VBG effective_JJ measures_NNS ,_, they_PRP may_MD spread_VB throughout_IN the_DT island_NN ._.
8_CD ._.
The_DT responsibility_NN for_IN carrying_VBG into_IN operation_NN these_DT measures_NNS devolves_VBZ upon_IN the_DT Municipal_NNP Corporation_NNP of_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, and_CC the_DT Governor_NNP in_IN Council_NNP trusts_VBZ that_IN the_DT Corporation_NNP will_MD address_VB itself_PRP to_TO the_DT task_NN with_IN energy_NN and_CC carry_VBP through_IN the_DT operations_NNS to_TO success_NN without_IN delay_NN ._.
He_PRP has_VBZ no_DT doubt_NN that_IN the_DT Corporation_NNP will_MD meet_VB with_IN the_DT willing_JJ co-operation_NN of_IN all_DT classes_NNS of_IN citizens_NNS now_RB that_IN careful_JJ investigation_NN has_VBZ shown_VBN what_WP is_VBZ necessary_JJ ._.
The_DT large_JJ public_JJ bodies_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN the_DT Port_NNP Trust_NNP ,_, the_DT Improvement_NNP Trust_NNP ,_, and_CC the_DT two_CD great_JJ railway_NN administrations_NNS have_VBP already_RB shown_VBN their_PRP$ willingness_NN to_TO co-operate_NN ,_, and_CC they_PRP will_MD no_DT doubt_NN undertake_VB the_DT necessary_JJ measures_NNS within_IN the_DT areas_NNS subject_VBP to_TO their_PRP$ jurisdiction_NN ._.
The_DT Corporation_NNP should_MD be_VB informed_VBN that_DT Government_NNP will_MD give_VB steady_JJ support_NN to_TO their_PRP$ endeavours_NNS ._.
9_CD ._.
In_IN the_DT first_JJ place_NN it_PRP will_MD be_VB necessary_JJ for_IN the_DT Corporation_NN to_TO consider_VB the_DT proposals_NNS contained_VBN in_IN paragraph_NN 459_CD of_IN the_DT report_NN ,_, which_WDT are_VBP as_IN follows_VBZ :_: -_: (_( 1_CD )_) to_TO decide_VB whether_IN the_DT measures_NNS shall_MD be_VB taken_VBN against_IN all_DT mosquitoes_NNS or_CC be_VB directed_VBN specially_RB against_IN those_DT responsible_JJ for_IN malaria_NN ;_: (_( 2_CD )_) to_TO vote_VB sufficient_JJ money_NN for_IN the_DT purpose_NN ;_: (_( 3_CD )_) to_TO sanction_VB the_DT appointment_NN of_IN a_DT Special_JJ Assistant_NN to_TO the_DT Executive_NNP Health_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, who_WP can_MD devote_VB his_PRP$ whole_JJ time_NN to_TO the_DT direction_NN and_CC supervision_NN of_IN the_DT necessary_JJ measures_NNS ;_: (_( 4_CD )_) to_TO sanction_VB an_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT existing_VBG subordinate_JJ staff_NN of_IN the_DT Health_NNP Department_NNP ,_, so_RB as_IN to_TO allow_VB of_IN the_DT necessary_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN Inspectors_NNS and_CC labourers_NNS required_VBN for_IN the_DT work_NN ;_: (_( 5_CD )_) to_TO obtain_VB adequate_JJ legal_JJ powers_NNS for_IN carrying_VBG out_RP the_DT necessary_JJ measures_NNS ._.
10_CD ._.
In_IN dealing_VBG with_IN mosquito_JJ reduction_NN the_DT Governor_NNP in_IN Council_NNP agrees_VBZ with_IN Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP that_WDT measures_VBZ should_MD in_IN the_DT first_JJ instance_NN be_VB first_RB directed_VBN to_TO the_DT eradication_NN of_IN the_DT deadly_JJ malaria_NN carrier_NN ._.
The_DT organization_NN required_VBN for_IN this_DT purpose_NN would_MD be_VB capable_JJ of_IN expansion_NN so_RB as_IN to_TO deal_VB with_IN all_DT mosquitoes_NNS ._.
When_WRB malaria_NN has_VBZ been_VBN adequately_RB controlled_VBN ,_, the_DT Corporation_NNP will_MD no_DT doubt_NN turn_VB to_TO the_DT larger_JJR question_NN ._.
The_DT complete_JJ reduction_NN of_IN mosquitoes_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN attended_VBN with_IN considerable_JJ improvement_NN in_IN public_JJ health_NN in_IN all_DT places_NNS where_WRB it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN carried_VBN out_IN ,_, and_CC there_EX is_VBZ no_DT doubt_NN that_IN similar_JJ beneficial_JJ results_NNS could_MD be_VB achieved_VBN in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
11_CD ._.
Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP shows_VBZ that_IN for_IN an_DT annual_JJ expenditure_NN that_WDT may_MD vary_VB between_IN two_CD and_CC five_CD lakhs_NNS ,_, Bombay_NNP could_MD be_VB completely_RB freed_VBN from_IN mosquitoes_NNS ._.
The_DT cost_NN of_IN measures_NNS directed_VBN against_IN the_DT malaria_NN carrier_NN alone_RB would_MD not_RB be_VB much_RB more_JJR than_IN one_CD lakh_NN annually_RB for_IN the_DT whole_NN of_IN A_NNP ,_, B_NNP ,_, C_NNP ,_, D_NNP ,_, and_CC E_NNP wards_NNS of_IN the_DT city_NN ,_, while_IN the_DT area_NN of_IN the_DT most_RBS intense_JJ infection_NN (_( A_NNP ,_, B_NNP and_CC C_NNP wards_NNS )_) could_MD be_VB adequately_RB dealt_JJ with_IN for_IN an_DT annual_JJ expenditure_NN of_IN Rs_NNP ._.
50,000_CD ._.
These_DT sums_NNS do_VBP not_RB take_VB into_IN account_NN the_DT staff_NN of_IN the_DT Health_NNP Department_NNP whose_WP$ services_NNS would_MD be_VB utilized_JJ ,_, but_CC provide_VBP for_IN a_DT complete_JJ new_JJ organization_NN ._.

50,000_CD and_CC for_IN another_DT Rs_NNP ._.
50,000_CD one-half_NN of_IN the_DT remaining_VBG wells_NNS to_TO the_DT south_NN of_IN the_DT Grant_NNP Road_NNP could_MD be_VB effectively_RB protected_VBN ._.

1,00,000_CD from_IN Provincial_NNP revenues_NNS and_CC to_TO place_VB it_PRP at_IN the_DT disposal_NN of_IN the_DT Corporation_NNP to_TO assist_VB them_PRP Genl_NNP 483-2_JJ ?_. 6_CD in_IN the_DT campaign_NN as_RB soon_RB as_IN he_PRP has_VBZ received_VBN a_DT satisfactory_JJ assurance_NN that_IN they_PRP will_MD proceed_VB with_IN vigorous_JJ measures_NNS under_IN proper_JJ direction_NN for_IN the_DT eradication_NN of_IN malaria_NN from_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
12_CD ._.
The_DT Governor_NNP in_IN Council_NNP agrees_VBZ that_IN for_IN effective_JJ working_VBG it_PRP is_VBZ necessary_JJ that_IN the_DT operations_NNS should_MD be_VB under_IN the_DT control_NN of_IN a_DT Special_JJ Assistant_NNP Health_NNP Officer_NNP whose_WP$ whole_JJ time_NN should_MD be_VB devoted_VBN to_TO this_DT duty_NN ._.

13_CD ._.
Dr._NNP Bentley_NNP has_VBZ fully_RB discussed_VBN the_DT important_JJ question_NN of_IN the_DT additional_JJ legal_JJ powers_NNS that_WDT are_VBP required_VBN for_IN the_DT success_NN of_IN the_DT proposed_VBN campaign_NN ._.
In_IN two_CD respects_VBZ the_DT law_NN requires_VBZ to_TO be_VB supplemented_VBN ,_, firstly_RB ,_, in_IN order_NN to_TO declare_VB ``_`` mosquito_JJ breeding_NN ''_'' a_DT statutory_JJ nuisance_NN and_CC ,_, secondly_RB ,_, in_IN order_NN to_TO invest_VB the_DT Municipal_NNP Commissioner_NNP with_IN power_NN not_RB only_RB to_TO take_VB action_NN himself_PRP for_IN the_DT abatement_NN of_IN such_PDT a_DT nuisance_NN ,_, but_CC to_TO delegate_VB the_DT power_NN to_TO the_DT Executive_NNP Health_NNP Officer_NNP or_CC to_TO a_DT responsible_JJ assistant_NN ._.

14_CD ._.
While_IN mosquito_JJ reduction_NN must_MD constitute_VB the_DT chief_JJ measure_NN in_IN malaria_NN prevention_NN in_IN the_DT city_NN ,_, the_DT use_NN of_IN quinine_NN as_IN a_DT prophylactic_JJ and_CC curative_JJ agent_NN should_MD not_RB be_VB neglected_VBN ._.

Wilhelmshaven.-It_NNP is_VBZ recorded_VBN that_IN in_IN 1896_CD during_IN the_DT construction_NN of_IN the_DT harbour_NN at_IN Wilhelmshaven_NNP ,_, a_DT fearful_JJ epidemic_NN of_IN malaria_NN occurred_VBD ,_, which_WDT affected_VBD both_DT the_DT workmen_NNS ,_, the_DT crews_NNS belonging_VBG to_TO the_DT shipping_NN and_CC the_DT residents_NNS in_IN the_DT vicinity_NN ._.
At_IN this_DT time_NN little_JJ was_VBD known_VBN of_IN the_DT possibility_NN of_IN preventing_VBG malaria_NN ._.
But_CC during_IN the_DT recent_JJ enlargement_NN of_IN the_DT harbour_NN works_NN ,_, special_JJ precautions_NNS were_VBD adopted_VBN from_IN the_DT commence-_JJ ment_NN and_CC as_IN a_DT result_NN there_RB has_VBZ been_VBN no_DT outbreak_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
442_CD ._.
The_DT result_NN of_IN the_DT preventive_JJ work_NN that_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN carried_VBN out_RP at_IN Panama_NNP and_CC Wilhelmshaven_NNP shows_VBZ that_IN even_RB among_IN aggregations_NNS of_IN labourers_NNS engaged_VBN upon_IN construc-_JJ tion_NN work_NN in_IN malarious_JJ areas_NNS ,_, the_DT adoption_NN of_IN adequate_JJ precautions_NNS is_VBZ sufficient_JJ to_TO neutralize_VB the_DT risk_NN of_IN epidemic_JJ outbreaks_NNS of_IN malaria_NN ,_, to_TO which_WDT these_DT temporary_JJ collections_NNS of_IN labourers_NNS are_VBP specially_RB liable_JJ ._.

1_CD ._.
The_DT City_NNP of_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, the_DT capital_NN of_IN the_DT Bombay_NNP Presidency_NNP and_CC the_DT principal_JJ seaport_NN of_IN Western_JJ India_NNP ,_, is_VBZ situated_VBN on_IN an_DT island_NN on_IN the_DT shore_NN of_IN the_DT Arabian_NNP Sea_NNP in_IN 18_CD 55_CD '_POS N._NNP and_CC 72_CD 54_CD '_'' E._NNP This_DT island_NN forms_VBZ one_CD of_IN a_DT group_NN lying_VBG off_RP the_DT coast_NN of_IN the_DT Konkan_NNP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ now_RB permanently_RB united_VBN to_TO a_DT larger_JJR island_NN ,_, Salsette_NNP ,_, and_CC the_DT mainland_NN by_IN means_NNS of_IN causeways_NNS ,_, bridges_NNS and_CC break-_JJ waters_NNS ._.
Originally_RB seven_CD small_JJ islands_NNS ,_, separated_VBN from_IN one_CD another_DT by_IN narrow_JJ channels_NNS and_CC enclosing_VBG a_DT large_JJ central_JJ lagoon_NN ,_, occupied_VBD the_DT site_NN of_IN the_DT present_JJ island_NN ,_, as_IN may_MD be_VB seen_VBN by_IN reference_NN to_TO map_VB No_NNP ._.
II_NNP ;_: but_CC gradually_RB these_DT islands_NNS were_VBD connected_VBN by_IN causeways_NNS and_CC ,_, embankments_NNS and_CC ,_, after_IN the_DT construction_NN of_IN the_DT great_JJ Hornby_NNP Vellard_NNP ,_, the_DT island_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP assumed_VBD its_PRP$ present_JJ form_NN ._.
Since_IN that_DT time_NN a_DT considerable_JJ area_NN of_IN foreshore_NN has_VBZ been_VBN reclaimed_VBN and_CC a_DT large_JJ amount_NN of_IN low-land_NN has_VBZ been_VBN filled_VBN in_IN ,_, but_CC even_RB now_RB much_RB of_IN the_DT central_JJ portion_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN is_VBZ below_IN sea_NN level_NN ._.
Reference_NN to_TO map_VB No_NNP ._.
III_NNP ,_, in_IN which_WDT the_DT shaded_JJ portion_NN represents_VBZ land_NN below_IN sea_NN level_NN ,_, will_MD show_VB this_DT ._.
2_CD ._.
Physically_RB the_DT island_NN consists_VBZ of_IN a_DT low-lying_JJ alluvial_JJ plain_NN or_CC shallow_VB valley_NN between_IN two_CD parallel_JJ ranges_NNS of_IN low_JJ broken_JJ hills_NNS ._.
To_TO the_DT south_JJ these_DT two_CD ranges_NNS are_VBP represented_VBN by_IN the_DT respective_JJ promontories_NNS of_IN Malabar_NNP Hill_NNP and_CC Colaba_NNP Point_NNP ,_, which_WDT jut_VBZ into_IN the_DT sea_NN and_CC partly_RB enclose_VB a_DT large_JJ shallow_JJ expanse_NN of_IN water_NN known_VBN as_IN Back_NNP Bay_NNP ._.
The_DT hills_NNS on_IN the_DT island_NN are_VBP all_DT small_JJ ,_, reaching_VBG an_DT elevation_NN a_DT little_RB more_JJR than_IN 150_CD feet_NNS ._.
There_EX are_VBP no_DT rivers_NNS or_CC permanent_JJ natural_JJ streams_NNS ;_: but_CC as_IN the_DT centre_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN ,_, towards_IN the_DT north_NN ,_, forms_VBZ a_DT basin_NN shaped_VBN depression_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ subject_JJ to_TO temporary_JJ flooding_NN during_IN the_DT rainy_NN season_NN ._.
3_CD ._.
The_DT climate_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP is_VBZ warm_JJ ,_, equable_JJ and_CC humid_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ mean_JJ annual_JJ temperature_NN is_VBZ 79.6_CD Fah._NNP ,_, January_NNP being_VBG the_DT coldest_JJS month_NN with_IN an_DT average_JJ mean_JJ temperature_NN of_IN 73.9_CD and_CC May_NNP the_DT warmest_JJS with_IN an_DT average_JJ mean_JJ temperature_NN of_IN 84.7_CD ._.
The_DT seasons_NNS may_MD be_VB conveniently_RB divided_VBN into_IN the_DT wet_NN and_CC the_DT dry_NN ._.
The_DT wet_NN season_NN usually_RB begins_VBZ in_IN June_NNP when_WRB the_DT monsoon_NN bursts_NNS and_CC continues_VBZ until_IN the_DT middle_NN or_CC end_NN of_IN October_NNP ._.
After_IN the_DT onset_NN of_IN the_DT rains_NNS the_DT temperature_NN falls_VBZ slightly_RB ,_, but_CC remains_VBZ remarkably_RB uniform_JJ ,_, almost_RB within_IN 1_CD of_IN the_DT mean_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN ,_, until_IN October_NNP ,_, when_WRB a_DT slight_JJ rise_NN occurs_VBZ ._.
From_IN October_NNP the_DT temperature_NN falls_VBZ gradually_RB until_IN January_NNP ,_, after_IN which_WDT it_PRP rises_VBZ again_RB to_TO the_DT maximum_NN in_IN May_NNP ._.
Table_NN I_PRP in_IN the_DT appendix_NN gives_VBZ the_DT average_JJ temperature_NN observed_VBN from_IN 1873-1905_JJ and_CC the_DT actuals_NNS recorded_VBD during_IN 1906-1910_JJ ._.
There_EX is_VBZ no_DT forest_NN or_CC jungle_NN and_CC little_JJ natural_JJ undergrowth_NN on_IN the_DT island_NN ._.
Up_RB to_TO 1872_CD more_JJR than_IN half_PDT the_DT island_NN was_VBD under_IN cultivation_NN ,_, large_JJ areas_NNS being_VBG used_VBN for_IN rice_NN ,_, plantations_NNS of_IN toddy_JJ palms_NNS and_CC market_NN gardens_NNS ;_: but_CC in_IN 1909_CD only_RB a_DT little_JJ over_IN 2,000_CD acres_NNS was_VBD cropped_VBN ,_, chiefly_NN in_IN the_DT north_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN ._.
Of_IN this_DT area_NN over_IN 800_CD acres_NNS were_VBD covered_VBN with_IN toddy_JJ palms_NNS ,_, nearly_RB 500_CD acres_NNS with_IN rice_NN and_CC the_DT remainder_NN was_VBD used_VBN for_IN market_NN gardens_NNS ._.
4_CD ._.
The_DT average_JJ annual_JJ rainfall_NN for_IN Bombay_NNP is_VBZ 71.15_CD inches_NNS ._.
The_DT maximum_JJ fall_NN recorded_VBN in_IN one_CD year_NN is_VBZ 114.89_CD and_CC the_DT minimum_JJ 33.42_CD ._.
The_DT average_JJ number_NN of_IN rainy_JJ days_NNS in_IN the_DT year_NN is_VBZ 103_CD ._.

The_DT atmosphere_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP is_VBZ generally_RB moist_JJ ,_, the_DT lowest_JJS relative_JJ humidity_NN 0.668*_CD occurs_NN late_RB in_IN December_NNP ._.
During_IN December_NNP ,_, January_NNP and_CC February_NNP it_PRP remains_VBZ fairly_RB uniform_JJ ,_, but_CC from_IN then_RB onwards_NNS gradually_RB increases_VBZ ._.
With_IN the_DT fall_NN of_IN temperature_NN which_WDT occurs_VBZ in_IN June_NNP after_IN the_DT onset_NN of_IN the_DT rains_NNS the_DT relative_JJ humidity_NN increases_NNS ,_, and_CC ._.
the_DT maximum_JJ 0.867_CD is_VBZ reached_VBN about_IN the_DT middle_NN of_IN July_NNP ._.
Prom_NNP July_NNP to_TO September_NNP there_EX is_VBZ little_JJ fluctua-_JJ tion_NN but_CC about_IN the_DT middle_NN of_IN October_NNP a_DT somewhat_RB sharp_JJ fall_NN occurs_VBZ ._.
The_DT diurnal_JJ variations_NNS in_IN the_DT relative_JJ humidity_NN is_VBZ most_RBS marked_VBN in_IN the_DT dry_JJ weather_NN ._.
In_IN December_NNP when_WRB at_IN 2_CD p.m._NN the_DT humidity_NN is_VBZ only_RB 0.554_CD at_IN 6_CD a.m._NN it_PRP is_VBZ 0.673_CD ;_: but_CC in_IN July_NNP the_DT respective_JJ figures_NNS are_VBP 0.841_CD and_CC 0.895_CD ._.
6_CD ._.
The_DT prevailing_NN winds_NNS vary_VBP according_VBG to_TO season_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT monsoon_NN months_NNS the_DT wind_NN blows_VBZ from_IN W.S.W_NNP ._.
The_DT maximum_JJ velocity_NN is_VBZ 18.8_CD miles_NNS per_IN hour_NN and_CC is_VBZ attained_VBN in_IN July_NNP ._.
By_IN November_NNP the_DT prevailing_NN winds_VBZ come_VBN from_IN the_DT N.E._NNP ,_, but_CC from_IN January_NNP onwards_IN the_DT easterly_JJ component_NN gradually_RB disappears_NNS and_CC is_VBZ replaced_VBN in_IN March_NNP by_IN a_DT westerly_JJ one_CD ._.
About_IN the_DT middle_NN of_IN May_NNP the_DT northerly_JJ component_NN is_VBZ replaced_VBN by_IN a_DT southerly_JJ one_CD and_CC from_IN then_RB onwards_NNS south-westerly_RB winds_NNS increase_NN in_IN strength_NN to_TO their_PRP$ maximum_NN in_IN July_NNP ._.
Section_NN 2_CD ._.
7_CD ._.
THE_DT POPULATION_NNP OF_NNP BOMBAY.-The_NNP population_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP is_VBZ an_DT altogether_RB abnormal_JJ one_CD ._.
it_PRP may_MD be_VB said_VBD to_TO be_VB composed_VBN of-_JJ (_( 1_CD )_) A_DT fixed_VBN and_CC permanent_JJ population_NN ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) A_DT floating_VBG population_NN (_( A_DT )_) varying_NN in_IN numbers_NNS from_IN year_NN to_TO year_NN ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) A_DT second_JJ floating_JJ population_NN (_( B_NNP )_) varying_VBG in_IN numbers_NNS from_IN season_NN to_TO season_NN ._.
(_( 4_CD )_) A_DT third_JJ floating_VBG population_NN (_( 0_CD )_) composed_VBN of_IN people_NNS passing_VBG through_IN the_DT City_NNP and_CC resident_NN for_IN only_RB brief_JJ periods_NNS ._.
8_CD ._.
The_DT fixed_JJ population_NN mainly_RB consists_VBZ of_IN those_DT born_VBN in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, together_RB with_IN a_DT certain_JJ number_NN of_IN persons_NNS from_IN the_DT Bombay_NNP Presidency_NNP and_CC other_JJ parts_NNS ,_, who_WP may_MD be_VB said_VBD to_TO have_VB made_VBN Bombay_NNP their_PRP$ home_NN ._.
The_DT floating-_JJ population_NN (_( A_DT )_) is_VBZ composed_VBN of_IN those_DT who_WP come_VBP to_TO reside_VB in_IN Bombay_NNP for_IN business_NN and_CC other_JJ purposes_NNS ,_, and_CC who_WP remain_VBP for_IN periods_NNS of_IN one_CD or_CC more_JJR years_NNS ._.
The_DT floating_VBG population_NN (_( B_NNP )_) consists_VBZ of_IN people_NNS of_IN the_DT labouring_JJ class_NN ,_, who_WP visit_VBP Bombay_NNP in_IN search_NN of_IN employment_NN during_IN the_DT dry_JJ weather_NN ,_, returning_VBG to_TO their_PRP$ own_JJ homes_NNS just_RB before_IN the_DT onset_NN of_IN the_DT rainy_NN season_NN ._.
The_DT floating_VBG population_NN (_( C_NNP )_) includes_VBZ visitors_NNS for_IN short_JJ periods_NNS ,_, travellers_NNS by_IN rail_NN and_CC steamer_NN who_WP are_VBP constantly_RB arriving_VBG and_CC departing_VBG ,_, the_DT crews_NNS of_IN vessels_NNS in_IN the_DT harbour_NN and_CC pilgrims_NNS who_WP pass_VBP through_IN on_IN their_PRP$ way_NN to_TO Mecca_NNP ._.
Of_IN the_DT total_JJ population_NN more_JJR than_IN four-fifths_NNS are_VBP concentrated_VBN in_IN the_DT southern_JJ half_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN ._.
Thus_RB the_DT one_CD half_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN contains_VBZ a_DT population_NN averaging_VBG 200_CD to_TO the_DT acre_NN ,_, whereas_IN the_DT other_JJ shows_VBZ an_DT average_NN of_IN only_RB 20_CD to_TO the_DT acre_NN ._.
9_CD ._.
There_EX is_VBZ probably_RB no_DT city_NN in_IN the_DT world_NN in_IN which_WDT a_DT larger_JJR number_NN of_IN different_JJ races_NNS is_VBZ to_TO be_VB met_VBN with_IN than_IN in_IN Bombay_NNP ;_: this_DT is_VBZ shown_VBN by_IN the_DT fact_NN that_WDT at_IN the_DT Census_NNP of_IN 1901_CD ,_, 62_CD different_JJ dialects_NNS were_VBD recorded_VBN as_IN being_VBG spoken_VBN in_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.
*_RB 1.000_CD denotes_NNS complete_JJ saturation_NN ._.

Education.-No_JJ city_NN in_IN India_NNP is_VBZ more_RBR advanced_JJ as_IN regards_NNS education_NN than_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
At_IN the_DT Census_NNP of_IN 1901_CD nearly_RB 20_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT total_JJ popula-_JJ tion_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB literate_JJ ,_, a_DT proportion_NN which_WDT is_VBZ very_RB high_JJ for_IN India_NNP ._.
Among_IN Indian_JJ born_VBN persons_NNS the_DT Parsis_NNP ,_, as_IN a_DT community_NN ,_, showed_VBD the_DT highest_JJS percentage_NN of_IN literates_NNS among_IN both_DT males_NNS and_CC females_NNS ._.
Education_NN is_VBZ rapidly_RB developing_VBG in_IN Bombay_NNP ;_: there_EX are_VBP many_JJ elementary_JJ schools_NNS in_IN the_DT City_NNP ,_, a_DT fair_JJ number_NN of_IN higher_JJR class_NN schools_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT University_NNP ._.
A_DT large_JJ medical_JJ school_NN is_VBZ attached_VBN to_TO the_DT University_NNP from_IN which_WDT about_IN 100_CD qualified_JJ medical_JJ men_NNS pass_VBP out_RP each_DT year_NN ._.
13_CD ._.
Occupation.-At_NNP the_DT Census_NNP of_IN 1906_CD a_DT total_NN of_IN 588,713_CD persons_NNS were_VBD returned_VBN as_IN workers_NNS and_CC 389,109_CD as_IN dependents_NNS and_CC non-workers_NNS ._.
Among_IN the_DT workers_NNS 502,544_CD were_VBD males_NNS and_CC 86,169_CD females_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ sometimes_RB imagined_VBN ,_, because_IN women_NNS may_MD be_VB seen_VBN working_VBG as_IN coolies_NNS ,_, that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ a_DT customary_JJ thing_NN in_IN India_NNP for_IN women_NNS of_IN the_DT poorer_NN classes_VBZ to_TO become_VB wage_NN earners_NNS ;_: but_CC this_DT is_VBZ not_RB the_DT case_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP where_WRB only_RB women_NNS of_IN special_JJ castes_NNS and_CC from_IN certain_JJ districts_NNS seek_JJ employment_NN outside_IN their_PRP$ own_JJ homes_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ a_DT common_JJ idea_NN that_WDT children_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP augment_JJ family_NN incomes_NNS considerably_RB by_IN their_PRP$ earnings_NNS ,_, but_CC in_IN 1907_CD a_DT total_NN of_IN only_RB 3,000_CD children_NNS was_VBD employed_VBN in_IN factories_NNS of_IN all_DT kinds_NNS in_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.
In_IN 1906_CD Cotton_NNP Mills_NNP employed_VBD 82,867_CD males_NNS and_CC 29,160_CD females_NNS ;_: the_DT average_JJ number_NN at_IN work_NN daily_RB was_VBD 100,798_CD ;_: and_CC these_DT 112,027_CD mill-workers_NNS supported_VBD 55,539_CD dependents_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT same_JJ year_NN there_EX were_VBD 98,519_CD general_JJ labourers_NNS on_IN the_DT island_NN ,_, including_VBG 20,278_CD female_JJ workers_NNS who_WP supported_VBD 33,308_CD dependents_NNS ;_: domestic_JJ and_CC other_JJ service_NN maintained_VBD 101,017_CD persons_NNS including_VBG dependents_NNS ;_: 48,761_CD persons_NNS lived_VBN by_IN washing_VBG ,_, tailoring_VBG ,_, cooking_NN ,_, baking_NN ,_, etc_FW ;_: a_DT total_NN of_IN 113,671_CD persons_NNS obtained_VBD their_PRP$ living_NN from_IN trade_NN ,_, by_IN shopkeeping_VBG ,_, dealing_VBG and_CC hawking_VBG ;_: and_CC 54,986_CD by_IN the_DT carriage_NN of_IN goods_NNS or_CC passengers_NNS on_IN sea_NN or_CC land_NN ._.
14_CD ._.
The_DT vast_JJ majority_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP belong_NN to_TO the_DT working_NN classes_NNS ,_, and_CC of_IN these_DT people_NNS a_DT very_RB large_JJ number_NN exist_VBP in_IN a_DT condition_NN of_IN the_DT greatest_JJS poverty_NN ._.
Out_IN of_IN the_DT total_NN of_IN 588_CD ,_, 713_CD actual_JJ workers_NNS present_JJ in_IN Bombay_NNP in_IN 1906_CD ,_, only_RB 18,849_CD persons_NNS or_CC just_RB over_IN 3.2_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.

In_IN this_DT case_NN the_DT man_NN explained_VBD that_IN as_IN he_PRP could_MD not_RB afford_VB to_TO keep_VB his_PRP$ wife_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP she_PRP remained_VBD at_IN home_NN in_IN her_PRP$ father_NN 's_POS house_NN ._.

These_DT figures_NNS help_VBP to_TO explain_VB the_DT appalling_VBG overcrowding_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ;_: for_IN it_PRP is_VBZ clear_JJ that_IN when_WRB the_DT majority_NN of_IN workers_NNS have_VBP paid_VBN for_IN their_PRP$ food_NN and_CC clothes_NNS and_CC the_DT few_JJ luxuries_NNS in_IN which_WDT they_PRP indulge_VBP ,_, such_JJ as_IN tobacco_NN and_CC an_DT occasional_JJ drink_NN of_IN toddy_NN or_CC liquor_NN ,_, they_PRP have_VBP little_JJ or_CC nothing_NN left_NN ;_: and_CC under_IN these_DT circumstances_NNS they_PRP can_MD not_RB afford_VB to_TO hire_VB a_DT single_JJ room_NN to_TO themselves_PRP ._.

In_IN this_DT manner_NN many_JJ thousands_NNS of_IN the_DT working_NN classes_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, among_IN both_DT casual_JJ labourers_NNS and_CC those_DT in_IN regular_JJ employment_NN ,_, are_VBP forced_VBN to_TO live_VB from_IN hand_NN to_TO mouth_NN ,_, taking_VBG their_PRP$ ordinary_JJ meagre_NN diet_NN of_IN rice_NN or_CC bajri_NN when_WRB they_PRP have_VBP money_NN or_CC can_MD borrow_VB and_CC going_VBG short_JJ from_IN time_NN to_TO time_NN as_IN a_DT matter_NN of_IN course_NN ._.
To_TO these_DT people_NNS fluctuations_NNS in_IN the_DT market_NN price_NN of_IN food_NN and_CC fuel_NN are_VBP of_IN vital_JJ importance_NN ;_: and_CC there_EX is_VBZ no_DT factor_NN which_WDT exerts_VBZ a_DT greater_JJR influence_NN upon_IN the_DT health_NN conditions_NNS of_IN the_DT masses_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP than_IN this_DT question_NN of_IN the_DT cost_NN of_IN food_NN ._.

In_IN 1877_CD ,_, owing_VBG to_TO failure_NN of_IN the_DT monsoon_NN ,_, they_PRP rose_VBD suddenly_RB once_RB more_JJR and_CC remained_VBD high_JJ during_IN the_DT whole_NN of_IN 1878_CD ._.
After_IN this_DT for_IN nearly_RB twenty_CD years_NNS they_PRP remained_VBD comparatively_RB low_JJ ,_, but_CC owing_VBG to_TO short_VB rains_NNS in_IN 1895_CD and_CC 1896_CD ,_, they_PRP rose_VBD very_RB suddenly_RB in_IN the_DT last_JJ quarter_NN of_IN the_DT latter_JJ year_NN and_CC remained_VBD high_RB through_IN 1897_CD ._.
In_IN 1900_CD there_EX was_VBD a_DT still_RB greater_JJR rise_NN owing_VBG to_TO famine_VB in_IN the_DT Presidency_NNP ,_, but_CC in_IN 1901_CD they_PRP fell_VBD considerably_RB ._.
In_IN the_DT middle_NN of_IN 1907_CD a_DT very_RB sudden_JJ rise_NN took_VBD place_NN in_IN the_DT cost_NN of_IN every_DT kind_NN of_IN food_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP and_CC of_IN fuel_NN also_RB ,_, and_CC in_IN December_NNP prices_NNS were_VBD far_RB in_IN excess_NN of_IN those_DT at_IN the_DT beginning_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
The_DT cost_NN of_IN wheat_NN rose_VBD 60.1_CD per_IN cent._NN ,_, jawri_NN ,_, bjri_NN and_CC nchni_$ 37.5_CD per_IN cent._NN ,_, flour_VBP 33.7_CD per_IN cent._NN ,_, common_JJ rice_NN 31.7_CD per_IN cent._NN ,_, grain_NN and_CC tur_NN dl_NN 20_CD per_IN cent._NN ,_, cocoanut_JJ oil_NN 25_CD per_IN cent._NN ,_, ghee_VBP 20_CD per_IN cent._NN ,_, and_CC firewood_VBD 31_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
In_IN 1908_CD prices_NNS still_RB remained_VBD high_JJ and_CC a_DT still_RB further_JJ rise_NN took_VBD place_NN in_IN the_DT prices_NNS of_IN bjri_NN ,_, nchni_RB ,_, gram_NN and_CC ?_. 8_CD tur_NN dl_NN ._.
Bjri_NNP ,_, which_WDT forms_VBZ the_DT staple_NN food_NN of_IN the_DT Deccani_NNP population_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, cost_NN Rs_NNP ._.
2-11-11_JJ per_IN maund_NN during_IN the_DT first_JJ five_CD months_NNS of_IN 1907_CD ,_, but_CC in_IN Septem-_NNP ber_NN 1908_CD the_DT price_NN had_VBD risen_VBN to_TO Rs_NNP ._.
4-4-10_JJ ,_, an_DT increase_NN of_IN 56.7_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
As_IN has_VBZ already_RB been_VBN pointed_VBN out_RP ,_, although_IN the_DT single_JJ man_NN among_IN the_DT workers_NNS of_IN Bombay_NNP is_VBZ well_RB off_IN and_CC may_MD be_VB able_JJ to_TO save_VB and_CC remit_VB money_NN to_TO his_PRP$ country_NN ,_, the_DT working_VBG man_NN with_IN a_DT family_NN has_VBZ a_DT hard_JJ fight_NN at_IN the_DT best_JJS of_IN times_NNS and_CC a_DT rise_NN in_IN the_DT price_NN of_IN food_NN or_CC in_IN rents_NNS affects_NNS him_PRP very_RB greatly_RB ._.

Indebtedness.-A_JJ very_RB large_JJ proportion_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, particularly_RB those_DT belonging_VBG to_TO the_DT working_NN classes_NNS ,_, exist_VBP in_IN a_DT chronic_JJ state_NN of_IN indebtedness_NN ;_: and_CC of_IN this_DT there_EX are_VBP two_CD kinds_NNS :_: -_: (_( a_DT )_) Debts_NNP contracted_VBN in_IN their_PRP$ country_NN usually_RB in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN a_DT mortgage_NN on_IN land_NN ._.
(_( b_NN )_) Debts_NNP contracted_VBD locally_RB with_IN Banias_NNP and_CC others_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
Indebtedness_NN of_IN the_DT first_JJ class_NN is_VBZ responsible_JJ for_IN bringing_VBG large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN workers_NNS to_TO the_DT City_NNP in_IN search_NN of_IN employment_NN ._.
Debts_NNS of_IN this_DT nature_NN generally_RB range_VBP from_IN Rs_NNP ._.
100_CD to_TO Rs_NNP ._.
1,000_CD or_CC more_JJR ,_, upon_IN which_WDT interest_NN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN from_IN 10_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
to_TO 12_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
is_VBZ charged_VBN ._.
In_IN many_JJ cases_NNS holders_NNS of_IN in-_NN debted_VBN land_NN appear_VBP to_TO have_VB passed_VBN their_PRP$ land_NN on_IN to_TO others_NNS ,_, who_WP cultivate_VBP it_PRP and_CC pay_VB the_DT interest_NN ,_, the_DT original_JJ holder_NN retaining_VBG nothing_NN but_CC a_DT lien_NN on_IN the_DT land_NN in_IN the_DT hope_NN of_IN some_DT day_NN resuming_VBG it_PRP ._.
Local_JJ indebtedness_NN is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO another_DT cause_NN ._.
Usually_RB people_NNS coming_VBG to_TO Bombay_NNP in_IN search_NN of_IN work_NN are_VBP compelled_VBN to_TO borrow_VB from_IN friends_NNS or_CC relatives_NNS or_CC to_TO obtain_VB goods_NNS on_IN credit_NN from_IN Banias_NNP ._.
If_IN a_DT man_NN loses_VBZ his_PRP$ employment_NN ,_, through_IN illness_NN or_CC otherwise_RB ,_, he_PRP speedily_RB falls_VBZ into_IN debt_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ no_DT uncommon_JJ thing_NN to_TO find_VB that_IN men_NNS earning_VBG from_IN Rs_NNP ._.
10_CD to_TO 12_CD or_CC Rs_NNP ._.
16_CD per_IN month_NN are_VBP in_IN debt_NN to_TO a_DT Bania_NNP for_IN as_RB much_JJ as_IN Rs_NNP ._.
50_CD or_CC more_JJR ;_: the_DT crowd_NN of_IN Banias_NNP ,_, Mrwries_NNP and_CC Cabuli_NNP money-lenders_NNS who_WP may_MD may_MD be_VB seen_VBN hanging_VBG round_JJ pay_NN offices_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP on_IN pay_NN days_NNS shows_VBZ that_IN the_DT petty_JJ money-lenders_NNS in_IN the_DT City_NNP keep_VB a_DT sharp_JJ look_NN out_IN upon_IN their_PRP$ clients_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ often_RB forgotten_VBN that_IN ,_, the_DT impelling_VBG motive_NN that_WDT brings_VBZ many_JJ workers_NNS into_IN the_DT City_NNP is_VBZ the_DT necessity_NN for_IN earning_VBG money_NN to_TO remit_VB to_TO their_PRP$ homes_NNS ,_, either_RB for_IN the_DT support_NN of_IN relations_NNS or_CC for_IN the_DT payment_NN of_IN debts_NNS or_CC both_DT ._.
Thus_RB it_PRP happens_VBZ that_IN the_DT average_JJ Bombay_NNP labourer_NN can_MD count_VB upon_IN spending_VBG only_RB a_DT portion_NN of_IN his_PRP$ earnings_NNS upon_IN himself_PRP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ no_DT uncommon_JJ thing_NN for_IN men_NNS ,_, who_WP have_VBP left_VBN their_PRP$ families_NNS at_IN home_NN ,_, to_TO remit_VB a_DT considerable_JJ amount_NN of_IN their_PRP$ wages_NNS each_DT month_NN to_TO their_PRP$ native_JJ village_NN ._.
Masons_NNS from_IN the_DT Poona_NNP District_NNP earning_VBG Re_NNP ._.
1_CD a_DT day_NN will_MD sometimes_RB send_VB as_RB much_JJ as_IN Rs_NNP ._.

MUNICIPAL_JJ ADMINISTRATION.-At_NNP the_DT head_NN of_IN the_DT Municipal_NNP Administration_NNP of_IN the_DT City_NNP is_VBZ the_DT Municipal_JJ Corporation_NNP ,_, the_DT Standing_NNP Committee_NNP and_CC the_DT Municipal_NNP Commissioner_NNP ._.
The_DT Municipal_NNP Corporation_NNP is_VBZ composed_VBN of_IN 72_CD members_NNS ,_, 36_CD of_IN whom_WP are_VBP elected_VBN at_IN Ward_NNP Elections_NNP by_IN the_DT votes_NNS of_IN property-_NN owners_NNS and_CC tax-payers_NNS ._.

One-sixth_JJ are_VBP usually_RB Europeans_NNPS and_CC one-fourth_JJ Prsis_NNP and_CC the_DT remainder_NN is_VBZ mostly_RB made_VBN up_IN of_IN Hindus_NNP and_CC Mussulmans_NNPS ._.

The_DT Municipal_NNP Commissioner_NNP is_VBZ appointed_VBN by_IN Government_NNP ._.
?_. 9_CD 21_CD ._.
With_IN the_DT Municipal_NNP Corporation_NNP lies_VBZ the_DT power_NN of_IN the_DT purse_NN ,_, and_CC under_IN the_DT City_NNP of_IN Bombay_NNP Municipal_NNP Act_NNP it_PRP is_VBZ incumbent_JJ upon_IN it_PRP to_TO provide_VB for_IN the_DT execution_NN and_CC maintenance_NN of_IN drainage_NN ,_, water-works_JJ ,_, conservancy_NN ,_, reclamation_NN of_IN unhealthy_JJ localities_NNS ,_, regulation_NN of_IN places_NNS for_IN the_DT disposal_NN of_IN the_DT dead_JJ ,_, birth_NN and_CC death_NN registration_NN ,_, measures_NNS for_IN preventing_VBG and_CC checking_VBG the_DT spread_NN of_IN disease_NN ,_, maintenance_NN and_CC regulation_NN of_IN markets_NNS and_CC slaughter-houses_NNS ._.

The_DT Department_NNP of_IN Public_NNP Works_NNP is_VBZ under_IN the_DT Executive_NNP Engineer_NNP ,_, assisted_VBN by_IN a_DT large_JJ staff_NN of_IN Deputy_NNP and_CC Assistant_NNP Engineers_NNP in_IN charge_NN of_IN differ-_JJ ent_JJ branches_NNS of_IN work_NN ._.

In_IN the_DT ten_NN years_NNS since_IN 1897_CD 57\3/4\_CD lakhs_NN has_VBZ been_VBN spent_VBN on_IN drainage_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ proposed_VBN to_TO carry_VB out_RP further_JJ drainage_NN works_VBZ in_IN the_DT next_JJ few_JJ years_NNS at_IN an_DT estimated_JJ cost_NN of_IN 50_CD lakhs_NN ._.

Effect_NN of_IN Migration_NNP upon_IN Mortality.-If_NNP we_PRP were_VBD dealing_VBG with_IN a_DT permanent_JJ population_NN of_IN known_JJ number_NN it_PRP would_MD be_VB reasonable_JJ to_TO assume_VB that_IN an_DT increase_NN or_CC decrease_NN in_IN the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN deaths_NNS occurring_VBG from_IN year_NN to_TO year_NN was_VBD due_JJ either_RB to_TO a_DT greater_JJR or_CC a_DT lessened_JJ prevalence_NN of_IN disease_NN ;_: and_CC that_IN this_DT in_IN turn_NN was_VBD directly_RB related_VBN to_TO the_DT climatic_JJ ,_, economic_JJ or_CC other_JJ con-_JJ ditions_NNS obtaining_VBG at_IN different_JJ times_NNS ._.
But_CC the_DT factors_NNS which_WDT determine_VBP the_DT variations_NNS in_IN the_DT total_JJ mortality_NN of_IN large_JJ cities_NNS in_IN India_NNP are_VBP usually_RB of_IN a_DT complex_JJ nature_NN ._.
In_IN Bombay_NNP migration_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN is_VBZ a_DT factor_NN of_IN tremendous_JJ importance_NN both_DT as_IN regards_NNS the_DT real_JJ and_CC the_DT apparent_JJ health_NN conditions_NNS of_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.
As_IN has_VBZ already_RB been_VBN mentioned_VBN ,_, the_DT population_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP is_VBZ augmented_VBN each_DT dry_NN season_NN by_IN many_JJ thousands_NNS of_IN persons_NNS most_JJS of_IN whom_WP leave_VBP the_DT City_NNP again_RB before_IN the_DT onset_NN of_IN the_DT south-west_JJ monsoon_NN ._.
There_EX are_VBP strong_JJ grounds_NNS for_IN believing_VBG that_IN this_DT periodical_JJ movement_NN affects_NNS at_IN least_JJS ?_. 13_CD 15_CD to_TO 20_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT population_NN usually_RB present_JJ at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN the_DT Census_NNP ;_: and_CC the_DT influence_NN of_IN this_DT migration_NN upon_IN the_DT public_JJ health_NN is_VBZ very_RB marked_JJ ._.
But_CC the_DT influx_NN and_CC subsequent_JJ exodus_NN of_IN people_NNS is_VBZ not_RB constant_JJ from_IN year_NN to_TO year_NN ._.
Scarcity_NN in_IN the_DT Presidency_NNP or_CC special_JJ demand_NN and_CC high_JJ rates_NNS for_IN labour_NN in_IN the_DT City_NNP results_NNS in_IN an_DT abnormal_JJ swelling_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN ;_: whereas_JJ prosperity_NN in_IN the_DT agricultural_JJ districts_NNS or_CC lack_NN of_IN employment_NN in_IN the_DT City_NNP reduces_VBZ the_DT periodi-_JJ cal_JJ migration_NN to_TO a_DT very_RB marked_JJ degree_NN ;_: and_CC the_DT result_NN is_VBZ reflected_VBN in_IN the_DT total_JJ mortality_NN returns_NNS from_IN year_NN to_TO year_NN ._.
34_CD ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ necessary_JJ to_TO discuss_VB the_DT seasonal_JJ fluctuation_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN at_IN some_DT length_NN ,_, as_IN very_RB little_JJ attention_NN appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN paid_VBN to_TO it_PRP in_IN the_DT past_NN ,_, although_IN it_PRP is_VBZ a_DT factor_NN of_IN enormous_JJ importance_NN in_IN relation_NN to_TO the_DT public_JJ health_NN problems_NNS of_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.
The_DT influx_NN of_IN people_NNS commences_NNS after_IN harvest_NN in_IN November_NNP ,_, and_CC their_PRP$ numbers_NNS gradually_RB increase_VB throughout_IN the_DT succeeding_JJ months_NNS until_IN May_NNP and_CC June_NNP when_WRB a_DT sudden_JJ exodus_NN occurs_NNS ._.
The_DT Imperial_NNP Gazetteer_NNP of_IN India_NNP speaks_VBZ of-_JJ ``_`` The_DT almost_RB limitless_JJ reserves_NNS of_IN the_DT Ght_NNP village_NN whence_NN cultivators_NNS ``_`` proceed_VBN in_IN large_JJ numbers_NNS to_TO Bombay_NNP to_TO work_VB for_IN a_DT few_JJ months_NNS ,_, and_CC ``_`` return_NN with_IN their_PRP$ savings_NNS to_TO their_PRP$ villages_NNS ,_, either_RB at_IN the_DT Holi_NNP festival_NN ``_`` (_( March_NNP )_) or_CC at_IN the_DT commencement_NN of_IN the_DT south-west_JJ monsoon_NN ._. ''_''
and_CC states_VBZ that-_JJ ``_`` The_DT mills_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP draw_VB large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN labourers_NNS from_IN the_DT Kon-_NNP ``_`` kan_JJ Districts_NNS of_IN Kolba_NNP and_CC Ratngiri_NNP and_CC from_IN Stra_NNP ,_, Poona_NNP and_CC Ahmed-_NNP ``_`` nagar_NN in_IN the_DT Deccan_NNP ._.
These_DT for_IN the_DT most_JJS part_NN return_NN to_TO their_PRP$ homes_NNS ``_`` at_IN intervals_NNS for_IN such_JJ agricultural_JJ operations_NNS as_IN their_PRP$ continual_JJ con-_NN ``_`` nection_NN with_IN the_DT land_NN requires_VBZ ._. ''_''
This_DT movement_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN has_VBZ continued_VBN for_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN years_NNS ,_, and_CC some_DT idea_NN of_IN its_PRP$ extent_NN may_MD be_VB gauged_VBN by_IN the_DT statements_NNS published_VBN in_IN the_DT Gazetteers_NNP for_IN Ratngiri_NNP ,_, Poona_NNP and_CC Stra_NNP Districts_NNP ,_, in_IN 1880-1885_JJ ._.

''_''
The_DT Poona_NNP District_NNP Gazetteer_NNP also_RB records_VBZ that-_JJ ``_`` During_IN the_DT eight_CD months_NNS from_IN October_NNP to_TO June_NNP ,_, especially_RB during_IN ``_`` the_DT latter_JJ portion_NN of_IN this_DT period_NN ,_, a_DT considerable_JJ proportion_NN of_IN the_DT kunbi_NN ``_`` or_CC cultivating_VBG classes_NNS go_VBP to_TO Bombay_NNP ,_, where_WRB they_PRP earn_VBP a_DT living_NN as_IN palanquin_JJ ``_`` bearers_NNS ,_, carriers_NNS ,_, grass-cutters_NNS and_CC labourers_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ impossible_JJ to_TO make_VB ``_`` an_DT accurate_JJ estimate_NN of_IN the_DT proportion_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN who_WP yearly_RB ``_`` move_NN to_TO Bombay_NNP in_IN search_NN of_IN work_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ probably_RB not_RB less_JJR than_IN ``_`` 5_CD per_IN cent_NN ._. ''_''
The_DT population_NN of_IN Poona_NNP District_NNP at_IN the_DT period_NN when_WRB this_DT Gazetteer_NNP was_VBD published_VBN numbered_JJ 900,621_CD ._.
The_DT Stra_NNP District_NNP Gazetteer_NNP published_VBN about_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN makes_VBZ a_DT very_RB similar_JJ statement_NN regarding_VBG the_DT temporary_JJ movement_NN of_IN people_NNS from_IN that_DT district_NN to_TO Bombay_NNP ,_, but_CC gives_VBZ no_DT estimate_NN of_IN the_DT probable_JJ number_NN concerned_VBN ._.

The_DT plague_NN epidemic_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP City_NNP to_TO which_WDT the_DT male_NN ``_`` population_NN of_IN these_DT districts_NNS emigrates_VBZ annually_RB seems_VBZ to_TO have_VB caused_VBN ``_`` the_DT death_NN of_IN the_DT husbands_NNS ._. ''_''

Death-rates.-Total_JJ mortality_NN figures_NNS give_VBP but_CC a_DT slight_JJ indication_NN of_IN the_DT true_JJ state_NN of_IN the_DT public_JJ health_NN and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ usual_JJ for_IN comparative_JJ purposes_NNS to_TO make_VB use_NN of_IN death-rates_NNS ,_, that_WDT is_VBZ the_DT ratio_NN of_IN persons_NNS dying_VBG each_DT year_NN to_TO the_DT total_JJ population_NN living_NN ._.
For_IN calculating_VBG death-rates_NNS it_PRP is_VBZ necessary_JJ to_TO have_VB an_DT estimate_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ population_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT figures_NNS obtained_VBN at_IN each_DT decennial_JJ census_NN are_VBP made_VBN use_NN of_IN for_IN this_DT purpose_NN ._.
In_IN Great_NNP Britain_NNP it_PRP is_VBZ customary_JJ to_TO calculate_VB the_DT population_NN living_NN in_IN each_DT year_NN of_IN the_DT inter-censal_JJ periods_NNS and_CC to_TO base_VB birth_NN and_CC death-rates_NNS upon_IN these_DT figures_NNS ;_: but_CC in_IN India_NNP no_DT such_JJ correction_NN is_VBZ made_VBN ,_, birth_NN and_CC death-rates_NNS being_VBG calculated_VBN upon_IN the_DT census_NN population_NN ._.

?_. 16_CD (_( 3_CD )_) Owing_VBG to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT influx_NN of_IN people_NNS into_IN Bombay_NNP is_VBZ not_RB constant_JJ from_IN year_NN to_TO year_NN the_DT census_NN may_MD show_VB a_DT population_NN either_DT greatly_RB in_IN excess_NN of_IN the_DT average_JJ yearly_JJ dry_JJ weather_NN population_NN or_CC greatly_RB below_IN it_PRP The_DT 1901_CD census_NN population_NN was_VBD supposed_VBN to_TO be_VB much_RB below_IN the_DT normal_JJ the_DT 1906_CD census_NN was_VBD certainly_RB greatly_RB in_IN excess_NN of_IN the_DT normal_JJ ._.

Census_NNP population_NN and_CC actual_JJ population.-The_JJ census_NN of_IN 1906_CD was_VBD taken_VBN on_IN February_NNP 9th_CD at_IN a_DT time_NN when_WRB the_DT population_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP was_VBD swollen_VBN by_IN an_DT influx_NN of_IN destitute_JJ famine_NN refugees_NNS and_CC an_DT army_NN of_IN worker_NN in_IN excess_NN of_IN the_DT number_NN usually_RB finding_JJ employment_NN there_RB ,_, and_CC it_PRP was_VBD recognized_VBN at_IN the_DT time_NN that_IN an_DT abnormal_JJ influx_NN of_IN people_NNS had_VBD occurred_VBN ._.
The_DT Administration_NNP Report_NNP of_IN the_DT City_NNP for_IN 1906-1907_JJ speaks_NNS of_IN the_DT deficient_NN rainfall_NN of_IN 1905_CD and_CC remarks-_JJ ``_`` As_IN usual_JJ ,_, the_DT influx_NN of_IN famine_JJ refugees_NNS proved_VBD to_TO be_VB one_CD of_IN the_DT ``_`` principal_JJ causes_NNS of_IN the_DT increased_JJ unhealthiness_NN of_IN the_DT City_NNP ..._: ..._: ''_'' ._.
Many_JJ important_JJ works_NNS also_RB were_VBD undergoing_JJ construction_NN during_IN this_DT year_NN and_CC served_VBD to_TO attract_VB an_DT abnormal_JJ number_NN of_IN labourers_NNS to_TO the_DT City_NNP ._.
The_DT Executive_NNP Health_NNP Officer_NNP records_NNS in_IN his_PRP$ report_NN for_IN 1906_CD that-_JJ ``_`` Electric_NNP tram-lines_NNS are_VBP under_IN construction_NN which_WDT has_VBZ brought_VBN to_TO ``_`` the_DT City_NNP a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN labouring_VBG hands_NNS ,_, to_TO add_VB to_TO the_DT number_NN already_RB ``_`` engaged_VBN in_IN the_DT construction_NN of_IN the_DT Docks_NNP ._.

A_DT specially_RB large_JJ number_NN of_IN women_NNS was_VBD present_JJ in_IN the_DT City_NNP that_WDT year_NN ,_, as_IN shown_VBN by_IN the_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT total_JJ female_JJ deaths_NNS ,_, which_WDT rose_VBD 3,000_CD in_IN excess_NN of_IN the_DT mean_NN of_IN the_DT previous_JJ four_CD years_NNS ._.

All_PDT these_DT facts_NNS point_NN to_TO the_DT presence_NN of_IN a_DT specially_RB large_JJ population_NN in_IN 1906_CD ;_: but_CC there_EX are_VBP grave_JJ reasons_NNS for_IN doubting_VBG the_DT accuracy_NN of_IN the_DT special_JJ census_NN held_VBD in_IN that_DT year_NN ._.
In_IN 1901_CD the_DT census_NN ,_, which_WDT was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP in_IN March_NNP ,_, showed_VBD a_DT ratio_NN of_IN females_NNS to_TO males_NNS of_IN 617_CD ,_, and_CC the_DT death_NN returns_NNS during_IN the_DT months_NNS of_IN January_NNP ,_, February_NNP and_CC March_NNP 1901_CD show_NN a_DT ratio_NN of_IN female_JJ deaths_NNS to_TO male_NN of_IN 590_CD ,_, 598_CD and_CC 604_CD rising_VBG to_TO 691_CD in_IN April_NNP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ apparent_JJ therefore_RB that_IN there_EX was_VBD a_DT close_JJ relationship_NN between_IN the_DT proportion_NN of_IN females_NNS to_TO males_NNS as_IN ascertained_VBN by_IN the_DT census_NN and_CC that_IN inferred_VBN from_IN the_DT relative_JJ mortality_NN of_IN the_DT two_CD sexes_NNS about_IN the_DT census_NN period_NN ._.
But_CC the_DT 1906_CD census_NN ,_, which_WDT was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP in_IN February_NNP ,_, gave_VBD a_DT ratio_NN of_IN only_RB 595_CD females_NNS to_TO 1,000_CD males_NNS ,_, though_IN the_DT mortality_NN returns_VBZ show_VBP that_IN in_IN January_NNP ,_, February_NNP and_CC March_NNP respectively_RB ,_, 802_CD ,_, 737_CD and_CC 712_CD females_NNS died_VBD to_TO every_DT 1,000_CD males_NNS ._.
This_DT lack_NN of_IN correspondence_NN between_IN ,_, the_DT ratio_NN of_IN female_NN to_TO male_VB deaths_NNS and_CC that_DT of_IN living_NN females_NNS to_TO living_VBG males_NNS ,_, as_IN found_VBN by_IN the_DT census_NN ,_, indicates_VBZ a_DT serious_JJ error_NN in_IN the_DT enumeration_NN ._.
