in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN inhabited_JJ houses_NNS in_IN the_DT City_NNP as_IN compared_VBN with_IN 1901_CD ._.
Taking_VBG everything_NN into_IN consideration_NN there_RB does_VBZ not_RB appear_VB to_TO have_VB been_VBN such_PDT an_DT extraordinary_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_DT mean_JJ annual_JJ population_NN during_IN the_DT past_JJ ten_NN years_NNS ,_, as_IN that_DT shown_VBN by_IN a_DT comparison_NN of_IN the_DT census_NN returns_NNS of_IN 1901_CD and_CC 1906_CD ._.
41_CD ._.
Unfortunately_RB it_PRP is_VBZ impossible_JJ to_TO say_VB whether_IN the_DT mean_JJ annual_JJ population_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP amounts_NNS to_TO 700,000_CD or_CC to_TO 900,000_CD and_CC unless_IN measures_NNS were_VBD adopted_VBN for_IN keeping_VBG an_DT accurate_NN record_NN of_IN all_PDT those_DT who_WP enter_VBP and_CC leave_VBP the_DT island_NN ,_, so_RB as_IN to_TO correct_VB the_DT estimate_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN from_IN time_NN to_TO time_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ difficult_JJ to_TO see_VB how_WRB a_DT definite_JJ standard_NN is_VBZ to_TO be_VB obtained_VBN ._.
Many_JJ years_NNS ago_IN the_DT B_NNP 136-5_JJ ?_. 18_CD suggestion_NN was_VBD made_VBN that_IN ,_, a_DT double_JJ census_NN should_MD be_VB held_VBN ,_, one_CD enumeration_NN in_IN the_DT dry_JJ weather_NN and_CC another_DT in_IN the_DT rains_NNS ,_, but_CC this_DT would_MD of_IN course_NN only_RB give_JJ figures_NNS for_IN one_CD year_NN ,_, which_WDT might_MD be_VB completely_RB upset_VBN the_DT following_VBG season_NN ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN these_DT facts_NNS it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN considered_VBN wise_NN to_TO attach_VB no_DT weight_NN to_TO conclusions_NNS based_VBN upon_IN the_DT mortality_NN rates_NNS of_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
42_CD ._.
Errors_NNS in_IN death-rates.-But_JJ the_DT error_NN in_IN calculating_VBG death-rates_NNS upon_IN an_DT unknown_JJ and_CC fluctuating_JJ population_NN is_VBZ still_RB further_RBR increased_VBN by_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT crude_JJ death-rate_JJ takes_VBZ no_DT account_NN of_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN sick_JJ people_NNS who_WP leave_VBP Bombay_NNP and_CC die_NN in_IN other_JJ places_NNS ;_: and_CC also_RB that_IN in_IN calculating_VBG the_DT crude_NN death-rate_JJ no_DT allowance_NN is_VBZ made_VBN for_IN the_DT age_NN and_CC sex_NN distribution_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ a_DT well_RB known_VBN fact_NN that_IN persons_NNS of_IN different_JJ ages_NNS die_VBP at_IN different_JJ rates_NNS ,_, mortality_NN being_VBG very_RB high_JJ among_IN young_JJ children_NNS ,_, low_JJ among_IN young_JJ adults_NNS and_CC high_JJ again_RB among_IN the_DT old_JJ people_NNS ._.
There_EX are_VBP also_RB slight_JJ differences_NNS in_IN the_DT death-rates_NNS of_IN the_DT different_JJ sexes_NNS ,_, but_CC these_DT are_VBP not_RB so_RB great_JJ in_IN India_NNP as_IN to_TO be_VB important_JJ ._.
Towns_NNP usually_RB contain_VBP an_DT excess_NN of_IN young_JJ adults_NNS whose_WP$ death-rate_NN is_VBZ less_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT general_JJ population_NN ;_: and_CC as_IN a_DT result_NN the_DT recorded_VBN death-rate_NN of_IN towns_NNS is_VBZ usually_RB too_RB low_JJ ._.
43_CD ._.
Various_JJ methods_NNS have_VBP been_VBN devised_VBN for_IN correcting_VBG the_DT errors_NNS in_IN death-_JJ rates_NNS arising_VBG from_IN sex_NN and_CC age_NN constitution_NN of_IN a_DT population_NN ._.
The_DT method_NN most_RBS generally_RB used_VBN in_IN England_NNP is_VBZ based_VBN primarily_RB upon_IN the_DT actual_JJ death-rate_NN of_IN each_DT sex_NN at_IN different_JJ ages_NNS throughout_IN England_NNP and_CC Wales_NNP ._.
In_IN use_NN a_DT hypothe-_JJ tical_JJ death-rate_NN is_VBZ calculated_VBN for_IN each_DT large_JJ city_NN ,_, based_VBN on_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN deaths_NNS that_WDT would_MD have_VB occurred_VBN in_IN any_DT given_VBN year_NN if_IN the_DT population_NN existing_VBG in_IN the_DT city_NN at_IN different_JJ age_NN periods_NNS had_VBD died_VBN at_IN the_DT same_JJ rates_NNS as_IN persons_NNS of_IN the_DT same_JJ age_NN in_IN the_DT country_NN as_IN a_DT whole_NN ._.
This_DT hypothetical_JJ death-rate_NN is_VBZ called_VBN the_DT standard_JJ death-rate_NN ._.
The_DT correction_NN factor_NN is_VBZ obtained_VBN by_IN dividing_VBG the_DT actual_JJ number_NN of_IN deaths_NNS in_IN the_DT year_NN with_IN the_DT hypothetical_JJ total_NN obtained_VBN under_IN the_DT standard_JJ death-rate_NN ._.
If_IN we_PRP wish_VBP to_TO compare_VB the_DT mortality_NN rates_NNS of_IN Bombay_NNP with_IN those_DT of_IN the_DT whole_JJ Presidency_NN ,_, we_PRP must_MD make_VB a_DT somewhat_RB similar_JJ correction_NN ,_, and_CC we_PRP find_VBP that_IN the_DT standard_JJ death-rates_NNS for_IN Bombay_NNP for_IN the_DT years_NNS 1907_CD ,_, 1908_CD and_CC 1909_CD calculated_VBD on_IN the_DT assumption_NN that_IN the_DT City_NNP population_NN at_IN various_JJ age_NN periods_NNS died_VBD each_DT year_NN at_IN the_DT same_JJ rate_NN as_IN those_DT of_IN the_DT same_JJ age_NN in_IN the_DT whole_JJ Presidency_NN were_VBD :_: -_: 1907_CD ..._: ..._: ..._: 281_CD per_IN 1,000_CD 1908_CD ..._: ..._: ..._: 224_CD ``_`` ``_`` 1909_CD ..._: ..._: ..._: 229_CD ``_`` ``_`` The_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN deaths_NNS that_WDT would_MD have_VB occurred_VBN at_IN these_DT rates_NNS (_( on_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN the_DT 1906_CD census_NN )_) was-_NN 1907_CD ..._: ..._: ..._: ..._: 27,555_CD 1908_CD ..._: ..._: ..._: ..._: 21,980_CD 1909_CD ..._: ..._: ..._: ..._: 22,268_CD And_CC the_DT actual_JJ number_NN of_IN deaths_NNS occurring_VBG each_DT year_NN divided_VBN by_IN these_DT figures_NNS gives_VBZ the_DT correction_NN factors_NNS of-_JJ 1403_CD for_IN 1907_CD 1741_CD for_IN 1908_CD 1566_CD for_IN 1909_CD When_WRB corrected_VBN by_IN means_NNS of_IN these_DT factors_NNS the_DT death-rate_NN for_IN the_DT City_NNP for_IN the_DT three_CD years_NNS becomes-_JJ 1907_CD ._.
1908_CD ._.
1909_CD ._.
Crude_NNP death-rate_NN as_IN recorded_VBN in_IN Bombay_NNP ..._: ..._: 3956_CD 3913_CD 3566_CD Death-rate_NNP corrected_VBD for_IN age_NN distribution_NN of_IN population_NN ._.
5550_CD 6812_CD 5584_CD These_DT figures_NNS are_VBP not_RB put_RB forward_RB as_IN being_VBG accurate_JJ ,_, as_IN neither_CC the_DT census_NN figures_NNS for_IN the_DT Presidency_NNP nor_CC those_DT for_IN the_DT City_NNP are_VBP correct_JJ ,_, but_CC they_PRP serve_VBP to_TO indicate_VB the_DT fallacy_NN of_IN basing_VBG conclusions_NNS regarding_VBG the_DT health_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP 19_CD upon_IN the_DT figures_NNS of_IN a_DT crude_JJ death-rate_NN ._.
As_IN a_DT matter_NN of_IN fact_NN 1908_CD was_VBD undoubt-_JJ edly_RB more_RBR unhealthy_JJ than_IN 1907_CD ,_, owing_VBG to_TO the_DT prevalance_NN of_IN malaria_NN ,_, but_CC this_DT was_VBD absolutely_RB masked_VBN by_IN the_DT uncorrected_JJ death-rates_NNS for_IN these_DT years_NNS ._.
44_CD ._.
The_DT causes_NNS of_IN death_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ._. ?_.
As_IN has_VBZ already_RB been_VBN pointed_VBN out_RP the_DT registration_NN of_IN causes_NNS of_IN death_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP is_VBZ largely_RB a_DT matter_NN of_IN guess-work_NN ._.
In_IN 1909_CD ,_, 21_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN deaths_NNS were_VBD certified_VBN against_IN 7_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN 1901_CD ,_, but_CC in_IN the_DT vast_JJ majority_NN of_IN cases_NNS ,_, dependence_NN has_VBZ to_TO be_VB placed_VBN upon_IN enquiries_NNS made_VBN of_IN friends_NNS or_CC relations_NNS ._.
In_IN 1910_CD ,_, 8,394_CD deaths_NNS were_VBD certified_VBN and_CC 19,607_CD verified_VBN by_IN enquiry_NN among_IN friends_NNS and_CC relatives_NNS of_IN the_DT deceased_VBN ._.
This_DT latter_JJ work_NN is_VBZ carried_VBN out_RP by_IN a_DT special_JJ registration_NN staff_NN first_RB appointed_VBN in_IN 1902_CD ._.
One_CD effect_NN of_IN this_DT improved_JJ organization_NN was_VBD the_DT immediate_JJ reduction_NN of_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN deaths_NNS recorded_VBN under_IN the_DT head_NN fever_NN ,_, a_DT reduction_NN which_WDT might_MD be_VB ascribed_VBN to_TO other_JJ causes_NNS if_IN this_DT co-incident_JJ alteration_NN in_IN the_DT method_NN of_IN registration_NN were_VBD overlooked_VBN ._.
Unfortunately_RB in_IN the_DT published_VBN returns_NNS certified_JJ causes_NNS of_IN deaths_NNS are_VBP pooled_VBN with_IN those_DT arrived_VBN at_IN as_IN the_DT result_NN of_IN enquiry_NN after_IN death_NN ._.
45_CD ._.
The_DT principal_JJ causes_NNS of_IN death_NN ,_, as_IN at_IN present_NN recorded_VBN ,_, are_VBP plague_JJ ,_, cholera_NN ,_, small-pox_JJ ,_, fevers_NNS ,_, dysentery_NN ,_, diarrha_NN ,_, phthisis_NN and_CC respiratory_NN diseases_NNS ._.
The_DT following_VBG table_JJ gives_VBZ the_DT total_JJ deaths_NNS recorded_VBN under_IN different_JJ headings_NNS ,_, taken_VBN from_IN the_DT Annual_NNP Report_NNP of_IN the_DT Executive_NNP Health_NNP Officer_NNP for_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.
The_DT rate_NN per_IN 1,000_CD of_IN the_DT population_NN is_VBZ not_RB given_VBN ,_, as_IN in_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT uncertainty_NN regarding_VBG the_DT actual_JJ population_NN at_IN any_DT given_VBN period_NN such_JJ figures_NNS are_VBP fallacious_JJ :_: -_: Year_IN Small-_NNP pox_NN ._.

?_. PART_NNP II.-MALARIA_NNP IN_NNP BOMBAY_NNP ._.
CHAPTER_NN I_PRP ._.
THE_DT HISTORY_NNP OF_NNP MALARIA_NNP IN_NNP BOMBAY_NNP ._.
46_CD ._.
Bombay_NNP has_VBZ passed_VBN through_IN many_JJ periods_NNS of_IN ill-health_NN ,_, from_IN the_DT time_NN when_WRB speaking_NN of_IN Europeans_NNPS it_PRP was_VBD said_VBD that_IN ,_, ``_`` Two_CD monsoons_NNS were_VBD the_DT life_NN of_IN a_DT man_NN ''_'' to_TO the_DT more_RBR recent_JJ outbreak_NN of_IN plague_NN ,_, but_CC there_EX are_VBP few_JJ references_NNS to_TO malaria_VB to_TO be_VB found_VBN in_IN the_DT history_NN of_IN the_DT Island_NNP and_CC this_DT fact_NN supports_VBZ the_DT assumption_NN that_IN the_DT City_NNP has_VBZ never_RB suffered_VBN as_IN severely_RB from_IN malaria_NNS as_IN many_JJ other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN India_NNP ._.
Freyer_NNP writing_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP in_IN 1673_CD remarks_NNS :_: -_: ``_`` I_PRP reckon_VBP the_DT people_NNS of_IN Bombay_NNP walk_NN in_IN charnel_NN houses_NNS ,_, the_DT climate_NN ``_`` being_VBG extremely_RB unhealthy_JJ ,_, as_IN first_JJ thought_NN to_TO be_VB caused_VBN by_IN bubsho_NN ,_, ``_`` rotten_JJ fish_NN ;_: but_CC ,_, though_IN that_DT be_VB prohibited_VBN ,_, yet_CC it_PRP continues_VBZ as_IN mortal_NN ._.
``_`` I_PRP rather_RB impute_VBP it_PRP to_TO the_DT situation_NN which_WDT causes_VBZ an_DT infecundity_NN in_IN the_DT ``_`` earth_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT putridness_NN in_IN the_DT air_NN ,_, which_WDT being_VBG produced_VBN seldom_RB coming_VBG ``_`` to_TO maturity_NN ,_, whereby_WRB what_WP is_VBZ eaten_VBN is_VBZ undigested_VBN ;_: whence_NN follow_NN fluxes_NNS ,_, ``_`` dropsy_NN ,_, scurvy_NN ,_, barbiers_NNS ,_, gout_NN ,_, stone_NN ,_, malignant_JJ and_CC putrid_JJ fevers_NNS ,_, which_WDT ``_`` are_VBP endemial_JJ diseases_NNS ._. ''_''
And_CC Aungier_NNP ,_, the_DT famous_JJ Governor_NNP of_IN the_DT Island_NNP ,_, in_IN a_DT report_NN written_VBN in_IN the_DT same_JJ year_NN as_IN Freyer_NNP 's_POS memoir_NN ,_, stated_VBD that-_JJ ``_`` After_IN the_DT first_JJ intermission_NN of_IN the_DT rains_NNS in_IN May_NNP or_CC June_NNP and_CC after_IN ``_`` their_PRP$ total_JJ ceasing_NN in_IN October_NNP the_DT air_NN and_CC water_NN are_VBP unwholesome_VBN by_IN ``_`` reason_NN of_IN the_DT crude_NN pestiferous_JJ vapours_NNS exhaled_VBN by_IN the_DT violent_JJ heat_NN of_IN the_DT ``_`` sun_NN into_IN the_DT air_NN and_CC vermin_NN created_VBN in_IN the_DT wells_NNS and_CC tanks_NNS which_WDT renders_VBP ``_`` those_DT months_NNS mostly_RB sickly_VBP to_TO the_DT inhabitants_NNS ,_, and_CC especially_RB Europeans_NNPS ._. ''_''
A_DT few_JJ years_NNS later_RB Ovington_NNP writes_NNS of_IN Bombay_NNP as_IN follows_VBZ :_: -_: ``_`` Fish_JJ manure_NN is_VBZ a_DT mortal_JJ enemy_NN to_TO the_DT lives_NNS of_IN Europeans_NNPS ._.
We_PRP ``_`` arrived_VBD here_RB at_IN the_DT beginning_NN of_IN the_DT rains_NNS and_CC buried_VBN of_IN the_DT 24_CD passen-_JJ ``_`` gers_NNS we_PRP brought_VBD with_IN us_PRP above_IN 20_CD ,_, before_IN they_PRP were_VBD ended_VBN ;_: and_CC of_IN all_DT ``_`` our_PRP$ own_JJ ships_NNS '_POS company_NN above_IN 15_CD ._.
..._: ..._: ._.
The_DT prodigious_JJ growth_NN ``_`` of_IN vermin_NN and_CC of_IN venomous_JJ creatures_NNS at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN the_DT monsoons_NNS do_VBP ``_`` abundantly_RB demonstrate_VB the_DT malignant_JJ corruption_NN of_IN the_DT air_NN ._. ''_''
47_CD ._.
In_IN recent_JJ years_NNS it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN suggested_VBN that_IN malaria_NN was_VBD responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT condition_NN of_IN things_NNS recorded_VBN by_IN Freyer_NNP ,_, Aungier_NNP and_CC Ovington_NNP ._.
Campbell_NNP in_IN his_PRP$ History_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP (_( Vol_NNP ._.
I_PRP ,_, p._RB 437_CD )_) ,_, remarks_NNS :_: -_: ``_`` Various_JJ causes_NNS were_VBD assigned_VBN for_IN the_DT alarming_VBG mortality_NN amongst_IN ``_`` Europeans_NNPS in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
The_DT atmosphere_NN was_VBD at_IN first_JJ supposed_VBN to_TO be_VB ``_`` polluted_VBN by_IN the_DT putrid_JJ fish_NN with_IN which_WDT the_DT trees_NNS were_VBD manured_VBN ._.
A_DT more_RBR ``_`` reasonable_JJ conjecture_NN was_VBD that_IN malaria_NNS arose_VBP from_IN the_DT low_JJ plains_NNS ``_`` which_WDT were_VBD overflowed_VBN at_IN high_JJ tides_NNS and_CC left_VBN in_IN a_DT swampy_JJ state_NN when_WRB ``_`` the_DT sea_NN receded_VBD ._. ''_''
And_CC in_IN the_DT recently_RB published_VBN Bombay_NNP Gazetteer_NNP ,_, a_DT comment_NN upon_IN Aungier_NNP 's_POS report_NN suggests_VBZ that_IN :_: -_: ``_`` One_CD of_IN the_DT chief_JJ reasons_NNS for_IN the_DT unhealthiness_NN recorded_VBN by_IN him_PRP ,_, was_VBD ``_`` doubtless_IN the_DT gradual_JJ silting-up_NN of_IN the_DT creeks_NN which_WDT divided_VBD Bombay_NNP into_IN ``_`` a_DT group_NN of_IN islets_NNS ._.
At_IN high_JJ tide_IN the_DT sea_NN swept_VBD through_IN the_DT breaches_NNS ,_, ``_`` overflowed_VBD the_DT major_JJ portion_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN ,_, and_CC left_VBD a_DT pestilential_JJ deposit_NN ``_`` highly_RB productive_JJ of_IN malaria_NN ;_: and_CC the_DT conviction_NN of_IN the_DT truth_NN of_IN this_DT ``_`` suggestion_NN led_VBD the_DT Court_NNP of_IN Directors_NNPS between_IN 1684_CD to_TO 1710_CD to_TO constantly_VB ``_`` emphasize_VB the_DT need_NN of_IN stopping_VBG up_RP the_DT breaches_NNS and_CC reclaiming_VBG the_DT ``_`` drowned_JJ lands_NNS ._. ''_''
B_IN 136-6_CD ?_. 22_CD 48_CD ._.
Bombay_NNP appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB become_VBN more_RBR healthy_JJ ,_, after_IN Aungier_NNP 's_POS time_NN ._.
Grose_NNP writes_VBZ in_IN 1750_CD as_IN follows_VBZ :_: -_: ``_`` Whatever_WDT may_MD be_VB the_DT reason_NN the_DT point_NN is_VBZ certain_JJ that_IN the_DT climate_NN is_VBZ ``_`` no_RB longer_RB so_RB fatal_JJ to_TO the_DT English_JJ inhabitants_NNS as_IN it_PRP used_VBD to_TO be_VB ,_, and_CC is_VBZ ``_`` incomparably_RB more_RBR healthy_JJ than_IN that_DT of_IN many_JJ other_JJ of_IN our_PRP$ settlements_NNS ._.
``_`` The_DT most_RBS common_JJ disorders_NNS are_VBP fever_RB ,_, bloody_JJ fluxes_NNS ,_, cutaneous_JJ eruptions_NNS ``_`` and_CC a_DT sort_NN of_IN tetter_NN called_VBN ringworms_NNS ._. ''_''
And_CC he_PRP points_VBZ out_RP that_IN ,_, one_CD reason_NN assigned_VBN for_IN the_DT island_NN having_VBG grown_VBN healthier_NN ,_, was_VBD the_DT lessening_NN of_IN the_DT waters_NNS ,_, by_IN a_DT breach_NN of_IN the_DT sea_NN being_VBG banked_VBN off_RP ._.
But_CC he_PRP adds-_VBZ ``_`` This_DT however_RB does_VBZ not_RB seem_VB to_TO me_PRP a_DT satisfactory_JJ reason_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ ``_`` still_RB subsisting_VBG a_DT great_JJ body_NN of_IN salt-water_NN in_IN the_DT inside_NN of_IN the_DT breach_NN ,_, the_DT ``_`` communication_NN of_IN which_WDT with_IN the_DT sea_NN being_VBG less_JJR free_JJ than_IN before_IN the_DT ``_`` breach_NN was_VBD built_VBN must_MD be_VB in_IN the_DT proportion_NN more_RBR apt_JJ to_TO stagnate_VB and_CC ``_`` breed_VBP noxious_JJ vapours_NNS ._.
The_DT improvement_NN is_VBZ due_JJ therefore_RB more_JJR to_TO ``_`` different_JJ diet_NN and_CC manner_NN of_IN living_NN of_IN the_DT Europeans_NNPS and_CC also_RB to_TO the_DT ``_`` place_NN being_VBG provided_VBN with_IN more_RBR skilful_JJ physicians_NNS than_IN formerly_RB ._. ''_''
49_CD ._.
A_DT few_JJ years_NNS later_RB ,_, in_IN 1757_CD ,_, a_DT serious_JJ epidemic_JJ broke_VBD out_RP both_DT among_IN the_DT labourers_NNS employed_VBN on_IN the_DT fortifications_NNS and_CC the_DT general_JJ population_NN of_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.
Of_IN the_DT exact_JJ nature_NN of_IN this_DT epidemic_JJ there_EX is_VBZ no_DT evidence_NN ,_, but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ quite_RB possible_JJ that_IN it_PRP may_MD have_VB been_VBN malaria_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ recorded_VBN in_IN 1774_CD among_IN certain_JJ details_NNS regarding_VBG hospital_NN administra-_JJ tion_NN that_IN ,_, ``_`` In_IN the_DT General_NNP Hospital_NNP during_IN the_DT month_NN of_IN January_NNP 1774_CD the_DT number_NN of_IN sick_NN was_VBD 3,368_CD ,_, and_CC of_IN these_DT cases_NNS 156_CD were_VBD fever_RB ._. ''_''
In_IN the_DT Convalescent_NNP Hospital_NNP during_IN the_DT same_JJ month_NN there_EX were_VBD 2,372_CD sick_JJ ,_, of_IN whom_WP 434_CD were_VBD cases_NNS of_IN ``_`` intermitting_VBG fever_NN ._. ''_''
In_IN 1787_CD the_DT Polish_JJ traveller_NN Dr._NNP Heve_NNP refers_NNS to_TO a_DT statement_NN of_IN Dr._NNP Scott_NNP ,_, who_WP ,_, he_PRP says_VBZ ,_, informed_VBD him_PRP that-_JJ ``_`` The_DT people_NNS of_IN Mahim_NNP often_RB manure_VBP their_PRP$ plantations_NNS with_IN ``_`` putrified_JJ fish_NN ,_, which_WDT renders_VBZ the_DT air_NN unwholesome_JJ to_TO those_DT that_WDT live_VBP in_IN ``_`` it_PRP ._.
Not_RB an_DT instance_NN is_VBZ known_VBN of_IN an_DT European_JJ recovering_NN of_IN a_DT fever_NN if_IN he_PRP ``_`` has_VBZ contracted_VBN it_PRP in_IN these_DT woods_NNS ._. ''_''
What_WP this_DT Mahim_NNP fever_NN really_RB was_VBD we_PRP do_VBP not_RB know_VB ,_, but_CC for_IN many_JJ years_NNS this_DT part_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP was_VBD supposed_VBN to_TO be_VB intensely_RB malarious_JJ and_CC people_NNS still_RB cling_VBG to_TO this_DT idea_NN at_IN the_DT present_JJ time_NN ._.
50_CD ._.
The_DT records_NNS regarding_VBG the_DT condition_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP during_IN the_DT early_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT 19th_JJ Century_NNP are_VBP rather_RB contradictory_JJ ._.
Captain_NNP Seely_NNP ,_, who_WP was_VBD in_IN Bombay_NNP in_IN 1825_CD ,_, remarked_VBD that-_JJ ``_`` The_DT climate_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP is_VBZ preferable_JJ to_TO most_JJS parts_NNS of_IN India_NNP ,_, having_VBG ``_`` a_DT refreshing_JJ sea-breeze_NN commonly_RB called_VBD from_IN its_PRP$ healthful_JJ effects_NNS the_DT ``_`` 'Doctor_NN '_'' ._.
There_EX is_VBZ now_RB very_RB little_JJ wood_NN on_IN the_DT island_NN ,_, no_DT marshes_NNS ,_, and_CC ``_`` but_CC few_JJ large_JJ pools_NNS of_IN stagnant_JJ water_NN ._.
To_TO these_DT causes_NNS much_RB of_IN the_DT ``_`` sickness_NN that_WDT prevails_VBZ in_IN other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN India_NNP must_MD be_VB attributed_VBN and_CC ``_`` the_DT salubriety_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP causes_VBZ it_PRP to_TO be_VB resorted_VBN to_TO by_IN invalids_NNS from_IN ``_`` other_JJ Presidencies_NNPS and_CC the_DT interior_NN ._. ''_''
But_CC reference_NN to_TO the_DT Diary_NNP of_IN Lady_NNP West_NNP ,_, written_VBN about_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN (_( 1825-29_JJ )_) ,_, leads_VBZ to_TO a_DT different_JJ impression_NN ;_: for_IN this_DT authoress_NN frequently_RB mentions_VBZ the_DT extreme_JJ unhealthiness_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP and_CC records_NNS a_DT number_NN of_IN cases_NNS of_IN illness_NN and_CC death_NN among_IN her_PRP$ friends_NNS and_CC acquaintances_NNS ._.
Her_PRP$ house_NN was_VBD in_IN the_DT Fort_NNP and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ interesting_VBG to_TO note_VB the_DT bitter_NN complaints_VBZ she_PRP makes_VBZ regarding_VBG the_DT prevalence_NN of_IN mosquitoes_NNS there_RB ._.
Among_IN other_JJ items_NNS she_PRP records_VBZ the_DT fact_NN that_IN one_CD of_IN the_DT Crown_NNP Judges_NNP ,_, who_WP was_VBD sent_VBN out_RP from_IN England_NNP to_TO assist_VB her_PRP$ husband_NN ,_, was_VBD taken_VBN ill_RB with_IN ``_`` fever_NN ''_'' in_IN her_PRP$ house_NN ,_, within_IN three_CD weeks_NNS of_IN his_PRP$ arrival_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
Apparently_RB the_DT Judge_NNP ,_, his_PRP$ wife_NN and_CC her_PRP$ maid_NN were_VBD all_DT prostrated_VBN at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN ._.
These_DT facts_NNS hardly_RB support_VBP Captain_NNP Seely_NNP 's_POS eulogy_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
No_DT :_: III_NN ?_. 23_CD 51_CD ._.
In_IN 1838_CD an_DT anonymous_JJ writer_NN in_IN the_DT Asiatic_NNP Society_NNP 's_POS Journal_NNP in_IN a_DT description_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, remarks_NNS that-_VBP ``_`` The_DT island_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP from_IN an_DT unwholesome_JJ swamp_NN has_VBZ been_VBN converted_VBN into_IN a_DT very_RB salubrious_JJ residence_NN ..._: ..._: ..._: the_DT superabundant_NN trees_NNS have_VBP been_VBN cut_VBN down_RP ,_, the_DT marshes_NNS filled_VBD up_RP ..._: ..._: ''_'' That_IN the_DT writer_NN connected_VBD the_DT improvement_NN in_IN the_DT health_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP with_IN the_DT filling_VBG up_IN of_IN the_DT swamps_NNS is_VBZ certain_JJ ,_, but_CC in_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN a_DT great_JJ portion_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN at_IN the_DT present_JJ day_NN is_VBZ still_RB below_IN sea-level_JJ and_CC must_MD have_VB been_VBN subject_JJ then_RB as_RB now_RB to_TO flooding_VBG and_CC the_DT formation_NN of_IN large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN pools_NNS of_IN stagnant_JJ water_NN ,_, this_DT explanation_NN is_VBZ doubtful_JJ ;_: and_CC from_IN what_WP we_PRP learn_VBP a_DT few_JJ years_NNS later_RB it_PRP may_MD be_VB questioned_VBN whether_IN there_EX was_VBD much_JJ reason_NN to_TO suppose_VB that_IN such_JJ a_DT change_NN as_IN that_DT recorded_VBN by_IN the_DT writer_NN had_VBD been_VBN effected_VBN ._.
Thus_RB between_IN 1840-1860_JJ we_PRP learn_VBP that_IN there_EX were_VBD terrible_JJ miasmata_NNS in_IN the_DT Fort_NNP and_CC Esplanade_NNP ._.
And_CC Douglas_NNP in_IN ``_`` Glimpses_NNP of_IN Old_NNP Bombay_NNP ,_, ''_'' page_NN 39_CD ,_, speaking_NN of_IN Colaba_NNP ,_, says-_JJ ``_`` The_DT suspicion_NN that_IN it_PRP was_VBD unhealthy_JJ in_IN the_DT year_NN which_WDT followed_VBD ,_, took_VBD tangible_JJ shape_NN in_IN 1840_CD ,_, when_WRB it_PRP was_VBD announced_VBN to_TO the_DT dismay_NN of_IN all_DT concerned_VBN ,_, that_IN Colaba_NNP having_VBG been_VBN pronounced_VBN by_IN medical_JJ authorities_NNS a_DT most_RBS unhealthy_JJ station_NN for_IN European_JJ troops_NNS is_VBZ to_TO be_VB forthwith_RB abandoned_VBN as_IN a_DT military_JJ station_NN ..._: ..._: .And_NN in_IN 1841_CD a_DT Medical_NNP Board_NNP found_VBD that_IN a_DT deadly_JJ malaria_NN was_VBD caused_VBN by_IN the_DT mangrove_NN trees_NNS on_IN the_DT western_JJ shore_NN and_CC the_DT sea_NN washing_VBG thereon_NN twice_RB in_IN twenty-four_JJ hours_NNS ._. ''_''
The_DT writer_NN adds-_JJ ``_`` Colaba_NNP would_MD soon_RB have_VB justified_VBN its_PRP$ name_NN of_IN Old_NNP Woman_NNP 's_POS Island_NNP had_VBD not_RB the_DT two_CD Napiers_NNS Charles_NNP and_CC Robert_NNP stepped_VBD in_IN successively_RB to_TO avert_VB this_DT disaster_NN ._.
The_DT spade_NN and_CC the_DT blade_NN were_VBD the_DT remedies_NNS ._. ''_''
Some_DT years_NNS later_RB Dr._NNP Hewlett_NNP speaking_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP prior_RB to_TO 1835_CD stated_VBD that_IN ``_`` the_DT City_NNP had_VBD an_DT unenviable_JJ reputation_NN for_IN unhealthiness_NN ''_'' and_CC in_IN 1874_CD the_DT Health_NNP Officer_NNP of_IN the_DT City_NNP refers_NNS to_TO ``_`` the_DT putrid_JJ salt_NN marsh_NN to_TO the_DT windward_NN of_IN the_DT town_NN ,_, *_NNP undrained_VBD ,_, uncared_JJ for_IN ,_, ..._: ..._: horribly_RB offensive_JJ ,_, unutter-_JJ ably_RB foul_NN ..._: ..._: ''_'' and_CC remarked_VBD that_IN this_DT condition_NN had_VBD remained_VBN unabated_JJ for_IN thirty_JJ years_NNS ._.
52_CD ._.
Although_IN such_JJ evidence_NN as_IN exists_NNS does_VBZ not_RB point_VB to_TO malaria_VB having_VBG been_VBN particularly_RB prevalent_JJ in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ certain_JJ that_IN the_DT disease_NN must_MD have_VB been_VBN present_JJ to_TO some_DT extent_NN even_RB in_IN the_DT earliest_JJS times_NNS ._.
And_CC this_DT view_NN is_VBZ borne_VBN out_RP by_IN facts_NNS gleaned_VBN from_IN later_JJR records_NNS ._.
Thus_RB Morehead_NNP in_IN speaking_NN of_IN the_DT type_NN of_IN malaria_NNS met_VBN with_IN in_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN India_NNP mentions_NNS that_IN of_IN 243_CD cases_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, 221_CD were_VBD quotidian_JJ ,_, 27_CD tertian_JJ and_CC 5_CD uncertain_NN ._.
At_IN a_DT later_JJ date_NN Vandyke_NNP Carter_NNP working_VBG in_IN Bombay_NNP was_VBD the_DT first_JJ medical_JJ man_NN in_IN India_NNP to_TO confirm_VB Laveran_NNP 's_POS discovery_NN of_IN the_DT malaria_NN parasite_NN ._.
Carter_NN records_NNS finding_VBG Laveran_NNP 's_POS organism_NN present_NN in_IN 13_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT cases_NNS examined_VBN by_IN him_PRP ,_, so_IN that_DT malarial_JJ infection_NN was_VBD undoubtedly_RB present_JJ to_TO an_DT appreciable_JJ extent_NN at_IN that_DT time_NN ;_: and_CC as_IN Carter_NNP only_RB noted_VBD the_DT presence_NN of_IN pigmented_JJ organisms_NNS it_PRP is_VBZ probable_JJ that_IN a_DT much_RB larger_JJR proportion_NN of_IN his_PRP$ cases_NNS were_VBD malarial_JJ in_IN nature_NN than_IN his_PRP$ figures_NNS show_VBP ._.
Unfortunately_RB few_JJ recorded_VBN observations_NNS relating_VBG to_TO the_DT incidence_NN of_IN malaria_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP since_IN Carter_NNP 's_POS time_NN appear_VB to_TO exist_VB ;_: and_CC though_IN in_IN 1901_CD in_IN a_DT special_JJ report_NN regarding_VBG malaria_NNS and_CC anopheles_NNS mosquitoes_NNS it_PRP was_VBD asserted_VBN that_IN ,_, until_IN the_DT public_JJ generally_RB were_VBD educated_VBN to_TO appreciate_VB the_DT fact_NN that_IN malarial_JJ fevers_NNS were_VBD the_DT cause_NN of_IN most_JJS of_IN the_DT sickness_NN in_IN the_DT City_NNP ,_, little_JJ could_MD be_VB done_VBN to_TO reduce_VB the_DT disease_NN ,_, no_DT evidence_NN regarding_VBG the_DT prevalence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, or_CC its_PRP$ local_JJ incidence_NN ,_, appears_VBZ in_IN the_DT report_NN ._.
53_CD ._.
In_IN 1901_CD a_DT Committee_NNP of_IN eleven_JJ members_NNS of_IN the_DT Corporation_NNP was_VBD appointed_VBN to_TO deal_VB with_IN the_DT question_NN of_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN anopheles_NNS mosquitoes_NNS in_IN the_DT City_NNP and_CC the_DT measures_NNS to_TO be_VB adopted_VBN against_IN them_PRP ._.
Their_PRP$ report_NN was_VBD submitted_VBN to_TO the_DT Corporation_NNP in_IN 1902_CD ._.
No_DT investigation_NN regarding_VBG the_DT presence_NN of_IN malaria_NN was_VBD undertaken_JJ ,_, but_CC the_DT Committee_NNP recommended_VBD that_IN steps_NNS should_MD be_VB taken_VBN to_TO destroy_VB all_DT kinds_NNS of_IN mosquitoes_NNS ._.
54_CD ._.
The_DT only_JJ information_NN available_JJ regarding_VBG the_DT incidence_NN of_IN malaria_NN among_IN the_DT population_NN before_IN 1903_CD is_VBZ in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN mortality_NN returns_NNS and_CC statistics_NNS of_IN admissions_NNS to_TO hospitals_NNS and_CC dispensaries_NNS ;_: but_CC in_IN that_DT year_NN a_DT valuable_JJ paper_NN The_DT italics_NNS are_VBP mine.-C._JJ A_NNP ._.
B_NNP ._.
?_. 24_CD was_VBD read_VBN before_IN the_DT Bombay_NNP Medical_NNP and_CC Physical_NNP Society_NNP by_IN Dr._NNP S._NNP A._NNP Powell_NNP ,_, the_DT Police_NNP Surgeon_NNP ;_: and_CC this_DT paper_NN gives_VBZ some_DT idea_NN of_IN the_DT actual_JJ incidence_NN of_IN malaria_NN among_IN a_DT portion_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN during_IN the_DT period_NN 1901-1903_JJ ._.
Dr._NNP Powell_NNP as_IN the_DT result_NN of_IN the_DT microscopic_NN examinations_NNS of_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN 3,413_CD cases_NNS of_IN fever_NN ,_, chiefly_NN met_VBD with_IN among_IN the_DT Police_NNP of_IN the_DT City_NNP ,_, diagnosed_VBD the_DT presence_NN of_IN malaria_NN parasites_NNS in_IN 2,542_CD ._.
55_CD ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ difficult_JJ to_TO find_VB any_DT record_NN of_IN much_JJ value_NN regarding_VBG malaria_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP from_IN the_DT date_NN of_IN publication_NN of_IN Dr._NNP Powell_NNP 's_POS paper_NN until_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN 1908_CD ._.
In_IN a_DT recent_JJ report_NN published_VBN by_IN the_DT Health_NNP Department_NNP references_NNS are_VBP made_VBN to_TO the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN at_IN Chowpati_NNP ,_, and_CC in_IN the_DT neighbourhood_NN of_IN the_DT Malabar_NNP Hill_NNP Reservoir_NNP in_IN 1905_CD ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB recorded_VBN that_IN in_IN 1906_CD a_DT request_NN to_TO be_VB allowed_VBN to_TO examine_VB the_DT blood_NN of_IN children_NNS in_IN 10_CD schools_NNS at_IN Mazagaon_NNP ,_, in_IN order_NN to_TO ascertain_VB the_DT prevalence_NN of_IN malaria_NN ,_, was_VBD refused_VBN by_IN those_DT in_IN charge_NN ,_, except_IN in_IN two_CD cases_NNS ._.
56_CD ._.
In_IN September_NNP 1905_CD the_DT Municipal_NNP Corporation_NNP passed_VBD the_DT following_JJ resolution_NN :_: -_: ``_`` That_DT in_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT steadily_JJ increasing_VBG prevalence_NN of_IN malarial_JJ and_CC ``_`` various_JJ other_JJ fevers_NNS in_IN the_DT City_NNP ,_, and_CC the_DT very_RB high_JJ rate_NN of_IN mortality_NN ``_`` resulting_VBG therefrom_NN for_IN several_JJ years_NNS past_IN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ very_RB necessary_JJ in_IN the_DT ``_`` opinion_NN of_IN this_DT Corporation_NNP ,_, that_IN a_DT comprehensive_JJ and_CC searching_VBG enquiry_JJ ``_`` should_MD be_VB instituted_VBN with_IN regard_NN to_TO their_PRP$ causation_NN and_CC spread_NN and_CC ``_`` the_DT measures_NNS necessary_JJ for_IN their_PRP$ prevention_NN and_CC removal_NN so_RB far_RB as_IN ``_`` is_VBZ practicable_JJ ._. ''_''
As_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN this_DT resolution_NN a_DT Committee_NNP was_VBD appointed_VBN to_TO enquire_VB into_IN certain_JJ matters_NNS connected_VBN with_IN the_DT prevalence_NN and_CC causation_NN of_IN malarial_JJ and_CC other_JJ fevers_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP City_NNP ;_: but_CC no_DT actual_JJ investigation_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN was_VBD undertaken_JJ and_CC the_DT Committee_NNP after_IN sitting_VBG for_IN about_IN two_CD years_NNS published_VBD a_DT report_NN in_IN 1908_CD ,_, in_IN which_WDT little_JJ mention_NN is_VBZ made_VBN of_IN malaria_NNS ._.
57_CD ._.
But_CC towards_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN 1907_CD complaints_NNS began_VBD to_TO be_VB made_VBN about_IN malaria_NNS in_IN the_DT neighbourhood_NN of_IN the_DT Frere_NNP Road_NNP and_CC the_DT Corporation_NNP passed_VBD a_DT resolution_NN in_IN December_NNP 1907_CD asking_VBG the_DT Municipal_NNP Commissioner_NNP to_TO report_VB as_IN to_TO the_DT cause_NN of_IN an_DT epidemic_NN of_IN virulent_NN type_NN which_WDT had_VBD broken_VBN out_RP there_RB ._.
In_IN December_NNP 1907_CD Dr._NNP Cogill_NNP called_VBD attention_NN to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN among_IN 200_CD of_IN the_DT Governor_NNP 's_POS Body_NNP Guard_NNP ,_, resident_NN in_IN the_DT lines_NNS at_IN Chowpati_NNP ,_, there_EX had_VBD been_VBN 40_CD cases_NNS of_IN malaria_NN ,_, and_CC stated_VBD that_IN the_DT disease_NN was_VBD steadily_RB increasing_VBG ._.
The_DT Body_NNP Guard_NNP lines_NNS are_VBP situated_VBN at_IN the_DT base_NN of_IN Malabar_NNP Hill_NNP and_CC leakage_NN from_IN the_DT reservoir_NN above_IN them_PRP formed_VBD small_JJ pools_NNS and_CC streamlets_NNS in_IN which_WDT anopheles_NNS mosquitces_NNS were_VBD readily_RB found_VBN ._.
58_CD ._.
In_IN May_NNP 1908_CD certain_JJ residents_NNS in_IN the_DT Frere_NNP Road_NNP addressed_VBD a_DT letter_NN to_TO the_DT Municipal_NNP Commissioner_NNP making_VBG further_JJ complaints_NNS regarding_VBG malaria_NNS in_IN that_DT locality_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT letter_NN they_PRP stated_VBD that_IN some_DT of_IN them_PRP had_VBD lived_VBN in_IN that_DT neigh-_JJ bourhood_NN for_IN ten_JJ years_NNS without_IN suffering_VBG from_IN malaria_NN until_IN the_DT construction_NN of_IN the_DT New_NNP Docks_NNP was_VBD undertaken_VBN there_RB ._.
The_DT contract_NN for_IN the_DT New_NNP Docks_NNP was_VBD signed_VBN in_IN April_NNP 1904_CD ,_, work_NN began_VBD the_DT same_JJ year_NN and_CC the_DT foundation_NN stone_NN was_VBD laid_VBN in_IN 1905_CD ,_, but_CC the_DT earliest_JJS complaints_NNS about_IN malaria_NN in_IN the_DT vicinity_NN appear_VBP to_TO have_VB been_VBN submitted_VBN late_RB in_IN 1907_CD ,_, three_CD clear_JJ years_NNS after_IN the_DT work_NN had_VBD commenced_VBN ._.
59_CD ._.
During_IN 1908_CD numerous_JJ complaints_NNS of_IN malaria_NNS were_VBD made_VBN from_IN many_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT City_NNP ,_, but_CC there_EX is_VBZ no_DT definite_JJ information_NN regarding_VBG the_DT incidence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN any_DT locality_NN with_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN that_DT given_VBN in_IN a_DT valuable_JJ paper_NN by_IN Major_NNP Liston_NNP ,_, I._NNP M._NNP S._NNP ,_, published_VBN in_IN the_DT Journal_NNP of_IN the_DT Bombay_NNP Natural_NNP History_NNP Society_NNP ,_, November_NNP 1908_CD ._.
In_IN this_DT paper_NN Major_NNP Liston_NNP records_VBZ the_DT fact_NN that_IN an_DT investigation_NN in_IN the_DT neighbourhood_NN of_IN the_DT Frere_NNP Road_NNP adjoining_VBG the_DT New_NNP Docks_NNP had_VBD shown_VBN that_IN 80_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT children_NNS resident_NN there_RB had_VBD enlarged_VBN spleens_NNS and_CC 50_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN those_DT examined_VBN by_IN him_PRP harboured_VBD malarial_JJ parasites_NNS in_IN their_PRP$ blood_NN ._.
Two_CD species_NNS of_IN anopheles_NNS mosquitoes_NNS were_VBD caught_VBN by_IN him_PRP in_IN the_DT locality_NN ,_, Nysso-Myzomyia_NNP rossi_NN and_CC Neocellia_NNP stephensi_NN and_CC the_DT dissection_NN of_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN the_DT latter_NN led_VBD to_TO the_DT important_JJ discovery_NN that_IN 25_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
were_VBD infected_VBN with_IN malaria_NNS ._.
60_CD ._.
In_IN November_NNP 1908_CD the_DT Government_NNP of_IN Bombay_NNP influenced_VBN by_IN the_DT serious_JJ nature_NN of_IN the_DT epidemic_NN of_IN malaria_NN in_IN the_DT City_NNP ,_, decided_VBD to_TO take_VB action_NN and_CC to_TO arrange_VB for_IN a_DT systematic_JJ investigation_NN of_IN the_DT causes_NNS which_WDT had_VBD led_VBN to_TO the_DT outbreak_NN with_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO the_DT adoption_NN of_IN preventive_JJ measures_NNS in_IN the_DT future_NN ._.
?_. 25_CD CHAPTER_NN II_NNP ._.
61_CD ._.
THE_DT MEASUREMENT_NNP OF_NNP MALARIA_NNP IN_NNP BOMBAY.-In_NNP dis-_NN cussing_VBG the_DT prevention_NN of_IN malaria_NN in_IN a_DT community_NN ,_, Ross_NNP has_VBZ laid_VBN down_RP as_IN one_CD of_IN the_DT first_JJ essentials_VBZ the_DT necessity_NN for_IN a_DT careful_JJ measurement_NN of_IN the_DT malaria_NN present_NN ;_: and_CC he_PRP has_VBZ pointed_VBN out_RP that_IN for_IN this_DT purpose_JJ direct_JJ observa-_JJ tion_NN is_VBZ of_IN greater_JJR value_NN than_IN inferences_NNS drawn_VBN from_IN hospital_NN statistics_NNS and_CC mortality_NN returns_NNS ._.
Before_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN no_DT serious_JJ attempt_NN appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN made_VBN to_TO measure_VB the_DT amount_NN of_IN malaria_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, but_CC a_DT few_JJ isolated_JJ enquiries_NNS have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN from_IN time_NN to_TO time_NN in_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.
In_IN Bombay_NNP with_IN rare_JJ exceptions_NNS the_DT microscope_NN is_VBZ not_RB greatly_RB used_VBN in_IN the_DT diagnosis_NN of_IN malaria_NN ._.
The_DT report_NN of_IN the_DT Municipal_NNP Analyst_NNP shows_VBZ that_IN the_DT following_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN blood_NN specimens_NNS have_VBP been_VBN examined_VBN for_IN malaria_NN in_IN the_DT municipal_JJ laboratory_NN since_IN 1904_CD ,_, but_CC the_DT results_NNS are_VBP not_RB given_VBN :_: -_: Numbers_NNS of_IN blood_NN specimens_NNS examined_VBD for_IN malaria-_JJ 1904_CD ..._: ..._: ..._: ..._: 8_CD 1905_CD ..._: ..._: ..._: ..._: 3_CD 1906_CD ..._: ..._: ..._: ..._: 2_CD 1907_CD ..._: ..._: ..._: ..._: 12_CD 1908_CD ..._: ..._: ..._: ..._: 166_CD 1909_CD ..._: ..._: ..._: ..._: 80_CD As_IN will_MD be_VB seen_VBN the_DT number_NN is_VBZ too_RB small_JJ to_TO be_VB of_IN much_JJ value_NN as_IN a_DT test_NN of_IN the_DT incidence_NN of_IN malaria_NN in_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.
62_CD ._.
The_DT most_RBS valuable_JJ information_NN available_JJ regarding_VBG the_DT incidence_NN of_IN malaria_NN in_IN the_DT past_NN is_VBZ to_TO be_VB found_VBN in_IN a_DT paper_NN by_IN Dr._NNP S._NNP A._NNP Powell_NNP ,_, previously_RB referred_VBN to_TO ,_, which_WDT deals_VBZ with_IN the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN malaria_NN in_IN 1901_CD to_TO 1903_CD ,_, as_IN diagnosed_VBN by_IN the_DT microscope_NN ,_, chiefly_NN among_IN the_DT Police_NNP ._.
The_DT City_NNP Police_NNP ,_, who_WP are_VBP stationed_VBN in_IN every_DT part_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN and_CC live_VBP in_IN different_JJ localities_NNS ,_, numbered_VBD about_IN 2,000_CD in_IN 1901-1903_JJ ._.
They_PRP are_VBP picked_VBN men_NNS as_IN regards_NNS physique_NN ,_, they_PRP have_VBP steady_JJ employment_NN ,_, good_JJ clothing_NN and_CC shelter_NN ,_, and_CC they_PRP receive_VBP regular_JJ medical_JJ attention_NN ._.
During_IN a_DT succession_NN of_IN years_NNS 1901-1903_CD an_DT average_NN of_IN nearly_RB 1,000_CD admissions_NNS for_IN malaria_NN or_CC just_RB about_IN 500_CD per_IN 1,000_CD of_IN strength_NN occurred_VBD amongst_IN these_DT men_NNS ,_, and_CC we_PRP are_VBP justified_VBN in_IN assuming_VBG that_IN the_DT incidence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN among_IN the_DT general_JJ population_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP in_IN those_DT years_NNS was_VBD not_RB less_JJR than_IN this_DT ._.

Section_NN 1_CD ._.
THE_DT SPLEEN_NNP INDEX.-It_NNP has_VBZ been_VBN known_VBN for_IN very_RB many_JJ years_NNS that_IN malaria_NN often_RB produced_VBD enlargement_NN of_IN the_DT spleen_NN in_IN those_DT who_WP suffered_VBD from_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
More_JJR than_IN fifty_CD years_NNS ago_RB certain_JJ medical_JJ officers_NNS in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP carried_VBD out_RP a_DT spleen_JJ census_NN in_IN order_NN to_TO estimate_VB the_DT prevalence_NN of_IN malaria_NN among_IN the_DT population_NN of_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT irrigated_JJ tracts_NNS ;_: and_CC the_DT taking_NN of_IN a_DT spleen_JJ census_NN has_VBZ ?_. 27_CD now_RB become_VBP a_DT routine_JJ method_NN of_IN measuring_VBG the_DT malaria_NN of_IN a_DT community_NN ,_, as_IN it_PRP is_VBZ generally_RB recognized_VBN that_IN in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN a_DT disease_NN such_JJ as_IN Kala-azar_NNP ,_, which_WDT also_RB causes_VBZ splenic_JJ enlargement_NN ,_, a_DT very_RB good_JJ idea_NN of_IN the_DT prevalence_NN of_IN malaria_NN may_MD be_VB arrived_VBN at_IN by_IN estimating_VBG the_DT proportion_NN of_IN a_DT population_NN possessing_VBG palpably_RB enlarged_VBN spleens_NNS ._.
Usually_RB such_PDT a_DT census_NN is_VBZ taken_VBN among_IN young_JJ children_NNS only_RB ,_, because_IN observations_NNS made_VBN upon_IN persons_NNS of_IN different_JJ ages_NNS resident_NN in_IN malarious_JJ countries_NNS show_VBP that_IN after_IN a_DT certain_JJ age_NN splenic_JJ enlargement_NN becomes_RB much_RB less_JJR common_JJ ,_, owing_VBG probably_RB to_TO the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN a_DT condition_NN of_IN toleration_NN or_CC partial_JJ immunity_NN ,_, produced_VBN by_IN long_JJ exposure_NN to_TO infection_NN ._.
The_DT exact_JJ significance_NN of_IN splenic_JJ enlargement_NN is_VBZ not_RB clear_JJ ._.
Many_JJ cases_NNS of_IN mild_JJ malarial_JJ infection_NN fail_NN to_TO show_VB an_DT appreciable_JJ enlargement_NN of_IN the_DT spleen_NN and_CC in_IN a_DT considerable_JJ proportion_NN of_IN cases_NNS with_IN marked_JJ enlargement_NN ,_, undoubtedly_RB due_JJ to_TO antecedent_JJ malaria_NN ,_, examination_NN of_IN the_DT blood_NN fails_VBZ to_TO reveal_VB the_DT presence_NN of_IN parasites_NNS ._.
But_CC although_IN there_EX are_VBP grounds_NNS for_IN believing_VBG that_DT enlargement_NN of_IN the_DT spleen_JJ indicates_VBZ the_DT previous_JJ occurrence_NN of_IN malarial_JJ disease_NN more_RBR certainly_RB than_IN the_DT existence_NN of_IN present_JJ infection_NN ,_, this_DT fact_NN in_IN no_DT way_NN invalidates_VBZ the_DT use_NN of_IN the_DT splenic_JJ index_NN as_IN a_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT malaria_JJ present_NN among_IN a_DT community_NN ;_: and_CC the_DT taking_NN of_IN a_DT spleen_JJ census_NN is_VBZ the_DT simplest_NN and_CC probably_RB under_IN ordinary_JJ conditions_NNS the_DT most_RBS accurate_JJ method_NN that_WDT can_MD be_VB adopted_VBN for_IN estimating_VBG the_DT amount_NN of_IN malaria_NNS existing_VBG among_IN a_DT large_JJ population_NN ._.

higher_JJR than_IN either_DT Market_NNP or_CC Chakla_NNP Sections_NNP ._.

70_CD ._.
The_DT areas_NNS most_RBS severely_RB affected_VBN by_IN malaria_NNS are_VBP Esplanade_NNP ,_, North_NNP Fort_NNP and_CC Mandvi_NNP Sections_NNP ._.
These_DT sections_NNS immediately_RB adjoin_VBP the_DT enclosure_NN of_IN the_DT New_NNP Dock_NNP Works_NNP and_CC at_IN first_JJ sight_VBD it_PRP might_MD appear_VB that_IN proximity_NN to_TO the_DT work_NN in_IN progress_NN there_EX was_VBD the_DT sole_JJ cause_NN of_IN their_PRP$ being_VBG severely_RB affected_VBN by_IN malaria_NNS ._.
But_CC more_RBR detailed_JJ enquiry_NN shows_NNS that_WDT although_IN this_DT explanation_NN holds_VBZ good_JJ in_IN regard_NN to_TO Mandvi_NNP and_CC Esplanade_NNP Sections_NNP it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB equally_RB so_RB of_IN North_NNP Fort_NNP ._.

of_IN children_NNS living_VBG between_IN Frere_NNP Road_NNP and_CC the_DT New_NNP Dock_NNP showed_VBD enlarged_JJ spleen_NN ,_, 27.8_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.

of_IN those_DT living_VBG east_NN of_IN Parsi_NNP Bazar_NNP Street_NNP and_CC 42.8_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN those_DT living_VBG west_JJS of_IN Parsi_NNP Bazar_NNP Street_NNP ._.
And_CC the_DT second_JJ spleen_JJ census_NN in_IN 1910_CD shows_NNS that_IN if_IN we_PRP follow_VBP a_DT line_NN drawn_VBN diagonally_RB through_IN North_NNP Fort_NNP Section_NNP ,_, from_IN Fort_NNP Street_NNP on_IN the_DT extreme_JJ east_NN to_TO the_DT corner_NN of_IN Church_NNP Gate_NNP Street_NNP and_CC Hornby_NNP Road_NNP on_IN the_DT west_NN ,_, we_PRP find_VBP ,_, first_RB an_DT area_NN near_IN the_DT Dock_NNP Works_NNP with_IN a_DT spleen_JJ index_NN of_IN 35.4_CD per_IN cent._NN ,_, then_RB west_JJS of_IN this_DT an_DT area_NN with_IN a_DT lower_JJR spleen_JJ index_NN of_IN 21_CD per_IN cent._NN ,_, then_RB further_RBR to_TO the_DT west_NN another_DT area_NN with_IN a_DT spleen_JJ index_NN of_IN 35.6_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
and_CC in_IN extreme_JJ west_NN of_IN the_DT section_NN farthest_JJS removed_VBN from_IN the_DT Dock_NNP Works_NNP an_DT area_NN with_IN a_DT spleen_JJ index_NN of_IN 42.5_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.

71_CD ._.
One_CD of_IN the_DT most_RBS interesting_JJ and_CC important_JJ facts_NNS brought_VBN out_RP by_IN the_DT spleen_JJ census_NN is_VBZ the_DT comparative_JJ freedom_NN of_IN the_DT whole_NN of_IN the_DT north_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN from_IN any_DT serious_JJ amount_NN of_IN malaria_NN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN supposed_VBN for_IN hundreds_NNS of_IN years_NNS that_IN the_DT ill-drained_JJ ,_, low-lying_JJ areas_NNS in_IN the_DT Centre_NNP and_CC North_NNP of_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, were_VBD more_RBR malarious_JJ than_IN the_DT older_JJR portions_NNS of_IN the_DT City_NNP on_IN the_DT higher_JJR land_NN to_TO the_DT south_NN ._.
But_CC it_PRP is_VBZ a_DT significant_JJ fact_NN that_IN among_IN 6,132_CD children_NNS living_VBG in_IN the_DT undrained_JJ portion_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN only_RB 60_CD or_CC 0.9_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
showed_VBD splenic_JJ enlargement_NN ,_, whereas_VBP among_IN 46,404_CD living_NN in_IN the_DT drained_JJ portion_NN 3,743_CD or_CC nearly_RB 8_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
have_VB enlarged_VBN spleen_NN ._.
It_PRP must_MD be_VB pointed_VBN out_RP however_RB that_IN the_DT apparent_JJ relation_NN of_IN malaria_NN to_TO drainage_VB is_VBZ an_DT accident_NN ,_, due_JJ to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN breeding_VBG places_NNS favoured_VBN by_IN the_DT chief_JJ malaria-carrying_JJ anopheles_NNS of_IN Bombay_NNP happen_VB to_TO be_VB present_JJ in_IN the_DT drained_JJ area_NN and_CC -absent_NN in_IN the_DT undrained_JJ one_CD ._.
This_DT mosquito_NN Neocellia_NNP stephensi_NN does_VBZ not_RB breed_VB in_IN the_DT foul_JJ water_NN of_IN house_NN and_CC street_NN drains_NNS and_CC sewers_NNS ,_, so_IN that_IN the_DT existence_NN of_IN drains_NNS is_VBZ not_RB responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN malaria_NN ._.
B_IN 136-8_JJ ?_. 30_CD 72_CD ._.
It_PRP was_VBD commonly_RB suggested_VBN in_IN the_DT past_NN that_IN the_DT existence_NN of_IN the_DT low-_JJ lying_JJ area_NN in_IN the_DT centre_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN known_VBN as_IN the_DT ``_`` Flats_NNP ``_`` was_VBD the_DT cause_NN of_IN a_DT considerable_JJ amount_NN of_IN malaria_NN ._.

73_CD ._.
Another_DT fallacy_NN regarding_VBG Bombay_NNP malaria_NN ,_, which_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN commonly_RB accepted_VBN in_IN the_DT past_NN ,_, is_VBZ the_DT suggestion_NN that_IN much_JJ of_IN the_DT malaria_NN in_IN the_DT City_NNP was_VBD due_JJ to_TO the_DT importation_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN and_CC that_IN this_DT source_NN of_IN infection_NN was_VBD so_RB common_JJ as_IN to_TO render_VB it_PRP exceedingly_RB doubtful_JJ if_IN measures_NNS taken_VBN to_TO prevent_VB the_DT breeding_NN of_IN malaria-carrying_JJ anopheles_NNS would_MD be_VB of_IN much_JJ effect_NN ._.

BLOOD_NNP EXAMINATION.-Although_NNP the_DT spleen_JJ census_NN gives_VBZ most_RBS valuable_JJ information_NN regarding_VBG antecedent_NN malaria_NNS and_CC may_MD be_VB used_VBN as_IN a_DT measure_NN of_IN malarial_JJ endemicity_NN ,_, the_DT microscopic_NN examination_NN of_IN the_DT blood_NN gives_VBZ informa-_JJ tion_NN regarding_VBG the_DT actual_JJ presence_NN of_IN infection_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT species_NNS of_IN parasite_NN ,_, not_RB to_TO be_VB gained_VBN in_IN any_DT other_JJ way_NN ._.
Years_NNS ago_RB Stephens_NNP and_CC Christophers_NNP suggested_VBD ,_, as_IN a_DT measure_NN of_IN malarial_JJ endemicity_NN ,_, the_DT use_NN of_IN an_DT infection_NN index_NN arrived_VBD at_IN by_IN the_DT microscopical_JJ examination_NN of_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN young_JJ children_NNS ._.
This_DT suggestion_NN was_VBD based_VBN upon_IN a_DT consideration_NN of_IN the_DT following_JJ facts_NNS ._.
In_IN a_DT very_RB malarious_JJ locality_NN nearly_RB all_DT new_JJ comers_NNS usually_RB contract_NN malaria_NNS after_IN a_DT short_JJ stay_NN of_IN days_NNS or_CC weeks_NNS ;_: in_IN a_DT less_RBR malarious_JJ locality_NN a_DT smaller_JJR proportion_NN become_NN infected_VBN in_IN a_DT given_VBN period_NN ;_: and_CC in_IN a_DT place_NN where_WRB malaria_NN is_VBZ only_RB mild_JJ ,_, new_JJ comers_NNS may_MD escape_VB infection_NN for_IN months_NNS or_CC even_RB years_NNS ._.
Therefore_RB the_DT examination_NN of_IN new_JJ comers_NNS for_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN malarial_JJ infection_NN enables_VBZ the_DT observer_NN to_TO arrive_VB at_IN a_DT figure_NN of_IN value_NN for_IN comparative_JJ purposes_NNS ;_: and_CC as_IN a_DT rule_NN young_JJ children_NNS are_VBP selected_VBN for_IN the_DT purposes_NNS of_IN this_DT examination_NN because_IN they_PRP form_VBP a_DT class_NN of_IN new_JJ comers_NNS more_RBR or_CC less_JJR fixed_VBN in_IN character_NN and_CC available_JJ everywhere_RB ._.
But_CC in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, where_WRB a_DT large_JJ proportion_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN is_VBZ formed_VBN of_IN new_JJ arrivals_NNS and_CC temporary_JJ residents_NNS ,_, there_EX are_VBP many_JJ thousands_NNS of_IN adults_NNS who_WP are_VBP probably_RB quite_RB as_RB susceptible_JJ to_TO malarial_JJ infection_NN as_IN young_JJ children_NNS ;_: and_CC it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN that_IN the_DT adult_NN population_NN of_IN malarious_JJ localities_NNS in_IN the_DT City_NNP is_VBZ infected_VBN with_IN malaria_NNS in_IN much_JJ the_DT same_JJ proportion_NN as_IN the_DT child_NN population_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT present_JJ enquiry_NN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN blood_NN films_NNS have_VBP been_VBN collected_VBN from_IN both_DT children_NNS and_CC adults_NNS in_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.
As_IN it_PRP is_VBZ quite_RB impossible_JJ to_TO examine_VB the_DT blood_NN of_IN more_JJR than_IN a_DT small_JJ proportion_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN in_IN a_DT City_NNP as_RB large_JJ as_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, it_PRP was_VBD necessary_JJ to_TO adopt_VB a_DT system_NN of_IN ''_'' random_NN sampling_NN ,_, ''_'' when_WRB obtaining_VBG specimens_NNS for_IN the_DT estimation_NN of_IN the_DT parasite_JJ index_NN ._.
The_DT method_NN employed_VBN in_IN the_DT collection_NN of_IN blood_NN films_NNS during_IN the_DT investigation_NN was_VBD as_IN follows_VBZ :_: -A_JJ locality_NN ,_, chosen_VBN indis-_JJ criminately_RB ,_, was_VBD visited_VBN usually_RB in_IN the_DT early_JJ morning_NN ._.
Conversation_NN was_VBD exchanged_VBN with_IN some_DT resident_NN or_CC passer-by_NN until_IN a_DT crowd_NN collected_VBN ._.
After_IN a_DT little_JJ persuasion_NN ,_, some_DT one_CD would_MD consent_VB to_TO allow_VB his_PRP$ finger_NN to_TO be_VB pricked_VBN and_CC a_DT blood_NN film_NN prepared_VBD ,_, and_CC it_PRP would_MD soon_RB become_VB fashionable_JJ to_TO follow_VB suit_NN ._.
Children_NNP coming_VBG forward_RB or_CC brought_VBN by_IN their_PRP$ parents_NNS were_VBD rewarded_VBN with_IN a_DT pice_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT way_NN it_PRP was_VBD usually_RB possible_JJ in_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN an_DT hour_NN to_TO collect_VB 50_CD or_CC 60_CD blood_NN films_NNS ,_, specimens_NNS being_VBG taken_VBN from_IN every_DT one_CD in_IN the_DT crowd_NN who_WP appeared_VBD willing_JJ ._.
Blood_NNP films_NNS were_VBD collected_VBN in_IN this_DT manner_NN from_IN over_IN 00_CD localities_NNS in_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.
79_CD ._.

Wards_NNS )_) is_VBZ only_RB 7.5_CD times_NNS more_RBR malarious_JJ than_IN the_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN ._.

Broadly_RB speaking_VBG we_PRP may_MD say_VB therefore_NN that_IN the_DT south_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP Island_NNP is_VBZ about_IN thirty_JJ times_NNS as_RB malarious_JJ as_IN the_DT north_NN ._.

Chawl_NNP A_NNP was_VBD composed_VBN of_IN lines_NNS of_IN single_JJ storied_VBN huts_NNS built_VBN of_IN corrugated_JJ iron_NN and_CC provided_VBN with_IN roomy_JJ open_JJ verandahs_NN in_IN which_WDT many_JJ of_IN the_DT people_NNS used_VBN to_TO sleep_VB ._.

Chawl_NNP B_NNP was_VBD composed_VBN of_IN three_CD two-storied_JJ blocks_NNS of_IN back_NN to_TO back_VB tenements_NNS ,_, dark_NN ,_, filthy_JJ and_CC overcrowded_VBD ._.

The_DT windows_NNS also_RB were_VBD all_DT stopped_VBD up_RP with_IN paper_NN and_CC rags_NNS ._.

?_. 41_CD These_DT observations_NNS appear_VBP to_TO show_VB that_IN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT seasonal_JJ rise_NN and_CC fall_NN in_IN the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN infections_NNS in_IN a_DT given_VBN area_NN and_CC a_DT corresponding_JJ seasonal_JJ increase_NN or_CC decrease_NN in_IN the_DT intensity_NN of_IN the_DT infections_NNS met_VBD with_IN ;_: and_CC they_PRP also_RB support_VBP the_DT view_NN that_IN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT direct_JJ relation_NN between_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN high_JJ or_CC low_JJ endemic_JJ indices_NNS and_CC the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN malarial_JJ infections_NNS of_IN high_JJ or_CC low_JJ intensity_NN ._.

MALARIA_NNP AS_IN A_NNP CAUSE_NNP OF_NNP DEATH_NNP IN_NNP BOMBAY.-Unfortu-_NNP nately_RB little_JJ or_CC nothing_NN can_MD be_VB learned_VBN until_IN quite_RB recent_JJ times_NNS of_IN the_DT effect_NN produced_VBN by_IN malaria_NNS on_IN the_DT health_NN of_IN the_DT general_JJ population_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, and_CC even_RB now_RB it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB possible_JJ to_TO make_VB more_JJR than_IN a_DT very_RB rough_JJ estimate_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ morbidity_NN and_CC mortality_NN occurring_NN in_IN the_DT City_NNP from_IN this_DT cause_NN ._.
At_IN the_DT beginning_NN of_IN the_DT 19th_JJ century_NN the_DT average_JJ annual_JJ mortality_NN in_IN the_DT City_NNP ranged_VBD from_IN 4,000_CD to_TO 8,000_CD rising_VBG to_TO 26,000_CD in_IN 1804_CD in_IN consequence_NN of_IN famine_NN in_IN the_DT Konkan_NNP ._.
The_DT most_RBS common_JJ causes_NNS of_IN death_NN were_VBD stated_VBN to_TO be_VB fever_RB and_CC liver_RB complaint_NN ,_, but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ doubtful_JJ if_IN much_JJ of_IN this_DT was_VBD due_JJ to_TO malaria_VB ,_, as_IN in_IN 1825_CD Seely_RB stated_VBD that_IN ``_`` the_DT salubriety_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP caused_VBD it_PRP to_TO be_VB ``_`` resorted_VBN to_TO by_IN invalids_NNS from_IN other_JJ Presidencies_NNPS and_CC the_DT interior_NN ._. ''_''
But_CC on_IN occasion_NN fever_NN has_VBZ claimed_VBN a_DT large_JJ toll_NN of_IN human_JJ life_NN ,_, as_IN for_IN example_NN between_IN 1863_CD and_CC 1866_CD ,_, when_WRB scarcity_NN in_IN the_DT rural_JJ districts_NNS and_CC commercial_JJ activity_NN in_IN the_DT City_NNP led_VBD to_TO a_DT great_JJ immigration_NN of_IN labourers_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ quite_RB possible_JJ that_IN malaria_NN may_MD have_VB played_VBN some_DT part_NN in_IN increasing_VBG mortality_NN at_IN this_DT time_NN ,_, for_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN reclamation_NN works_NNS were_VBD commenced_VBN during_IN this_DT period_NN ,_, and_CC there_EX are_VBP reasons_NNS for_IN supposing_VBG that_IN the_DT Back_NNP Bay_NNP Reclamation_NNP especially_RB led_VBD to_TO an_DT increase_NN of_IN malaria_NNS in_IN the_DT parts_NNS of_IN the_DT City_NNP adjoining_VBG it_PRP ._.
In_IN 1877_CD when_WRB the_DT City_NNP was_VBD filled_VBN with_IN famine-stricken_JJ people_NNS from_IN the_DT Deccan_NNP ,_, Gujart_NNP and_CC Rjputna_NNP ,_, fever_NN caused_VBD a_DT heavy_JJ mortality_NN ;_: but_CC this_DT fever_NN was_VBD chiefly_JJ relapsing_NN fever_NN ,_, a_DT fact_NN shewn_VBN by_IN Vandyke_NNP Carter_NNP ,_, who_WP reported_VBD on_IN it_PRP at_IN the_DT time_NN ._.
From_IN 1878_CD to_TO 1901_CD the_DT annual_JJ deaths_NNS from_IN fever_NN ranged_VBN from_IN 5,000_CD to_TO 9,000_CD ,_, but_CC only_RB a_DT small_JJ proportion_NN was_VBD due_JJ to_TO malaria_VB ,_, and_CC as_RB has_VBZ already_RB been_VBN remarked_VBN ,_, when_WRB a_DT new_JJ system_NN of_IN death_NN registration_NN was_VBD instituted_VBN in_IN 1902_CD and_CC enquiry_VB into_IN the_DT cause_NN of_IN death_NN was_VBD made_VBN by_IN trained_JJ medical_JJ officers_NNS ,_, the_DT recorded_VBN fever_NN mortality_NN dropped_VBD immediately_RB to_TO 4,518_CD in_IN 1902_CD and_CC 2,333_CD in_IN 1903_CD ._.
