115_CD ._.
EPIDEMIC_NNP MALARIA_NNP IN_NNP BOMBAY.-Before_NNP discussing_VBG epi-_JJ demic_JJ malaria_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP it_PRP must_MD be_VB pointed_VBN out_RP that_IN there_EX is_VBZ no_DT evidence_NN to_TO shew_VB that_DT outbreaks_NNS of_IN malaria_NN on_IN that_DT island_NN have_VBP ever_RB been_VBN of_IN so_RB severe_JJ a_DT nature_NN as_IN the_DT pandemics_NNS that_WDT occur_VBP in_IN the_DT Punjb_NNP and_CC other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN India_NNP ,_, and_CC the_DT term_NN ``_`` epidemic_JJ malaria_NN ``_`` applied_VBN to_TO conditions_NNS met_VBN with_IN in_IN Bombay_NNP refers_NNS merely_RB to_TO an_DT increase_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN above_IN the_DT normal_JJ ,_, due_JJ in_IN the_DT most_RBS part_NN to_TO the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN local_JJ outbreaks_NNS or_CC epidemies_NNS ._.
The_DT medical_JJ history_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP is_VBZ so_RB obscure_JJ that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ exceedingly_RB difficult_JJ to_TO get_VB any_DT definite_JJ history_NN of_IN epidemic_JJ outbreaks_NNS of_IN malaria_NN in_IN the_DT past_NN ._.
In_IN 1757_CD a_DT severe_JJ epidemic_NN of_IN some_DT sort_NN occurred_VBD both_DT among_IN the_DT labourers_NNS employed_VBN upon_IN the_DT fortifications_NNS and_CC the_DT general_JJ population_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ not_RB certain_JJ that_IN the_DT disease_NN was_VBD malaria_JJ ,_, but_CC in_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT nature_NN of_IN the_DT work_NN and_CC the_DT locality_NN (_( i._JJ e._NN ,_, the_DT fort_NN which_WDT was_VBD surrounded_VBN by_IN the_DT moat_NN and_CC contained_VBD many_JJ private_JJ and_CC public_JJ wells_NNS )_) ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ probable_JJ that_IN the_DT outbreak_NN was_VBD of_IN this_DT nature_NN ._.
An_DT epidemic_NN of_IN malaria_NNS took_VBD place_NN in_IN Colaba_NNP about_IN 1838-1841_JJ ._.
This_DT outbreak_JJ appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB occurred_VBN in_IN association_NN with_IN the_DT construction_NN of_IN the_DT Colaba_NNP Causeway_NNP ._.
The_DT work_NN on_IN the_DT Colaba_NNP Causeway_NNP which_WDT began_VBD in_IN 1835_CD involved_VBD the_DT reclamation_NN of_IN a_DT large_JJ area_NN of_IN low-lying_JJ land_NN previovsly_RB covered_VBN by_IN the_DT sea_NN at_IN certain_JJ states_NNS of_IN the_DT tide_NN ._.
Colaba_NNP became_VBD comparatively_RB healthy_JJ again_RB after_IN the_DT completion_NN of_IN the_DT Causeway_NNP ,_, a_DT result_NN which_WDT is_VBZ in_IN accord_NN with_IN the_DT general_JJ experience_NN of_IN such_JJ outbreaks_NNS ._.
116_CD ._.
There_EX appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN an_DT outbreak_NN of_IN fever_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP during_IN the_DT period_NN of_IN extraordinary_JJ commercial_JJ activity_NN between_IN 1861-1866_CD which_WDT followed_VBD upon_IN the_DT inflation_NN of_IN cotton_NN prices_NNS as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN the_DT American_NNP War_NNP ._.
A_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN reclamation_NN schemes_NNS were_VBD commenced_VBN in_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT island_NN at_IN this_DT time_NN and_CC they_PRP were_VBD probably_RB responsible_JJ for_IN an_DT increase_NN of_IN malaria_NNS ._.
In_IN particular_JJ the_DT Back_NNP Bay_NNP Reclamation_NNP ,_, which_WDT was_VBD begun_VBN and_CC then_RB allowed_VBD to_TO remain_VB for_IN some_DT time_NN uncompleted_JJ ,_, appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB given_VBN rise_NN to_TO a_DT considerable_JJ increase_NN of_IN malaria_NNS in_IN the_DT areas_NNS immediately_RB adjoining_VBG it_PRP ._.
The_DT increased_JJ prevalence_NN of_IN fever_NN is_VBZ shewn_VBN by_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN during_IN the_DT four_CD years_NNS 1863-1866_CD the_DT fever_NN deaths_NNS recorded_VBN in_IN the_DT City_NNP averaged_VBD 12,577_CD a_DT year_NN ,_, or_CC nearly_RB double_RB the_DT mean_NN of_IN the_DT previous_JJ five_CD years_NNS ,_, and_CC in_IN 1865_CD the_DT recorded_VBN fever_NN mortality_NN reached_VBD a_DT maximum_NN of_IN 18,767_CD ._.
117_CD ._.
Ten_CD years_NNS later_RB the_DT proposal_NN to_TO construct_VB the_DT Prince_NNP 's_POS Dock_NNP occasioned_VBD considerable_JJ alarm_NN owing_VBG to_TO the_DT fear_NN that_IN it_PRP would_MD affect_VB the_DT health_NN of_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.
Work_NN was_VBD begun_VBN in_IN 1875_CD and_CC the_DT Dock_NNP was_VBD completed_VBN in_IN 1880_CD ._.
In_IN spite_NN of_IN the_DT fears_NNS expressed_VBN by_IN many_JJ people_NNS before_IN the_DT commencement_NN of_IN the_DT work_NN ,_, no_DT special_JJ outbreak_NN of_IN fever_NN appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN associated_VBN with_IN it_PRP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ true_JJ that_IN in_IN 1877-1878_JJ fever_NN became_VBD prevalent_JJ in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, but_CC this_DT was_VBD due_JJ to_TO the_DT influx_NN of_IN large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN famine-stricken_JJ people_NNS from_IN the_DT rural_JJ districts_NNS ;_: and_CC the_DT fever_NN prevalent_NN then_RB was_VBD shewn_VBN by_IN Vandyke_NNP Carter_NNP ,_, who_WP investigated_VBD the_DT condition_NN ,_, to_TO be_VB ``_`` famine_JJ fever_NN ``_`` or_CC relapsing_VBG fever_RB ,_, a_DT disease_NN entirely_RB distinct_JJ from_IN malaria_NN ._.
On_IN several_JJ occasions_NNS local_JJ outbreaks_NNS of_IN malaria_NNS appear_VBP to_TO have_VB occurred_VBN at_IN different_JJ times_NNS in_IN connection_NN with_IN the_DT construction_NN of_IN the_DT water-works_NNS at_IN Malbr_NNP Hill_NNP and_CC also_RB in_IN connection_NN with_IN similar_JJ work_NN at_IN Bhandrwda_NNP Hill_NNP ,_, Mazagaon_NNP ._.
118_CD ._.
When_WRB the_DT construction_NN of_IN the_DT Victoria_NNP Dock_NNP and_CC Merewether_NNP Dry_NNP Dock_NNP was_VBD undertaken_JJ no_DT outbreak_NN of_IN malaria_NN appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB occurred_VBN ;_: neither_CC did_VBD the_DT enlarging_NN of_IN the_DT Duncan_NNP Dry_NNP Dock_NNP and_CC construction_NN of_IN a_DT Wet_NNP Basin_NNP in_IN the_DT Government_NNP Dockyard_NNP ,_, which_WDT was_VBD decided_VBN on_IN in_IN 1890_CD ,_, seem_VBP to_TO give_VB rise_NN to_TO any_DT great_JJ measure_NN of_IN unhealthiness_NN ._.
But_CC this_DT latter_JJ work_NN was_VBD pushed_VBN on_IN very_RB rapidly_RB ,_, 2,000_CD men_NNS being_VBG employed_VBN upon_IN it_PRP ,_, so_IN that_IN everything_NN was_VBD completed_VBN in_IN two_CD and_CC a_DT half_JJ years_NNS from_IN the_DT commencement_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ that_IN a_DT temporary_JJ increase_NN of_IN malaria_NN may_MD have_VB been_VBN overlooked_VBN ._.
119_CD ._.
Between_JJ 1903_CD and_CC 1907_CD there_EX appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN a_DT local_JJ increase_NN of_IN malaria_NNS at_IN Malbr_NNP Hill_NNP in_IN the_DT neighbourhood_NN of_IN the_DT water-works_JJ co-incident_JJ 55_CD with_IN the_DT enlarging_NN of_IN the_DT filtering_NN plant_NN and_CC reservoir_NN ;_: and_CC similar_JJ work_NN at_IN Mazagaon_NNP also_RB appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB given_VBN rise_VB once_RB more_JJR to_TO a_DT temporary_JJ increase_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN that_DT locality_NN ._.
120_CD ._.
During_IN the_DT recent_JJ reclamation_NN work_NN at_IN Colaba_NNP there_EX was_VBD a_DT marked_JJ increase_NN of_IN ``_`` fever_NN ''_'' in_IN that_DT neighbourhood_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ reflected_VBN in_IN the_DT sudden_JJ rise_NN of_IN nearly_RB 70_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
in_IN the_DT cases_NNS treated_VBN at_IN the_DT local_JJ dispensary_NN ;_: and_CC the_DT demolition_NN work_NN carried_VBD out_RP by_IN the_DT Improvenent_NNP Trust_NNP in_IN the_DT areas_NNS required_VBN for_IN Sandhurst_NNP Road_NNP ,_, Princess_NNP Street_NNP and_CC for_IN the_DT reconstruction_NN of_IN areas_NNS such_JJ as_IN Dongri-Koliwda_NNP also_RB appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB caused_VBN local_JJ increases_NNS of_IN malaria_NN in_IN those_DT localities_NNS ._.
121_CD ._.
The_DT construction_NN of_IN the_DT Alexandra_NNP Dock_NNP and_CC Hughes_NNP Dry_NNP Dock_NNP ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ still_RB in_IN progress_NN ,_, has_VBZ caused_VBN a_DT considerable_JJ increase_NN of_IN malaria_NNS in_IN the_DT areas_NNS adjoining_VBG it_PRP ._.
Work_NN on_IN these_DT docks_NNS was_VBD commenced_VBN in_IN 1904_CD ._.
A_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN labourers_NNS are_VBP employed_VBN and_CC many_JJ of_IN those_DT engaged_VBN on_IN the_DT excavation_NN work_NN have_VBP from_IN the_DT first_JJ resided_VBN in_IN huts_NNS erected_VBN on_IN the_DT site_NN of_IN the_DT work_NN ._.
An_DT increase_NN of_IN ``_`` fever_NN ''_'' occurred_VBN in_IN the_DT neighbourhood_NN of_IN Frere_NNP Road_NNP in_IN 1905_CD ,_, but_CC it_PRP was_VBD not_RB until_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN 1907_CD that_WDT residents_NNS in_IN the_DT vicinity_NN began_VBD to_TO complain_VB ._.
In_IN 1908_CD the_DT disease_NN broke_VBD out_RP with_IN increased_JJ severity_NN and_CC as_IN a_DT result_NN there_EX was_VBD an_DT exodus_NN of_IN coolies_NNS and_CC labourers_NNS employed_VBN in_IN the_DT neighbour-_JJ hood_NN of_IN the_DT docks_NNS and_CC among_IN the_DT shipping_NN ._.
The_DT 1908_CD outbreak_NN caused_VBD a_DT considerable_JJ outcry_NN and_CC it_PRP was_VBD stated_VBN by_IN many_JJ people_NNS at_IN the_DT time_NN that_IN the_DT dock-work_NN was_VBD entirely_RB responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN malaria_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
But_CC the_DT abnormal_JJ increase_NN of_IN malaria_NN was_VBD not_RB confined_VBN to_TO the_DT area_NN around_IN the_DT docks_NNS ;_: for_IN in_IN parts_NNS of_IN the_DT City_NNP remote_NN from_IN the_DT dock-works_JJ malaria_NN was_VBD also_RB more_RBR prevalent_JJ and_CC more_RBR severe_JJ during_IN 1908_CD than_IN usual_JJ ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, at_IN Sewri_NNP ,_, where_WRB the_DT Port_NNP Trust_NNP had_VBD large_JJ reclamation_NN works_NNS in_IN progress_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN the_DT north_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN along_IN the_DT line_NN of_IN the_DT new_JJ Harbour_NNP Branch_NNP Railway_NNP ,_, which_WDT was_VBD undergoing_VBG construction_NN at_IN this_DT time_NN ,_, there_EX does_VBZ not_RB appear_VB to_TO have_VB been_VBN any_DT great_JJ increase_NN of_IN malaria_NNS ._.
The_DT latter_JJ work_NN entailed_VBD a_DT large_JJ amount_NN of_IN excavation_NN and_CC earthwork_NN and_CC many_JJ coolies_NNS were_VBD employed_VBN upon_IN it_PRP ,_, but_CC neither_CC the_DT workmen_NNS nor_CC residents_NNS in_IN the_DT vicinity_NN of_IN the_DT new_JJ line_NN appear_VBP to_TO have_VB suffered_VBN from_IN malaria_NNS to_TO any_DT great_JJ extent_NN ._.
122_CD ._.
Although_IN the_DT epidemic_JJ associated_VBN with_IN the_DT construction_NN of_IN the_DT new_JJ docks_NNS affected_VBD a_DT considerable_JJ area_NN ,_, including_VBG portions_NNS of_IN Mndvi_NNP and_CC Chakla_NNP ,_, the_DT Esplanade_NNP and_CC to_TO some_DT extent_NN the_DT North_NNP Fort_NNP ,_, the_DT suggestion_NN made_VBN in_IN 1908_CD that_WDT practically_RB all_PDT the_DT malaria_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP was_VBD due_JJ to_TO these_DT works_NNS is_VBZ not_RB in_IN accord_NN with_IN facts_NNS ._.
123_CD ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ not_RB difficult_JJ to_TO map_VB out_RP the_DT area_NN influenced_VBN by_IN direct_JJ diffusion_NN of_IN infection_NN from_IN the_DT new_JJ dock-works_NNS ._.
To_TO the_DT immediate_JJ north_NN of_IN the_DT new_JJ dock_NN enclosure_NN lies_VBZ Carnac_NNP Bandar_NNP with_IN Victoria_NNP Dock_NNP beyond_IN it_PRP ._.
The_DT most_RBS southerly_JJ berths_NNS in_IN Victoria_NNP Dock_NNP are_VBP used_VBN by_IN the_DT P._NNP &_CC O_NNP ._.
Company_NN ;_: and_CC during_IN the_DT epidemic_JJ in_IN the_DT summer_NN of_IN 1908_CD the_DT crews_NNS of_IN many_JJ of_IN the_DT P._NNP &_CC O._NNP vessels_NNS lying_VBG there_RB contracted_VBN malaria_NN ._.
On_IN boat_NN after_IN boat_NN from_IN 80_CD to_TO 100_CD cases_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN occurred_VBD among_IN the_DT crew_NN during_IN the_DT homeward_JJ voyage_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD only_JJ members_NNS of_IN the_DT crew_NN who_WP remained_VBD on_IN board_NN while_IN the_DT boats_NNS were_VBD in_IN the_DT dock_NN who_WP suffered_VBD ;_: the_DT passengers_NNS entirely_RB escaped_VBD ._.
But_CC although_IN the_DT P._NNP &_CC O._NNP crews_NNS suffered_VBD severely_RB ,_, other_JJ ships_NNS berthed_VBN in_IN the_DT Victoria_NNP and_CC Prince_NNP 's_POS Dock_NNP ,_, beyond_IN the_DT P._NNP &_CC O._NNP boats_NNS ,_, did_VBD not_RB appear_VB to_TO be_VB much_RB affected_VBN and_CC those_DT ships_NNS which_WDT lay_VBD out_RP in_IN the_DT harbour_NN escaped_VBD almost_RB entirely_RB ._.
In_IN Mándvi_NNP section_NN ,_, which_WDT lies_VBZ to_TO the_DT west_NN of_IN Victoria_NNP Dock_NNP ,_, the_DT disease_NN penetrated_VBD some_DT distance_NN ,_, but_CC did_VBD not_RB pass_VB beyond_IN Masjid_NNP Siding_VBG to_TO any_DT great_JJ extent_NN ._.
Further_RB west_JJS it_PRP penetrated_VBD about_IN half_NN through_IN Chakla_NNP ,_, but_CC the_DT blocks_NNS of_IN dwelling_VBG houses_NNS ,_, many_JJ of_IN which_WDT rise_NN to_TO five_CD storeys_NNS in_IN height_NN ,_, soon_RB barred_VBD its_PRP$ progress_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT spleen_JJ census_NN in_IN 1909_CD it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN high_JJ blocks_NNS of_IN houses_NNS ,_, separating_VBG two_CD narrow_JJ streets_NNS in_IN the_DT middle_NN of_IN Chakla_NNP ,_, shewed_VBD a_DT high_JJ spleen_NN rate_NN reaching_VBG 20_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
among_IN residents_NNS on_IN the_DT side_NN facing_VBG the_DT harbour_NN ;_: but_CC among_IN residents_NNS in_IN the_DT tenements_NNS facing_VBG away_RB from_IN the_DT harbour_NN the_DT spleen_JJ rate_NN was_VBD only_RB about_RB 3_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
In_IN Esplanade_NNP section_NN infection_NN was_VBD diffused_VBN as_RB far_RB as_IN Crawford_NNP Market_NNP ;_: and_CC the_DT inmates_NNS of_IN the_DT Paltan_NNP Road_NNP Improvement_NNP Trust_NNP semi-permanent_JJ chawls_NN ,_, Municipal_NNP chawls_NN and_CC Native_JJ 56_CD Infantry_NNP Lines_NNPS suffered_VBD severely_RB ._.
Large_JJ buildings_NNS such_JJ as_IN the_DT Crawford_NNP Market_NNP and_CC Sitaram_NNP Buildings_NNP appear_VBP to_TO have_VB acted_VBN as_IN a_DT bar_NN to_TO the_DT diffusion_NN of_IN infection_NN ,_, there_EX being_VBG much_JJ less_JJR sign_NN of_IN malaria_NN immediately_RB due_JJ west_JJS of_IN them_PRP than_IN on_IN the_DT Paltan_NNP Road_NNP side_NN ;_: but_CC ,_, where_WRB the_DT wall_NN of_IN high_JJ buildings_NNS ceased_VBD ,_, infection_NN diffused_VBD more_JJR deeply_RB into_IN the_DT Esplanade_NNP and_CC penetrated_VBN as_RB far_RB as_IN the_DT Cama_NNP Hospital_NNP ,_, the_DT Gokuldas_NNP Tejpal_NNP Hospital_NNP and_CC St._NNP Xavier_NNP 's_POS College_NNP ._.
Further_RB south_RB in_IN the_DT Esplanade_NNP the_DT lofty_JJ buildings_NNS of_IN the_DT Victoria_NNP Terminus_NNP and_CC the_DT Municipal_NNP Offices_NNPS appear_VBP to_TO have_VB checked_VBN the_DT diffusion_NN of_IN infection_NN to_TO the_DT west_NN ,_, but_CC all_PDT the_DT residents_NNS to_TO the_DT east_NN of_IN these_DT buildings_NNS suffered_VBD severely_RB ._.
The_DT guards_NNS ,_, porters_NNS and_CC sweepers_NNS belonging_VBG to_TO the_DT G._NNP I._NNP P._NNP Railway_NNP were_VBD attacked_VBN ,_, and_CC so_RB many_JJ of_IN the_DT former_JJ were_VBD prostrated_VBN that_IN at_IN one_CD time_NN during_IN the_DT height_NN of_IN the_DT epidemic_JJ as_RB many_JJ as_IN ten_NNS of_IN the_DT local_JJ trains_NNS had_VBD to_TO be_VB cancelled_VBN ._.
St._NNP George_NNP 's_POS Hospital_NNP ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ situated_VBN so_RB that_IN it_PRP overlooks_VBZ the_DT new_JJ dock-works_NNS ,_, became_VBD the_DT most_RBS malarious_JJ place_NN in_IN the_DT City_NNP ,_, the_DT members_NNS of_IN the_DT nursing_JJ staff_NN were_VBD frequently_RB prostrated_VBN with_IN malaria_NNS ,_, and_CC few_JJ of_IN the_DT patients_NNS who_WP entered_VBD the_DT hospital_NN escaped_VBD contracting_VBG the_DT disease_NN ._.
The_DT portion_NN of_IN the_DT North_NNP Fort_NNP immediately_RB overlooking_VBG the_DT harbour_NN was_VBD also_RB seriously_RB affected_JJ ,_, but_CC a_DT careful_JJ examination_NN of_IN that_DT area_NN shews_VBZ that_IN ,_, though_IN malaria_NN was_VBD intense_JJ in_IN Frere_NNP Road_NNP ,_, there_EX was_VBD a_DT marked_JJ fall_NN in_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN infection_NN present_NN ,_, as_IN shewn_NN by_IN the_DT spleen_JJ rate_NN ,_, in_IN the_DT area_NN immediately_RB adjoining_VBG Mint_NNP Road_NNP ._.
This_DT appears_VBZ to_TO indicate_VB that_IN blocks_NNS of_IN high_JJ buildings_NNS in_IN the_DT North_NNP Fort_NNP formed_VBD a_DT barrier_NN and_CC checked_VBD the_DT diffusion_NN of_IN malarial_JJ infection_NN from_IN the_DT east_NN into_IN that_DT section_NN just_RB as_IN they_PRP had_VBD evidently_RB done_VBN in_IN Chakla_NNP ._.
124_CD ._.
Passing_VBG westward_NN from_IN Fere_NNP Road_NNP into_IN the_DT North_NNP Fort_NNP ,_, malaria_NN becomes_VBZ more_JJR intense_JJ again_RB ,_, but_CC investigation_NN has_VBZ shewn_VBN that_IN this_DT is_VBZ due_JJ not_RB to_TO the_DT diffusion_NN of_IN malaria_NN from_IN the_DT east_NN or_CC harbour_JJ side_NN ,_, but_CC to_TO the_DT existence_NN of_IN hundreds_NNS of_IN open_JJ wells_NNS and_CC permanent_JJ foci_NN of_IN malarial_JJ infection_NN in_IN the_DT Fort_NNP itself_PRP ._.
A_DT similar_JJ centre_NN of_IN infection_NN ,_, due_JJ entirely_RB to_TO local_JJ causes_NNS ,_, is_VBZ to_TO be_VB found_VBN in_IN Dhobi_NNP Talo_NNP section_NN ,_, an_DT area_NN situated_VBN on_IN the_DT west_JJ side_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN far_RB away_RB from_IN the_DT new_JJ dock-works_NNS ._.
In_IN this_DT case_NN also_RB the_DT local_JJ cause_NN of_IN malaria_NN is_VBZ the_DT presence_NN of_IN hundreds_NNS of_IN open_JJ house_NN wells_NNS in_IN the_DT section_NN ;_: and_CC the_DT same_JJ influence_NN may_MD be_VB traced_VBN in_IN the_DT Market_NNP section_NN to_TO the_DT east_NN of_IN this_DT ._.
125_CD ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ now_RB evident_JJ as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN numerous_JJ observations_NNS regarding_VBG the_DT distribution_NN of_IN splenic_JJ enlargement_NN ,_, malarial_JJ infection_NN and_CC local_JJ species_NNS of_IN anopheles_NNS mosquitoes_NNS ,_, that_IN all_PDT the_DT factors_NNS necessary_JJ for_IN the_DT continued_VBN existence_NN and_CC spread_NN of_IN malaria_NNS are_VBP to_TO be_VB found_VBN in_IN many_JJ of_IN the_DT older_JJR portions_NNS of_IN the_DT City_NNP ,_, especially_RB in_IN A._NNP and_CC parts_NNS of_IN B._NNP and_CC C._NNP Wards_NNP and_CC to_TO a_DT much_RB less_RBR extent_JJ in_IN D._NNP and_CC E._NNP Wards_NNP ._.
And_CC so_RB long_RB as_IN this_DT condition_NN is_VBZ allowed_VBN to_TO exist_VB ,_, the_DT undertaking_NN of_IN any_DT large_JJ work_NN necessitating_VBG excavation_NN and_CC leading_VBG possibly_RB to_TO the_DT encampment_NN for_IN a_DT considerable_JJ period_NN of_IN large_JJ bodies_NNS of_IN coolie_JJ labourers_NNS on_IN the_DT site_NN of_IN the_DT work_NN ,_, will_MD undoubtedly_RB be_VB followed_VBN by_IN a_DT gradual_JJ increase_NN of_IN malaria_NNS in_IN the_DT adjoining_VBG areas_NNS ,_, unless_IN the_DT strictest_JJS precautions_NNS are_VBP adopted_VBN from_IN the_DT outset_NN ._.
126_CD ._.
There_EX are_VBP strong_JJ grounds_NNS for_IN believing_VBG that_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN outbreaks_NNS of_IN malaria_NNS in_IN association_NN with_IN the_DT construction_NN of_IN the_DT Prince_NNP 's_POS and_CC Victoria_NNP Docks_NNP years_NNS ago_RB and_CC the_DT more_RBR recent_JJ work_NN at_IN Sewri_NNP and_CC the_DT Port_NNP Trust_NNP Railway_NNP was_VBD due_JJ to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN :_: -_: (_( 1_CD )_) No_DT serious_JJ centres_NNS of_IN malarial_JJ infection_NN existed_VBN in_IN the_DT vicinity_NN of_IN these_DT works_NNS ;_: (_( 2_CD )_) Few_JJ permanent_JJ breeding_NN places_NNS of_IN dangerous_JJ species_NNS of_IN anopheles_NNS were_VBD present_JJ in_IN their_PRP$ neighbourhood_NN ;_: (_( 3_CD )_) The_DT labourers_NNS employed_VBN were_VBD not_RB encamped_VBN ,_, in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT dock-works_NNS ,_, on_IN the_DT site_NN of_IN the_DT works_NNS ._.
127_CD ._.
The_DT sequence_NN of_IN events_NNS in_IN connection_NN with_IN the_DT epidemic_JJ outbreak_NN of_IN malaria_NNS associated_VBN with_IN the_DT construction_NN of_IN present_JJ new_JJ docks_NNS appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: -_: (_( 1_CD )_) The_DT existence_NN of_IN a_DT serious_JJ amount_NN of_IN malarial_JJ infection_NN among_IN the_DT residents_NNS of_IN North_NNP Fort_NNP close_NN to_TO the_DT site_NN of_IN the_DT works_NNS ._.
57_CD (_( 2_CD )_) The_DT existence_NN of_IN numerous_JJ permanent_JJ breeding_NN places_NNS of_IN Neocellia_NNP stephensi_NN in_IN the_DT hundreds_NNS of_IN open_JJ house_NN wells_NNS and_CC a_DT less_JJR number_NN of_IN masonry_NN tanks_NNS and_CC iron_NN cisterns_NNS in_IN the_DT North_NNP Fort_NNP ,_, adjoining_VBG the_DT area_NN in_IN which_WDT construction_NN work_NN was_VBD being_VBG undertaken_JJ ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) The_DT settling_VBG down_IN of_IN many_JJ coolie_NN labourers_NNS in_IN temporary_JJ huts_NNS on_IN the_DT site_NN of_IN the_DT new_JJ dock-works_NNS ._.
(_( 4_CD )_) The_DT formation_NN of_IN many_JJ pools_NNS of_IN water_NN on_IN the_DT upper_JJ surface_NN of_IN the_DT works_NNS (_( not_RB excavations_NNS )_) in_IN the_DT vicinity_NN of_IN the_DT labourers_NNS '_POS huts_NNS ._.
(_( 5_CD )_) The_DT gradual_JJ spread_NN of_IN Neocellia_NNP stephensi_NN from_IN the_DT North_NNP Fort_NNP to_TO these_DT new_JJ breeding_NN places_NNS ._.
(_( 6_CD )_) The_DT gradual_JJ spread_NN of_IN infection_NN among_IN the_DT labourers_NNS ,_, at_IN first_JJ chiefly_NN from_IN the_DT North_NNP Fort_NNP but_CC afterwards_NNS from_IN one_CD to_TO another_DT ._.
(_( 7_CD )_) The_DT occurrence_NN in_IN 1907_CD and_CC 1908_CD of_IN climatic_JJ ,_, economic_JJ and_CC other_JJ conditions_NNS favouring_VBG an_DT epidemic_JJ outbreak_NN of_IN malarial_JJ disease_NN ._.
128_CD ._.
There_EX is_VBZ plenty_NN of_IN evidence_NN to_TO show_VB that_IN malaria_NN existed_VBN in_IN the_DT North_NNP Fort_NNP long_RB before_RB 1904_CD when_WRB the_DT docks_NNS were_VBD commenced_VBN ._.
A_DT medical_JJ man_NN born_VBN and_CC brought_VBN up_RP in_IN the_DT Fort_NNP volunteered_VBD the_DT inform-_JJ ation_NN that_IN he_PRP well_VBZ remembers_NNS possessing_VBG an_DT enlarged_JJ spleen_NN as_IN a_DT boy_NN and_CC being_VBG treated_VBN for_IN it_PRP ;_: and_CC ten_CD years_NNS ago_RB Europeans_NNPS resident_NN in_IN flats_NNS near_IN Elphinstone_NNP Circle_NNP repeatedly_RB suffered_VBD from_IN malaria_NN ,_, some_DT of_IN them_PRP so_RB severely_RB that_IN they_PRP had_VBD to_TO leave_VB the_DT neighbourhood_NN ._.
As_IN residents_NNS in_IN the_DT North_NNP Fort_NNP contracted_VBD malaria_CD years_NNS ago_RB ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ certain_JJ that_IN the_DT transmitting_NN agent_NN must_MD have_VB been_VBN present_JJ ._.
Neocellia_NNP stephensi_NN ,_, the_DT transmitting_VBG agent_NN of_IN most_JJS of_IN the_DT malaria_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, was_VBD found_VBN in_IN the_DT city_NN in_IN 1901_CD ,_, and_CC the_DT presence_NN of_IN over_IN 600_CD wells_NNS and_CC other_JJ collections_NNS of_IN water_NN in_IN the_DT North_NNP Fort_NNP ,_, 300_CD of_IN which_WDT were_VBD infested_VBN with_IN it_PRP in_IN 1909_CD ,_, makes_VBZ it_PRP reasonable_JJ to_TO assume_VB that_IN it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN concerned_VBN in_IN the_DT spead_NN of_IN malaria_NN in_IN this_DT area_NN for_IN a_DT very_RB long_JJ period_NN ._.
129_CD ._.
The_DT settling_NN of_IN large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN coolies_NNS in_IN temporary_JJ huts_NNS on_IN the_DT dock_NN site_NN was_VBD a_DT mistake_NN in_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT danger_NN of_IN epidemic_JJ disease_NN occurring_VBG amongst_VB them_PRP ._.
The_DT rule_NN that_IN ,_, in_IN malarious_JJ countries_NNS labourers_NNS should_MD not_RB be_VB housed_VBN on_IN the_DT site_NN of_IN large_JJ excavation_NN works_NNS ,_, was_VBD first_RB laid_VBN down_RP by_IN Colin_NNP over_IN 50_CD years_NNS ago_RB and_CC it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN endorsed_VBN by_IN many_JJ other_JJ authorities_NNS since_IN then_RB ._.
Fayrer_NN in_IN 1902_CD ,_, emphasizing_VBG the_DT precautions_NNS previously_RB laid_VBN down_RP by_IN Colin_NNP ,_, states_NNS :_: -_: ``_`` The_DT draining_NN of_IN marshes_NNS ,_, the_DT making_NN of_IN canals_NNS ,_, railway_NN cuttings_NNS ,_, ``_`` roads_NNS ,_, embankments_NNS ,_, fortifications_NNS and_CC such_JJ like_IN ,_, and_CC the_DT cutting_VBG down_IN of_IN ``_`` jungle_NN ,_, should_MD be_VB executed_VBN with_IN great_JJ precautions_NNS ,_, and_CC if_IN possible_JJ at_IN the_DT ``_`` healthy_JJ season_NN ;_: the_DT labourers_NNS are_VBP to_TO be_VB protected_VBN by_IN proper_JJ shelter_NN ,_, ``_`` removal_NN from_IN the_DT seat_NN of_IN labour_NN at_IN night_NN ,_, *_NNP and_CC the_DT free_JJ use_NN of_IN quinine_NN and_CC ``_`` proper_JJ diet_NN while_IN they_PRP are_VBP at_IN work_NN ._. ''_''
It_PRP is_VBZ probable_JJ that_IN the_DT failure_NN to_TO remove_VB the_DT labourers_NNS from_IN the_DT site_NN of_IN the_DT work_NN at_IN night_NN and_CC the_DT omission_NN possibly_RB of_IN sufficiently_RB drastic_JJ measures_NNS of_IN prevention_NN at_IN the_DT outset_NN have_VBP been_VBN responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT severity_NN of_IN the_DT outbreak_NN of_IN malaria_NN in_IN the_DT neighbourhood_NN of_IN the_DT new_JJ docks_NNS ._.
130_CD ._.
There_EX is_VBZ no_DT reason_NN to_TO suppose_VB that_IN the_DT labourers_NNS brought_VBD much_JJ infection_NN with_IN them_PRP ,_, as_IN the_DT examination_NN of_IN newly_RB arrived_VBN coolies_NNS living_VBG on_IN the_DT works_NNS has_VBZ usually_RB shewn_VBN them_PRP to_TO be_VB free_JJ both_DT from_IN enlarged_VBN spleen_NN or_CC parasites_NNS in_IN their_PRP$ blood_NN ;_: but_CC those_DT resident_VBP a_DT few_JJ months_NNS shew_VBP a_DT considerable_JJ amount_NN of_IN infec-_JJ tion_NN ;_: and_CC among_IN those_DT over_IN a_DT year_NN at_IN work_NN nearly_RB everyone_NN has_VBZ an_DT enlarged_VBN spleen_NN ._.
In_IN 1910_CD the_DT headman_NN of_IN one_CD gang_NN volunteered_VBD the_DT statement_NN that_IN of_IN 300_CD working_VBG coolies_NNS who_WP came_VBD with_IN him_PRP from_IN their_PRP$ district_NN (_( Mrwr_NNP )_) one_CD hundred_VBN had_VBD died_VBN and_CC another_DT hundred_VBN had_VBD deserted_VBN their_PRP$ work_NN during_IN the_DT preceding_VBG eighteen_JJ months_NNS ._.
He_PRP ascribed_VBD the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN fever_NN and_CC enlarge-_JJ ment_NN of_IN the_DT spleen_NN among_IN his_PRP$ men_NNS to_TO the_DT water_NN they_PRP drank_VBP at_IN the_DT docks_NNS and_CC stated_VBD that_IN in_IN his_PRP$ own_JJ village_NN the_DT people_NNS did_VBD not_RB suffer_VB in_IN this_DT way_NN ._.
His_PRP$ ideas_NNS regarding_VBG the_DT water_NN were_VBD of_IN course_NN an_DT error_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT examination_NN of_IN a_DT dozen_NN *_IN The_DT italies_NNS are_VBP mine.-C._JJ A_NNP ._.
B_NNP ._.
136-15_JJ 58_CD people_NNS newly_RB arrived_VBN from_IN the_DT same_JJ district_NN shewed_VBD that_IN none_NN of_IN them_PRP had_VBD splenic_JJ enlargement_NN or_CC other_JJ sign_NN of_IN malaria_NN ,_, a_DT fact_NN which_WDT supported_VBD his_PRP$ state-_JJ ment_NN regarding_VBG the_DT absence_NN of_IN malaria_NN in_IN his_PRP$ village_NN ._.
131_CD ._.
The_DT only_JJ conclusion_NN that_WDT can_MD be_VB arrived_VBN at_IN regarding_VBG the_DT origin_NN of_IN the_DT epidemic_NN of_IN 1908_CD is_VBZ that_IN ,_, the_DT existence_NN of_IN unrecognized_JJ centres_NNS of_IN malarial_JJ infection_NN in_IN various_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT City_NNP and_CC a_DT gradual_JJ and_CC unsuspected_JJ increase_NN of_IN malaria_NNS in_IN association_NN with_IN these_DT centres_NNS was_VBD the_DT prime_JJ cause_NN of_IN the_DT outbreak_NN and_CC the_DT determining_VBG factor_NN was_VBD a_DT combination_NN of_IN climatic_JJ ,_, economic_JJ and_CC other_JJ conditions_NNS favourable_JJ to_TO the_DT spread_NN of_IN malaria_NN ._.
Where_WRB these_DT conditions_NNS could_MD act_VB with_IN greatest_JJS effect_NN ,_, i._NN e._NN ,_, in_IN the_DT area_NN around_IN the_DT new_JJ dock-works_NNS and_CC among_IN the_DT coolie_NN labourers_NNS encamped_VBD there_RB ,_, they_PRP produced_VBD a_DT more_RBR intense_JJ outbreak_NN than_IN in_IN other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.
132_CD ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN this_DT conclusion_NN the_DT question_NN naturally_RB arises_VBZ :_: -_: (_( 1_CD )_) Could_MD the_DT 1907-1908_JJ epidemic_NN of_IN malaria_NNS have_VBP been_VBN prevented_VBN ?_.
and_CC (_( 2_CD )_) Is_VBZ there_EX a_DT danger_NN of_IN other_JJ similar_JJ epidemics_NNS occurring_VBG in_IN the_DT future_NN ?_.
It_PRP is_VBZ very_RB doubtful_JJ if_IN there_EX could_MD have_VB been_VBN such_PDT an_DT epidemic_JJ if_IN there_EX had_VBD been_VBN no_RB more_RBR malaria_NNS in_IN the_DT Fort_NNP ,_, Dhobi_NNP Talo_NNP and_CC the_DT southern_JJ portion_NN of_IN the_DT City_NNP generally_RB than_IN there_EX is_VBZ in_IN the_DT centre_NN and_CC the_DT extreme_JJ north_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN ._.
If_IN steps_NNS had_VBD been_VBN taken_VBN to_TO thoroughly_VB investigate_VB the_DT distribution_NN of_IN malaria_NN on_IN the_DT island_NN and_CC the_DT means_NNS by_IN which_WDT it_PRP was_VBD spread_VBN after_IN Powell_NNP had_VBD shewn_VBN the_DT comparative_JJ frequency_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN among_IN the_DT City_NNP Police_NNP in_IN 1901_CD to_TO 1903_CD there_EX is_VBZ little_JJ question_NN that_IN the_DT conditions_NNS favouring_VBG an_DT increase_NN of_IN malaria_NNS would_MD have_VB been_VBN recognized_VBN ;_: and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ probable_JJ that_IN ,_, if_IN it_PRP had_VBD been_VBN realized_VBN in_IN 1904_CD that_IN the_DT North_NNP Fort_NNP was_VBD a_DT focus_NN of_IN malaria_NN ,_, adequate_JJ precautions_NNS would_MD have_VB been_VBN adopted_VBN in_IN connexion_NN with_IN the_DT new_JJ docks_NNS at_IN the_DT outset_NN ._.
As_IN to_TO the_DT possible_JJ recurrence_NN of_IN epidemic_JJ malaria_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, it_PRP may_MD be_VB remarked_VBN that_IN ,_, now_RB that_IN the_DT facts_NNS are_VBP known_VBN and_CC the_DT danger_NN recognized_VBN ,_, there_EX should_MD be_VB less_JJR chance_NN of_IN malaria_NNS being_VBG allowed_VBN to_TO pass_VB beyond_IN control_NN ._.
But_CC unfortunately_RB malaria_NNS is_VBZ far_RB from_IN being_VBG controlled_VBN at_IN present_NN ._.
The_DT small_JJ attempts_NNS that_WDT have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN to_TO limit_VB it_PRP have_VB only_RB served_VBN to_TO mitigate_VB the_DT disease_NN to_TO a_DT slight_JJ extent_NN ,_, and_CC though_IN it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN checked_VBN a_DT little_JJ in_IN some_DT areas_NNS ,_, unless_IN more_RBR radical_JJ measures_NNS are_VBP adopted_VBN and_CC carried_VBN to_TO a_DT successful_JJ termina-_JJ tion_NN ,_, the_DT City_NNP will_MD remain_VB as_IN liable_JJ to_TO epidemic_VB outbreaks_NNS of_IN malaria_NN in_IN the_DT future_NN as_IN it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN in_IN the_DT past_NN ._.
59_CD CHAPTER_NN IV_NNP ._.
133_CD ._.
THE_DT COST_NNP OF_NNP MALARIA_NNP IN_NNP BOMBAY.-It_NNP is_VBZ always_RB difficult_JJ to_TO estimate_VB the_DT cost_NN of_IN a_DT disease_NN to_TO a_DT community_NN ,_, even_RB when_WRB there_EX are_VBP exact_JJ figures_NNS to_TO go_VB upon_RB ,_, because_IN there_EX are_VBP so_RB many_JJ different_JJ factors_NNS to_TO take_VB into_IN account_NN ._.
In_IN cases_NNS of_IN death_NN there_EX is_VBZ the_DT loss_NN occasioned_VBD to_TO relations_NNS ,_, cost_NN of_IN burial_JJ ,_, funeral_JJ ceremonies_NNS and_CC expenses_NNS which_WDT are_VBP incurred_VBN in_IN connexion_NN with_IN it_PRP ;_: and_CC there_EX is_VBZ also_RB the_DT loss_NN of_IN possibly_RB useful_JJ lives_NNS to_TO the_DT community_NN ,_, representing_VBG capital_NN of_IN unknown_JJ amount_NN ._.
But_CC when_WRB we_PRP come_VBP to_TO estimate_VB the_DT loss_NN occasioned_VBN by_IN malaria_NNS ,_, death_NN is_VBZ a_DT small_JJ matter_NN compared_VBN with_IN sickness_NN ._.
Ross_NNP states_NNS that_WDT probably_RB one-third_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ population_NN of_IN malarious_JJ countries_NNS require_VBP medical_JJ treatment_NN on_IN account_NN of_IN malaria_NN every_DT year_NN and_CC that_IN probably_RB from_IN one-fourth_JJ to_TO one-half_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ attendance_NN at_IN hospitals_NNS and_CC dispensaries_NNS are_VBP due_JJ to_TO this_DT cause_NN ._.
134_CD ._.
But_CC in_IN India_NNP the_DT number_NN of_IN cases_NNS of_IN malaria_NN attending_VBG hospitals_NNS is_VBZ no_DT criterion_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN sick_JJ ,_, and_CC in_IN a_DT city_NN like_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, where_WRB there_EX are_VBP probably_RB not_RB less_JJR than_IN 700_CD qualified_JJ medical_JJ men_NNS ,_, a_DT host_NN of_IN unqualified_JJ practi-_JJ tioners_NNS and_CC many_JJ hundreds_NNS of_IN chemists_NNS and_CC druggists_NNS of_IN all_DT sorts_NNS ,_, only_RB a_DT propor-_JJ tion_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ sick_NN among_IN the_DT population_NN attend_NN hospitals_NNS and_CC dispensaries_NNS ._.
There_EX are_VBP many_JJ people_NNS among_IN the_DT working_NN classes_NNS also_RB who_WP do_VBP not_RB think_VB of_IN seek-_JJ ing_VBG treatment_NN until_IN after_IN they_PRP have_VBP suffered_VBN from_IN repeated_JJ attacks_NNS of_IN fever_NN ;_: and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ probable_JJ therefore_NN that_IN only_RB a_DT small_JJ proportion_NN of_IN the_DT cases_NNS of_IN mild_JJ ``_`` inter-_JJ mittent_NN ``_`` malaria_JJ receive_JJ treatment_NN of_IN any_DT kind_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT past_JJ ten_NN years_NNS the_DT supposed_JJ cases_NNS of_IN malaria_NN treated_VBN at_IN certain_JJ of_IN the_DT hospitals_NNS and_CC dispensaries_NNS in_IN the_DT City_NNP appear_VBP to_TO have_VB varied_VBN from_IN about_RB 15_CD to_TO 18_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT cases_NNS treated_VBD ._.
The_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN cases_NNS of_IN all_DT kinds_NNS receiving_VBG treatment_NN is_VBZ between_IN 3,00,000_CD or_CC 4,00,000_CD ,_, giving_VBG an_DT admission_NN rate_NN for_IN sickness_NN on_IN the_DT whole_JJ popula-_JJ tion_NN of_IN nearly_RB 400_CD per_IN 1,000_CD per_IN annum_NN ._.
But_CC if_IN we_PRP take_VBP the_DT Police_NNP Hospital_NNP we_PRP find_VBP that_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN admission_NN per_IN strength_NN for_IN all_DT diseases_NNS is_VBZ more_JJR than_IN 1,000_CD per_IN 1,000_CD of_IN strength_NN and_CC of_IN these_DT admissions_NNS nearly_RB 50_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
are_VBP cases_NNS of_IN fever_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT years_NNS 1901-1903_VBP the_DT diagnosis_NN of_IN these_DT fever_NN cases_NNS ,_, based_VBN upon_IN a_DT careful_JJ examination_NN of_IN the_DT blood_NN conducted_VBN by_IN an_DT expert_NN ,_, showed_VBD that_IN 75_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
were_VBD due_JJ to_TO malaria_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ certain_JJ that_IN there_EX is_VBZ at_IN least_JJS as_RB much_JJ sickness_NN among_IN the_DT general_JJ population_NN as_IN among_IN the_DT police_NN and_CC probably_RB a_DT far_RB greater_JJR amount_NN ;_: but_CC if_IN we_PRP estimate_VBP the_DT rate_NN to_TO be_VB the_DT same_JJ we_PRP should_MD have_VB about_IN 1,000,000_CD cases_NNS of_IN sickness_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP each_DT year_NN ._.

may_MD be_VB assumed_VBN to_TO be_VB malarial_JJ in_IN nature_NN ._.

135_CD ._.

61_CD CHAPTER_NN V._NNP THE_NNP MOSQUITOES_NNP OF_NNP BOMBAY_NNP ._.
Section_NN 1_CD ._.
138_CD ._.
Bombay_NNP appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB suffered_VBN from_IN a_DT plague_NN of_IN mosquitoes_NNS for_IN many_JJ years_NNS ._.
Aungier_NNP ,_, nearly_RB 250_CD years_NNS ago_RB ,_, writes_NNS of_IN ``_`` The_DT vermin_NN created_VBD in_IN the_DT wells_NNS and_CC tanks_NNS ,_, ''_'' and_CC Ovington_NNP mentions_NNS ``_`` The_DT prodigious_JJ growth_NN of_IN vermin_NN and_CC the_DT venomous_JJ creatures_NNS in_IN the_DT monsoon_NN ,_, ''_'' and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ more_RBR than_IN probable_JJ that_IN these_DT remarks_NNS referred_VBD in_IN part_NN at_IN least_JJS to_TO mosquitoes_NNS ._.
Lady_JJ West_NNP ,_, in_IN her_PRP$ diary_JJ written_VBN between_IN 1825-1828_JJ ,_, repeatedly_RB complains_VBZ of_IN being_VBG tormented_VBN with_IN mosquitoes_NNS ,_, which_WDT appear_VBP to_TO have_VB been_VBN numerous_JJ in_IN the_DT Fort_NNP in_IN her_PRP$ day_NN ;_: and_CC Douglas_NNP ,_, in_IN his_PRP$ ``_`` Glimpses_NNP of_IN Old_NNP Bombay_NNP ,_, ''_'' quotes_VBZ some_DT verses_NNS by_IN a_DT Bombay_NNP writer_NN in_IN 1829_CD which_WDT begin-_VBP ``_`` Adieu_NNP Bombay_NNP !_.

139_CD ._.
Shortly_RB after_IN the_DT announcement_NN of_IN Ross_NNP '_POS discovery_NN ,_, the_DT late_JJ Colonel_NNP ._.
Weir_NNP ,_, I._NNP M._NNP S._NNP ,_, then_RB Executive_NNP Health_NNP Officer_NNP of_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, turned_VBD his_PRP$ attention_NN to_TO the_DT question_NN of_IN mosquitoes_NNS breeding_VBG in_IN the_DT City_NNP and_CC referred_VBD to_TO the_DT matter_NN in_IN certain_JJ of_IN his_PRP$ reports_NNS ;_: and_CC in_IN 1899_CD Mr._NNP Santo_NNP Crimp_NNP suggested_VBD that_IN malaria-_JJ carrying_NN mosquitoes_NNS might_MD breed_VB in_IN the_DT tanks_NNS in_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.
But_CC the_DT late_JJ Mr._NNP E._NNP H._NNP Aitken_NNP appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN the_DT first_JJ to_TO really_RB investigate_VB the_DT mosquito_NN fauna_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
In_IN an_DT interesting_JJ letter_NN on_IN the_DT subject_NN ,_, published_VBN in_IN the_DT Journal_NNP of_IN the_DT Bombay_NNP Natural_NNP History_NNP Society_NNP in_IN 1900_CD ,_, Mr._NNP Aitken_NNP refers_VBZ to_TO a_DT number_NN of_IN mosquito-breeding_JJ places_NNS in_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT City_NNP in_IN which_WDT plenty_NN of_IN Anopheles_NNP larv_NNS were_VBD found_VBN ._.
He_PRP also_RB mentions_VBZ experiments_NNS with_IN small_JJ fish_NN as_IN agents_NNS for_IN destroying_VBG mosquito_JJ larv_NN ._.
In_IN these_DT experiments_NNS Mr._NNP Aitken_NNP used_VBD a_DT species_NNS of_IN Haphlochilus_NNP locally_RB known_VBN as_IN ``_`` Piku_NNP ``_`` but_CC named_VBN by_IN him_PRP ``_`` Scooties_NNS ''_'' because_IN of_IN their_PRP$ darting_NN movements_NNS ._.
Among_IN other_JJ observations_NNS ,_, recorded_VBN by_IN Mr._NNP Aitken_NNP ,_, one_CD relating_NN to_TO the_DT relative_JJ frequency_NN with_IN which_WDT adult_NN Anopheles_NNP and_CC Culex_NNP mosquitoes_NNS were_VBD to_TO be_VB met_VBN with_IN in_IN the_DT Fort_NNP is_VBZ of_IN considerable_JJ interest_NN ._.
He_PRP states_VBZ :_: -_: ``_`` As_IN regards_NNS the_DT nature_NN of_IN adult_NN anopheles_NNS ,_, the_DT most_RBS remarkable_JJ fact_NN ``_`` mentioned_VBN in_IN my_PRP$ notes_NNS is_VBZ that_IN I_PRP have_VBP not_RB seen_VBN one_CD during_IN the_DT twelve_NN ``_`` months_NNS excepting_VBG those_DT that_IN I_PRP reared_VBD ._.
This_DT fact_NN will_MD give_VB the_DT best_JJS idea_NN ``_`` of_IN what_WP an_DT insidious_JJ enemy_NN we_PRP have_VBP to_TO deal_VB with_IN ._.
I_PRP lived_VBD most_JJS of_IN the_DT ``_`` years_NNS at_IN the_DT Bombay_NNP Club_NNP ,_, within_IN a_DT stone-throw_NN of_IN the_DT Frere_NNP Fountain_NNP ,_, ``_`` in_IN which_WDT anopheles_NNS were_VBD being_VBG produced_VBN by_IN the_DT thousand_NN ,_, but_CC I_PRP never_RB ``_`` saw_VBD one_CD ,_, though_IN I_PRP was_VBD often_RB tormented_VBN by_IN culex_NN ,_, the_DT larv_NN of_IN which_WDT ``_`` were_VBD comparatively_RB scarce_JJ ._.

rossi_NN ._. ''_''
140_CD ._.
During_IN 1901_CD considerable_JJ attention_NN was_VBD paid_VBN to_TO mosquitoes_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP ;_: and_CC the_DT Executive_NNP Health_NNP Officer_NNP in_IN one_CD of_IN his_PRP$ reports_NNS makes_VBZ the_DT follwing_JJ statement_NN :_: -_: ``_`` The_DT chief_JJ specimens_NNS of_IN anopheles_NNS mosquitoes_NNS found_VBD in_IN Bombay_NNP ``_`` are_VBP Anopheles_NNP Rossei_NNP ,_, Barbarosei_NNP ,_, Jamesei_NNP ,_, Culicifacias_NNP ,_, Stephensei_NNP and_CC ``_`` Listonii_NNP ._.

141_CD ._.
The_DT Culicid_NNP fauna_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP is_VBZ extensive_JJ ;_: the_DT number_NN of_IN different_JJ species_NNS both_DT of_IN Culicine_NNP and_CC Anopheline_NNP mosquitoes_NNS is_VBZ considerable_JJ and_CC certain_JJ B_NNP 136-16_JJ 62_CD of_IN them_PRP ,_, notably_RB Culex_NNP fatigans_NNS and_CC Nysso-myzomyia_NNP rossi_NN ,_, are_VBP met_VBN with_IN in_IN every_DT part_NN of_IN the_DT Island_NNP and_CC are_VBP present_JJ in_IN many_JJ localities_NNS in_IN such_JJ countless_JJ numbers_NNS as_IN to_TO become_VB a_DT grave_JJ nuisance_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT dry_JJ season_NN from_IN October_NNP to_TO June_NNP Culex_NNP fatigans_NNS is_VBZ by_IN far_RB the_DT commonest_JJS mosquito_NN ,_, but_CC after_IN the_DT onset_NN of_IN the_DT rains_NNS Nysso-myzomyia_NNP rossi_NN is_VBZ produced_VBN in_IN enormous_JJ numbers_NNS ,_, and_CC in_IN August_NNP and_CC September_NNP ,_, Stegomyi_NNP ,_, notably_RB Stegomyia_NNP sugens_NNS ,_, Stegomyia_NNP scutellaris_NN and_CC Stegomyia_NNP calopus_NN (_( fasciata_NN )_) become_VBP unpleasantly_RB numerous_JJ ._.

Abdomen.-Dorsal_NNP and_CC ventral_JJ surfaces_NNS of_IN the_DT last_JJ one_CD or_CC two_CD segments_NNS carry_VBP scales_NNS as_IN in_IN the_DT genus_NN Nyssorhynchus_NNP ._.
Thorax.-With_NNP long_JJ narrow_JJ sharp-pointed_JJ scales_NNS as_IN in_IN the_DT genus_NN Myzomyia_NNP and_CC with_IN some_DT broader_JJR short_JJ scales_NNS ._.

(_( 1_CD )_) Diagram_NNP of_IN Anopheles_NNP larva_FW showing_VBG frontal_JJ hairs_NNS F._NNP H._NNP ,_, which_WDT must_MD not_RB be_VB confused_VBN with_IN feeding_VBG brushes_NNS F._NNP B_NNP ,_, also_RB palmate_VBP hairs_NNS or_CC fans_NNS P._NNP H._NNP ,_, a_DT pair_NN of_IN which_WDT is_VBZ usually_RB present_JJ on_IN most_JJS of_IN the_DT abdominal_JJ segments_NNS ._.

?_. 63_CD Protheracic_NNP lobes.-With_NN a_DT tuft_NN of_IN scales_NNS ._.

NYSSO-MYZOMYIA_JJ ROSSI_NNP ._.
Adult_NNP characters.-A_JJ fair_JJ sized_VBN mosquito_NN ,_, of_IN a_DT general_JJ light_NN brown_IN colour_NN ._.
The_DT head_NN is_VBZ blackish_JJ ,_, but_CC possesses_VBZ a_DT well-developed_JJ frontal_JJ tuft_NN of_IN white_JJ hairs_NNS projecting_VBG forwards_NNS ._.
The_DT palpi_NN have_VBP three_CD white_JJ bands_NNS ,_, and_CC in_IN the_DT female_NN ,_, the_DT outermost_NN which_WDT includes_VBZ the_DT tips_NNS of_IN the_DT palpi_NN is_VBZ broad_JJ ,_, the_DT other_JJ two_CD being_VBG narrow_JJ ._.
The_DT proboscis_NN is_VBZ dark_JJ brown_IN with_IN a_DT yellowish_JJ tip_NN ._.
The_DT wings_NNS are_VBP spotted_VBN with_IN black_JJ especially_RB along_IN the_DT border_NN of_IN the_DT costa_NN and_CC the_DT central_JJ spot_NN resembles_NNS in_IN shape_NN an_DT expanded_VBN ``_`` T_NNP ''_'' ._.
The_DT legs_NNS are_VBP brownish_JJ in_IN colour_NN ,_, but_CC show_VBP white_JJ bandings_NNS at_IN the_DT joints_NNS ,_, especially_RB noticeable_JJ on_IN the_DT forelegs_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ no_DT speckling_NN of_IN the_DT legs_NNS ._.
Examination_NN with_IN a_DT microscope_NN shows_VBZ many_JJ golden_JJ hairs_NNS and_CC scattered_JJ narrow_JJ whitish_JJ scales_NNS on_IN the_DT thorax_NN ,_, dense_JJ yellowish_JJ brown_VBN hairs_NNS on_IN the_DT general_JJ surface_NN of_IN the_DT abdomen_NNS and_CC a_DT few_JJ true_JJ scales_NNS on_IN the_DT last_JJ one_CD or_CC two_CD segments_NNS ;_: these_DT scales_NNS are_VBP especially_RB noticeable_JJ around_IN the_DT base_NN of_IN the_DT claspers_NNS in_IN the_DT male_NN ._.
Larval_JJ characters.-The_JJ frontal_JJ hairs_NN on_IN the_DT clypeus_NN of_IN the_DT larv_NN are_VBP simple_JJ and_CC unbranched_JJ ._.
Palmate_NNP hairs_NNS are_VBP present_JJ from_IN the_DT second_JJ to_TO the_DT seventh_JJ abdominal_JJ segment_NN ._.
The_DT terminal_JJ filament_NN of_IN each_DT leaflet_NN of_IN the_DT palmate_NN hairs_NN is_VBZ very_RB long_RB ,_, often_RB longer_RBR than_IN the_DT basal_JJ portion_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ little_JJ or_CC no_DT marking_NN or_CC pigmentation_NN on_IN the_DT shoulder_NN of_IN the_DT leaflets_NNS at_IN the_DT origin_NN of_IN the_DT terminal_JJ filaments_NNS ._.
Ovum.-Boat-shaped_NNP ,_, with_IN a_DT broad_JJ upper_JJ surface_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ a_DT well-_JJ developed_JJ fringe_NN striated_VBD throughout_IN its_PRP$ whole_JJ length_NN ,_, and_CC scallop-shell_NN shaped_VBD floats_NNS which_WDT touch_VBP the_DT margin_NN of_IN the_DT anterior_JJ surface_NN ._.
The_DT lower_JJR surface_NN is_VBZ not_RB ornamented_VBN ._.
145_CD ._.
NEOCELLIA_NNP ._.
Generic_JJ characters_NNS ._.
Abdomen._NNP --_: The_DT dorsal_JJ surface_NN of_IN every_DT segment_NN carries_VBZ scales_NNS ._.
The_DT ventral_JJ surface_NN of_IN the_DT last_JJ three_CD or_CC four_CD segments_NNS carry_VBP scales_NNS ._.
None_NN of_IN the_DT scales_NNS are_VBP aggregated_VBN to_TO form_VB tufts_NNS ._.
Thorax.-With_NNP a_DT short_JJ ,_, broad_JJ true_JJ scales_NNS ._.
Protheracic_NNP lobes.-With_NN a_DT tuft_NN of_IN scales_NNS ._.
Upright_NNP forked_VBD cephalic_JJ scales.-Of_JJ the_DT usual_JJ broadly_RB expending_VBG type_NN ._.
Wing_VBG scales.-Not_JJ characteristic_NN ._.
NEOCELLIA_NNP STEPHENSI_NNP ._.
Adult_NNP characters.-A_JJ medium_NN sized_VBN mosquito_RBR closely_RB resembling_VBG Nysso-_NNP myzomyia_NN rossi_NN in_IN general_JJ appearance_NN ._.
Head_NNP blackish_NN ,_, with_IN a_DT prominent_JJ frontal_JJ tuft_NN of_IN white_JJ hairs_NNS projecting_VBG forwards_NNS ._.
The_DT palpi_NN have_VBP three_CD white_JJ bands_NNS which_WDT in_IN the_DT male_NN are_VBP almost_RB indistinguishable_JJ from_IN those_DT of_IN Nysso-_NNP myzimyia_NN rossi_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT female_NN the_DT medium_NN white_JJ band_NN is_VBZ broad_JJ and_CC only_RB separated_VBD from_IN the_DT broad_JJ terminal_JJ white_JJ band_NN by_IN a_DT narrow_JJ band_NN of_IN black_JJ ;_: the_DT proximal_JJ white_JJ band_NN is_VBZ narrow_JJ ;_: and_CC there_EX are_VBP also_RB a_DT few_JJ scattered_JJ white_JJ scales_NNS among_IN the_DT black_JJ scales_NNS of_IN the_DT palpi_NN ,_, which_WDT give_VBP it_PRP a_DT somewhat_RB speckled_JJ appearance_NN ._.
The_DT proboscis_NN is_VBZ blackish_JJ brown_NN in_IN colour_NN with_IN a_DT whitish_JJ tip_NN ._.
The_DT wings_NNS are_VBP spotted_VBN with_IN black_JJ especially_RB along_IN the_DT costa_NN and_CC there_EX is_VBZ a_DT central_JJ ``_`` T_NNP ''_'' -shaped_VBD spot_NN with_IN a_DT small_JJ black_JJ spot_NN like_IN a_DT full-stop_JJ adjoining_NN it_PRP ._.
The_DT legs_NNS are_VBP thickly_RB speckled_VBN with_IN white_JJ scales_NNS and_CC there_EX are_VBP narrow_JJ white_JJ bands_NNS at_IN certain_JJ of_IN the_DT joints_NNS ._.
Examination_NN under_IN a_DT microscope_NN shows_VBZ the_DT thorax_NN to_TO be_VB thickly_RB covered_VBN with_IN broad_JJ white_JJ scales_NNS and_CC dark_JJ hairs_NNS ;_: the_DT ventral_JJ surface_NN of_IN the_DT last_JJ two_CD or_CC three_CD segments_NNS are_VBP also_RB covered_VBN with_IN scales_NNS ,_, but_CC there_EX are_VBP no_DT scale_JJ tufts_NNS ._.
?_. 64_CD Larval_JJ characters.-The_JJ frontal_JJ hairs_NN of_IN the_DT clypeus_NN of_IN the_DT larva_NN are_VBP very_RB slightly_RB branched_VBN ,_, the_DT branching_NN being_VBG sometimes_RB so_RB fine_JJ as_IN to_TO require_VB a_DT one-sixth_JJ objective_NN or_CC higher_JJR power_NN to_TO define_VB it_PRP ._.
The_DT palmate_NN hairs_NNS are_VBP present_JJ on_IN the_DT first_JJ to_TO the_DT seventh_JJ abdominal_JJ segments_NNS ;_: the_DT leaflets_NNS are_VBP usually_RB pigmented_VBN and_CC broken-looking_NN at_IN the_DT shoulder_NN and_CC the_DT terminal_JJ filament_NN is_VBZ comparatively_RB short_JJ ._.
Ovum.-The_JJ ova_NNS are_VBP boat-shaped_JJ ,_, but_CC the_DT upper_JJ surface_NN is_VBZ considerably_RB contracted_VBN owing_VBG to_TO the_DT striated_VBN scallop-shell_NN shaped_NN floats_NNS which_WDT almost_RB meet_NN in_IN the_DT centre_NN ._.
146_CD ._.
MYZORHYNCHUS_NNP ._.
Generic_JJ characters_NNS ._.
Abdomen.-The_JJ dorsal_NN surface_NN with_IN hairs_NNS only_RB ._.
The_DT ventral_JJ surface_NN with_IN a_DT tuft_NN of_IN scales_NNS projecting_VBG vertically_RB downwards_NNS from_IN the_DT apex_NN of_IN the_DT seventh_JJ segment_NN in_IN the_DT mid_JJ line_NN ._.
Thoras.-With_NNP sharp_JJ pointed_VBD very_RB narrow_JJ ,_, curved_JJ scales_NNS as_IN in_IN the_DT genus_NN Myzomyia_NNP ._.
Prothoracic_NNP lobes.-With_NN a_DT dense_NN tuft_NN of_IN broad_JJ scales_NNS ._.
Upright_NNP forked_VBD cephalic_JJ scales.-Very_JJ broadly_RB expending_VBG ._.
Wing_VBG scales.-Not_JJ characteristic_NN ._.
MYZORHYNCHUS_NNP BARBIROSTRIS_NNP ._.
Adult_NNP characters.-This_NN is_VBZ a_DT very_RB large_JJ mosquito_NN ,_, easily_RB recognized_VBN by_IN its_PRP$ deep_JJ blackish_JJ colour_NN and_CC thick_NN unbanded_JJ palpi_NN ._.
Beyond_IN a_DT frontal_JJ tuft_NN of_IN whitish_JJ hairs_NNS ,_, and_CC a_DT few_JJ white_JJ scales_NNS on_IN the_DT occiput_NN and_CC on_IN the_DT wings_NNS the_DT entire_JJ mosquito_NN is_VBZ a_DT deep_JJ brown_NN or_CC black_JJ colour_NN ._.
The_DT legs_NNS are_VBP dark_JJ brown_IN with_IN lighter_JJ patches_NNS at_IN the_DT joints_NNS ._.
On_IN examination_NN with_IN a_DT miscroscope_NN the_DT head_NN is_VBZ seen_VBN to_TO be_VB covered_VBN with_IN black_JJ broadly_RB expanding_VBG upright_JJ forked_JJ scales_NNS ;_: the_DT thorax_NN is_VBZ covered_VBN with_IN very_RB narrow_JJ curved_VBD hair-like_JJ brown_NN or_CC blackish_JJ scales_NNS ;_: and_CC the_DT abdomen_NNS has_VBZ many_JJ black_JJ hairs_NNS on_IN its_PRP$ dorsal_NN surface_NN and_CC possesses_VBZ a_DT tuft_NN of_IN black_JJ scales_NNS on_IN its_PRP$ ventral_JJ surface_NN projecting_VBG downwards_NNS from_IN the_DT apex_NN of_IN the_DT seventh_JJ segment_NN in_IN the_DT mid_JJ line_NN ._.
The_DT scales_NNS forming_VBG the_DT wing-fringe_NN :_: are_VBP mostly_RB black_JJ ,_, but_CC there_EX is_VBZ a_DT light_JJ area_NN at_IN the_DT apex_NN of_IN the_DT wings_NNS and_CC another_DT somewhat_RB below_IN at_IN the_DT apex_NN of_IN the_DT posterior_JJ branch_NN of_IN the_DT fifth_JJ longitudinal_JJ vein_NN ._.
Larval_JJ characters.-The_JJ larva_NNS are_VBP usually_RB black_JJ or_CC brown_VBN in_IN colour_NN ,_, but_CC generally_RB show_VBP two_CD whitish_JJ bands_NNS on_IN the_DT upper_JJ surface_NN of_IN the_DT abdomen_NNS ._.
The_DT abdominal_JJ segments_NNS do_VBP not_RB taper_VB so_RB rapidly_RB as_IN in_IN the_DT larva_NN of_IN many_JJ other_JJ species_NNS and_CC in_IN young_JJ larvae_VBP the_DT absence_NN of_IN tapering_NN is_VBZ so_RB marked_JJ ,_, as_IN to_TO give_VB them_PRP almost_RB the_DT appearance_NN of_IN equal_JJ width_NN from_IN thorax_NN to_TO tail_VB ._.
The_DT irontal_JJ hairs_NNS are_VBP peculiar_JJ ,_, the_DT inner_JJ hairs_NNS being_VBG usually_RB long_RB ,_, simple_JJ and_CC unbranched_JJ and_CC often_RB crossed_VBD over_RP one_CD another_DT at_IN the_DT tip_NN ._.
The_DT external_JJ frontal_JJ hairs_NNS are_VBP thickly_RB branched_VBN and_CC resemble_JJ cockades_NNS ._.
The_DT antennae_JJ bear_NN a_DT large_JJ branched_JJ hair_NN on_IN their_PRP$ inner_JJ aspect_NN ._.
Ovum.-The_JJ upper_JJ surface_NN is_VBZ very_RB narrow_JJ ,_, the_DT floats_NNS do_VBP not_RB touch_VB the_DT margin_NN of_IN the_DT upper_JJ surface_NN ._.
The_DT lower_JJR surface_NN is_VBZ ornamented_VBN with_IN polygonal_JJ markings_NNS ._.
Viewed_VBN laterally_RB the_DT pointed_JJ extremities_NNS of_IN the_DT upper_JJ surface_NN are_VBP seen_VBN to_TO be_VB turned_VBN up_RP ._.
147_CD ._.
NYSSORHYNCHUS_NNP ._.
Generic_JJ characters_NNS ._.
Abdomen.-The_JJ dorsal_NN and_CC ventral_JJ surfaces_NNS of_IN the_DT last_JJ three_CD or_CC two_CD segments_NNS carry_VBP scales_NNS which_WDT are_VBP not_RB aggregated_VBN to_TO form_VB tufts_NNS ._.
Thorax.-With_NNP short_JJ ,_, broad_JJ true_JJ scales_NNS ._.
Protheracic_NNP lobes.-Without_NN a_DT tuft_NN of_IN scales_NNS ._.
Upright_NNP forked_VBD cephalic_JJ scales.-Of_JJ the_DT usual_JJ broadly_RB expending_VBG type_NN ._.
Wing_VBG scales.-Not_JJ characteristic_NN ._.
?_. 65_CD NYSSORHYNCHUS_NNP JAMESI_NNP ._.
Adult_NNP characters.-This_NN is_VBZ rather_RB a_DT small_JJ mosquito_NN ._.
Usually_RB it_PRP is_VBZ rather_RB blackish_JJ in_IN colour_NN ,_, but_CC it_PRP may_MD sometimes_RB be_VB found_VBN of_IN a_DT lighter_NN grey_NN or_CC brown_JJ appearance_NN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ a_DT pecular_JJ habit_NN when_WRB at_IN rest_NN of_IN waving_VBG its_PRP$ white_JJ tipped_VBN hind_NN legs_NN about_IN in_IN the_DT air_NN ._.
It_PRP possesses_VBZ three_CD rather_RB narrow_JJ white_JJ bands_NNS on_IN its_PRP$ palpi_NN ,_, the_DT terminal_JJ one_CD being_VBG the_DT widest_JJS ._.
The_DT dorsal_NN aspect_NN of_IN the_DT thorax_NN is_VBZ grey_JJ owing_VBG to_TO the_DT presence_NN of_IN white_JJ scales_NNS ,_, the_DT lateral_JJ and_CC ventral_JJ aspects_NNS are_VBP dark_JJ ._.
The_DT abdomen_NNS is_VBZ dark_JJ in_IN colour_NN ._.
The_DT wings_NNS are_VBP spotted_VBN with_IN black_JJ and_CC white_JJ and_CC the_DT legs_NNS are_VBP thickly_RB speckled_VBN with_IN white_JJ except_IN the_DT last_JJ three_CD segments_NNS of_IN the_DT hind_NN tarsi_NN which_WDT are_VBP snowwhite_JJ ._.
Examination_NN with_IN a_DT microscope_NN shows_VBZ numerous_JJ short_JJ broad_JJ white_JJ scales_NNS and_CC dark_JJ hairs_NNS on_IN the_DT thorax_NN ,_, and_CC dark_JJ scales_NNS on_IN the_DT last_JJ two_CD or_CC three_CD segments_NNS of_IN the_DT abdomen_NNS ._.
The_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT abdo-_JJ men_NNS is_VBZ covered_VBN with_IN brown_JJ hairs_NNS ._.
The_DT characteristic_JJ markings_NNS are_VBP the_DT speckling_NN of_IN the_DT legs_NNS and_CC the_DT white_JJ hind_NN tarsi_NN ._.
Larval_JJ characters.-The_JJ larv_NNS are_VBP usually_RB of_IN a_DT reddish_JJ brown_IN colour_NN and_CC present_JJ rather_RB a_DT hairy_JJ appearance_NN ._.
The_DT frontal_JJ hairs_NN possess_NN numerous_JJ lateral_JJ branches_NNS ._.
The_DT palmate_NN hairs_NNS are_VBP large_JJ and_CC are_VBP present_JJ on_IN the_DT second_JJ to_TO the_DT seventh_JJ abdominal_JJ segments_NNS ;_: the_DT terminal_JJ filament_NN is_VBZ rather_RB short_JJ ._.
Ovum.-The_JJ upper_JJ surface_NN is_VBZ rather_RB narrow_JJ ._.
The_DT floats_NNS are_VBP rather_RB short_JJ and_CC oval_JJ and_CC are_VBP placed_VBN far_RB forwards_NNS ,_, the_DT fringe_NN is_VBZ fairly_RB developed_VBN but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB continued_VBN over_IN the_DT floats_NNS ._.
148_CD ._.
Nyssorhynchus_RB Fuliginosus_NNP ._.
This_DT mosquito_NN ,_, which_WDT has_VBZ only_RB once_RB been_VBN found_VBN in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, resembles_VBZ Nyssor-_NNP hynchus_NN jamesi_NN very_RB closely_RB ,_, the_DT only_JJ marked_VBD difference_NN being_VBG in_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN its_PRP$ legs_NNS are_VBP not_RB speckled_VBN with_IN white_JJ as_IN are_VBP those_DT of_IN Nyssorhynchus_NNP jamesi_NN ._.
In_IN every_DT other_JJ particular_JJ it_PRP is_VBZ the_DT same_JJ ;_: and_CC the_DT larvae_NN and_CC ova_NN also_RB are_VBP almost_RB identical_JJ with_IN those_DT of_IN Nyssorhynchus_NNP jamesi_NN ._.

MYZOMYIA_NNP ._.
Generic_JJ characters_NNS ._.
Abdomen.-Only_RB the_DT last_JJ segment_NN carries_VBZ scales_NNS ._.
Thorax.-With_JJ hairs_NNS and_CC sharp-pointed_JJ curve_NN scales_NNS ._.
Prothoracic_NNP lobes_NNS ,_, -With_VBP a_DT conspicuous_JJ tuft_NN of_IN true_JJ scales_NNS ._.
Upright_NNP forked_VBD cephalic_JJ scales.-Of_JJ the_DT usual_JJ type_NN but_CC forming_VBG tufts_NNS at_IN the_DT postero-lateral_JJ angles_NNS ._.
Wing_VBG scales.-Not_JJ characteristic_NN ._.
Myzomyia_NNP Listoni_NNP ._.
Adult_NNP characters.-This_NN is_VBZ an_DT exceedingly_RB small_JJ mosquito_NN of_IN very_RB fragile_JJ appearance_NN ,_, with_IN very_RB delicate_JJ slender_NN legs_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ usually_RB of_IN a_DT dark_JJ grey_NN or_CC blackish_VB colour_NN with_IN wings_NNS spotted_VBN with_IN white_JJ ._.
The_DT palpi_NN have_VBP three_CD almost_RB equal_JJ white_JJ bands_NNS ,_, the_DT outermost_NN extending_NN to_TO the_DT tip_NN ._.
The_DT proboscis_NN is_VBZ black_JJ with_IN a_DT yellowish_JJ tip_NN ._.
The_DT head_NN is_VBZ covered_VBN with_IN dark_JJ brown_NN and_CC white_JJ upright_JJ scales_NNS and_CC there_EX is_VBZ a_DT frontal_JJ tuft_NN of_IN hairs_NNS ._.
The_DT thorax_NN is_VBZ covered_VBN with_IN white_JJ scales_NNS on_IN a_DT dark_JJ ground_NN ._.
The_DT abdomen_NNS is_VBZ of_IN a_DT dark_JJ black_JJ colour_NN with_IN many_JJ yellowish_JJ hairs_NNS ._.
The_DT wing_NN costa_NN is_VBZ marked_VBN by_IN four_CD white_JJ areas_NNS ,_, the_DT smallest_JJS near_IN the_DT apex_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ generally_RB stated_VBN that_IN a_DT characteristic_JJ feature_NN of_IN the_DT wing_JJ markings_NNS of_IN Myzomyia_NNP listoni_NN is_VBZ the_DT white_JJ scaled_VBD 3rd_CD longitudinal_JJ vein_NN ;_: but_CC in_IN the_DT variety_NN present_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP this_DT vein_NN is_VBZ black_JJ scaled_JJ ,_, like_IN that_DT of_IN M._NNP culicifacies_NNS ._.
The_DT legs_NN are_VBP generally_RB dark_JJ ,_, almost_RB black_JJ in_IN colour_NN ,_, but_CC occasionally_RB slightly_RB paler_JJ areas_NNS are_VBP present_JJ near_IN the_DT joints_NNS ._.
Major_NNP S._NNP P._NNP James_NNP ,_, I.M.S._NNP ,_, has_VBZ mentioned_VBN as_IN characteristic_JJ features_NNS distinguishing_VBG M._NNP listoni_NN from_IN M._NNP culicifacies_VBZ the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT 1st_CD fork_NN cell_NN of_IN the_DT wing_NN is_VBZ more_JJR than_IN 11/2_CD times_NNS the_DT length_NN of_IN the_DT 2nd_CD fork_NN cell_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN there_EX are_VBP 5_CD pale_JJ areas_NNS on_IN the_DT wing_NN fringe_NN ._.
B_IN 136-17_JJ ?_. 66_CD Characters_NNPS of_IN the_DT larva.-The_JJ frontal_JJ hairs_NN of_IN the_DT larv_NN found_VBD in_IN Bombay_NNP possess_NN a_DT few_JJ fine_JJ lateral_JJ branches_NNS similar_JJ to_TO those_DT seen_VBN on_IN the_DT larv_NN of_IN N._NNP stephensi_NN ._.
Palmate_NNP hairs_NNS are_VBP present_JJ on_IN the_DT thorax_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN on_IN the_DT abdominal_JJ segments_NNS ;_: they_PRP are_VBP generally_RB large_JJ and_CC prominent_JJ ;_: the_DT leaflets_NNS are_VBP provided_VBN with_IN a_DT well_NN marked_VBN shoulder_NN which_WDT is_VBZ usually_RB serrated_VBN and_CC pigmented_VBN at_IN the_DT origin_NN of_IN the_DT terminal_JJ filament_NN ._.
The_DT terminal_JJ filament_NN is_VBZ short_JJ ._.
Ovum.-Upper_JJ surface_NN very_RB narrow_JJ ;_: floats_NNS do_VBP not_RB touch_VB margin_NN of_IN upper_JJ surface_NN ;_: lower_JJR surface_NN not_RB ornamented_VBN ._.
Myzomyia_NNP Culicifacies_NNP ._.
150_CD ._.
There_EX is_VBZ no_DT necessity_NN to_TO enter_VB into_IN a_DT detailed_JJ description_NN of_IN this_DT mosquito_NN which_WDT resembles_VBZ M._NNP listoni_JJ very_RB closely_RB ._.
The_DT specimens_NNS met_VBD with_IN in_IN Bombay_NNP have_VBP been_VBN usually_RB slightly_RB larger_JJR and_CC rather_RB paler_NN in_IN colour_NN than_IN M._NNP listoni_NN and_CC possess_VB a_DT marked_JJ culicine_NN attitude_NN when_WRB at_IN rest_NN ._.
Major_NNP S._NNP P._NNP James_NNP mentions_NNS as_IN a_DT characteristic_JJ distinction_NN between_IN this_DT mosquito_NN and_CC M._NNP listoni_NN ,_, the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT 1st_CD fork_NN cell_NN is_VBZ less_JJR than_IN 11/2_CD times_NNS the_DT length_NN of_IN the_DT 2nd_CD fork_NN cell_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT wing_NN fringe_NN has_VBZ 2_CD white_JJ areas_NNS instead_RB of_IN 5_CD ._.
Larv_NNP and_CC Ova.-The_NNP larv_NN and_CC ova_NN are_VBP indistinguishable_JJ from_IN those_DT of_IN M._NNP listoni_NN ._.
Section_NN 2_CD ._.
151_CD ._.
INFECTION_NN OF_IN MOSQUITOES.-In_NNP discussing_VBG the_DT mosquitoes_NNS of_IN Bombay_NNP in_IN relation_NN to_TO the_DT spread_NN of_IN malaria_NN the_DT vast_JJ bulk_NN of_IN the_DT insects_NNS that_WDT exist_VBP in_IN the_DT City_NNP may_MD be_VB at_IN once_RB passed_VBN over_IN ._.
Neither_CC the_DT ubiquitous_JJ Culex_NNP fatigans_NNS nor_CC the_DT annoying_NN Stegomyia_NNP are_VBP dangerous_JJ from_IN the_DT point_NN of_IN view_NN of_IN malaria_NN ,_, and_CC other_JJ mosquitoes_NNS which_WDT belong_VBP to_TO the_DT Culicine_NNP family_NN are_VBP non-_JJ carriers_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN likewise_NN ._.
152_CD ._.
Among_IN mosquitoes_NNS of_IN the_DT Anopheline_NNP family_NN (_( to_TO which_WDT the_DT carriers_NNS of_IN malaria_NNS alone_RB belong_RB )_) there_EX are_VBP ,_, as_IN has_VBZ already_RB been_VBN pointed_VBN out_RP ,_, 7_CD species_NNS present_JJ in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
By_IN far_RB the_DT most_RBS common_JJ species_NNS is_VBZ Nysso-myzomyia_JJ rossi_NN ._.
It_PRP abounds_VBZ everywhere_RB and_CC is_VBZ often_RB to_TO be_VB found_VBN in_IN extraordinary_JJ numbers_NNS ;_: and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ a_DT matter_NN of_IN some_DT importance_NN to_TO learn_VB whether_IN or_CC not_RB it_PRP is_VBZ concerned_VBN in_IN the_DT transmission_NN of_IN malaria_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
153_CD ._.
A_DT large_JJ amount_NN of_IN evidence_NN has_VBZ been_VBN collected_VBN from_IN time_NN to_TO time_NN which_WDT appears_VBZ to_TO show_VB that_IN N._NNP rossi_NN is_VBZ not_RB concerned_VBN in_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN malaria_NN in_IN India_NNP ._.
In_IN 1901_CD Stephens_NNP and_CC Christophers_NNP ,_, the_DT members_NNS of_IN the_DT Royal_NNP Society_NNP 's_POS Commission_NNP on_IN Malaria_NNP ,_, examined_VBD very_RB large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN N._NNP rossi_NN caught_NN in_IN dwelling-houses_NNS in_IN Calcutta_NNP ,_, Mian_NNP Mir_NNP ,_, Ennur_NNP and_CC the_DT Bengal_NNP Duars_NNP without_IN finding_VBG a_DT single_JJ infected_JJ insect_NN ._.
They_PRP record_VBP the_DT dissection_NN of_IN 1,189_CD specimens_NNS ,_, 860_CD of_IN which_WDT were_VBD caught_VBN at_IN Mian_JJ Mir_NNP and_CC Ennur_NNP ,_, at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN and_CC in_IN the_DT same_JJ places_NNS as_IN smaller_JJR numbers_NNS of_IN M._NNP culicifacies_NNS ._.
In_IN both_DT stations_NNS malarial_VBP parasites_NNS were_VBD uniformly_JJ absent_NN from_IN rossi_JJ whereas_NNS in_IN specimens_NNS of_IN M._NNP culifacies_NNS ,_, sporozoits_NNS of_IN malaria_NNS were_VBD present_JJ to_TO the_DT extent_NN of_IN 4.6_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
and_CC 8.6_CD per_IN cent._NN ,_, respectively_RB ._.
154_CD ._.
But_CC although_IN these_DT observations_NNS of_IN Stephens_NNP and_CC Christophers_NNPS are_VBP almost_RB conclusive_JJ ,_, it_PRP was_VBD felt_VBN that_IN it_PRP would_MD be_VB wise_JJ to_TO make_VB absolutely_RB sure_JJ that_IN rossi_NN did_VBD not_RB behave_VB in_IN a_DT different_JJ manner_NN under_IN conditions_NNS present_VBP in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, and_CC this_DT point_NN was_VBD investigated_VBN early_RB in_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN the_DT enquiry_NN ._.
In_IN 1908_CD Major_NNP W._NNP Glen_NNP Liston_NNP ,_, I._NNP M._NNP S._NNP ,_, caught_VBD a_DT number_NN of_IN adult_NN mosquitoes_NNS in_IN dwelling-houses_NNS while_IN investigating_VBG malaria_NN near_IN the_DT New_NNP Docks_NNP in_IN the_DT Frere_NNP Road_NNP ._.
Among_IN those_DT mosquitoes_NNS two_CD species_NNS of_IN anopheles_NNS were_VBD present_JJ ,_, Nysso-myzomyia_JJ rossi_NN and_CC N._NNP stephensi_NN ;_: and_CC examination_NN of_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN the_DT latter_NN resulted_VBD in_IN the_DT important_JJ discovery_NN that_IN they_PRP were_VBD infected_VBN with_IN malarial_JJ parasites_NNS in_IN as_RB high_JJ a_DT proportion_NN as_IN 25_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN this_DT fact_NN the_DT same_JJ locality_NN was_VBD chosen_VBN as_IN a_DT suitable_JJ place_NN from_IN which_WDT to_TO obtain_VB mosquitoes_NNS for_IN systematic_JJ examination_NN ,_, and_CC during_IN the_DT investigation_NN adult_NN mosquitoes_NNS were_VBD caught_VBN there_RB at_IN frequent_JJ intervals_NNS ._.
With_IN few_JJ exceptions_NNS these_DT mosquitoes_NNS when_WRB caught_NN were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB full_JJ of_IN blood_NN ,_, presumably_RB derived_VBN from_IN the_DT inmates_NNS of_IN the_DT houses_NNS in_IN which_WDT they_PRP were_VBD found_VBN ._.
Among_IN these_DT inmates_NNS were_VBD many_JJ children_NNS who_WP showed_VBD a_DT spleen_JJ index_NN of_IN 70_CD to_TO 80_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
and_CC a_DT parasite_JJ 67_CD index_NN of_IN about_IN 40_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
As_IN it_PRP was_VBD considered_VBN advisable_JJ to_TO examine_VB both_DT the_DT stomach_NN and_CC salivary_JJ glands_NNS of_IN the_DT mosquitoes_NNS ,_, in_IN order_NN to_TO determine_VB the_DT presence_NN or_CC absence_NN of_IN both_CC the_DT zygote_NN and_CC sporozoit_JJ stage_NN of_IN the_DT malaria_NN parasite_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD necessary_JJ to_TO keep_VB them_PRP for_IN a_DT time_NN until_IN their_PRP$ stomachs_NNS became_VBD empty_JJ ._.
155_CD ._.
A_DT total_NN of_IN 4,235_CD dissections_NNS of_IN mosquitoes_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP during_IN the_DT investigation_NN ,_, about_IN 2,050_CD of_IN which_WDT were_VBD for_IN the_DT purpose_NN of_IN examining_VBG the_DT salivary_JJ glands_NNS and_CC the_DT remainder_NN for_IN the_DT examination_NN of_IN the_DT stomach_NN or_CC midgut_NN ._.
Of_IN the_DT mosquitoes_NNS examined_VBD the_DT great_JJ majority_NN were_VBD specimens_NNS of_IN Nysso-myzomyia_NNP rossi_NN and_CC N._NNP stephensi_NN ._.
The_DT examination_NN of_IN 925_CD stomachs_NNS and_CC 806_CD salivary_JJ glands_NNS of_IN Nysso-_NNP myzomyia_NNP rossi_NN gave_VBD entirely_RB negative_JJ results_NNS ;_: whereas_VBZ the_DT examination_NN of_IN adult_NN Neocellia_NNP stephensi_NN showed_VBD among_IN 1,228_CD stomachs_NNS ,_, 91_CD or_CC 7.4_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
infected_VBN with_IN zygotes_NNS of_IN malaria_NN ,_, and_CC of_IN 1,217_CD salivary_JJ glands_NNS 30_CD or_CC 2.4_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
with_IN sporozoits_NNS ._.
156_CD ._.
A_DT few_JJ feeding_NN experiments_NNS carried_VBD out_RP with_IN these_DT two_CD species_NNS of_IN anopheles_NNS gave_VBD similar_JJ results_NNS ._.
Of_IN 51_CD rossi_NN fed_VBN upon_IN cases_NNS of_IN malaria_NN harbouring_VBG crescent_JJ infections_NNS none_NN showed_VBD zygote_NNP development_NN ,_, whereas_VBP among_IN 24_CD stephensi_NNS two_CD developed_JJ zygotes_NNS in_IN the_DT midgut_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT examination_NN of_IN mosquitoes_NNS at_IN certain_JJ seasons_NNS of_IN the_DT year_NN the_DT infections_NNS met_VBD with_IN among_IN N._NNP stephensi_NNS were_VBD very_RB numerous_JJ ._.
In_IN July_NNP 1910_CD ,_, 10_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
harboured_VBN sporozoits_NNS and_CC in_IN August_NNP ,_, 18_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
were_VBD found_VBN to_TO contain_VB zygotes_NNS ;_: but_CC among_IN large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN rossi_NN caught_VBN in_IN the_DT same_JJ houses_NNS at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN ,_, none_NN showed_VBD a_DT sign_NN of_IN infection_NN ._.
These_DT observations_NNS are_VBP most_RBS important_JJ as_IN they_PRP appear_VBP to_TO prove_VB conclusively_RB that_IN Nysso-myzomyia_NNP rossi_NN is_VBZ not_RB concerned_VBN in_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN malaria_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
157_CD ._.
The_DT only_JJ mosquitoes_NNS that_WDT were_VBD found_VBN infected_VBN with_IN malaria_NN during_IN the_DT investigation_NN belonged_VBD to_TO the_DT species_NNS N._NNP stephensi_NN ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB remarked_VBN that_IN laboratory_NN experiments_NNS conducted_VBN by_IN Stephens_NNP and_CC Christophers_NNP with_IN N._NNP stephensi_NN as_IN long_RB ago_RB as_IN 1901_CD showed_VBD that_IN malarial_JJ parasites_NNS could_MD complete_VB their_PRP$ development_NN in_IN the_DT stomach_NN and_CC pass_NN to_TO the_DT salivary_JJ glands_NNS of_IN this_DT mosquito_NN ._.
This_DT observation_NN was_VBD not_RB confirmed_VBN by_IN the_DT finding_NN of_IN naturally_RB infected_VBN insects_NNS until_IN 1908_CD when_WRB Major_NNP Liston_NNP ,_, I._NNP M._NNP S._NNP ,_, investigated_VBD the_DT question_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
But_CC although_IN the_DT dangerous_JJ nature_NN of_IN N._NNP stephensi_NN was_VBD not_RB definitely_RB proved_VBN until_IN 1908_CD there_EX is_VBZ not_RB the_DT least_JJS doubt_NN that_IN it_PRP had_VBD been_VBN spreading_VBG malaria_NN for_IN many_JJ years_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP City_NNP ,_, and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ a_DT mistake_NN to_TO suppose_VB it_PRP has_VBZ only_RB recently_RB become_VB a_DT carrier_NN of_IN malaria_NN ._.
158_CD ._.
In_IN addition_NN to_TO N._NNP stephensi_NN three_CD other_JJ species_NNS among_IN the_DT anopheles_NNS mosquitoes_NNS of_IN Bombay_NNP have_VBP been_VBN shown_VBN to_TO be_VB definitely_RB concerned_VBN in_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN malaria_NNS in_IN certain_JJ parts_NNS of_IN India_NNP ._.
They_PRP are-_VBP (_( 1_CD )_) M._NNP culicifacies_NNS ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) M._NNP listoni_NN ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) N._NNP fuliginosus_NN ._.
Investigation_NN has_VBZ not_RB as_IN yet_RB shown_VBN the_DT two_CD remaining_VBG Bombay_NNP anopheles_NNS to_TO be_VB natural_JJ carriers_NNS of_IN infection_NN ,_, and_CC although_IN both_DT N._NNP jamesi_NN and_CC M._NNP barbirostris_NNS have_VBP been_VBN infected_VBN experimentally_RB in_IN the_DT laboratory_NN there_EX are_VBP strong_JJ reasons_NNS for_IN supposing_VBG that_IN the_DT latter_NN at_IN all_DT events_NNS is_VBZ generally_RB innocous_JJ ._.
As_IN it_PRP was_VBD impossible_JJ to_TO catch_VB any_DT great_JJ number_NN of_IN adult_NN N._NNP jamesi_NN ,_, M._NNP barbirostris_NN ,_, M._NNP culicifacies_NNS and_CC M._NNP listoni_NN during_IN the_DT investigation_NN ,_, only_RB a_DT very_RB few_JJ could_MD be_VB dissected_VBN ,_, and_CC the_DT negative_JJ results_NNS obtained_VBN are_VBP inconclusive_JJ ,_, but_CC there_EX is_VBZ strong_JJ presumptive_JJ evidence_NN that_IN M._NNP barbirostris_NN is_VBZ not_RB a_DT common_JJ carrier_NN of_IN malaria_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, because_IN the_DT parts_NNS of_IN the_DT island_NN where_WRB it_PRP is_VBZ most_RBS numerous_JJ are_VBP almost_RB free_JJ of_IN malarial_JJ infection_NN ._.
159_CD ._.
The_DT observations_NNS upon_IN N._NNP stephensi_NN which_WDT have_VBP been_VBN carried_VBN out_RP regularly_RB since_IN July_NNP 1909_CD bring_NN to_TO light_JJ certain_JJ interesting_JJ facts_NNS regarding_VBG the_DT seasonal_JJ prevalence_NN of_IN malarial_JJ infection_NN among_IN mosquitoes_NNS ._.
This_DT is_VBZ of_IN some_DT importance_NN as_IN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT direct_JJ relation_NN between_IN the_DT existence_NN of_IN malaria-infected_JJ mosquitoes_NNS and_CC the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN fresh_JJ infections_NNS in_IN man_NN ._.

?_. 69_CD Infected_VBD anopheles_NNS were_VBD not_RB met_VBN with_IN before_IN the_DT middle_NN of_IN July_NNP either_CC in_IN 1909_CD or_CC 1910_CD ;_: in_IN the_DT dry_JJ weather_NN of_IN 1909-1910_JJ 156_CD stomachs_NNS and_CC 83_CD sali-_JJ vary_JJ glands_NNS of_IN N._NNP stephensi_NN examined_VBD consecutively_RB gave_VBD negative_JJ results_NNS ;_: in_IN February_NNP and_CC March_NNP 1911_CD ,_, 238_CD stomachs_NN showed_VBD only_RB one_CD infection_NN ;_: and_CC the_DT same_JJ number_NN of_IN salivary_JJ glands_NNS were_VBD examined_VBN without_IN the_DT finding_NN of_IN sporozoits_NNS ._.
160_CD ._.
The_DT relation_NN of_IN Anopheline_NNP infection_NN to_TO weather_NN was_VBD noted_VBN in_IN 1910_CD ._.
In_IN July_NNP of_IN that_DT year_NN a_DT sudden_JJ break_NN occurred_VBD in_IN the_DT rains_NNS ,_, only_RB 179_CD inches_NNS of_IN rain_NN falling_VBG during_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN three_CD weeks_NNS ,_, and_CC there_RB being_VBG only_RB three_CD days_NNS during_IN this_DT period_NN on_IN which_WDT the_DT rainfall_NN was_VBD 0.25_CD inches_NNS or_CC more_JJR ._.
The_DT weather_NN during_IN this_DT period_NN was_VBD bright_JJ and_CC sunny_JJ ,_, the_DT temperature_NN rose_VBD slightly_RB and_CC the_DT atmospheric_JJ humidity_NN remained_VBD very_RB high_JJ ._.
At_IN this_DT time_NN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN N._NNP stephensi_NN became_VBD infected_JJ with_IN malaria_NNS and_CC the_DT infections_NNS reached_VBD maturity_NN very_RB rapidly_RB as_IN shown_VBN by_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN 11.4_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN those_DT examined_VBN showed_VBD zygotes_NNS in_IN their_PRP$ stomachs_NNS and_CC 10_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
had_VBD sporozoits_NNS in_IN their_PRP$ salivary_JJ glands_NNS ._.
A_DT little_JJ later_RB ,_, during_IN the_DT first_JJ half_NN of_IN August_NNP ,_, the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN almost_RB unbroken_JJ rain_NN appeared_VBD to_TO reduce_VB the_DT proportion_NN of_IN sporozoit-_JJ carrying_VBG anopheles_NNS considerably_RB and_CC though_IN 18.6_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN those_DT examined_VBN had_VBD zygotes_NNS in_IN their_PRP$ midgut_NN only_RB 5_CD out_IN of_IN 158_CD or_CC 3.1_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
showed_VBD sporozoits_NNS in_IN their_PRP$ salivary_JJ glands_NNS ._.
Section_NN 3_CD ._.
161_CD ._.
MOSQUITO_NNP LARV.-Since_NNP the_DT commencement_NN of_IN the_DT enquiry_NN about_IN 20,000_CD collections_NNS of_IN water_NN of_IN all_DT kinds_NNS in_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT island_NN ,_, have_VBP been_VBN examined_VBN for_IN mosquito_NN larv_NN ,_, including_VBG about_IN 5,000_CD wells_NNS ,_, nearly_RB 5,000_CD cisterns_NNS ,_, 2,386_CD small_JJ masonry_NN tanks_NNS in_IN gardens_NNS and_CC compounds_NNS and_CC 215_CD large_JJ tanks_NNS ,_, 551_CD public_JJ and_CC private_JJ fountains_NNS ,_, 3,500_CD tubs_NN ,_, barrels_NNS and_CC buckets_NNS ,_, many_JJ hundreds_NNS of_IN large_JJ and_CC small_JJ pools_NNS and_CC many_JJ minor_JJ collections_NNS of_IN water_NN in_IN tubs_NN ,_, troughs_NNS ,_, tin-pots_NNS and_CC hollows_NNS in_IN old_JJ machinery_NN ,_, etc_FW ._.
In_IN a_DT large_JJ proportion_NN of_IN these_DT potential_JJ breeding_NN places_NNS larv_NN of_IN different_JJ species_NNS of_IN Culex_NNP have_VBP been_VBN met_VBN with_IN and_CC N.-M._NNP rossi_NN has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN breeding_VBG in_IN very_RB many_JJ of_IN them_PRP ._.
162_CD ._.
Method_NNP of_IN examining_VBG breeding_NN places_NNS for_IN Mosquito_NNP Larv.-Early_NNP in_IN the_DT enquiry_NN it_PRP became_VBD apparent_JJ that_IN many_JJ of_IN the_DT collections_NNS of_IN water_NN used_VBN as_IN breeding_VBG place_NN by_IN the_DT mosquitoes_NNS of_IN Bombay_NNP were_VBD of_IN such_JJ a_DT nature_NN that_IN it_PRP was_VBD not_RB possible_JJ to_TO examine_VB them_PRP properly_RB by_IN means_NNS of_IN ordinary_JJ dippers_NNS ._.
In_IN Bombay_NNP wells_NNS form_JJ common_JJ breeding_VBG place_NN of_IN anopheles_NNS mosquitoes_NNS and_CC in_IN the_DT vast_JJ majority_NN of_IN cases_NNS the_DT surface_NN of_IN the_DT water_NN can_MD only_RB be_VB reached_VBN with_IN difficulty_NN ;_: and_CC although_IN it_PRP is_VBZ sometimes_RB possible_JJ to_TO dip_VB larv_FW out_IN of_IN a_DT well_NN by_IN means_NNS of_IN a_DT bucket_NN and_CC rope_NN ,_, this_DT is_VBZ by_IN no_DT means_NNS a_DT certain_JJ method_NN of_IN examination_NN ._.
On_IN some_DT occasions_NNS as_RB many_JJ as_IN twenty_JJ buckets_NNS of_IN water_NN have_VBP been_VBN removed_VBN from_IN a_DT well_RB known_VBN to_TO contain_VB larv_NN without_IN one_CD being_VBG found_VBN in_IN this_DT way_NN ._.
163_CD ._.
To_TO meet_VB the_DT difficulty_NN of_IN examining_VBG wells_NNS a_DT special_JJ form_NN of_IN apparatus_NN was_VBD devised_VBN early_RB in_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN the_DT investigation_NN ,_, a_DT brief_JJ description_NN of_IN which_WDT is_VBZ as_IN follows_VBZ ._.
A_DT loop_NN about_IN 15_CD to_TO 18_CD inches_NNS in_IN diameter_NN is_VBZ made_VBN of_IN very_RB thick_JJ brass_NN or_CC galvanized_VBN iron_NN wire_NN ,_, and_CC upon_IN this_DT frame_NN a_DT shallow_JJ net_NN of_IN very_RB thin_JJ mull-mull_NN or_CC muslin_NN is_VBZ stretched_VBN ._.
The_DT net_NN is_VBZ suspended_VBN by_IN three_CD short_JJ brass_NN chains_NNS about_IN 2_CD feet_NNS long_RB ,_, which_WDT are_VBP attached_VBN to_TO the_DT frame_NN below_IN and_CC to_TO a_DT small_JJ ring_NN above_IN ._.
To_TO the_DT ring_VBG a_DT rope_NN is_VBZ tied_VBN and_CC the_DT net_JJ can_MD then_RB be_VB lowered_VBN to_TO any_DT required_JJ depth_NN ._.
When_WRB a_DT well_RB has_VBZ to_TO be_VB examined_VBN the_DT net_NN is_VBZ lowered_VBN to_TO about_IN a_DT foot_NN beneath_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN the_DT water_NN ,_, the_DT weight_NN of_IN the_DT frame_NN causing_VBG it_PRP to_TO sink_VB ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ then_RB gently_RB moved_VBN below_IN the_DT surface_NN and_CC pulled_VBD up_RP at_IN a_DT point_NN some_DT distanc_NN s_NN from_IN where_WRB it_PRP first_RB entered_VBD the_DT water_NN ._.
On_IN examining_VBG the_DT net_JJ larv_NN ,_, if_IN plentiful_JJ ,_, are_VBP easily_RB seen_VBN and_CC can_MD be_VB secured_VBN by_IN washing_VBG them_PRP off_RP into_IN bowl_NN of_IN clean_JJ water_NN ._.
If_IN larv_NNS are_VBP very_RB small_JJ or_CC scanty_NN in_IN number_NN they_PRP are_VBP not_RB easily_RB seen_VBN on_IN mere_JJ inspection_NN of_IN the_DT net_JJ but_CC by_IN inverting_VBG it_PRP into_IN a_DT shallow_JJ white_JJ enamelled_JJ vessel_NN of_IN water_NN they_PRP can_MD be_VB washed_VBN off_RB and_CC easily_RB detected_VBN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN useful_JJ to_TO adopt_VB this_DT washing_NN of_IN the_DT inverted_JJ net_NN as_IN a_DT routine_JJ method_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN that_IN a_DT large-sized_JJ white_JJ enamelled_VBD frying_NN pan_NN is_VBZ a_DT useful_JJ vessel_NN in_IN which_WDT to_TO invert_VB the_DT net_JJ and_CC wash_VBZ its_PRP$ surface_NN ._.
The_DT value_NN of_IN the_DT net_JJ method_NN for_IN examining_VBG wells_NNS is_VBZ shown_VBN by_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN in_IN certain_JJ areas_NNS double_VBP the_DT number_NN were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB infested_VBN with_IN larv_NN of_IN Neocellia_NNP stephensi_NN ,_, than_IN had_VBD been_VBN supposed_VBN ,_, when_WRB examination_NN had_VBD been_VBN made_VBN by_IN means_NNS of_IN a_DT bucket_NN ._.
B_NNP 136_CD -_: 18_CD ?_. 70_CD 164_CD ._.
For_IN examining_VBG cisterns_NNS and_CC tanks_NNS mull-mull_JJ nets_NNS on_IN longer_JJR or_CC shorter_JJR handles_NNS were_VBD found_VBN effective_JJ ._.
A_DT net_NN of_IN this_DT kind_NN can_MD be_VB introduced_VBN into_IN a_DT cistern_JJ and_CC swept_VBD rapidly_RB over_IN the_DT whole_JJ surface_NN of_IN the_DT water_NN and_CC on_IN removal_JJ quickly_RB inverted_VBN and_CC washed_VBN in_IN a_DT white_JJ enamelled_JJ vessel_NN of_IN water_NN ._.
Larv_NNP if_IN present_JJ are_VBP easily_RB detected_VBN in_IN this_DT way_NN ._.
By_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN a_DT net_JJ the_DT presence_NN of_IN larv_NN of_IN Neocellia_NNP stephensi_NN was_VBD demonstrated_VBN in_IN several_JJ hundreds_NNS of_IN cisterns_NNS which_WDT had_VBD previously_RB been_VBN examined_VBN by_IN means_NNS of_IN dippers_NNS and_CC declared_VBD to_TO be_VB quite_RB free_JJ of_IN mosquito_JJ larv_NN ;_: and_CC it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN possible_JJ to_TO show_VB the_DT presence_NN of_IN larv_NN in_IN the_DT Malabr_NNP Hill_NNP reservoir_VB where_WRB the_DT water_NN is_VBZ 18_CD feet_NNS deep_JJ and_CC absolutely_RB clear_JJ ,_, when_WRB previous_JJ examination_NN by_IN dippers_NNS had_VBD given_VBN uniformly_RB negative_JJ results_NNS ._.
Anopheline_NNP Larv_NNP ._.
165_CD ._.
During_IN the_DT investigation_NN larv_NN of_IN N._NNP stephensi_NN were_VBD met_VBN with_IN in_IN 1,693_CD different_JJ collections_NNS of_IN water_NN ;_: larv_NN of_IN M._NNP barbirostris_NN in_IN about_RB 500_CD places_NNS ;_: larv_NN of_IN N._NNP jamesi_NN in_IN nearly_RB 100_CD and_CC larv_JJR of_IN M._NNP culicifacies_NNS and_CC M_NNP ._.
