The_DT nature_NN of_IN the_DT breeding_NN places_NNS chosen_VBN by_IN Neocellia_NNP stephensi_NN is_VBZ shown_VBN below_IN ._.
Among_IN a_DT total_NN of_IN nearly_RB 1,700_CD collections_NNS of_IN water_NN harbouring_VBG the_DT larv_NN of_IN this_DT mosquito_VBZ the_DT various_JJ breeding_NN places_NNS were_VBD approximately_RB as_IN follows_VBZ :_: -_: Open_NNP wells_VBZ 65_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Open_JJ and_CC improperly_RB closed_VBD cisterns_NNS .._$ 10_CD Fountains_NNP 2_CD Masonry_NNP and_CC other_JJ tanks_NNS 4_CD Tubs_NNP ,_, barrels_NNS ,_, tin-pots_NNS and_CC minor_JJ collections_NNS of_IN water_NN .._$ 9_CD Pools_NNP of_IN water_NN 10_CD 168_CD ._.
These_DT breeding_VBG places_NNS may_MD be_VB divided_VBN into_IN two_CD classes_NNS :_: -_: (_( 1_CD )_) Permanent_NNP breeding_NN places_NNS ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) Temporary_NNP breeding_NN places_NNS ._.
The_DT permanent_JJ breeding_NN places_NNS which_WDT chiefly_VBP consist_NN of_IN open_JJ wells_NNS ,_, open_JJ and_CC improperly_RB closed_VBD cisterns_NNS ,_, fountains_NNS and_CC garden_NN and_CC other_JJ tanks_NNS ,_, are_VBP of_IN the_DT utmost_JJ importance_NN as_IN they_PRP enable_VBP the_DT mosquito_NN to_TO continue_VB breeding_VBG unchecked_JJ throughout_IN the_DT year_NN and_CC provide_VB the_DT source_NN from_IN which_WDT temporary_JJ breeding_NN places_NNS become_VBP infected_VBN from_IN time_NN to_TO time_NN ._.
Besides_IN the_DT ordinary_JJ permanent_JJ breeding_NN places_NNS there_EX are_VBP a_DT few_JJ special_JJ ones_NNS in_IN certain_JJ localities_NNS ._.
The_DT filter-beds_NNS and_CC reservoirs_NNS at_IN Malabr_NNP and_CC Bhandarwada_NNP Hills_NNP are_VBP prolific_JJ breeding_VBG grounds_NNS and_CC the_DT waste_NN water_NN and_CC leakage_NN from_IN these_DT water_NN works_VBZ also_RB form_VB small_JJ streamlets_NNS and_CC pools_NNS in_IN which_WDT the_DT mosquito_NN can_MD breed_VB all_PDT the_DT year_NN round_NN ._.
Certain_NNP places_NNS on_IN the_DT foreshore_NN in_IN Colaba_NNP and_CC Walkeshwar_NNP ,_, where_WRB pools_NNS of_IN brackish_JJ water_NN remain_VBP throughout_IN the_DT year_NN ,_, also_RB form_JJ permanent_JJ breeding_NN places_NNS from_IN which_WDT temporary_JJ pools_NNS created_VBN during_IN the_DT monsoon_NN subsequently_RB become_VBN infected_JJ ._.
169_CD ._.
Temporary_JJ breeding_NN places_NNS are_VBP usually_RB only_RB formed_VBD during_IN the_DT rainy_NN season_NN and_CC speedily_RB disappear_VBP after_IN the_DT commencement_NN of_IN the_DT dry_JJ weather_NN ._.
They_PRP consist_VBP chiefly_NN in_IN surface_NN pools_NNS of_IN water_NN which_WDT are_VBP formed_VBN after_IN heavy_JJ rains_NNS on_IN the_DT uneven_JJ surface_NN of_IN the_DT ground_NN in_IN large_JJ compounds_NNS such_JJ as_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT New_NNP Dock_NNP Works_NNP enclosure_NN ,_, the_DT Railway_NNP Yards_NNP and_CC many_JJ other_JJ places_NNS ,_, earas_VBZ No_NNP ._.
V_NNP NO_NNP :_: VI_NNP ?_. 71_CD in_IN which_WDT building_NN s_NNS have_VBP been_VBN demolished_VBN ,_, sites_VBZ upon_IN which_WDT building_NN operations_NNS are_VBP going_VBG on_IN and_CC many_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT foreshore_NN ._.
A_DT number_NN of_IN minor_JJ temporary_JJ breeding_NN places_NNS also_RB occur_VBP in_IN the_DT rainy_NN season_NN in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN tubs_NN ,_, buckets_NNS ,_, tin-_JJ pots_NNS and_CC in_IN hollows_NNS in_IN iron_NN machinery_NN and_CC masonry_NN ._.
In_IN areas_NNS containing_VBG many_JJ permanent_JJ breeding_VBG places_NNS of_IN Neocellia_NNP stephensi_NN ,_, garden_NN tubs_NNS and_CC barrels_NNS of_IN water_NN in_IN stables_NNS may_MD often_RB be_VB found_VBN harbouring_VBG larv_NN ,_, if_IN the_DT water_NN has_VBZ been_VBN allowed_VBN to_TO remain_VB unchanged_JJ for_IN a_DT time_NN ._.
170_CD ._.
More_JJR than_IN half_PDT the_DT wells_NNS in_IN A_DT ._.
Ward_NNP ;_: one-third_JJ of_IN those_DT in_IN C._NNP and_CC D._NNP Wards_NNP and_CC 10_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN those_DT in_IN B._NNP and_CC E._NNP Wards_NNP are_VBP infected_VBN with_IN Neocellia_NNP stephensi_NN ._.
Many_JJ of_IN the_DT wells_NNS in_IN A._NN ,_, B_NNP ,_, and_CC parts_NNS of_IN C._NNP Wards_NNP contained_VBD a_DT great_JJ number_NN \ill\_NNP larv_NN ,_, but_CC in_IN the_DT wells_NNS situated_VBN in_IN D._NNP and_CC E._NNP Wards_NNP and_CC the_DT north_NN of_IN C._NNP Ward_NNP larv_NN were_VBD usually_RB met_VBN with_IN in_IN comparatively_RB scanty_JJ numbers_NNS ._.
The_DT largest_JJS number_NN of_IN infected_JJ wells_NNS was_VBD met_VBN with_IN in_IN A._NN and_CC C._NNP Wards_NNP ._.
Many_JJ of_IN the_DT wells_NNS in_IN these_DT wards_NNS are_VBP inside_IN the_DT houses_NNS ,_, either_RB in_IN the_DT basement_NN or_CC situated_VBN under_IN the_DT central_JJ shaft_NN which_WDT often_RB passes_VBZ up_RP through_IN the_DT house_NN and_CC usually_RB contains_VBZ the_DT stairways_NNS and_CC landings_NNS on_IN each_DT floor_NN ._.
All_PDT these_DT house_NN wells_NNS are_VBP so_RB arranged_JJ that_IN tenants_NNS of_IN the_DT upper_JJ floors_NNS can_MD draw_VB water_NN ,_, without_IN descending_VBG to_TO the_DT mouth_NN of_IN the_DT well_NN ,_, by_IN letting_VBG down_RP a_DT vessel_NN with_IN a_DT rope_NN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN that_IN wells_NNS of_IN this_DT character_NN generally_RB harbour_VBZ a_DT far_RB greater_JJR number_NN of_IN larv_NN of_IN N._NNP stephensi_NN than_IN open_JJ wells_NNS in_IN gardens_NNS and_CC compounds_NNS ;_: and_CC even_RB when_WRB they_PRP appeared_VBD clean_JJ and_CC free_JJ from_IN floating_VBG matter_NN and_CC were_VBD in_IN constant_JJ use_NN numerous_JJ larv_NN were_VBD often_RB present_JJ ._.
Many_JJ of_IN the_DT wells_NNS in_IN D._NNP and_CC the_DT northern_JJ portion_NN of_IN C._NNP Ward_NNP are_VBP of_IN a_DT different_JJ character_NN ._.
They_PRP are_VBP not_RB house_NN wells_NNS but_CC are_VBP situated_VBN in_IN yards_NNS or_CC gardens_NNS and_CC owing_VBG possibly_RB to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT wells_NNS in_IN the_DT open_JJ usually_RB contain_VBP a_DT very_RB large_JJ amount_NN of_IN aquatic_JJ insect_JJ life_NN ,_, among_IN which_WDT there_EX are_VBP many_JJ natural_JJ enemies_NNS of_IN mosquito_NN larv_NN ,_, such_JJ larv_NN when_WRB present_NN were_VBD often_RB found_VBN in_IN very_RB scanty_JJ numbers_NNS ._.
171_CD ._.
Neocellia_NNP stephensi_NN is_VBZ essentially_RB a_DT domestic_JJ mosquito_NN ._.
It_PRP lives_VBZ and_CC breeds_NNS in_IN the_DT immediate_JJ neighbourhood_NN of_IN human_JJ dwellings_NNS and_CC adapts_NNS itself_PRP to_TO all_DT sorts_NNS of_IN artificial_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
In_IN particular_JJ its_PRP$ use_NN of_IN artificial_JJ collections_NNS of_IN water_NN for_IN breeding_VBG purposes_NNS shows_VBZ it_PRP to_TO possess_VB very_RB different_JJ habits_NNS to_TO the_DT species_NNS of_IN anopheles_NNS usually_RB associated_VBN with_IN the_DT dissemination_NN of_IN malaria_NN ,_, and_CC serves_VBZ to_TO mark_VB it_PRP out_RP as_IN especially_RB suited_VBN for_IN existence_NN in_IN towns_NNS ._.
It_PRP exercises_VBZ extraordinary_JJ ingenuity_NN in_IN its_PRP$ choice_NN of_IN breeding_VBG places_NNS ,_, its_PRP$ larv_NN being_VBG found_VBN in_IN wells_NNS 20_CD to_TO 30_CD feet_NNS or_CC more_JJR in_IN depth_NN and_CC in_IN cisterns_NNS on_IN the_DT roofs_NN of_IN houses_NNS as_RB much_RB as_IN 70_CD to_TO 100_CD feet_NNS above_IN the_DT ground_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ often_RB found_VBN in_IN dark_JJ wells_NNS in_IN the_DT basement_NN of_IN houses_NNS and_CC in_IN cisterns_NNS in_IN which_WDT the_DT cover_NN allows_VBZ only_RB the_DT narrowest_JJS of_IN openings_NNS by_IN which_WDT the_DT gravid_NN female_NN may_MD enter_VB and_CC the_DT newly_RB hatched_VBN swarm_NN pass_NN out_IN ._.
172_CD ._.
The_DT larv_NN are_VBP extraordinarily_RB sensitive_JJ to_TO danger_VB ._.
The_DT falling_VBG of_IN a_DT shadow_NN upon_IN them_PRP or_CC the_DT slightest_JJS disturbance_NN of_IN the_DT water_NN in_IN which_WDT are_VBP they_PRP breeding_VBG will_MD cause_VB them_PRP to_TO sink_VB rapidly_RB to_TO the_DT bottom_NN ,_, where_WRB they_PRP remain_VBP quiescent_JJ for_IN periods_NNS often_RB as_RB long_RB as_IN twenty_NN minutes_NNS or_CC more_JJR ._.
They_PRP breed_VBP readily_RB in_IN deep_JJ water_NN and_CC they_PRP may_MD often_RB be_VB found_VBN in_IN water_NN that_WDT is_VBZ quite_RB clear_JJ and_CC free_JJ from_IN weed_NN ._.
They_PRP have_VBP been_VBN discovered_VBN in_IN the_DT reservoir_NN at_IN Malabr_NNP Hill_NNP which_WDT has_VBZ a_DT depth_NN of_IN 18_CD feet_NNS ;_: and_CC many_JJ of_IN the_DT wells_NNS ,_, iron_NN cisterns_NNS and_CC masonry_NN tanks_NNS in_IN which_WDT they_PRP most_RBS commonly_RB breed_VBP usually_RB have_VBP a_DT depth_NN of_IN clear_JJ water_NN of_IN from_IN 3_CD to_TO 10_CD feet_NNS or_CC more_JJR ._.
In_IN spite_NN of_IN statements_NNS to_TO the_DT contrary_JJ they_PRP are_VBP frequently_RB to_TO be_VB met_VBN with_IN in_IN wells_NNS that_WDT are_VBP apparently_RB clean_JJ and_CC in_IN daily_JJ use_NN ._.
They_PRP breed_VBP in_IN salt_NN water_NN almost_RB as_RB readily_RB as_IN fresh_JJ ._.
Gravid_NNP female_NN Neocellia_NNP stephensi_NN will_MD deposit_VB their_PRP$ eggs_NNS upon_IN sea_NN water_NN and_CC larv_NN hatch_NN out_IN and_CC live_VB in_IN this_DT medium_NN ,_, but_CC those_DT that_WDT have_VBP been_VBN hatched_VBN in_IN fresh_JJ water_NN quickly_RB die_VBD when_WRB transferred_VBN to_TO salt_VB water_NN ._.
173_CD ._.
In_IN the_DT north_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN there_EX are_VBP many_JJ wells_NNS but_CC few_JJ or_CC none_NN of_IN them_PRP are_VBP inside_IN the_DT houses_NNS ._.
In_IN F._NNP and_CC G._NNP Wards_NNP among_IN 1,600_CD wells_NNS not_RB one_CD was_VBD found_VBN to_TO harbour_VB larv_NN of_IN Neocellia_NNP stephensi_FW though_IN a_DT few_JJ contained_JJ larv_NN of_IN Myzomyia_NNP listoni_NN or_CC Myzomyia_NNP culicifacies_NNS ._.

?_. 72_CD The_DT absence_NN of_IN N._NNP stephensi_NN from_IN the_DT north_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN is_VBZ probably_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT imperfect_JJ means_NNS of_IN communication_NN between_IN this_DT part_NN and_CC the_DT Fort_NNP ._.

174_CD ._.
The_DT larv_NN of_IN Mysorhynchus_NNP larbirostris_FW occurs_VBZ most_JJS commonly_RB in_IN F._NNP ,_, G._NNP and_CC E._NNP Wards_NNP ,_, but_CC it_PRP has_VBZ also_RB been_VBN met_VBN with_IN in_IN the_DT very_RB centre_NN of_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.

Culex_NNP Larv_NNP 175_CD ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ unnecessary_JJ to_TO enter_VB into_IN a_DT detailed_JJ description_NN of_IN the_DT Culicine_NNP mosquitoes_NNS of_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, but_CC a_DT few_JJ facts_NNS regarding_VBG the_DT species_NNS most_RBS commonly_RB met_VBN with_IN in_IN the_DT City_NNP are_VBP recorded_VBN below_IN ._.
Culex_NNP fatigans_NNS is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS common_JJ species_NNS of_IN mosquito_NN in_IN many_JJ parts_NNS of_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ found_VBN in_IN enormous_JJ numbers_NNS even_RB in_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT most_RBS densely_RB populated_JJ areas_NNS ;_: and_CC is_VBZ usually_RB most_RBS troublesome_JJ in_IN the_DT dry_JJ weather_NN and_CC shortly_RB after_IN the_DT close_NN of_IN the_DT monsoon_NN ._.
The_DT entrances_NNS of_IN the_DT storm-water_JJ drains_NNS with_IN their_PRP$ catch-pits_NNS form_VBP some_DT of_IN the_DT most_RBS prolific_JJ breeding_NN places_NNS for_IN this_DT mosquito_NN ;_: and_CC during_IN the_DT dry_JJ season_NN when_WRB a_DT small_JJ quantity_NN of_IN water_NN passes_NNS into_IN these_DT drains_NNS by_IN reason_NN of_IN the_DT watering_NN of_IN the_DT streets_NNS and_CC roads_NNS enormous_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN larv_NN may_MD be_VB found_VBN in_IN a_DT considerable_JJ proportion_NN of_IN these_DT catch-_JJ pits_NNS ._.
C_NNP ,_, fatigans_VBZ breeds_NNS most_RBS readily_RB in_IN foul_JJ water_NN ._.
Myriads_NNS of_IN larv_NN may_MD often_RB be_VB found_VBN in_IN stagnant_JJ pools_NNS of_IN brackish_JJ water_NN that_WDT occur_VBP on_IN the_DT foreshore_NN in_IN the_DT area_NN between_IN the_DT high_JJ and_CC low_JJ tide_NN line_NN ;_: and_CC they_PRP are_VBP especially_RB numerous_JJ in_IN such_JJ places_NNS if_IN fcal_JJ contamination_NN is_VBZ common_JJ there_RB ._.

They_PRP are_VBP also_RB met_VBN with_IN in_IN large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN unused_JJ wells_NNS ,_, of_IN which_WDT there_EX are_VBP a_DT great_JJ number_NN in_IN the_DT City_NNP ,_, many_JJ of_IN them_PRP being_VBG exceedingly_RB foul_VBN ,_, and_CC they_PRP are_VBP almost_RB invariably_RB present_JJ in_IN minor_JJ collections_NNS of_IN water_NN such_JJ as_IN occur_NNS in_IN barrels_NNS ,_, tubs_NNS ,_, tin-pots_NNS ,_, disused_VBN garden_NN tanks_NNS ,_, especially_RB if_IN the_DT water_NN has_VBZ remained_VBN standing_VBG for_IN a_DT few_JJ days_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT large_JJ open_JJ storm-water_NN channels_NNS larv_CD of_IN C._NNP fatigans_NNS are_VBP always_RB to_TO be_VB found_VBN in_IN large_JJ numbers_NNS and_CC they_PRP are_VBP commonly_RB to_TO be_VB met_VBN with_IN in_IN the_DT smaller_JJR and_CC fouler_JJ collections_NNS of_IN water_NN that_WDT occur_VBP in_IN uneven_JJ ground_NN in_IN every_DT part_NN of_IN the_DT City_NNP during_IN and_CC after_IN the_DT monsoon_NN ._.
Swarms_NNS of_IN the_DT adult_NN mosquito_NN ,_, bred_VBD out_RP from_IN the_DT storm-water_NN drains_NNS ,_, haunt_VBD many_JJ of_IN the_DT houses_NNS in_IN the_DT City_NNP ;_: and_CC when_WRB it_PRP is_VBZ almost_RB impossible_JJ to_TO catch_VB adult_NN anopheles_NNS during_IN the_DT dry_JJ season_NN ,_, scores_NNS of_IN adult_NN C._NNP fatigans_NNS may_MD be_VB found_VBN with_IN ease_NN ._.

176_CD ._.
Stegomyia_NNP mosquitoes_NNS do_VBP not_RB become_VB very_RB prevalent_JJ in_IN Bombay_NNP until_IN about_RB August_NNP or_CC September_NNP ,_, except_IN in_IN buildings_NNS well_RB supplied_VBN with_IN fire_NN buckets_NNS ,_, where_WRB they_PRP are_VBP common_JJ all_PDT the_DT year_NN round_NN ._.

Culex_NNP concolor_NN and_CC Culex_NNP tigripes.-These_JJ two_CD species_NNS of_IN Culex_NNP which_WDT resemble_VBP one_CD another_DT very_RB closely_RB ,_, are_VBP very_RB large_JJ mosquitoes_NNS ;_: they_PRP are_VBP very_RB common_JJ in_IN many_JJ parts_NNS of_IN Bombay_NNP ;_: and_CC they_PRP usually_RB breed_VBP in_IN collections_NNS of_IN fairly_RB clean_JJ water_NN ._.
Their_PRP$ larv_NNS are_VBP peculiar_JJ ,_, because_IN ,_, unlike_IN most_JJS culicine_JJ larv_NN ,_, they_PRP float_VBP nearly_RB horizontal_JJ in_IN the_DT water_NN ,_, in_IN a_DT position_NN somewhat_RB resembling_VBG that_IN adopted_VBN by_IN anopheles_NNS larv_NNS ._.
They_PRP attain_VBP a_DT very_RB large_JJ size_NN and_CC they_PRP are_VBP cannibal_JJ in_IN character_NN ,_, greedily_RB devouring_VBG other_JJ mosquito_NN larv_NNS that_WDT may_MD be_VB sharing_VBG the_DT same_JJ breeding-place_NN with_IN them_PRP and_CC even_RB feeding_VBG upon_IN one_CD another_DT ._.

These_DT breeding_VBG places_NNS were_VBD distributed_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: -_: A_DT ._.
Ward_NNP ..._: ..._: 45_CD B._NNP ,_, ,_, ..._: ..._: 44_CD C._NNP ,_, ,_, .._VBP ..._: 142_CD D._NNP ,_, ,_, ..._: ..._: 186_CD E._NNP ,_, ,_, ..._: ..._: 210_CD F._NNP ,_, ,_, ..._: ..._: 50_CD G._NNP ,_, ,_, ..._: ..._: 44_CD There_EX is_VBZ no_DT evidence_NN to_TO show_VB that_IN Culex_NNP concolor_NN and_CC Culex_NNP tigripes_NNS are_VBP harmful_JJ to_TO man_NN ;_: they_PRP do_VBP not_RB appear_VB to_TO attack_VB man_NN very_RB readily_RB ;_: and_CC in_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN they_PRP undoubtedly_RB serve_VBP to_TO reduce_VB the_DT numbers_NNS of_IN other_JJ and_CC possibly_RB dangerous_JJ species_NNS of_IN mosquitoes_NNS they_PRP must_MD be_VB looked_VBN upon_IN as_IN being_VBG rather_RB beneficial_JJ than_IN otherwise_RB ._.
178_CD ._.
The_DT larv_NN of_IN Culex_NNP concolor_NN does_VBZ not_RB seek_VB its_PRP$ prey_NN ,_, but_CC waits_VBZ for_IN its_PRP$ approach_NN ._.
It_PRP usually_RB assumes_VBZ an_DT almost_RB horizontal_JJ position_NN just_RB below_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN the_DT water_NN ,_, admirably_RB suited_VBN for_IN attack_NN upon_IN larv_NN of_IN anopheles_NNS ,_, which_WDT float_VBP on_IN the_DT surface_NN ._.
Occasionally_RB it_PRP may_MD be_VB seen_VBN to_TO turn_VB its_PRP$ body_NN in_IN a_DT half_JJ circle_NN ,_, when_WRB any_DT moving_VBG object_NN comes_VBZ near_IN it_PRP ,_, as_IN if_IN it_PRP were_VBD keeping_VBG a_DT sharp_JJ look-out_NN for_IN the_DT approach_NN of_IN its_PRP$ prey_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ exceedingly_RB voracious_JJ and_CC when_WRB hungry_NN will_MD seize_VB any_DT larva_NN that_WDT ventures_NNS with_IN striking_JJ distance_NN ,_, the_DT movements_NNS of_IN its_PRP$ head_NN and_CC neck_NN being_VBG so_RB rapid_JJ that_IN the_DT eye_NN can_MD not_RB follow_VB them_PRP ._.
Small_JJ larv_NNS are_VBP swallowed_VBN whole_JJ ,_, disappearing_VBG instantaneously_RB ,_, large_JJ larv_NN are_VBP seized_VBN and_CC held_VBN remorselessly_RB in_IN spite_NN of_IN their_PRP$ struggles_NNS ,_, and_CC rapidly_RB devoured_VBD while_IN still_RB alive_JJ ._.
179_CD ._.
The_DT following_JJ observation_NN shows_VBZ how_WRB destructive_JJ C._NNP concolor_NN may_MD be_VB to_TO other_JJ mosquitoes_NNS ._.
Four_CD large_JJ larv_NN of_IN Culex_NNP concolor_NN ,_, when_WRB placed_VBN in_IN a_DT bowl_NN containing_VBG a_DT number_NN of_IN larv_NN of_IN Neocellia_NNP stephensi_NN of_IN different_JJ sizes_NNS ,_, immediately_RB began_VBD to_TO seize_VB and_CC devour_VB them_PRP ;_: and_CC in_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN two_CD hours_NNS had_VBD destroyed_VBN over_IN 50_CD ._.

180_CD ._.
Desvoidia_NNP obturbans.-_JJ Desvoidia_NNP obturbans_NNS (_( formerly_RB called_VBN Culex_NNP obturbans_NNS or_CC Armigeres_NNS obturbans_NNS )_) is_VBZ another_DT species_NNS of_IN mosquito_JJ present_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP whose_WP$ larv_JJ possess_NN cannibal_NN tendencies_NNS ,_, but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB so_RB common_JJ as_IN Culex_NNP concolor_NN ,_, and_CC as_IN it_PRP usually_RB breeds_VBZ in_IN foul_JJ water_NN it_PRP rarely_RB preys_VBZ upon_IN B_NNP 136-19_CD ?_. 74_CD dangerous_JJ anopheles_NNS ._.
The_DT adult_NN mosquito_NN is_VBZ very_RB large_JJ and_CC is_VBZ coloured_VBN a_DT dull_JJ black_JJ and_CC white_JJ ._.
Its_PRP$ larv_NN resemble_JJ very_RB large_JJ Stegomyia_NNP larv_NN and_CC assume_VB the_DT same_JJ position_NN in_IN water_NN ,_, hanging_VBG nearly_RB perpendicular_JJ with_IN the_DT head_NN down-_JJ wards_NNS ._.
They_PRP breed_VBP in_IN very_RB foul_JJ water_NN and_CC on_IN one_CD occasion_NN many_JJ hundred_CD were_VBD found_VBN in_IN a_DT vessel_NN containing_VBG stale_JJ urine_NN ._.
Several_JJ other_JJ species_NNS of_IN mosquitoes_NNS ,_, mostly_RB Culicines_NNP ,_, may_MD be_VB found_VBN in_IN all_DT parts_NNS of_IN the_DT island_NN ._.
Among_IN those_DT may_MD be_VB mentioned_VBN a_DT species_NNS of_IN Mansonia_NNP ,_, probably_RB Mansonia_NNP uniformis_NNP ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ present_JJ in_IN certain_JJ localities_NNS ._.
Towards_IN the_DT centre_NN and_CC north_NN of_IN the_DT Island_NNP nearly_RB every_DT pool_NN of_IN water_NN containing_VBG weed_NN or_CC alge_NN is_VBZ found_VBN to_TO harbour_VB numerous_JJ larv_NN of_IN Culex_NNP tnorhynchus_RB often_RB in_IN association_NN with_IN enormous_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN the_DT larv_NN of_IN N._NNP rossi_NN ._.
Section_NN 4_CD ._.
181_CD ._.
THE_DT NATURAL_NNP ENEMIES_NNP OF_NNP MOSQUITOES.-It_NNP has_VBZ long_RB been_VBN known_VBN that_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN mosquitoes_NNS may_MD be_VB largely_RB reduced_VBN by_IN the_DT attacks_NNS of_IN natural_JJ enemies_NNS ._.
The_DT adult_NN insects_NNS often_RB fall_VBP a_DT prey_NN to_TO birds_NNS ,_, bats_NNS and_CC predacious_JJ insects_NNS and_CC certain_JJ species_NNS of_IN fish_NN also_RB attack_NN and_CC devour_VB large_JJ numbers_NNS when_WRB they_PRP approach_VBP sufficiently_RB near_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN the_DT water_NN ._.
Two_CD species_NNS of_IN fish_NN ,_, Haplochilus_NNP lineatus_NN and_CC Anabas_NNP scandens_NNS ,_, occurring_VBG in_IN streams_NNS ,_, pools_NNS and_CC tanks_NNS in_IN the_DT neighbourhood_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, readily_RB take_VB flying_VBG mosquitoes_NNS in_IN this_DT way_NN ,_, leaping_VBG six_CD inches_NNS or_CC more_JJR out_IN of_IN the_DT water_NN for_IN the_DT purpose_NN ._.
182_CD ._.
Ants_NNS will_MD also_RB attack_VB and_CC devour_VB adult_NN mosquitoes_NNS if_IN they_PRP happen_VBP to_TO be_VB in_IN an_DT enclosed_JJ space_NN ._.
This_DT fact_NN was_VBD demonstrated_VBN accidently_RB during_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN ._.
A_DT number_NN of_IN adult_NN anopheles_NNS ,_, which_WDT had_VBD been_VBN fed_VBN experimentally_RB upon_JJ cases_NNS of_IN malaria_NN ,_, were_VBD placed_VBN in_IN a_DT large_JJ wooden_NN box_NN containing_VBG a_DT vessel_NN of_IN water_NN until_IN ready_JJ for_IN dissection_NN ._.
Unfortunately_RB a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN small_JJ red_JJ ants_NNS obtained_VBD access_NN to_TO the_DT box_NN and_CC devoured_VBD nearly_RB every_DT mosquito_NN ,_, attacking_VBG even_RB those_DT that_WDT had_VBD settled_VBN on_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN the_DT water_NN for_IN the_DT purpose_NN of_IN depositing_VBG their_PRP$ eggs_NNS ._.
183_CD ._.
But_CC though_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN adult_NN mosquitoes_NNS are_VBP being_VBG constantly_RB destroyed_VBN by_IN natural_JJ enemies_NNS ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ probable_JJ that_IN this_DT loss_NN is_VBZ small_JJ compared_VBN to_TO that_DT occasioned_VBN by_IN the_DT natural_JJ enemies_NNS which_WDT pray_VBP upon_IN the_DT insect_NN in_IN its_PRP$ larval_JJ state_NN ;_: and_CC the_DT examination_NN of_IN collections_NNS of_IN water_NN containing_VBG mosquito_NNS larv_RBR usually_RB shows_VBZ the_DT presence_NN of_IN other_JJ aquatic_JJ larv_NN and_CC insects_NNS which_WDT help_VBP to_TO reduce_VB their_PRP$ number_NN very_RB greatly_RB ._.
Mention_NN has_VBZ already_RB been_VBN made_VBN in_IN the_DT paragraph_NN referring_VBG to_TO Culex_NNP concolor_NN and_CC Culex_NNP tigripes_NNS of_IN cannibal_JJ mosquito_NN larv_NN present_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, but_CC in_IN addition_NN to_TO these_DT cannibal_JJ larv_NN many_JJ other_JJ natural_JJ enemies_NNS of_IN mosquito_NNS have_VBP been_VBN met_VBN with_IN during_IN the_DT examination_NN of_IN collections_NNS of_IN water_NN on_IN the_DT island_NN ._.
184_CD ._.
Among_IN these_DT a_DT species_NNS of_IN water_NN boatmen_NNS ,_, belonging_VBG to_TO the_DT Notonectid_NNP ,_, is_VBZ especially_RB common_JJ ._.
This_DT aquatic_JJ insect_NN may_MD easily_RB be_VB recognized_VBN by_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN it_PRP swims_VBZ on_IN its_PRP$ back_NN ._.
If_IN carefully_RB watched_VBD it_PRP may_MD be_VB seen_VBN to_TO catch_VB and_CC devour_VB numbers_NNS of_IN mosquito_NN larv_FW both_DT Culicine_NNP and_CC Anopheline_NNP ._.
A_DT minute_JJ water_NN bug_NN which_WDT kills_VBZ anopheles_NNS larv_NN has_VBZ also_RB been_VBN found_VBN in_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN wells_NNS and_CC pools_NNS of_IN water_NN infested_VBN with_IN mosquito_JJ larv_NN ._.
This_DT bug_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ of_IN a_DT dark_JJ grey_NN or_CC black_JJ colour_NN ,_, is_VBZ only_RB a_DT fraction_NN of_IN an_DT inch_NN in_IN length_NN ._.
It_PRP possesses_VBZ a_DT long_JJ suctorial_NN proboscis_NN which_WDT is_VBZ usually_RB carried_VBN bent_JJ beneath_NN its_PRP$ body_NN ._.
It_PRP runs_VBZ about_RB rapidly_RB on_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN the_DT water_NN and_CC attacks_NNS anopheles_NNS larv_VBP readily_RB ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB seen_VBN to_TO climb_VB upon_IN them_PRP at_IN the_DT tail_JJ end_NN as_IN they_PRP rest_VBP quiet_JJ on_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN the_DT water_NN ;_: then_RB it_PRP moves_VBZ cautiously_RB forward_RB as_RB far_RB as_IN the_DT thorax_NN of_IN the_DT larva_NN and_CC inserting_VBG its_PRP$ proboscis_NN sucks_VBZ out_RP the_DT juice_NN of_IN its_PRP$ prey_NN ._.
One_CD small_JJ bug_NN about_IN as_RB big_JJ as_IN a_DT pin_NN 's_POS head_NN has_VBZ destroyed_VBN as_RB many_JJ as_IN ten_JJ anopheles_NNS larv_RBR in_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN a_DT few_JJ hours_NNS in_IN the_DT manner_NN described_VBD ._.
185_CD ._.
Certain_NNP aquatic_JJ beetles_NNS belonging_VBG to_TO the_DT Dytiscid_NNP and_CC Hydroplulid_NNP are_VBP common_JJ in_IN Bombay_NNP and_CC their_PRP$ larv_NN destroy_NN considerable_JJ number_NN of_IN mosquito_JJ larv_NN ._.
Many_JJ of_IN these_DT beetle_JJ larv_NN have_VBP been_VBN found_VBN in_IN the_DT large_JJ shallow_NN pools_NNS of_IN water_NN common_JJ in_IN the_DT centre_NN and_CC north_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN ._.
They_PRP vary_VBP in_IN size_NN from_IN 1/2_CD ''_'' to_TO 1_CD ''_'' or_CC more_RBR ,_, possess_VB a_DT whitish_JJ ,_, fleshy_JJ ,_, somewhat_RB maggot-shaped_JJ body_NN ,_, and_CC are_VBP provided_VBN with_IN three_CD pairs_NNS of_IN legs_NNS and_CC powerful_JJ jaws_NNS ._.
The_DT jaws_NN are_VBP peculiar_JJ ,_, being_VBG adapted_VBN both_DT for_IN seizing_VBG and_CC crushing_VBG their_PRP$ prey_NN ,_, and_CC owing_VBG to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN they_PRP are_VBP hollow_JJ ,_, or_CC groved_VBN ,_, serve_VB the_DT purpose_NN of_IN a_DT suctorial_JJ apparatus_NN also_RB ,_, by_IN means_NNS of_IN which_WDT the_DT juices_NNS of_IN the_DT victim_NN are_VBP rapidly_RB absorbed_VBN ._.
?_. 75_CD One_CD of_IN these_DT predacious_JJ larv_NN about_IN 3/4_CD inch_NN long_RB has_VBZ been_VBN seen_VBN to_TO devour_VB fifty_JJ larv_NN of_IN N._NNP rossi_NN successively_RB in_IN a_DT very_RB short_JJ time_NN ._.
It_PRP seized_VBD its_PRP$ victims_NNS while_IN swimming_VBG ,_, but_CC appeared_VBD unable_JJ to_TO devour_VB them_PRP while_IN it_PRP remained_VBD in_IN the_DT water_NN ,_, as_IN it_PRP did_VBD not_RB attempt_VB to_TO do_VB so_RB until_IN it_PRP had_VBD climbed_VBN upon_IN a_DT piece_NN of_IN stick_NN or_CC a_DT leaf_NN ._.

This_DT it_PRP rejected_VBD and_CC immediately_RB afterwards_NNS began_VBD to_TO seek_VB for_IN a_DT fresh_JJ supply_NN of_IN food_NN ._.
186_CD ._.
The_DT larv_NN of_IN certain_JJ of_IN the_DT May_NNP flies_NNS or_CC Ephemer_NNP are_VBP very_RB destructive_JJ to_TO mosquito_VB larv_NN ._.

187_CD ._.
But_CC although_IN mosquitoes_NNS suffer_VBP very_RB great_JJ reduction_NN owing_VBG to_TO the_DT attacks_NNS of_IN insect_JJ enemies_NNS ,_, and_CC although_IN the_DT presence_NN or_CC absence_NN of_IN such_JJ checks_NNS may_MD serve_VB to_TO modify_VB indirectly_RB the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN malaria_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ doubtful_JJ if_IN this_DT fact_NN can_MD be_VB turned_VBN to_TO any_DT great_JJ practical_JJ use_NN ,_, for_IN it_PRP does_VBZ not_RB appear_VB likely_RB that_IN much_RB good_JJ will_MD be_VB achieved_VBN by_IN attempting_VBG to_TO stock_NN collections_NNS of_IN water_NN with_IN insect_JJ life_NN ._.

188_CD ._.
Some_DT years_NNS ago_IN it_PRP was_VBD stated_VBN that_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN malaria_NNS in_IN Barbados_NNP was_VBD due_JJ to_TO the_DT presence_NN of_IN enormous_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN a_DT species_NNS of_IN small_JJ fresh-water_JJ fish_JJ locally_RB known_VBN as_IN ``_`` Millions_NNP ''_'' ;_: and_CC the_DT suggestion_NN has_VBZ been_VBN made_VBN from_IN time_NN to_TO time_NN that_IN these_DT fish_NN should_MD be_VB introduced_VBN into_IN India_NNP for_IN the_DT purpose_NN of_IN Anopheline_NNP reduction_NN ._.

189_CD ._.
The_DT fish_NN used_VBN by_IN Mr._NNP Aitken_NNP was_VBD a_DT species_NNS of_IN Haplochilus_NNP (_( H._NNP lineatus_NN )_) *_FW easily_RB obtainable_JJ locally_RB from_IN the_DT stream_NN which_WDT flows_VBZ out_IN of_IN the_DT Vehar_NNP Reservoir_NNP ,_, and_CC in_IN certain_JJ pools_NNS on_IN the_DT island_NN also_RB ,_, during_IN the_DT monsoon_NN ._.
These_DT fish_JJ are_VBP known_VBN locally_RB by_IN the_DT name_NN ``_`` Piku_NNP ''_'' ,_, but_CC they_PRP were_VBD called_VBN ``_`` Scooties_NNS ''_'' by_IN Mr._NNP Aitken_NNP on_IN account_NN of_IN their_PRP$ darting_NN movements_NNS ._.

190_CD ._.
During_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN experiments_NNS have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN with_IN fish_NN of_IN this_DT species_NNS ._.

*_NN This_DT fish_NN was_VBD identified_VBN for_IN me_PRP by_IN Mr._NNP N._NNP B._NNP Kinnear_NNP of_IN the_DT Bombay_NNP Natural_NNP History_NNP Society_NNP ._.
?_. 76_CD 191_CD ._.
In_IN addition_NN to_TO the_DT ``_`` Piku_NNP ''_'' a_DT number_NN of_IN local_JJ fish_NN of_IN other_JJ species_NNS have_VBP been_VBN found_VBN to_TO prey_VB readily_RB upon_IN mosquito_JJ larv_NN ._.
Among_IN these_DT may_MD be_VB mentioned_VBN Polyacanthus_NNP cupanus_NN ,_, *_VB a_DT small_JJ fish_JJ present_NN in_IN Gowalia_NNP tank_NN ,_, Anabas_NNP scandens_VBZ ,_, *_VBZ the_DT climbing_VBG perch_NN ,_, which_WDT can_MD be_VB obtained_VBN in_IN large_JJ numbers_NNS from_IN tanks_NNS and_CC pools_NNS on_IN the_DT island_NN and_CC from_IN the_DT mainland_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT species_NNS of_IN cat-fish_JJ which_WDT is_VBZ found_VBN in_IN pools_NNS in_IN the_DT bed_NN of_IN streams_NNS near_IN Thna_NNP ._.
Of_IN these_DT fish_JJ Anabas_NNP scandens_NNS ,_, known_VBN locally_RB as_IN ``_`` Kazari_NNP ''_'' ,_, is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS valuable_JJ ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ larger_JJR than_IN the_DT Haplochilus_NNP and_CC ,_, as_IN usually_RB obtained_VBN ,_, is_VBZ from_IN three_CD to_TO six_CD inches_NNS or_CC more_JJR in_IN length_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ stoutly_RB built_VBN ,_, with_IN a_DT large_JJ head_NN and_CC well-developed_JJ pectoral_JJ fins_NNS ._.

Its_PRP$ eyes_NNS are_VBP very_RB large_JJ and_CC brilliant_JJ ,_, coloured_VBD bright_JJ yellow_NN ,_, with_IN well-marked_JJ pupils_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ exceedingly_RB active_JJ ,_, readily_RB jumping_VBG out_IN of_IN the_DT water_NN after_IN flies_NNS and_CC mosquitoes_NNS ,_, and_CC it_PRP devours_VBZ mosquito_JJ larv_NN and_CC pup_NN voraciously_RB ._.
About_RB two_CD dozen_NN of_IN these_DT fish_NN placed_VBD in_IN a_DT masonry_NN tank_NN four_CD feet_NNS square_JJ containing_VBG about_IN four_CD feet_NNS of_IN water_NN ,_, kept_VBD the_DT tank_NN absolutely_RB free_JJ of_IN mosquito_NN larv_NN ,_, although_IN many_JJ thousands_NNS were_VBD added_VBN to_TO it_PRP every_DT day_NN ._.
Anabas_NNP scandens_VBZ has_VBZ also_RB been_VBN tried_VBN in_IN wells_NNS ;_: and_CC when_WRB present_JJ in_IN sufficient_JJ number_NN has_VBZ been_VBN successful_JJ in_IN freeing_VBG the_DT water_NN from_IN mosquito_NN larv_NN ;_: but_CC in_IN wells_NNS containing_VBG much_JJ weed_NN and_CC floating_VBG leaves_NNS or_CC rubbish_VB it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB successful_JJ as_IN the_DT larv_NN have_VBP cover_VBN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ little_JJ question_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, that_IN in_IN wells_NNS kept_VBD free_JJ of_IN floating_VBG matter_NN the_DT presence_NN of_IN a_DT sufficient_JJ number_NN of_IN these_DT fish_NN would_MD prevent_VB the_DT breeding_NN of_IN mosquitoes_NNS ._.
192_CD ._.
The_DT species_NNS of_IN cat-fish_JJ mentioned_VBN ,_, which_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN identified_VBN as_IN Ma-_NNP crones_NNS Corsula*_NNP var_NN ._.

The_DT two_CD latter_NN species_NNS also_RB appear_VBP to_TO be_VB better_RBR able_JJ to_TO resist_VB a_DT change_NN of_IN habitat_NN than_IN ``_`` Piku_NNP ,_, ''_'' which_WDT does_VBZ not_RB always_RB thrive_VBP in_IN captivity_NN ._.
193_CD ._.
In_IN conclusion_NN it_PRP may_MD be_VB stated_VBN that_DT ,_, as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN the_DT experiments_NNS and_CC observations_NNS that_WDT have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN ,_, there_EX appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB no_DT reason_NN why_WRB fish_NN of_IN the_DT species_NNS mentioned_VBD should_MD not_RB be_VB successfully_RB employed_VBN in_IN protecting_VBG many_JJ of_IN the_DT small_JJ permanent_JJ collections_NNS of_IN water_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP such_JJ as_IN wells_NNS ,_, fountains_NNS ,_, and_CC masonry_NN tanks_NNS ,_, from_IN the_DT breeding_NN of_IN anopheles_NNS and_CC other_JJ mosquitoes_NNS ,_, provided_VBD that_IN the_DT conditions_NNS indicated_VBD below_IN are_VBP adhered_VBN to_TO ._.
These_DT conditions_NNS are_VBP :_: -_: (_( 1_CD )_) The_DT number_NN of_IN fish_JJ employed_VBN must_MD be_VB sufficient_JJ for_IN the_DT task_NN and_CC proportionate_NN to_TO the_DT amount_NN of_IN water_NN to_TO be_VB protected_VBN ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) The_DT water_NN must_MD be_VB kept_VBN free_JJ from_IN weed_NN ,_, leaves_VBZ ,_, flowers_NNS and_CC floating_VBG matter_NN which_WDT might_MD afford_VB cover_NN to_TO mosquito_VB larv_NN ._.
Of_IN course_NN it_PRP must_MD be_VB understood_JJ that_IN fish_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB employed_VBN in_IN wells_NNS which_WDT are_VBP too_RB foul_JJ or_CC stagnant_JJ to_TO allow_VB of_IN there_EX being_VBG a_DT sufficient_JJ supply_NN of_IN oxygen_NN for_IN them_PRP ._.
Wells_NNP in_IN this_DT condition_NN must_MD be_VB protected_VBN in_IN some_DT other_JJ manner_NN ._.
194_CD ._.
Plants_NNS inimical_JJ to_TO mosquitoes.-_JJ Wolffia_NNP arizha_NN ,_, the_DT rootless-_JJ duckweed_NN ,_, may_MD be_VB placed_VBN among_IN the_DT natural_JJ enemies_NNS of_IN mosquitoes_NNS ._.
There_EX are_VBP three_CD varieties_NNS of_IN this_DT minute_NN water_NN plant_NN present_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP which_WDT differ_VBP from_IN one_CD another_DT in_IN the_DT size_NN and_CC shape_NN of_IN the_DT grains_NNS ._.
The_DT commonest_JJS form_NN is_VBZ to_TO be_VB seen_VBN in_IN the_DT Mint_NNP Tank_NNP and_CC a_DT number_NN of_IN other_JJ collections_NNS of_IN water_NN mostly_RB in_IN the_DT north_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT form_NN the_DT plant_NN consists_VBZ of_IN tiny_JJ round_NN fleshy_JJ masses_NNS about_IN the_DT size_NN of_IN a_DT pin_NN 's_POS head_NN and_CC of_IN a_DT brilliant_JJ green_JJ colour_NN ._.
In_IN another_DT variety_NN the_DT individual_JJ grains_NNS are_VBP cat-shaped_JJ instead_RB of_IN round_NN and_CC rather_RB smaller_JJR in_IN size_NN ._.
In_IN a_DT third_JJ variety_NN the_DT grains_NNS are_VBP much_JJ larger_JJR and_CC more_RBR flattened_JJ and_CC resemble_JJ small_JJ single_JJ leaflets_NNS of_IN lemna_NN or_CC ordinary_JJ duckweed_NN without_IN the_DT roots_NNS ._.
Where_WRB the_DT rootless-duckweed_NN is_VBZ present_JJ in_IN large_JJ amount_NN it_PRP forms_VBZ a_DT thick_JJ scum_NN on_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN the_DT water_NN and_CC by_IN its_PRP$ mechanical_JJ action_NN destroys_VBZ mosquito_JJ larv_NN just_RB as_IN a_DT film_NN of_IN oil_NN might_MD do_VB ._.
Mosquitoes_NNS will_MD lay_VB their_PRP$ eggs_NNS on_IN water_NN containing_VBG the_DT weed_NN and_CC young_JJ larv_NN hatch_NN out_IN and_CC live_VB for_IN a_DT time_NN ,_, because_IN while_IN small_JJ they_PRP can_MD pass_VB their_PRP$ breathing_NN syphons_NNS to_TO the_DT surface_NN between_IN the_DT particles_NNS of_IN weed_NN ,_, but_CC larger_JJR larv_NN die_NN of_IN *_NNP These_DT fish_NNS were_VBD identified_VBN for_IN me_PRP by_IN Mr._NNP N._NNP B._NNP Kinnear_NNP of_IN the_DT Bombay_NNP Natural_NNP History_NNP Society_NNP ._.
77_CD suffocation_NN ._.
Among_IN the_DT wells_NNS ,_, tanks_NNS and_CC pools_NNS of_IN Bombay_NNP over_IN 50_CD have_VBP been_VBN found_VBN in_IN which_WDT large_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN Wolffia_NNP were_VBD present_JJ ,_, and_CC in_IN which_WDT mosquito_NN larv_NN did_VBD not_RB exist_VB ._.
In_IN a_DT great_JJ many_JJ other_JJ collections_NNS of_IN water_NN a_DT scanty_JJ growth_NN of_IN the_DT weed_NN did_VBD not_RB appear_VB to_TO interfere_VB with_IN the_DT breeding_NN ?_.
of_IN mosquitoes_NNS and_CC in_IN pools_NNS where_WRB reeds_NNS and_CC largo_NN weeds_NNS broke_VBD the_DT surface_NN film_NN of_IN Wolffia_NNP ,_, larv_NN were_VBD to_TO be_VB found_VBN with_IN ease_NN ._.
Experiments_NNS with_IN the_DT weed_NN in_IN vitro_NN showed_VBD that_IN its_PRP$ action_NN is_VBZ purely_RB mechanical_JJ ._.
Anopheles_NNS larv_VBP placed_VBN in_IN water_NN covered_VBN with_IN a_DT layer_NN of_IN Wolffia_NNP immediately_RB assume_VBD an_DT almost_RB vertical_JJ position_NN ,_, hanging_VBG in_IN the_DT water_NN head_NN downwards_NNS in_IN a_DT manner_NN resembling_VBG that_IN of_IN Stegomyia_NNP larv_NN ._.
After_IN a_DT longer_RBR or_CC shorter_JJR interval_JJ dependent_NN upon_IN the_DT thickness_NN of_IN the_DT film_NN of_IN weed_NN ,_, the_DT larv_NN died_VBD and_CC sank_VBD to_TO the_DT bottom_NN of_IN the_DT water_NN ._.
195_CD ._.
Experiments_NNS tried_VBN with_IN ordinary_JJ duckweed_NN (_( Lemna_NNP )_) and_CC Azolla_NNP were_VBD unsatisfactory_JJ ,_, neither_DT of_IN these_DT plants_NNS appearing_VBG to_TO have_VB any_DT effect_NN upon_IN mosquito_NN larv_NN ._.
Both_DT Lemna_NNP and_CC Azolla_NNP were_VBD present_JJ in_IN tanks_NNS and_CC pools_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP and_CC in_IN almost_RB every_DT case_NN mosquito_NN larv_NN were_VBD found_VBN living_VBG amongst_IN the_DT weed_NN in_IN considerable_JJ numbers_NNS ._.
Section_NN 4_CD ._.
196_CD ._.
ARTIFICIAL_NNP MEANS_NNP FOR_NNP DESTROYING_NNP MOSQUITO_NNP LARV.-During_NNP the_DT investigation_NN a_DT number_NN of_IN experiments_NNS have_VBP been_VBN carried_VBN out_RP with_IN a_DT view_NN of_IN gaining_VBG some_DT idea_NN of_IN the_DT most_RBS effective_JJ larvacides_NNS from_IN the_DT point_NN of_IN view_NN both_DT of_IN cost_NN and_CC efficiency_NN ._.
The_DT cheapest_JJS larvacide_NN is_VBZ sea-water_JJ ._.
Unfortunately_RB mosquitoes_NNS quickly_RB adapt_VBP themselves_PRP to_TO breeding_VBG in_IN salt_JJ water_NN ;_: but_CC larv_VBP that_WDT have_VBP been_VBN hatched_VBN out_RP in_IN fresh_JJ water_NN die_NN after_IN a_DT few_JJ hours_NNS ,_, when_WRB sea-water_NN is_VBZ added_VBN to_TO the_DT water_NN in_IN which_WDT they_PRP are_VBP living_VBG so_RB as_IN to_TO form_VB a_DT mixture_NN containing_VBG 75_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN sea-water_NN ._.
Common_JJ salt_NN ,_, lime_NN ,_, sulphate_NN of_IN copper_NN and_CC sulphate_NN of_IN iron_NN ,_, destroy_NN mosquito_NN larv_NN when_WRB added_VBD to_TO the_DT water_NN in_IN which_WDT they_PRP are_VBP breeding_VBG ._.
Sulphate_NNP of_IN copper_NN is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS active_JJ of_IN these_DT substances_NNS but_CC the_DT cost_NN is_VBZ prohibitive_JJ ._.
Sulphate_NNP of_IN iron_NN is_VBZ active_JJ only_RB when_WRB the_DT solution_NN approaches_VBZ saturation_NN ._.
197_CD ._.
The_DT larvacides_NNS most_RBS commonly_RB used_VBN are_VBP crude_JJ petroleum_NN (_( otherwise_RB known_VBN as_IN liquid_NN fuel_NN or_CC pesterine_NN }_) and_CC kerosene_NN ._.
Of_IN these_DT kerosene_NN is_VBZ more_RBR effective_JJ than_IN pesterine_NN ,_, but_CC a_DT mixture_NN of_IN about_IN equal_JJ parts_NNS of_IN kerosene_NN and_CC pesterine_NN is_VBZ more_RBR efficient_JJ than_IN either_DT oil_NN by_IN itself_PRP ._.
Pesterine_NN has_VBZ the_DT advantage_NN of_IN cheapness_NN ,_, and_CC its_PRP$ colour_NN shows_NNS when_WRB it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN applied_VBN ;_: but_CC it_PRP does_VBZ not_RB spread_VB so_RB easily_RB as_IN kerosene_NN ,_, is_VBZ more_RBR apt_JJ to_TO collect_VB in_IN large_JJ blobs_NN and_CC is_VBZ much_RB slower_JJR in_IN its_PRP$ action_NN ._.
Unless_IN it_PRP is_VBZ used_VBN in_IN sufficient_JJ amount_NN and_CC carefully_RB spread_VB ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ of_IN very_RB little_JJ use_NN ,_, and_CC as_IN it_PRP tends_VBZ to_TO collect_VB in_IN large_JJ blobs_NNS with_IN free_JJ spaces_NNS in_IN between_IN ,_, mosquito_FW larv_FW easily_RB escape_DT suffocation_NN ._.
In_IN wells_NNS in_IN which_WDT many_JJ gallons_NNS of_IN pesterine_NN have_VBP been_VBN placed_VBN ,_, mosquito_FW larv_NNS have_VBP been_VBN after-_JJ wards_NNS discovered_VBN ,_, even_RB when_WRB there_EX was_VBD sufficient_JJ oil_NN present_NN to_TO have_VB covered_VBN the_DT surface_NN of_IN the_DT water_NN many_JJ times_NNS over_IN ._.
Kerosene_NNP costs_VBZ more_JJR than_IN pesterine_NN and_CC is_VBZ more_RBR liable_JJ to_TO be_VB stolen_VBN but_CC it_PRP spreads_VBZ better_RBR on_IN water_NN and_CC is_VBZ decidedly_RB quicker_RBR in_IN its_PRP$ action_NN ._.
Unfortunately_RB like_IN pesterine_NN it_PRP is_VBZ liable_JJ to_TO be_VB blown_VBN to_TO one_CD side_NN of_IN a_DT pool_NN if_IN there_EX is_VBZ much_JJ wind_NN and_CC it_PRP may_MD be_VB found_VBN necessary_JJ to_TO repeat_VB the_DT oiling_NN of_IN a_DT pool_NN three_CD days_NNS in_IN succession_NN before_IN all_PDT the_DT larv_NN and_CC pup_NN are_VBP destroyed_VBN ''_'' 198_CD ._.
In_IN a_DT series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS conducted_VBN in_IN the_DT New_NNP Dock_NNP Works_NNP early_RB in_IN 1909_CD it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN of_IN 66_CD pools_NNS of_IN water_NN containing_VBG numerous_JJ larv_NN which_WDT were_VBD carefully_RB oiled_VBN with_IN a_DT mixture_NN of_IN pesterine_NN and_CC kerosene_NN ,_, applied_VBN to_TO them_PRP by_IN means_NNS of_IN a_DT spray_NN ,_, 47_CD contained_VBD many_JJ live_JJ larv_VBP the_DT following_JJ day_NN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD all_DT treated_VBN once_RB more_RBR but_CC on_IN being_VBG examined_VBN again_RB the_DT next_JJ day_NN scanty_JJ larv_NN were_VBD found_VBN in_IN 22_CD ,_, and_CC after_IN being_VBG treated_VBD a_DT third_JJ time_NN a_DT few_JJ larv_NN were_VBD still_RB present_JJ in_IN 7_CD ._.
In_IN another_DT series_NN of_IN 44_CD pools_NNS most_RBS carefully_RB oiled_VBN by_IN being_VBG sprayed_VBN repeatedly_RB with_IN a_DT mixture_NN of_IN kerosene_NN and_CC pesterine_NN ,_, 12_CD showed_VBD a_DT number_NN of_IN living_VBG larv_IN the_DT next_JJ day_NN ._.
These_DT observations_NNS show_VBP that_IN where_WRB it_PRP is_VBZ a_DT matter_NN of_IN importance_NN ,_, as_IN in_IN the_DT New_NNP Dock_NNP enclosure_NN ,_, that_IN larv_NN should_MD be_VB destroyed_VBN thoroughly_RB ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB sufficient_JJ to_TO make_VB a_DT routine_JJ ap-_JJ plication_NN of_IN pesterine_NN or_CC kerosene_NN once_RB a_DT week_NN ,_, as_IN many_JJ mosquitoes_NNS continue_VBP to_TO reach_VB maturity_NN in_IN spite_NN of_IN it_PRP ,_, 199_CD ._.
During_IN the_DT experimental_JJ destruction_NN work_NN in_IN the_DT New_NNP Dock_NNP it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN the_DT only_JJ way_NN to_TO limit_VB the_DT breeding_NN of_IN mosquitoes_NNS there_RB with_IN much_JJ B_NNP 136-20_CD ?_. 78_CD effect_NN ,_, was_VBD to_TO divide_VB up_RP the_DT whole_JJ area_NN into_IN sections_NNS and_CC place_NN a_DT trained_JJ Indian_JJ in_IN charge_NN of_IN each_DT section_NN ,_, with_IN orders_NNS to_TO go_VB round_JJ every_DT day_NN and_CC destroy_VB any_DT larv_NN he_PRP might_MD find_VB ._.
The_DT Assistant_NNP Surgeon_NNP in_IN charge_NN of_IN these_DT men_NNS went_VBD round_IN the_DT whole_JJ area_NN during_IN the_DT week_NN ._.
The_DT staff_NN was_VBD told_VBN that_IN their_PRP$ work_NN would_MD be_VB inspected_VBN very_RB carefully_RB ;_: and_CC after_IN ten_JJ days_NNS or_CC a_DT fortnight_NN a_DT surprise_NN visit_NN was_VBD paid_VBN to_TO the_DT docks_NNS ._.
The_DT careful_JJ search_NN of_IN about_RB 290_CD pools_NNS conducted_VBN during_IN this_DT visit_NN showed_VBD scanty_JJ large_JJ larv_NN to_TO be_VB present_JJ in_IN only_RB 5_CD pools_NNS ._.
Complete_JJ absence_NN of_IN larv_NN was_VBD not_RB expected_VBN as_IN ova_NNS were_VBD continually_RB hatching_VBG out_RP and_CC many_JJ small_JJ larv_NNS were_VBD being_VBG produced_VBN in_IN this_DT way_NN every_DT day_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT comparative_JJ absence_NN of_IN full-grown_JJ larv_NN and_CC pup_NN showed_VBD that_IN few_JJ of_IN them_PRP were_VBD reaching_VBG maturity_NN ._.
200_CD ._.
As_IN the_DT result_NN of_IN an_DT enquiry_NN regarding_VBG the_DT larvacides_NNS in_IN use_NN in_IN Panama_NNP ,_, Colonel_NNP W._NNP G._NNP Gorgas_NNP ,_, U._NNP S._NNP A._NN ,_, the_DT Chief_NNP Officer_NNP in_IN charge_NN of_IN the_DT sanitation_NN of_IN the_DT Canal_NNP Zone_NNP ,_, very_RB kindly_RB supplied_VBD the_DT following_JJ formula_NN and_CC directions_NNS for_IN preparing_VBG a_DT larvacide_NN ,_, which_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN used_VBN with_IN very_RB great_JJ success_NN at_IN Panama_NNP ._.
``_`` Gorgas_NNP '_POS Larvacide-_NNP Carbolic_NNP Acid_NNP ,_, crude_NN ..._: ..._: 100_CD gals_NNS ._.
Resin_NN ..._: ..._: 66_CD lbs_NN ._.
Solution_NN of_IN Caustic_NNP Soda_NNP ..._: (_( 20_CD lbs_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT solid_JJ in_IN solution_NN )_) ._.
``_`` The_DT method_NN of_IN manufacture_NN is_VBZ to_TO place_VB the_DT carbolic_JJ acid_NN in_IN a_DT vat_NN and_CC ``_`` heat_NN to_TO the_DT boiling_VBG point_NN by_IN a_DT steam_NN coil_NN ._.
The_DT resin_NN is_VBZ then_RB powdered_VBN and_CC ``_`` added_VBD to_TO the_DT acid_NN ,_, is_VBZ melted_VBN by_IN the_DT heat_NN ,_, and_CC goes_VBZ into_IN solution_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT ``_`` process_NN of_IN adding_VBG the_DT resin_NN ,_, the_DT mixture_NN being_VBG formed_VBN is_VBZ thoroughly_RB stirred_VBN ``_`` by_IN a_DT paddle_JJ fixed_VBN on_IN an_DT iron_NN rod_NN in_IN the_DT vat_NN and_CC revolved_VBN by_IN a_DT crank_NN ._.
The_DT ``_`` Caustic_JJ Soda_NNP is_VBZ then_RB added_VBN ._.
After_IN heating_VBG for_IN two_CD or_CC three_CD minutes_NNS a_DT small_JJ ``_`` amount_NN of_IN the_DT mixture_NN in_IN the_DT vat_NN is_VBZ tested_VBN to_TO see_VB if_IN it_PRP thoroughly_VBZ emulsifies_NNS ``_`` with_IN water_NN ._.
The_DT emulsion_NN formed_VBD is_VBZ of_IN a_DT dirty_JJ white_JJ or_CC pinkish_JJ appearance_NN ._.
``_`` If_IN emulsification_NN is_VBZ complete_JJ the_DT larvacide_NN is_VBZ drawn_VBN off_RP into_IN barrels_NNS ,_, allowed_VBN ``_`` to_TO cool_VB ,_, and_CC is_VBZ then_RB distributed_VBN to_TO the_DT line_NN for_IN use_NN ._.
The_DT method_NN of_IN use_NN is_VBZ ,_, to_TO ``_`` one_CD part_NN of_IN the_DT larvacide_NN add_VBP three_CD parts_NNS of_IN water_NN ,_, which_WDT forms_VBZ an_DT emulsion_NN ._.
``_`` This_DT emulsion_NN is_VBZ then_RB spread_VBN on_IN breeding_VBG places_NNS by_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN the_DT '_POS Knap-_JJ ``_`` sack_NN Spray_NNP ._. '_''
The_DT advantages_NNS are_VBP that_IN the_DT larv_NN are_VBP readily_RB killed_VBN ,_, and_CC ``_`` their_PRP$ presence_NN may_MD be_VB discovered_VBN in_IN unsuspected_JJ places_NNS ;_: as_IN on_IN spraying_VBG the_DT ``_`` mixture_NN on_IN the_DT water_NN ,_, the_DT whitish_JJ appearance_NN of_IN the_DT emulsion_NN in_IN contrast_NN ``_`` with_IN water_NN brings_VBZ the_DT larv_NN into_IN relief_NN ._.
By_IN this_DT method_NN if_IN larv_NNS have_VBP not_RB ``_`` been_VBN found_VBN on_IN inspection_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ known_VBN whether_IN or_CC not_RB to_TO continue_VB the_DT ``_`` application_NN of_IN the_DT larvacide_NN by_IN the_DT appearance_NN ,_, or_CC non-appearance_NN ,_, as_IN the_DT case_NN ``_`` may_MD be_VB ,_, of_IN the_DT larv_NN in_IN the_DT emulsion_NN formed_VBN by_IN the_DT larvacide_NN with_IN the_DT water_NN ``_`` of_IN the_DT suspected_VBN breeding_NN place_NN ._.
``_`` The_DT objection_NN to_TO its_PRP$ use_NN is_VBZ that_IN even_RB in_IN very_RB high_JJ dilution_NN it_PRP will_MD kill_VB fish_JJ ._.
``_`` It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB destructive_JJ to_TO alg_VB and_CC to_TO a_DT lesser_JJR extent_NN to_TO plant_NN life_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ an_DT ``_`` advantage_NN ._.
By_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN a_DT 1/32_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
solution_NN of_IN arsenic_JJ the_DT action_NN ``_`` on_IN vegetation_NN is_VBZ greatly_RB enhanced_VBN ._.
A_DT small_JJ amount_NN of_IN the_DT larvacide_NN mixed_VBD ``_`` with_IN the_DT ordinary_JJ crude_NN oil_NN is_VBZ found_VBN to_TO be_VB very_RB efficacious_JJ on_IN running_VBG water_NN ._.
``_`` The_DT carbolic_JJ acid_NN used_VBN is_VBZ one_CD that_WDT should_MD contain_VB 20_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN phenol_NN and_CC ``_`` cresols_NNS ,_, and_CC a_DT specific_JJ gravity_NN of_IN not_RB greater_JJR than_IN 0.963_CD ._.
The_DT amount_NN of_IN ``_`` resin_NN and_CC caustic_JJ soda_NN used_VBN varies_NNS according_VBG to_TO the_DT quality_NN of_IN the_DT crude_NN ``_`` carbolic_JJ acid_NN ,_, and_CC each_DT shipment_NN of_IN carbolic_JJ acid_NN must_MD be_VB tested_VBN as_IN to_TO ``_`` the_DT amount_NN of_IN resin_NN and_CC caustic_JJ soda_NN used_VBN before_IN the_DT entire_JJ lot_NN is_VBZ converted_VBN ``_`` into_IN larvacide_NN ._.
As_IN the_DT crude_NN carbolic_JJ varies_NNS greatly_RB ,_, each_DT shipment_NN must_MD ``_`` be_VB tested_VBN ._.
The_DT cost_NN of_IN the_DT larvacide_NN manufactured_VBD at_IN Ancon_NNP is_VBZ about_IN 141/2_CD ``_`` cents_NNS per_IN gallon_NN ,_, United_NNP States_NNPS Currency_NNP ._. ''_''
201_CD ._.
Owing_VBG to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN it_PRP was_VBD impossible_JJ to_TO obtain_VB crude_JJ carbolic_JJ acid_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP of_IN the_DT kind_NN specified_VBN by_IN Colonel_NNP Gorgas_NNP ,_, it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN necessary_JJ to_TO modify_VB the_DT formula_NN considerably_RB in_IN order_NN to_TO prepare_VB a_DT suitable_JJ carbolic_JJ emulsion_NN for_IN experimental_JJ use_NN ._.
The_DT crude_NN carbolic_JJ acid_NN obtained_VBN had_VBD a_DT specific_JJ gravity_NN of_IN 1.040_CD and_CC was_VBD stated_VBN to_TO contain_VB 97_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN phenols_NNS and_CC cresols_NNS ._.
This_DT acid_NN required_VBD five_CD times_NNS the_DT amount_NN of_IN resin_NN and_CC soda_VB given_VBN in_IN 79_CD the_DT previous_JJ formula_NN and_CC the_DT resulting_VBG preparation_NN when_WRB cold_NN formed_VBD a_DT thick_JJ dark_NN brown_IN pasty_JJ mass_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD therefore_RB heated_VBN up_RP and_CC diluted_VBN with_IN three_CD parts_NNS of_IN water_NN ,_, when_WRB it_PRP formed_VBD a_DT dark_JJ brown_JJ treacle-like_JJ liquid_NN smelling_VBG strongly_RB of_IN carbolic_JJ acid_NN ._.

of_IN the_DT crude_NN carbolic_JJ acid_NN ._.

204_CD ._.
As_IN crude_JJ carbolic_JJ acid_NN can_MD be_VB obtained_VBN in_IN bulk_NN at_IN a_DT price_NN of_IN about_IN one_CD rupee_NN a_DT gallon_NN or_CC less_JJR ,_, an_DT exceedingly_RB cheap_JJ and_CC efficient_JJ larvacide_NN can_MD be_VB prepared_VBN from_IN it_PRP ._.
In_IN use_NN it_PRP is_VBZ found_VBN to_TO have_VB more_JJR action_NN upon_IN larv_JJR than_IN pup_NN ,_, and_CC nearly_RB mature_JJ larv_JJ pupate_NN rapidly_RB on_IN coming_VBG into_IN contact_NN with_IN it_PRP ,_, so_IN that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ a_DT good_JJ plan_NN to_TO combine_VB its_PRP$ use_NN with_IN that_DT of_IN kerosene_NN or_CC pesterine_NN ._.
The_DT original_JJ solution_NN mixes_NNS with_IN either_DT kerosene_NN or_CC pesterine_NN and_CC very_RB greatly_RB improves_VBZ their_PRP$ toxic_JJ action_NN and_CC their_PRP$ powers_NNS of_IN spreading_VBG quickly_RB and_CC evenly_RB ._.

205_CD ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB remarked_VBN that_IN the_DT above_JJ experiments_NNS were_VBD conducted_VBN in_IN the_DT dry_JJ weather_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ some_DT ground_NN for_IN assuming_VBG that_IN the_DT effect_NN of_IN larva-_JJ cides_NNS is_VBZ greater_JJR upon_IN mosquito_NN larv_NN hatched_VBN in_IN the_DT rainy_NN season_NN ,_, as_IN in_IN a_DT previous_JJ series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS carried_VBD out_RP in_IN the_DT rains_NNS ,_, larv_NN died_VBD more_RBR quickly_RB ,_, in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN every_DT larvacide_NN used_VBN ._.
It_PRP would_MD appear_VB from_IN this_DT that_WDT dry_VBZ weather_JJR larv_NN are_VBP naturally_RB more_RBR resistant_JJ to_TO adverse_VB influences_NNS than_IN those_DT produced_VBN in_IN the_DT rainy_NN season_NN ._.
206_CD ._.
A_DT further_JJ series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS were_VBD made_VBN with_IN non-poisonous_JJ larvacides-Malachite_JJ green_NN and_CC a_DT new_JJ preparation_NN ``_`` XeX_NN ''_'' *_NN prepared_VBN by_IN a_DT Swiss_JJ firm_NN and_CC available_JJ in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
Malachite_NNP green_JJ destroys_NN mosquito_NN larv_NN in_IN dilutions_NNS as_RB low_JJ as_IN 1-25,000_CD in_IN about_RB 24_CD hours_NNS ._.
Unfortunately_RB the_DT brilliant_JJ bluish-green_JJ colour_NN it_PRP gives_VBZ to_TO water_NN is_VBZ highly_RB objectionable_JJ and_CC water_NN treated_VBN with_IN it_PRP does_VBZ not_RB appear_VB to_TO retain_VB its_PRP$ larvacidal_NN properties_NNS very_RB long_RB ._.
207_CD ._.
XeX_NN green_NN has_VBZ been_VBN experimented_VBN with_IN in_IN Italy_NNP and_CC in_IN Ceylon_NNP and_CC appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB given_VBN satisfaction_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ especially_RB useful_JJ in_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN animals_NNS can_MD drink_VB water_NN containing_VBG it_PRP without_IN ill_JJ effect_NN ._.
As_IN supplied_VBN it_PRP is_VBZ in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN a_DT thick_JJ paste_NN of_IN a_DT greenish_JJ brown_IN colour_NN ._.
It_PRP mixes_VBD fairly_RB easily_RB with_IN water_NN ,_, forming_VBG a_DT dirty_JJ yellowish_JJ solution_NN ._.
Experiments_NNS with_IN larv_NN in_IN vitro_NN gave_VBD the_DT following_JJ results_NNS :_: -_: XeX_NN Green_NNP ._.
Anopheles_NNS larv_VBP ._.
Culex_NNP larv_NN ._.

Solution_NNP 1-1,000_CD All_NNP died_VBD in_IN 20_CD minutes_NNS ._.
All_DT died_VBD in_IN an_DT hour_NN ._.
All_DT died_VBD in_IN hour_NN ._.

All_DT died_VBD in_IN 3_CD to_TO 4_CD hours_NNS ._.
All_DT died_VBD in_IN 3_CD to_TO 4_CD hours_NNS ._.
A_DT small_JJ pool_NN containing_VBG mosquito_NN larv_NN was_VBD sprayed_VBN with_IN a_DT fairly_RB strong_JJ solution_NN so_RB as_IN to_TO form_VB approximately_RB a_DT solution_NN of_IN a_DT strength_NN of_IN about_IN 1-4,000_CD ._.
On_IN the_DT following_JJ day_NN all_PDT the_DT mosquito_NN larv_NN were_VBD dead_JJ ._.
These_DT experiments_NNS appear_VBP to_TO show_VB that_IN the_DT new_JJ larvacide_NN is_VBZ likely_JJ to_TO be_VB of_IN service_NN especially_RB where_WRB toxic_JJ larvacides_NNS can_MD not_RB be_VB used_VBN ._.
At_IN present_JJ there_EX is_VBZ no_DT data_NN to_TO show_VB how_WRB long_JJ water_NN once_RB treated_VBD remains_NNS toxic_JJ to_TO mosquito_VB larv_NN ._.

1911_CD ._.
?_. 81_CD CHAPTER_NN VI_NNP ._.
BRIEF_NNP SURVEY_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP FACTORS_NNP WHICH_NNP INFLUENCE_NNP MALARIA_NNP IN_NNP BOMBAY_NNP ._.
208_CD ._.
A_DT consideration_NN of_IN the_DT facts_NNS that_WDT have_VBP been_VBN discussed_VBN in_IN the_DT fore-_JJ going_VBG chapters_NNS indicates_VBZ that_IN there_EX is_VBZ no_DT direct_JJ relation_NN between_IN the_DT climatic_JJ conditions_NNS of_IN Bombay_NNP and_CC the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN malaria_NNS ,_, for_IN though_IN the_DT climate_NN in_IN every_DT part_NN of_IN such_JJ a_DT small_JJ island_NN must_MD be_VB almost_RB identical_JJ in_IN character_NN ,_, malaria_NN is_VBZ prevalent_VBN in_IN some_DT parts_NNS and_CC almost_RB absent_NN in_IN others_NNS ._.
Neither_DT is_VBZ it_PRP possible_JJ to_TO trace_VB any_DT relation_NN between_IN the_DT soil_NN and_CC malaria_NN for_IN a_DT similar_JJ reason_NN ._.
No_DT relation_NN can_MD be_VB traced_VBN also_RB between_IN cultivation_NN and_CC malaria_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, for_IN where_WRB there_EX is_VBZ most_JJS cultivation_NN there_EX is_VBZ least_JJ malaria_NNS and_CC the_DT existence_NN of_IN rice_NN lands_NNS and_CC palm_NN groves_NNS in_IN the_DT north_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN has_VBZ not_RB rendered_VBN these_DT parts_NNS malarious_VBP ._.
As_IN has_VBZ been_VBN previously_RB pointed_VBN out_RP ,_, the_DT low-lying_NN ,_, undrained_JJ and_CC swampy_JJ parts_NNS of_IN Bombay_NNP are_VBP less_RBR malarious_JJ than_IN the_DT parts_NNS that_WDT have_VBP been_VBN longest_JJS drained_VBN and_CC that_IN as_IN a_DT rule_NN are_VBP not_RB liable_JJ to_TO flooding_VBG and_CC it_PRP follows_VBZ that_DT little_JJ direct_JJ relation_NN can_MD be_VB traced_VBN between_IN the_DT height_NN of_IN sub-soil_JJ water_NN and_CC malaria_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
209_CD ._.
Thus_RB in_IN Bombay_NNP malaria_NN presents_VBZ a_DT complete_JJ contradiction_NN to_TO many_JJ of_IN the_DT commonly_RB accepted_JJ generalizations_NNS regarding_VBG the_DT disease_NN ._.
But_CC on_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN when_WRB the_DT presence_NN of_IN malaria-carrying_JJ anopheles_NNS and_CC their_PRP$ breeding_NN places_NNS are_VBP carefully_RB enquired_VBN into_IN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ seen_VBN that_IN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT remarkable_JJ correspondence_NN between_IN them_PRP and_CC the_DT presence_NN of_IN malaria_NN on_IN the_DT island_NN ._.
210_CD ._.
Nowadays_VBZ the_DT terms_NNS ``_`` malarious_JJ country_NN ''_'' and_CC ``_`` malarious_JJ climate_NN ''_'' are_VBP not_RB really_RB accurate_JJ and_CC their_PRP$ continued_VBN use_NN gives_VBZ rise_NN to_TO a_DT certain_JJ amount_NN of_IN confusion_NN in_IN the_DT minds_NNS of_IN those_DT who_WP do_VBP not_RB realize_VB that_IN ,_, when_WRB a_DT place_NN or_CC climate_NN is_VBZ spoken_VBN of_IN as_IN being_VBG malarious_JJ what_WP is_VBZ really_RB meant_JJ is_VBZ that_IN ,_, many_JJ of_IN the_DT people_NNS are_VBP infected_VBN with_IN malarial_JJ parasites_NNS and_CC that_IN conditions_NNS are_VBP suitable_JJ for_IN the_DT existence_NN of_IN species_NNS of_IN mosquitoes_NNS capable_JJ of_IN carrying_VBG the_DT disease_NN ._.
211_CD ._.
As_IN malaria_NN is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO the_DT presence_NN of_IN a_DT minute_NN animal_NN parasite_NN which_WDT passes_VBZ one_CD stage_NN of_IN its_PRP$ existence_NN in_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN man_NN and_CC another_DT in_IN the_DT body_NN of_IN a_DT female_JJ anopheles_NNS mosquito_NNS of_IN a_DT suitable_JJ species_NNS ,_, the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN malarial_JJ disease_NN in_IN any_DT place_NN is_VBZ dependent_JJ upon_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN the_DT three_CD factors_NNS :_: (_( A_DT )_) Man_NN ,_, (_( B_NNP )_) The_DT malaria_NN parasite_NN ,_, (_( C_NNP )_) A_NNP suitable_JJ species_NNS of_IN anopheles_NNS ,_, and_CC in_IN general_JJ it_PRP may_MD be_VB said_VBD that_IN the_DT severity_NN of_IN malaria_NN depends_VBZ upon_IN the_DT numerical_JJ relations_NNS of_IN these_DT different_JJ factors_NNS ._.
212_CD ._.
Broadly_RB speaking_VBG it_PRP may_MD be_VB said_VBD that_IN in_IN malarious_JJ places_NNS the_DT effect_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN among_IN the_DT population_NN is_VBZ proportionate_JJ to_TO the_DT number_NN of_IN malarial_JJ parasites_NNS actually_RB present_JJ ._.
If_IN there_EX are_VBP only_RB a_DT few_JJ million_CD parasites_NNS distributed_VBN among_IN a_DT thousand_CD people_NNS ,_, there_EX will_MD be_VB only_RB a_DT few_JJ cases_NNS of_IN mild_JJ malaria_NNS ,_, whereas_NNS if_IN the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN parasites_NNS is_VBZ many_JJ million_CD times_NNS greater_JJR both_DT the_DT number_NN of_IN sufferers_NNS and_CC the_DT severity_NN of_IN the_DT cases_NNS will_MD be_VB proportionately_RB increased_VBN ._.
213_CD ._.
The_DT number_NN of_IN malarial_JJ parasites_NNS present_VBP in_IN a_DT community_NN tends_VBZ to_TO increase_VB or_CC decrease_VB under_IN certain_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
(_( 1_CD )_) The_DT presence_NN of_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN anopheles_NNS mosquitoes_NNS of_IN a_DT species_NNS capable_JJ of_IN carrying_VBG malaria_NN tends_NNS to_TO produce_VB an_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN parasites_NNS owing_VBG to_TO the_DT spread_NN of_IN infection_NN ,_, whereas_IN a_DT reduction_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN suitable_JJ anopheles_NNS tends_NNS to_TO produce_VB a_DT fall_NN in_IN the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN parasites_NNS due_JJ to_TO a_DT lessened_VBN spread_NN of_IN infection_NN ._.
B_IN 136-21_JJ ?_. 82_CD (_( 2_CD )_) Among_IN infected_JJ people_NNS ,_, climatic_JJ ,_, social_JJ and_CC economic_JJ and_CC other_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, if_IN favourable_JJ to_TO man_NN ,_, tend_VBP to_TO reduce_VB the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN parasites_NNS ,_, by_IN increasing_VBG the_DT powers_NNS of_IN resistance_NN of_IN the_DT persons_NNS concerned_VBN ;_: whereas_NNS if_IN unfavourable_JJ they_PRP may_MD cause_VB an_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN malarial_JJ parasites_NNS by_IN lowering_VBG the_DT powers_NNS of_IN resistance_NN of_IN these_DT persons_NNS ._.
Section_NN 1_CD ._.
214_CD ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ necessary_JJ therefore_RB to_TO consider_VB in_IN some_DT detail_NN both_DT the_DT conditions_NNS which_WDT may_MD influence_VB the_DT number_NN of_IN malaria-carrying_JJ anopheles_NNS and_CC those_DT which_WDT may_MD influence_VB man_NN 's_POS powers_NNS of_IN resistance_NN to_TO malaria_NNS ._.
The_DT conditions_NNS relating_VBG to_TO anopheles_NNS ,_, which_WDT may_MD influence_VB malaria_NNS ,_, are_VBP :_: -_: (_( 1_CD )_) Species_NNPS of_IN anopheles_NNS ,_, (_( 2_CD )_) Number_NNP of_IN anopheles_NNS ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) Character_NN of_IN breeding_VBG places-_JJ (_( i_NN )_) Drainage_NN ._.
(_( ii_NN )_) Swamps_NNP ._.
(_( iii_NN )_) Rice_NNP growing_VBG and_CC Irrigation_NNP ._.
(_( 4_CD )_) Rainfall_NN ._.
(_( 5_CD )_) Other_JJ climatic_JJ conditions-_NN (_( i_NN )_) Temperature_NN ._.
(_( ii_NN )_) Humidity_NNP ._.

(_( 2_CD )_) Economic_NNP condition_NN ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) Social_NNP condition_NN ._.
(_( 4_CD )_) Overcrowding_NN ._.

215_CD ._.
Species_NNS of_IN Anopheles.-We_NNP have_VBP already_RB seen_VBN in_IN the_DT chapter_NN on_IN mosquitoes_NNS that_IN there_EX are_VBP seven_CD species_NNS of_IN anopheles_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP which_WDT ,_, from_IN the_DT point_NN of_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN malaria_NNS ,_, may_MD be_VB divided_VBN into_IN three_CD groups_NNS ._.
Known_VBN dangerous_JJ carriers_NNS of_IN malaria_NNS ._.
(_( 1_CD )_) N._NNP stephensi_NN ,_, M._NNP listoni_NN ,_, M._NNP culicifacies_NNS ,_, and_CC N._NNP filiginosus_NN ._.
Possible_JJ carriers_NNS of_IN malaria_NNS ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) N._NNP jamesi_NN and_CC M._NNP barbirostris_NN ._.
Non-carrier_NNP of_IN malaria_NN ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) Nysso-M._NNP rossi_NN ._.
If_IN we_PRP compare_VBP a_DT map_NN showing_VBG the_DT distribution_NN of_IN mosquitoes_NNS of_IN group_NN 1_CD with_IN another_DT map_NN showing_VBG the_DT distribution_NN of_IN malaria_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, it_PRP becomes_VBZ apparent_JJ at_IN once_RB that_IN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT close_JJ relationship_NN between_IN the_DT existence_NN of_IN malaria_NN among_IN the_DT population_NN and_CC the_DT presence_NN of_IN the_DT known_JJ carriers_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN group_NN 2_CD no_DT such_JJ definite_JJ relation_NN is_VBZ apparent_JJ ,_, and_CC though_IN possibly_RB N._NNP jamesi_NN may_MD be_VB concerned_VBN in_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN malaria_NN to_TO some_DT extent_NN the_DT fact_NN that_IN this_DT mosquito_NN often_RB occurs_VBZ in_IN association_NN with_IN either_DT ,_, N._NNP ,_, stephensi_NN or_CC M._NNP culifacies_NNS or_CC listoni_JJ obscures_VBZ the_DT relationship_NN ._.
It_PRP appears_VBZ reasonably_RB to_TO assume_VB that_IN M._NNP barbirostris_NN is_VBZ not_RB responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN malaria_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP because_IN the_DT places_NNS in_IN which_WDT it_PRP occurs_VBZ abundantly_RB ,_, i._NN e._NN ,_, Mahim_NNP and_CC other_JJ parts_NNS in_IN the_DT north_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN ,_, show_VBP little_JJ evidence_NN of_IN infection_NN ._.
As_IN regards_NNS Nysso-M._NNP rossi_NN which_WDT is_VBZ present_JJ in_IN large_JJ numbers_NNS all_DT over_IN the_DT island_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ conclusive_JJ evidence_NN that_IN it_PRP does_VBZ not_RB carry_VB malaria_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP and_CC as_IN might_MD be_VB expected_VBN no_DT relation_NN can_MD be_VB traced_VBN between_IN its_PRP$ presence_NN and_CC the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN malaria_NN ._.
216_CD ._.
Number_NNP of_IN dangerous_JJ Anopheles_NNS and_CC Malaria_NNP in_IN Bombay.-Broadly_NNP speaking_VBG a_DT definite_JJ relationship_NN can_MD be_VB traced_VBN between_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN malaria_NN present_NN in_IN different_JJ localities_NNS and_CC the_DT number_NN of_IN dangerous_JJ anopheles_NNS present_VBP there_RB as_IN judged_VBN by_IN the_DT findings_NNS of_IN larv_NN and_CC the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN breeding_VBG places_NNS ._.
In_IN Esplanade_NNP and_CC parts_NNS of_IN the_DT North_NNP Fort_NNP where_WRB very_RB large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN breeding_VBG No_DT :_: VIII_NN ._.
?_. 83_CD places_NNS of_IN N._NNP stephensi_JJ exist_NN and_CC where_WRB adult_NN insects_NNS can_MD be_VB caught_VBN fairly_RB easily_RB the_DT index_NN of_IN malarial_JJ infection_NN is_VBZ very_RB high_JJ and_CC in_IN Dhobi_NNP Talao_NNP where_WRB breeding_NN places_NNS are_VBP also_RB numerous_JJ both_CC the_DT spleen_JJ index_NN and_CC parasite_JJ index_NN show_NN malaria_NN to_TO be_VB exceedingly_RB prevalent_JJ ._.
In_IN B_NNP ward_VBP the_DT portion_NN most_RBS affected_JJ with_IN malaria_NN adjoins_VBZ the_DT New_NNP Dock_NNP enclosure_NN where_WRB many_JJ breeding_NN places_NNS of_IN N._NNP stephensi_NN occur_NN ._.
In_IN South_NNP Fort_NNP ,_, Colaba_NNP and_CC Market_NNP Sections_NNP breeding_VBG places_NNS of_IN N._NNP stephensi_NN are_VBP more_RBR widely_RB scattered_VBN and_CC malaria_NNS is_VBZ present_JJ in_IN lessened_JJ amount_NN ._.
In_IN Dongri_NNP ,_, Umarkhadi_NNP ,_, Khara_NNP Talao_NNP ,_, Kumbarwada_NNP and_CC the_DT greater_JJR portion_NN of_IN Bhuleshwar_NNP ,_, breeding_NN places_NNS are_VBP not_RB very_RB numerous_JJ but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ that_IN they_PRP existed_VBD there_EX in_IN greater_JJR number_NN previously_RB ,_, especially_RB in_IN areas_NNS which_WDT have_VBP been_VBN demolished_VBN by_IN the_DT Improvement_NNP Trust_NNP ._.
In_IN Fanaswadi_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Girgaum_NNP ,_, a_DT portion_NN of_IN Bhuleshwar_NNP ,_, Chowpati_NNP and_CC Khetwadi_NNP ,_, there_EX are_VBP a_DT number_NN of_IN breeding_VBG places_NNS but_CC they_PRP are_VBP rather_RB widely_RB scattered_VBN and_CC with_IN few_JJ exceptions_NNS appear_VBP to_TO harbour_VB comparatively_RB scanty_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN N._NNP stephensi_NN ._.
Further_RB to_TO the_DT north_NN with_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN the_DT neighbourhood_NN of_IN the_DT reservoirs_NNS at_IN Malabar_NNP Hill_NNP and_CC Bhandarwada_NNP ,_, the_DT number_NN of_IN malaria-carrying_JJ anopheles_NNS ,_, as_IN judged_VBN by_IN the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN their_PRP$ breeding_NN places_NNS ,_, diminishes_NNS very_RB greatly_RB ;_: and_CC in_IN the_DT extreme_JJ north_JJ N._NNP stephensi_NN is_VBZ absent_JJ and_CC only_RB a_DT few_JJ breeding_NN places_NNS of_IN M._NNP listoni_NN and_CC M._NNP culicifacies_NNS exist_VBP ._.
The_DT number_NN of_IN the_DT latter_JJ mosquitoes_NNS too_RB appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB very_RB limited_JJ as_IN their_PRP$ larv_NN are_VBP always_RB found_VBN in_IN very_RB scanty_JJ numbers_NNS ._.
217_CD ._.
Character_NN of_IN Breeding_NNP Places_NNPS of_IN Malaria-carriers_NNS in_IN relation_NN to_TO the_DT prevalence_NN of_IN Malaria_NNP in_IN Bombay.-In_NNP the_DT Chapter_NN on_IN mosquitoes_NNS it_PRP was_VBD stated_VBN that_IN the_DT commonest_JJS breeding_NN places_NNS of_IN malaria-carrying_NN mosquitoes_NNS were_VBD open_JJ wells_NNS ;_: and_CC in_IN particular_JJ 65_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT breeding_NN places_NNS favoured_VBD be_VB N._NNP stephensi_NN were_VBD of_IN this_DT character_NN ._.
Of_IN these_DT wells_NNS ,_, the_DT ones_NNS situated_VBD inside_JJ dwells_NNS ing-houses_NNS are_VBP usually_RB the_DT most_JJS prolific_JJ producers_NNS of_IN N._NNP stephensi_NN ,_, whereas_VBP those_DT in_IN the_DT open_JJ ,_, although_IN frequently_RB infected_VBN ,_, often_RB show_VBP only_RB scanty_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN larv_NN ._.
Pools_NNS of_IN water_NN do_VBP not_RB appear_VB to_TO be_VB greatly_RB favoured_VBN by_IN N._NNP stephensi_NN and_CC other_JJ malaria-carrying_JJ anopheles_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP ;_: and_CC with_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN the_DT surface_NN pools_NNS which_WDT occur_VBP in_IN the_DT New_NNP Dock_NNP Works_NNP and_CC some_DT of_IN the_DT neighbouring_NN yards_NNS ,_, which_WDT are_VBP prolific_JJ breeding_VBG places_NNS during_IN the_DT monsoons_NNS larv_WDT are_VBP never_RB very_RB plentiful_JJ in_IN them_PRP ._.
But_CC tin-pots_NNS ,_, tubs_NNS and_CC other_JJ small_JJ collections_NNS of_IN water_NN appear_VBP to_TO be_VB very_RB suitable_JJ breeding_NN places_NNS ,_, for_IN when_WRB the_DT larv_NN of_IN N._NNP stephensi_NN has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN in_IN such_JJ situations_NNS it_PRP has_VBZ generally_RB been_VBN present_JJ in_IN considerable_JJ numbers_NNS ._.
Cisterns_NNP vary_JJ very_RB greatly_RB as_IN regards_NNS their_PRP$ output_NN of_IN N._NNP stephensi_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT monsoon_NN they_PRP often_RB produce_VBP considerable_JJ numbers_NNS but_CC ,_, when_WRB the_DT weather_NN is_VBZ warm_JJ and_CC dry_JJ ,_, the_DT water_NN in_IN cisterns_NNS whose_WP$ sides_NNS are_VBP exposed_VBN to_TO the_DT sun_NN often_RB becomes_VBZ quite_RB hot_JJ and_CC this_DT does_VBZ not_RB appear_VB to_TO be_VB favourable_JJ to_TO mosquito_VB larv_NN ._.
The_DT existence_NN of_IN favourable_JJ breeding_NN places_NNS of_IN the_DT malaria-carriers_NNS is_VBZ of_IN course_NN directly_RB responsible_JJ for_IN their_PRP$ numbers_NNS ,_, and_CC in_IN this_DT way_NN a_DT more_RBR or_CC less_RBR direct_JJ relationship_NN can_MD be_VB traced_VBN between_IN the_DT character_NN of_IN breeding_VBG places_NNS and_CC the_DT prevalence_NN of_IN malaria_NN ._.
As_IN has_VBZ already_RB been_VBN pointed_VBN out_RP ,_, the_DT existence_NN of_IN swamps_NNS and_CC large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN pools_NNS ,_, the_DT lack_NN of_IN drainage_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT continuance_NN of_IN rice_NN cultivation_NN in_IN the_DT north_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN does_VBZ not_RB appear_VB to_TO increase_VB malaria_NNS to_TO any_DT appreciable_JJ extent_NN ,_, as_IN shown_VBN by_IN the_DT low_JJ spleen_NN and_CC parasite_JJ indices_NNS observed_VBD there_RB ._.
218_CD ._.
Rainfall_DT and_CC Malaria_NNP in_IN Bombay.-The_NNP malarious_JJ season_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP begins_VBZ shortly_RB after_IN the_DT commencement_NN of_IN the_DT rains_NNS and_CC continues_VBZ for_IN a_DT certain_JJ period_NN after_IN they_PRP have_VBP ceased_VBN ._.
Cases_NNS of_IN malaria_NNS usually_RB show_VBP an_DT increase_NN in_IN July_NNP and_CC infected_VBN anopheles_NNS are_VBP met_VBN with_IN in_IN considerable_JJ numbers_NNS in_IN that_DT month_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ difficult_JJ to_TO trace_VB any_DT relation_NN between_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN rainfall_NN and_CC the_DT prevalence_NN of_IN malaria_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ little_JJ evidence_NN to_TO show_VB that_IN years_NNS of_IN excessive_JJ rain_NN have_VBP been_VBN specially_RB malarious_JJ and_CC in_IN 1907_CD which_WDT had_VBD a_DT rainfall_NN of_IN 100_CD inches_NNS ,_, although_IN there_EX was_VBD a_DT considerable_JJ amount_NN of_IN malaria_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD not_RB nearly_RB as_RB much_JJ as_IN in_IN 1908_CD ,_, which_WDT had_VBD a_DT short_JJ rainfall_NN of_IN only_RB 51_CD inches_NNS ._.
In_IN both_DT 1909_CD and_CC 1910_CD ,_, although_IN the_DT rainfall_NN exceeded_VBD that_IN of_IN 1908_CD ,_, malaria_NN was_VBD much_RB less_JJR than_IN in_IN 1908_CD ._.
The_DT explanation_NN of_IN this_DT want_NN of_IN relation_NN between_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN rainfall_NN and_CC prevalence_NN of_IN malaria_NN is_VBZ to_TO be_VB sought_VBN in_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT majority_NN of_IN the_DT breeding_NN places_NNS of_IN the_DT malaria-carrying_JJ anopheles_NNS of_IN Bombay_NNP ?_. 84_CD are_VBP little_JJ influenced_JJ by_IN rain_NN ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB remarked_VBN also_RB that_DT in_IN 1909-1910_JJ many_JJ of_IN the_DT breeding_NN places_NNS in_IN the_DT Dockyard_NNP ,_, etc._NN ,_, which_WDT might_MD be_VB so_RB influenced_JJ were_VBD treated_VBN with_IN larvacides_NNS ._.
Distribution_NN of_IN rainfall_NN probably_RB exerts_VBZ some_DT influence_NN upon_IN malaria_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
It_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN in_IN July_NNP 1910_CD that_IN during_IN a_DT long_JJ break_NN in_IN the_DT rains_NNS a_DT larger_JJR proportion_NN of_IN sporozoit-carrying_JJ anopheles_NNS was_VBD met_VBN with_IN than_IN at_IN any_DT other_JJ time_NN ,_, whereas_NNS during_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN nearly_RB continuous_JJ rain_VBP the_DT proportion_NN of_IN sporozoit-bearing_JJ anopheles_NNS was_VBD greatly_RB reduced_VBN ._.
It_PRP appears_VBZ probable_JJ that_IN the_DT hot_JJ sunny_NN weather_NN combined_VBN with_IN high_JJ atmospheric_JJ humidity_NN that_WDT usually_RB characterises_VBZ the_DT breaks_NNS in_IN the_DT rains_NNS is_VBZ favourable_JJ to_TO infected_JJ anopheles_NNS ,_, whereas_NNS in_IN periods_NNS of_IN continuous_JJ rain_VBP many_JJ of_IN the_DT insects_NNS perish_JJ ,_, being_VBG killed_VBN possibly_RB by_IN exposure_NN to_TO rain_VB when_WRB attempting_VBG to_TO lay_VB their_PRP$ eggs_NNS ._.
219_CD ._.
Temperature_NN and_CC Malaria_NNP in_IN Bombay.-_NNP (_( 1_CD )_) Heat_NN ._.
High_JJ temperature_NN is_VBZ favourable_JJ to_TO the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN malaria_NNS especially_RB when_WRB associated_VBN with_IN rain_NN ;_: and_CC exposure_NN to_TO a_DT high_JJ temperature_NN appears_VBZ to_TO promote_VB both_PDT the_DT onset_NN of_IN symptoms_NNS of_IN an_DT infection_NN in_IN man_NN and_CC the_DT occurrences_NNS of_IN relapses_NNS ._.
In_IN Bombay_NNP relapses_NNS of_IN malaria_NNS often_RB occur_VBP at_IN the_DT hottest_JJS time_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN and_CC the_DT period_NN of_IN new_JJ infection_NN coincides_NNS with_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN slightly_RB lower_JJR but_CC almost_RB uniform_JJ high_JJ temperature_NN ._.
High_JJ temperature_NN also_RB shortens_VBZ the_DT larval_NN and_CC pupal_JJ stage_NN of_IN anopheles_NNS and_CC is_VBZ favourable_JJ to_TO the_DT increase_NN of_IN mosquitoes_NNS in_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN suitable_JJ condition_NN of_IN humidity_NN ,_, etc_FW ._.
It_PRP also_RB quickens_VBZ the_DT development_NN of_IN sporozoits_NNS in_IN infected_JJ mosquitoes_NNS ._.
220_CD ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) Cold_NNP ._.
Observation_NN has_VBZ shown_VBN that_IN the_DT parasite_NN of_IN malaria_NNS will_MD not_RB develop_VB in_IN the_DT mosquito_NN at_IN a_DT temperature_NN below_IN 60_CD Fahrenheit_NNP ;_: but_CC the_DT temper-_JJ ature_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP rarely_RB falls_VBZ as_RB low_JJ as_IN this_DT and_CC never_RB remain_VBP below_IN 65_CD Fah_NNP ._.
for_IN more_JJR than_IN a_DT few_JJ hours_NNS ,_, so_RB that_IN as_RB far_RB as_IN temperature_NN is_VBZ concerned_JJ infection_NN of_IN anopheles_NNS can_MD go_VB on_IN all_DT through_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
The_DT onset_NN of_IN the_DT colder_NN weather_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, as_IN in_IN other_JJ malarious_JJ countries_NNS ,_, is_VBZ often_RB the_DT cause_NN of_IN sudden_JJ small_JJ outbreaks_NNS of_IN malaria_NNS due_JJ to_TO the_DT maturing_NN of_IN infections_NNS contracted_VBN at_IN an_DT earlier_JJR period_NN ;_: and_CC the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN relapses_NNS is_VBZ also_RB favoured_VBN by_IN cold_NN ._.
Infections_NNS which_WDT have_VBP remained_VBN latent_JJ often_RB appear_VBP when_WRB the_DT diurnal_JJ variation_NN of_IN the_DT temperature_NN increases_VBZ suddenly_RB ,_, owing_VBG possibly_RB to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT resisting_VBG power_NN of_IN infected_JJ persons_NNS may_MD have_VB been_VBN slightly_RB reduced_VBN by_IN the_DT change_NN ._.
In_IN Bombay_NNP whenever_WRB the_DT variation_NN between_IN the_DT night_NN and_CC day_NN temperature_NN exceeds_VBZ 10_CD or_CC 12_CD degrees_NNS cases_NNS of_IN malaria_JJ increase_NN in_IN number_NN ,_, a_DT fact_NN which_WDT is_VBZ very_RB apparent_JJ each_DT October_NNP ._.
221_CD ._.
Atmospheric_NNP Humidity_NNP and_CC Malaria_NNP in_IN Bombay.-The_NNP malarious_JJ season_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP coincides_NNS with_IN the_DT period_NN of_IN highest_JJS and_CC most_RBS uniform_JJ atmospheric_JJ humidity_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ that_IN this_DT is_VBZ due_JJ partly_RB to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN excessive_JJ humidity_NN is_VBZ favourable_JJ to_TO insect_VB life_NN and_CC partly_RB because_IN it_PRP acts_VBZ as_IN a_DT depressing_JJ influence_NN upon_IN man_NN ._.
When_WRB the_DT humidity_NN of_IN the_DT atmosphere_NN rises_VBZ ,_, mosquitoes_VBZ become_VB very_RB active_JJ and_CC bite_VB more_JJR readily_RB than_IN at_IN other_JJ times_NNS and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ probable_JJ that_IN this_DT condition_NN conduces_NNS to_TO their_PRP$ longevity_NN also_RB ._.
There_EX is_VBZ the_DT further_JJ possibility_NN that_IN atmospheric_JJ humidity_NN may_MD influence_VB the_DT development_NN of_IN malaria_NN parasites_NNS in_IN the_DT body_NN of_IN the_DT mosquito_NN ._.
Infected_VBN anopheles_NNS appear_VBP to_TO become_VB numerous_JJ in_IN Bombay_NNP only_RB during_IN periods_NNS when_WRB atmospheric_JJ humidity_NN is_VBZ uniformly_RB high_JJ and_CC in_IN periods_NNS when_WRB it_PRP is_VBZ low_JJ or_CC when_WRB there_EX is_VBZ a_DT great_JJ diurnal_JJ variation_NN ,_, infected_JJ anopheles_NNS tend_VBP to_TO disappear_VB ._.

222_CD ._.
Conditions_NNS affecting_VBG malaria_NNS by_IN their_PRP$ influence_NN upon_IN man.-The_NN conditions_NNS which_WDT increase_VBP malaria_NNS by_IN influencing_VBG man_NN are_VBP those_DT which_WDT tend_VBP to_TO predispose_VB him_PRP to_TO infection_NN or_CC to_TO bring_VB about_RP relapses_NNS in_IN persons_NNS already_RB infect-_JJ ed_NN ._.
In_IN either_DT case_NN the_DT result_NN in_IN a_DT malaria-infected_JJ community_NN will_MD be_VB the_DT same_JJ ,_, namely_RB ,_, an_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN parasites_NNS present_JJ ._.
But_CC although_IN the_DT various_JJ factors_NNS which_WDT may_MD come_VB into_IN play_NN in_IN this_DT connexion_NN are_VBP important_JJ it_PRP must_MD be_VB pointed_VBN out_RP that_IN they_PRP have_VBP nothing_NN to_TO do_VB with_IN the_DT origin_NN of_IN malaria_NNS ;_: they_PRP can_MD only_RB modify_VB it_PRP when_WRB it_PRP is_VBZ present_JJ either_RB by_IN increasing_VBG or_CC reducing_VBG its_PRP$ severity_NN ._.
223_CD ._.
Social_JJ conditions_NNS in_IN relation_NN to_TO malaria_VB in_IN Bombay.-It_NNP has_VBZ often_RB been_VBN observed_VBN in_IN malarious_JJ places_NNS that_IN communities_NNS of_IN low_JJ social_JJ status_NN suffer_VBP more_RBR severely_RB than_IN those_DT of_IN higher_JJR standing_NN and_CC the_DT reason_NN for_IN this_DT is_VBZ easily_RB understood_JJ ,_, because_IN all_DT parasitic_JJ diseases_NNS tend_VBP to_TO occur_VB more_RBR frequently_RB and_CC to_TO ?_. 85_CD act_NN most_RBS intensely_RB among_IN the_DT poorer_JJR and_CC more_RBR ignorant_JJ classes_NNS ._.

This_DT is_VBZ especially_RB the_DT case_NN among_IN those_DT who_WP reside_VBP in_IN the_DT North_NNP Fort_NNP and_CC Dhobi_NNP Talao_NNP ._.
In_IN these_DT two_CD localities_NNS Prsis_NNP are_VBP probably_RB more_RBR exposed_JJ to_TO malarial_JJ infection_NN than_IN the_DT other_JJ classes_NNS of_IN the_DT community_NN by_IN reason_NN of_IN the_DT open_JJ anopheles-infested_JJ wells_NNS that_WDT are_VBP to_TO be_VB found_VBN inside_RB many_JJ Prsi_NNP dwelling-houses_NNS ._.
224_CD ._.
In_IN other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT City_NNP ,_, especially_RB in_IN portions_NNS of_IN the_DT Fort_NNP and_CC Colaba_NNP ,_, Europeans_NNPS and_CC Indians_NNPS of_IN good_JJ social_JJ standing_VBG often_RB contract_NN malaria_NNS ._.
One_CD reason_NN for_IN this_DT is_VBZ the_DT wide_JJ distribution_NN of_IN breeding_VBG places_NNS of_IN the_DT malaria_NN carrier_NN ,_, but_CC another_DT cause_NN is_VBZ the_DT fact_NN that_IN in_IN almost_RB all_PDT the_DT modern_JJ flats_NNS ,_, which_WDT are_VBP largely_RB used_VBN as_IN places_NNS of_IN residence_NN by_IN Europeans_NNPS and_CC better_JJR class_NN Indians_NNPS ,_, quarters_NNS for_IN native_JJ servants_NNS are_VBP constructed_VBN under_IN the_DT same_JJ roof_NN ._.
