6_CD ,_, Limits_NNS of_IN dangerous_JJ area_NN ._.
Pools_NNS may_MD occur_VB not_RB only_RB in_IN the_DT Cantonment_NNP but_CC in_IN the_DT dangerous_JJ zone_NN of_IN flat_JJ land_NN around_IN it_PRP ,_, which_WDT extends_VBZ for_IN miles_NNS ._.
E._NNP H._NNP Ross_NNP has_VBZ shown_VBN that_IN even_RB at_IN Ismailia_NNP ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ surrounded_VBN by_IN desert_NN ,_, a_DT few_JJ mosquitoes_NNS enter_VBP the_DT town_NN from_IN small_JJ breeding_NN places_NNS a_DT mile_NN away_RB ,_, near_IN a_DT part_NN of_IN the_DT fresh_JJ water_NN canal_NN ._.
If_IN this_DT is_VBZ the_DT case_NN at_IN Ismailia_NNP ,_, what_WP must_MD be_VB the_DT condition_NN at_IN Mian_NNP Mir_NNP which_WDT ,_, in_IN the_DT rainy_NN season_NN ,_, is_VBZ surrounded_VBN with_IN breeding_VBG places_NNS ?_.
To_TO prevent_VB malaria_NN at_IN Mian_JJ Mir_NNP it_PRP would_MD probably_RB be_VB necessary_JJ to_TO control_VB an_DT area_NN as_RB large_JJ as_IN the_DT whole_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP Island_NNP ._.
There_EX is_VBZ no_DT dangerous_JJ zone_NN around_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.
The_DT sea_NN surrounds_VBZ it_PRP on_IN three_CD sides_NNS ,_, and_CC malaria_NN is_VBZ negligible_JJ in_IN the_DT north_NN of_IN the_DT Island_NNP ._.
In_IN the_DT north_NN of_IN the_DT Island_NNP also_RB very_RB few_JJ breeding_NN places_NNS harbour_VBP malaria_NNS carrying_VBG anophelines_NNS ._.
To_TO free_VB Bombay_NNP from_IN the_DT greater_JJR part_NN of_IN the_DT malaria_NN present_NN there_RB ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ only_RB necessary_JJ to_TO control_VB an_DT area_NN of_IN about_IN 10_CD square_JJ miles_NNS ._.
This_DT comparison_NN shows_VBZ that_IN conditions_NNS are_VBP much_RB more_RBR favourable_JJ to_TO successful_JJ anopheline_JJ reduction_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP than_IN at_IN Mian_JJ Mir_NNP ._.
152_CD CHAPTER_NN VIII_NNP ._.
FINAL_NNP CONCLUSIONS_NNP REGARDING_NNP MALARIA_NNP PREVENTION_NNP IN_NNP BOMBAY_NNP ._.
447_CD ._.
In_IN the_DT preceding_NN Chapters_NNPS the_DT prevalence_NN and_CC distribution_NN of_IN malaria_NN on_IN the_DT Island_NNP of_IN Bombay_NNP have_VBP been_VBN discussed_VBN ;_: the_DT causes_NNS responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT existence_NN of_IN autochthonous_JJ malaria_NNS ,_, in_IN other_JJ words_NNS ,_, the_DT species_NNS of_IN anopheles_NNS mosquito_NNS which_WDT spreads_VBP the_DT disease_NN ,_, have_VBP been_VBN described_VBN ,_, their_PRP$ breeding_NN places_NNS have_VBP been_VBN examined_VBN ,_, and_CC their_PRP$ general_JJ distribution_NN in_IN the_DT City_NNP studied_VBD ;_: and_CC the_DT factors_NNS which_WDT tend_VBP to_TO produce_VB fluctuations_NNS in_IN the_DT intensity_NN of_IN malaria_NN from_IN year_NN to_TO year_NN have_VBP been_VBN considered_VBN ._.
The_DT measures_NNS which_WDT have_VBP been_VBN adopted_VBN from_IN time_NN to_TO time_NN with_IN a_DT view_NN of_IN mitigating_VBG the_DT disease_NN have_VBP been_VBN described_VBN ;_: and_CC the_DT cost_NN of_IN such_JJ measures_NNS and_CC the_DT difficulties_NNS to_TO be_VB encountered_VBN in_IN putting_VBG them_PRP into_IN practice_NN have_VBP been_VBN reviewed_VBN at_IN some_DT length_NN ;_: and_CC it_PRP only_RB remains_VBZ to_TO summarise_VB as_RB clearly_RB as_IN possible_JJ the_DT final_JJ conclusions_NNS that_WDT have_VBP been_VBN arrived_VBN at_IN regarding_VBG the_DT problem_NN of_IN malaria_NN prevention_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
448_CD ._.
In_IN the_DT chapter_NN on_IN ``_`` Malaria_NNP in_IN Bombay_NNP ''_'' it_PRP was_VBD shewn_NN that_IN ,_, though_IN not_RB nearly_RB as_IN prevalent_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP generally_RB as_IN in_IN many_JJ parts_NNS of_IN India_NNP ,_, the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ present_JJ in_IN every_DT part_NN of_IN the_DT Island_NNP ;_: but_CC while_IN infections_NNS are_VBP uncommon_JJ and_CC as_IN a_DT rule_NN exceedingly_RB mild_RB in_IN the_DT north_NN they_PRP are_VBP prevalent_JJ and_CC severe_JJ in_IN the_DT south_NN ;_: and_CC although_IN malaria_NN does_VBZ not_RB appear_VB to_TO be_VB directly_RB responsible_JJ for_IN a_DT very_RB heavy_JJ mortality_NN ,_, probably_RB under_IN a_DT thousand_JJ deaths_NNS per_IN annum_NN in_IN ordinary_JJ years_NNS ,_, there_EX is_VBZ reason_NN to_TO suppose_VB that_IN it_PRP gives_VBZ rise_NN to_TO a_DT great_JJ amount_NN of_IN sickness_NN ,_, from_IN 60_CD to_TO 75_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN all_DT fever_NN cases_NNS being_VBG due_JJ to_TO the_DT disease_NN ._.
The_DT resulting_JJ loss_NN to_TO the_DT City_NNP amounts_NNS ,_, on_IN the_DT average_NN ,_, to_TO a_DT sum_NN of_IN not_RB less_JJR than_IN Rs_NNP ._.
12,00,000_CD to_TO Rs_NNP ._.
13,00,000_CD per_IN annum_NN ._.
449_CD ._.
The_DT many_JJ thousand_VBP sufferers_NNS from_IN malaria_NNS are_VBP drawn_VBN from_IN every_DT class_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN ,_, the_DT rich_JJ as_RB well_RB as_IN the_DT poor_JJ ;_: but_CC of_IN the_DT different_JJ com-_JJ munities_NNS the_DT Prsis_NNPS appear_VBP to_TO shew_VB proportionately_RB the_DT greatest_JJS evidence_NN of_IN malaria_JJ infection_NN ;_: and_CC the_DT results_NNS of_IN this_DT are_VBP reflected_VBN in_IN the_DT high_JJ percentage_NN of_IN enlarged_JJ spleens_NNS among_IN Prsi_NNP children_NNS ,_, the_DT relatively_RB larger_JJR spleens_NNS among_IN these_DT children_NNS in_IN certain_JJ areas_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT general_JJ low_JJ vitality_NN of_IN the_DT race_NN ,_, indicated_VBN by_IN their_PRP$ failure_NN to_TO shew_VB a_DT natural_JJ increase_NN ,_, no_DT great_JJ excess_NN of_IN births_NNS over_IN deaths_NNS taking_VBG place_NN among_IN them_PRP from_IN year_NN to_TO year_NN ._.
450_CD ._.
In_IN the_DT chapter_NN on_IN ``_`` Mosquitoes_NNP ''_'' it_PRP was_VBD proved_VBN that_IN the_DT commonest_NN ,_, anopheles_NNS in_IN the_DT island_NN (_( N._NNP rossi_NN )_) plays_VBZ no_DT part_NN in_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ;_: but_CC Major_NNP Liston_NNP 's_POS discovery_NN of_IN the_DT part_NN played_VBN by_IN N._NNP stephensi_NN in_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN malaria_NN was_VBD confirmed_VBN ;_: and_CC it_PRP was_VBD shewn_VBN that_IN the_DT distribution_NN of_IN this_DT mosquito_NN and_CC its_PRP$ breeding_NN places_NNS in_IN the_DT City_NNP coincided_VBN in_IN a_DT remarkable_JJ manner_NN with_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT relative_JJ prevalence_NN and_CC intensity_NN of_IN malaria_NN ._.
451_CD ._.
As_IN regards_NNS the_DT malaria_NNS epidemic_IN of_IN 1908_CD ,_, the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN which_WDT suggested_VBD the_DT need_NN for_IN an_DT investigation_NN ,_, it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN shewn_VBN that_IN ,_, the_DT cause_NN of_IN the_DT outbreak_NN was_VBD neither_CC the_DT importation_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN nor_CC a_DT wave_NN of_IN malaria_NNS passing_VBG over_IN India_NNP ,_, but_CC the_DT previous_JJ existence_NN of_IN many_JJ hundreds_NNS of_IN breeding_VBG places_NNS of_IN Neocellia_NNP stephensi_NN in_IN the_DT City_NNP ,_, each_DT of_IN which_WDT formed_VBD a_DT centre_NN of_IN infection_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT way_NN many_JJ thousand_CD people_NNS became_VBD infected_JJ ,_, and_CC from_IN time_NN to_TO time_NN ,_, as_IN local_JJ conditions_NNS were_VBD favourable_JJ to_TO its_PRP$ spread_NN ,_, malaria_NN increased_VBD both_DT in_IN prevalence_NN and_CC intensity_NN ._.
In_IN 1906_CD and_CC 1907_CD there_EX were_VBD undoubtedly_RB very_RB many_JJ thousand_CD in-_JJ fected_JJ persons_NNS in_IN A._NN ,_, B._NNP and_CC C._NNP Wards_NNP ,_, and_CC the_DT sudden_JJ rise_NN in_IN the_DT prices_NNS of_IN food_NN in_IN the_DT latter_JJ half_NN of_IN 1907_CD helped_VBD to_TO intensify_VB existing_VBG infections_NNS ,_, pre-dispose_JJ to_TO relapses_NNS and_CC generally_RB favour_VBP the_DT spread_NN of_IN malaria_NN ._.
In_IN 1908_CD ,_, in_IN spite_NN of_IN a_DT short_JJ rainfall_NN ,_, the_DT distribution_NN of_IN the_DT rain_NN and_CC general_JJ climatic_JJ conditions_NNS appear_VBP to_TO have_VB been_VBN favourable_JJ to_TO the_DT production_NN of_IN large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN N._NNP stephensi_NN ,_, and_CC this_DT ,_, occurring_VBG at_IN a_DT time_NN when_WRB very_RB large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN people_NNS in_IN the_DT City_NNP were_VBD already_RB infected_VBN with_IN malaria_NN ,_, caused_VBD a_DT great_JJ intensification_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, which_WDT was_VBD enhanced_VBN by_IN the_DT further_JJ rise_NN in_IN the_DT prices_NNS of_IN food_NN in_IN September_NNP of_IN that_DT year_NN ._.
153_CD 452_CD ._.
The_DT observations_NNS relating_VBG to_TO the_DT malaria-carrying_JJ anophelines_NNS present_NN on_IN the_DT island_NN shew_NN that_IN ,_, though_IN the_DT Municipality_NNP was_VBD justified_VBN in_IN attempting_VBG to_TO combat_VB malaria_NNS by_IN measures_NNS directed_VBN against_IN mosquitoes_NNS ,_, until_IN Major_NNP Liston_NNP 's_POS discovery_NN of_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN N._NNP stephensi_NN was_VBD the_DT carrier_NN responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN most_JJS of_IN the_DT infection_NN ,_, the_DT attack_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB concentrated_VBN upon_IN the_DT most_RBS dangerous_JJ agent_NN of_IN transmission_NN ;_: and_CC in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN proper_JJ legal_JJ powers_NNS ,_, sufficiently_RB generous_JJ financial_JJ assistance_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT co-operation_NN of_IN the_DT wealthy_NN and_CC educated_JJ classes_NNS of_IN the_DT community_NN ,_, the_DT efforts_NNS of_IN the_DT sanitary_JJ authorities_NNS could_MD effect_NN only_RB a_DT slight_JJ mitigation_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
453_CD ._.
In_IN a_DT previous_JJ report_NN it_PRP was_VBD pointed_VBN out_RP that_IN ,_, in_IN India_NNP generally_RB the_DT prevention_NN of_IN malaria_NN was_VBD usually_RB a_DT question_NN of_IN mitigation_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, but_CC that_IN in_IN Bombay_NNP there_EX was_VBD good_JJ reason_NN to_TO believe_VB that_IN the_DT adoption_NN of_IN adequate_JJ measures_NNS would_MD bring_VB about_IN the_DT complete_JJ eradication_NN of_IN autochthonous_JJ malaria_NNS from_IN the_DT greater_JJR part_NN of_IN the_DT island_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ generally_RB recognized_VBN that_IN the_DT existence_NN of_IN endemic_JJ malaria_NN is_VBZ the_DT prime_JJ cause_NN of_IN epidemic_JJ malaria_NN ,_, and_CC so_RB long_RB as_IN endemic_JJ malaria_NN remains_VBZ uncontrolled_JJ ,_, epidemics_NNS are_VBP likely_JJ to_TO occur_VB ,_, whenever_WRB conditions_NNS become_VBP favourable_JJ for_IN such_JJ manifestation_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
454_CD ._.
To_TO prevent_VB epidemic_JJ malaria_NNS therefore_IN it_PRP is_VBZ necessary_JJ to_TO control_VB endemic_JJ malaria_NNS ;_: and_CC the_DT eradication_NN of_IN endemic_JJ malaria_NN from_IN Bombay_NNP must_MD be_VB aimed_VBN at_IN (_( 1_CD )_) because_IN as_RB far_RB as_IN natural_JJ obstacles_NNS are_VBP concerned_JJ it_PRP should_MD be_VB easy_JJ of_IN accomplishment_NN ,_, and_CC (_( 2_CD )_) because_IN until_IN malaria_NN has_VBZ been_VBN properly_RB controlled_VBN liability_NN to_TO the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN epidemic_JJ outbreak_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN will_MD continue_VB ._.
455_CD ._.
In_IN the_DT body_NN of_IN the_DT report_NN minor_JJ measures_NNS of_IN prevention_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN mosquito_JJ nets_NNS ,_, punkahs_NN and_CC fans_NNS are_VBP not_RB discussed_VBN ._.
They_PRP are_VBP largely_RB personal_JJ matters_NNS which_WDT have_VBP little_JJ bearing_NN upon_IN the_DT public_JJ prophylaxis_NN of_IN malaria_NN ._.
456_CD ._.
Education_NN also_RB ,_, although_IN of_IN great_JJ value_NN ,_, is_VBZ not_RB likely_JJ by_IN itself_PRP to_TO effect_NN very_RB much_RB ._.
Among_IN the_DT poor_JJ it_PRP is_VBZ useless_JJ to_TO talk_VB of_IN mosquito_NN nets_NNS and_CC ordinary_JJ measures_NNS of_IN personal_JJ prevention_NN ,_, but_CC they_PRP may_MD be_VB taught_VBN the_DT value_NN of_IN quinine_NN as_IN a_DT remedy_NN for_IN malaria_NN and_CC trained_VBD to_TO make_VB use_NN of_IN it_PRP for_IN the_DT relief_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
As_IN a_DT class_NN the_DT poor_JJ have_VBP little_JJ power_NN to_TO stop_VB the_DT spread_NN of_IN the_DT malaria_NN ,_, because_IN they_PRP can_MD not_RB control_VB the_DT breeding_NN places_NNS of_IN dangerous_JJ anopheles_NNS ,_, and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ therefore_RB not_RB of_IN much_JJ use_NN urging_VBG them_PRP to_TO pour_VB kerosine_NN on_IN water_NN or_CC to_TO attempt_VB similar_JJ measures_NNS ;_: but_CC among_IN the_DT educated_VBN and_CC the_DT wealthy_NN ,_, the_DT property-owners_NNS and_CC tax-payers_NNS ,_, those_DT who_WP have_VBP a_DT voice_NN in_IN the_DT Municipal_NNP administration_NN and_CC who_WP possess_VBP the_DT power_NN to_TO eradicate_VB malaria_NNS from_IN the_DT City_NNP ,_, education_NN regarding_VBG the_DT prevention_NN of_IN malaria_NNS by_IN public_JJ measures_NNS is_VBZ needed_VBN ,_, for_IN the_DT responsibility_NN rests_VBZ with_IN them_PRP ._.
457_CD ._.
The_DT use_NN of_IN quinine_NN ,_, though_RB often_RB of_IN supreme_JJ importance_NN where_WRB the_DT mitigation_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ all_DT that_WDT can_MD be_VB attempted_VBN ,_, becomes_NNS of_IN secondary_JJ importance_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ;_: and_CC though_IN the_DT popularization_NN of_IN the_DT remedy_NN ,_, its_PRP$ wide-_JJ spread_NN distribution_NN and_CC the_DT encouragement_NN of_IN its_PRP$ use_NN in_IN the_DT treatment_NN of_IN existing_VBG infections_NNS are_VBP likely_JJ to_TO be_VB of_IN great_JJ value_NN ,_, the_DT taking_NN of_IN doses_NNS for_IN the_DT prevention_NN of_IN fever_NN is_VBZ seen_VBN at_IN once_RB to_TO be_VB a_DT measure_NN useful_JJ possibly_RB for_IN large_JJ employers_NNS of_IN labour_NN ,_, among_IN troops_NNS and_CC prisoners_NNS and_CC for_IN private_JJ persons_NNS ,_, but_CC not_RB adapted_VBN for_IN large_JJ uncontrolled_JJ populations_NNS ._.
458_CD ._.
The_DT conclusions_NNS that_WDT have_VBP been_VBN reached_VBN regarding_VBG the_DT public_JJ measures_NNS of_IN malaria_NNS prevention_NN for_IN Bombay_NNP are_VBP as_IN follows_VBZ :_: -_: (_( 1_CD )_) The_DT measures_NNS should_MD be_VB directed_VBN against_IN mosquitoes_NNS ,_, but_CC the_DT suppres-_JJ sion_NN or_CC reduction_NN of_IN the_DT species_NNS of_IN anopheles_NNS that_WDT carry_VBP the_DT disease_NN must_MD first_RB be_VB aimed_VBN at_IN ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) The_DT measures_NNS must_MD be_VB so_RB contrived_JJ and_CC directed_VBD as_IN to_TO bring_VB about_RP not_RB merely_RB a_DT mitigation_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN but_CC the_DT eradication_NN of_IN autochthonous_JJ malaria_NNS from_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) The_DT more_RBR rapidly_RB the_DT measures_NNS are_VBP carried_VBN into_IN effect_NN the_DT greater_JJR will_MD be_VB the_DT certainty_NN of_IN their_PRP$ complete_JJ success_NN ._.
B_NNP 136-39_JJ 154_CD 459_CD ._.
Assuming_VBG that_IN the_DT Municipality_NNP decides_VBZ to_TO seriously_RB attempt_VB the_DT eradication_NN of_IN malaria_NNS the_DT following_JJ steps_NNS must_MD be_VB considered_VBN ._.
It_PRP will_MD be_VB necessary_JJ to-_NN (_( 1_CD )_) decide_VB whether_IN the_DT measures_NNS shall_MD be_VB taken_VBN against_IN all_DT mosquitoes_NNS or_CC be_VB directed_VBN specially_RB against_IN those_DT responsible_JJ for_IN malaria_NN ;_: (_( 2_CD )_) vote_NN sufficient_JJ money_NN for_IN the_DT purpose_NN ;_: (_( 3_CD )_) sanction_NN the_DT appointment_NN of_IN a_DT Special_JJ Assistant_NN to_TO the_DT Executive_NNP Health_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, who_WP can_MD devote_VB his_PRP$ whole_JJ time_NN to_TO the_DT direction_NN and_CC supervision_NN of_IN the_DT necessary_JJ measures_NNS ;_: (_( 4_CD )_) sanction_NN an_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT existing_VBG subordinate_JJ staff_NN of_IN the_DT Health_NNP Department_NNP ,_, so_RB as_IN to_TO allow_VB of_IN the_DT necessary_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN Inspectors_NNS and_CC labourers_NNS required_VBN for_IN the_DT work_NN ;_: (_( 5_CD )_) obtain_VB adequate_JJ legal_JJ powers_NNS for_IN carrying_VBG out_RP the_DT necesssary_JJ measures_NNS ._.
460_CD ._.
The_DT prevention_NN of_IN dangerous_JJ Anopheles_NNP or_CC of_IN all_DT kinds_NNS of_IN mosquitoes.-In_JJ the_DT ad_NN interim_JJ report_NN published_VBN in_IN 1910_CD it_PRP was_VBD stated_VBN that_IN the_DT conclusion_NN arrived_VBD at_IN was_VBD that_IN ,_, ``_`` The_DT prevention_NN of_IN dangerous_JJ anopheles_NNS ,_, rather_RB than_IN the_DT destruction_NN ``_`` of_IN all_DT mosquitoes_NNS ,_, must_MD form_VB the_DT key-note_NN of_IN anti-mosquito_JJ sanitation_NN ``_`` for_IN Bombay_NNP ._. ''_''
In_IN the_DT present_JJ report_NN the_DT cost_NN of_IN an_DT ``_`` all-mosquito-prevention_JJ scheme_NN ''_'' and_CC a_DT ``_`` dangerous-anopheline-prevention_JJ scheme_NN ''_'' have_VBP been_VBN compared_VBN ._.
461_CD ._.
There_EX is_VBZ much_JJ to_TO be_VB said_VBD in_IN regard_NN to_TO the_DT respective_JJ advantages_NNS of_IN these_DT two_CD measures_NNS ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB argued_VBN in_IN support_NN of_IN ``_`` all-mosquito_JJ work_NN ''_'' that_IN ,_, all_DT mosquitoes_NNS are_VBP a_DT nuisance_NN ,_, that_WDT certain_JJ species_NNS other_JJ than_IN malaria-_JJ carrying_VBG anopheles_NNS carry_VBP disease_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ a_DT good_JJ thing_NN to_TO attack_VB them_PRP all_DT ._.
In_IN particular_JJ it_PRP may_MD be_VB urged_VBN that_DT Culex_NNP fatigans_NNS and_CC N._NNP rossi_NN (_( possibly_RB )_) convey_NN filari_NN (_( the_DT cause_NN of_IN elephantiasis_NN )_) to_TO man_NN ;_: that_IN dengue_NN fever_NN is_VBZ supposed_VBN to_TO be_VB carried_VBN by_IN culicine_NN mosquitoes_NNS ,_, that_IN Stegomyia_NNP calopus_NN (_( or_CC fasciata_NN )_) carries_VBZ yellow_JJ fever_NN and_CC that_IN Manson_NNP and_CC others_NNS have_VBP already_RB warned_VBN us_PRP that_IN this_DT disease_NN may_MD be_VB introduced_VBN into_IN Asia_NNP after_IN the_DT opening_NN of_IN the_DT Panama_NNP Canal_NNP in_IN 1915_CD ._.
462_CD ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN it_PRP may_MD be_VB pointed_VBN out_RP that_IN ,_, although_IN an_DT attack_NN upon_IN all_DT kinds_NNS of_IN mosquitoes_NNS may_MD be_VB an_DT anti-malarial_JJ measure_NN ,_, unless_IN it_PRP is_VBZ carried_VBN out_IN so_RB carefully_RB that_IN the_DT actual_JJ carriers_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN are_VBP not_RB passed_VBN over_IN ,_, it_PRP may_MD easily_RB degenerate_VB ,_, into_IN the_DT mere_JJ slaughter_NN of_IN the_DT commonest_JJS species_NNS of_IN culex_NN and_CC anopheles_NNS mosquitoes_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT disease-carriers_NNS really_RB aimed_VBN at_IN may_MD almost_RB entirely_RB escape_NN ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB pointed_VBN out_RP also_RB that_IN ,_, filarial_JJ infection_NN is_VBZ not_RB common_JJ in_IN Bombay_NNP and_CC yellow_JJ fever_NN does_VBZ not_RB exist_VB there_RB at_IN present_NN ,_, moreover_RB the_DT breeding_NN places_NNS infected_VBN with_IN the_DT carriers_NNS of_IN malaria_NNS number_NN only_RB about_RB 2,000_CD ,_, and_CC many_JJ of_IN them_PRP are_VBP of_IN such_JJ a_DT nature_NN as_IN easily_RB to_TO be_VB neglected_VBN or_CC passed_VBN over_IN in_IN a_DT campaign_NN directed_VBN against_IN every_DT kind_NN of_IN mosquito_NN ._.
The_DT question_NN of_IN expenditure_NN must_MD be_VB considered_VBN also_RB ,_, and_CC it_PRP must_MD be_VB remembered_VBN that_IN the_DT cost_NN of_IN a_DT strict_JJ anti-malaria_NN campaign_NN ,_, directed_VBD mainly_RB against_IN the_DT carriers_NNS of_IN malaria_NN ,_, is_VBZ likely_JJ to_TO be_VB very_RB much_RB less_JJR than_IN a_DT campaign_NN against_IN all_DT mosquitoes_NNS ,_, which_WDT to_TO be_VB successful_JJ against_IN malaria_NN must_MD be_VB absolutely_RB thorough_JJ ._.

In_IN the_DT chapter_NN on_IN ``_`` The_DT Legal_NNP Aspect_NNP of_IN Mosquito_NNP Prevention_NNP ''_'' the_DT matter_NN has_VBZ been_VBN fully_RB discussed_VBN ,_, and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ only_RB necessary_JJ to_TO point_VB out_RP that_IN ``_`` mosquito_FW breeding_NN ''_'' must_MD be_VB declared_VBN a_DT statutory_JJ ``_`` nuisance_NN ''_'' and_CC power_NN must_MD be_VB given_VBN to_TO the_DT Municipal_NNP Commissioner_NNP ,_, not_RB only_RB to_TO take_VB the_DT necessary_JJ action_NN himself_PRP ,_, but_CC to_TO delegate_VB that_DT power_NN to_TO the_DT Executive_NNP Health_NNP Officer_NNP or_CC a_DT responsible_JJ assistant_NN ._.

468_CD ._.
In_IN the_DT ad_NN interim_JJ report_NN it_PRP was_VBD suggested_VBN that_IN a_DT scheme_NN for_IN registering_VBG and_CC licensing_VBG collections_NNS of_IN water_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN wells_NNS ,_, etc._NN ,_, which_WDT form_VBP potential_JJ breeding_NN places_NNS for_IN the_DT carriers_NNS of_IN malaria_NNS ,_, should_MD form_VB part_NN of_IN the_DT anti-malaria_JJ campaign_NN ._.

In_IN conclusion_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ only_RB necessary_JJ to_TO point_VB out_RP that_DT ,_, as_IN the_DT end_NN to_TO be_VB achieved_VBN is_VBZ the_DT eradication_NN of_IN malaria_NN from_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, permanent_JJ measures_NNS for_IN the_DT protection_NN or_CC abolition_NN of_IN breeding_VBG places_NNS of_IN the_DT malaria-carriers_NNS should_MD have_VB precedence_NN over_IN all_DT others_NNS ._.

470_CD ._.
As_IN regards_NNS the_DT use_NN of_IN quinine_NN ,_, it_PRP has_VBZ already_RB been_VBN pointed_VBN out_RP that_IN ,_, it_PRP must_MD take_VB a_DT subordinate_JJ place_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
But_CC it_PRP should_MD not_RB be_VB entirely_RB neglected_VBN on_IN that_DT account_NN ._.
The_DT data_NN obtained_VBD during_IN the_DT investigation_NN shew_NN ,_, not_RB only_RB that_IN quinine_NN is_VBZ readily_RB welcomed_VBN by_IN the_DT people_NNS when_WRB supplied_VBN in_IN a_DT palatable_JJ form_NN ,_, but_CC that_IN many_JJ of_IN them_PRP will_MD gladly_RB purchase_VB sugar-coated_JJ tablets_NNS if_IN they_PRP know_VBP where_WRB to_TO obtain_VB them_PRP in_IN small_JJ quantities_NNS at_IN a_DT reasonable_JJ price_NN ;_: and_CC shop-keepers_NNS and_CC others_NNS readily_RB become_VB vendors_NNS of_IN sugar-coated_JJ tablets_NNS if_IN they_PRP are_VBP allowed_VBN a_DT sufficient_JJ profit_NN upon_IN them_PRP ._.
471_CD ._.

There_EX is_VBZ reason_NN to_TO suppose_VB that_IN the_DT success_NN of_IN such_PDT a_DT measure_NN would_MD largely_RB depend_VB upon_IN the_DT palatability_NN of_IN the_DT preparation_NN ,_, and_CC on_IN this_DT account_NN sugar-coated_JJ tablets_NNS are_VBP to_TO be_VB greatly_RB recommended_VBN ._.
472_CD ._.
As_IN regards_NNS the_DT gratuitous_JJ distribution_NN of_IN quinine_NN ,_, it_PRP may_MD be_VB pointed_VBN out_RP that_IN this_DT is_VBZ a_DT measure_NN eminently_RB suited_VBN to_TO philanthropic_VB agencies_NNS ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB suggested_VBN that_IN the_DT wealthier_JJR members_NNS among_IN the_DT different_JJ communities_NNS of_IN Bombay_NNP should_MD be_VB asked_VBN to_TO organize_VB for_IN the_DT supply_NN of_IN gratuitous_JJ quiniue_JJ treat-_JJ ment_NN to_TO the_DT poorer_NN people_NNS in_IN the_DT more_RBR malarious_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.
In_IN this_DT way_NN sickness_NN will_MD be_VB lessened_VBN and_CC the_DT larger_JJR work_NN of_IN malaria_NNS prevention_NN be_VB somewhat_RB lightened_JJ ._.
473_CD ._.
Finally_RB it_PRP may_MD be_VB urged_VBN that_IN the_DT measures_NNS that_WDT have_VBP been_VBN suggested_VBN should_MD be_VB given_VBN close_JJ consideration_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ often_RB claimed_VBN that_IN not_RB only_RB is_VBZ Bombay_NNP the_DT wealthiest_JJS City_NNP of_IN India_NNP ,_, but_CC she_PRP is_VBZ the_DT largest_JJS as_IN regards_NNS popu-_JJ lation_NN and_CC the_DT most_RBS advanced_JJ as_IN regards_NNS education_NN and_CC the_DT general_JJ enlightment_NN of_IN her_PRP$ citizens_NNS ._.
She_PRP possesses_VBZ local_JJ self-government_NN ,_, and_CC an_DT up-to-date_JJ munici-_NN pal_JJ administration_NN ,_, and_CC her_PRP$ resources_NNS per_IN head_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN are_VBP far_RB larger_JJR than_IN those_DT of_IN any_DT other_JJ municipality_NN in_IN India_NNP The_DT problem_NN of_IN malaria_NNS pre-_JJ vention_NN in_IN the_DT City_NNP is_VBZ far_RB more_RBR easy_JJ ,_, as_RB far_RB as_IN natural_JJ difficulties_NNS are_VBP concerned_VBN ,_, than_IN that_DT to_TO be_VB faced_VBN in_IN many_JJ other_JJ places_NNS ;_: not_RB only_RB can_MD malaria_VB be_VB reduced_VBN ,_, but_CC it_PRP can_MD be_VB absolutely_RB eradicated_VBN from_IN the_DT greater_JJR part_NN of_IN Bombay_NNP ;_: and_CC the_DT expenditure_NN required_VBN is_VBZ not_RB only_RB well_RB within_IN the_DT means_NNS of_IN the_DT City_NNP ,_, but_CC would_MD amount_VB to_TO less_JJR than_IN a_DT tenth_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT loss_NN occasioned_VBD each_DT year_NN by_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
157_CD APPENDIX_NNP I_PRP ._.
Note_NNP upon_IN the_DT ,_, non-_JJ malarial_JJ fevers_NNS of_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
At_IN one_CD time_NN it_PRP was_VBD customary_JJ to_TO class_NN almost_RB all_DT cases_NNS of_IN febrile_JJ disease_NN met_VBD with_IN in_IN India_NNP as_IN malaria_NN ,_, either_CC under_IN the_DT head_NN of_IN ``_`` Remittent_JJ Fever_NN ''_'' or_CC ``_`` Intermittent_JJ Fever_NN ''_'' (_( Ague_NNP )_) ._.
No_DT doubt_NN many_JJ cases_NNS of_IN non-malarial_JJ fever_NN were_VBD thus_RB included_VBN under_IN the_DT general_JJ heading_NN of_IN malaria_NN ;_: but_CC now-a-days_VBZ the_DT tendency_NN is_VBZ to_TO go_VB to_TO the_DT other_JJ extreme_NN and_CC mild_NN and_CC evanescent_NN fevers_NNS ,_, many_JJ of_IN which_WDT are_VBP undoubtedly_RB due_JJ to_TO malaria_NNS ,_, are_VBP placed_VBN under_IN another_DT heading_NN ._.
By_IN far_RB the_DT largest_JJS proportion_NN of_IN cases_NNS of_IN fever_NN met_VBN with_IN in_IN Bombay_NNP during_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN have_VBP been_VBN cases_NNS of_IN malaria_NN ._.
These_DT cases_NNS have_VBP been_VBN almost_RB all_DT of_IN an_DT intermittent_JJ type_NN and_CC very_RB few_JJ cases_NNS of_IN fever_NN which_WDT would_MD be_VB generally_RB called_VBN ``_`` Remittent_NNP ''_'' or_CC ``_`` Continued_VBN ''_'' ,_, showed_VBD malarial_JJ parasites_NNS on_IN examination_NN of_IN the_DT blood_NN ._.
A_DT few_JJ cases_NNS of_IN Enteric_NNP Fever_NNP have_VBP been_VBN met_VBN with_IN and_CC a_DT rather_RB larger_JJR number_NN of_IN cases_NNS of_IN the_DT so-called_JJ ``_`` Bombay_NNP Fever_NNP ''_'' ,_, a_DT continued_VBN fever_NN lasting_VBG from_IN 5_CD to_TO 10_CD days_NNS ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN remarked_VBN that_IN this_DT latter_JJ type_NN of_IN fever_NN very_RB frequently_RB attacks_VBZ people_NNS who_WP have_VBP gone_VBN to_TO reside_VB in_IN newly_RB built_VBN houses_NNS ._.
In_IN none_NN of_IN the_DT 6,400_CD blood_NN specimens_NNS examined_VBD during_IN the_DT investigation_NN were_VBD the_DT spirilla_NN of_IN Relapsing_VBG Fever_NNP seen_VBN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ interesting_VBG in_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN in_IN 1907_CD and_CC 1908_CD there_EX was_VBD a_DT small_JJ epidemic_NN of_IN relapsing_VBG fever_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN which_WDT was_VBD recorded_VBN by_IN Captain_NNP Mackie_NNP ,_, I._NNP M._NNP S._NNP A_NNP few_JJ cases_NNS of_IN fever_NN which_WDT had_VBD been_VBN reported_VBN as_IN ``_`` Relapsing_VBG Fever_NNP ''_'' on_IN clinical_JJ grounds_NNS ,_, turned_VBD out_RP to_TO be_VB malaria_NNS (_( malignant_JJ tertian_NN )_) upon_IN examination_NN of_IN the_DT blood_NN ._.
Powell_NNP in_IN his_PRP$ paper_NN upon_IN ``_`` the_DT Blood_NNP Examination_NNP of_IN cases_NNS of_IN Febrile_NNP Diseases_NNP in_IN Bombay_NNP ''_'' (_( I._NNP M._NNP G._NNP March_NNP 1901_CD )_) records_VBZ the_DT following_JJ results_NNS in_IN regard_NN to_TO 3,413_CD cases_NNS of_IN ``_`` Fever_NNP ''_'' :_: -_: Diagnosed_VBN by_IN the_DT finding_NN of_IN parasites_NNS in_IN the_DT blood-_NN (_( 1_CD )_) Malaria_NNP parasites_VBZ present_JJ in_IN ..._: ..._: 2,542_CD (_( 2_CD )_) Spirilla_NN of_IN Relapsing_VBG Fever_NNP in_IN ..._: ..._: 94_CD (_( 3_CD )_) Plague_NNP Bacilli_NNP (_( out_IN of_IN 117_CD cases_NNS )_) ..._: ..._: 15_CD (_( 4_CD )_) Filaria_NNP nocturna_FW causing_VBG fever_NN ..._: ..._: 1_CD ________$ 2,652_CD Cases_NNPS in_IN which_WDT blood_NN examination_NN was_VBD negative_JJ ,_, subsequently_RB diagnosed_VBN on_IN other_JJ grounds-_JJ (_( 5_CD )_) Plague_NNP (_( except_IN 15_CD mentioned_VBN above_IN )_) ..._: ..._: 102_CD (_( 6_CD )_) Pneumonia_NN ..._: ..._: ..._: 92_CD (_( 7_CD )_) Tuberculosis_NN ..._: ..._: ..._: 94_CD (_( 8_CD )_) Pleurisy_NNP ,_, Influenza_NNP ,_, Bronchitis_NNP ..._: ..._: 77_CD (_( 9_CD )_) Enteric_NNP Fever_NNP ..._: ..._: ..._: 29_CD (_( 10_CD )_) Gonorrha_NNP ,_, Bubo_NNP and_CC other_JJ form_NN of_IN sepsis_NN ..._: 78_CD (_( 11_CD )_) Syphilitic_JJ Fever_NN ..._: ..._: ..._: 6_CD (_( 12_CD )_) Lepra_NN ..._: ..._: ..._: 4_CD (_( 13_CD )_) Liver_NNP abscess_NN ..._: ..._: ..._: 9_CD (_( 14_CD )_) Small-pox_NN ,_, chicken-pox_NN ,_, measles_NNS ,_, mumps_NNS ,_, tonsil-_JJ litis_NN ,_, etc_FW ._.
..._: ..._: ..._: 60_CD Powell_NNP adds_VBZ that_IN ``_`` In_IN 210_CD cases_NNS the_DT diagnosis_NN was_VBD reduced_VBN to_TO unproved_JJ malaria_NN (_( and_CC undoubtedly_RB the_DT majority_NN were_VBD such_JJ )_) febricula_NN ,_, or_CC simple_JJ continued_JJ fever_NN ._. ''_''
There_EX are_VBP strong_JJ grounds_NNS for_IN assuming_VBG that_DT tuberculosis_NN ,_, plague_NN ,_, pneumonia_NN and_CC respiratory_NN diseases_NNS are_VBP responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT largest_JJS number_NN of_IN so-called_JJ ``_`` Remittent_JJ Fevers_NNS ''_'' met_VBN with_IN in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
Tuberculosis_NN is_VBZ exceedingly_RB common_JJ ,_, many_JJ cases_NNS having_VBG been_VBN met_VBN with_IN during_IN the_DT investigation_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB exceedingly_RB fatal_JJ ,_, especially_RB when_WRB it_PRP occurs_VBZ among_IN people_NNS of_IN the_DT poorer_NN classes_VBZ ;_: and_CC there_EX are_VBP good_JJ reasons_NNS for_IN believing_VBG that_IN a_DT very_RB large_JJ proportion_NN of_IN the_DT deaths_NNS recorded_VBN under_IN the_DT heading_NN ``_`` Remittent_JJ fever_NN ''_'' are_VBP due_JJ to_TO this_DT cause_NN ._.
As_IN regards_NNS the_DT non-fatal_JJ short-term_JJ fevers_NNS prevalent_VBP in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, it_PRP has_VBZ already_RB been_VBN pointed_VBN out_RP that_IN ,_, the_DT largest_JJS proportion_NN show_NN the_DT presence_NN of_IN malarial_JJ parasites_NNS on_IN blood_NN examination_NN ;_: but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ probable_JJ that_IN the_DT existence_NN of_IN other_JJ specific_JJ fevers_NNS such_JJ as_IN the_DT recently_RB discovered_VBN ``_`` Sand-fly_JJ Fever_NNP ''_'' may_MD account_VB for_IN a_DT proportion_NN of_IN the_DT non-malarial_JJ fevers_NNS that_WDT are_VBP met_VBN with_IN ;_: and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ that_IN fevers_NNS of_IN this_DT kind_NN may_MD be_VB not_RB uncommon_JJ in_IN Mahim_NNP and_CC other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT island_NN ,_, where_WRB malaria_NN is_VBZ prevalent_JJ to_TO only_RB a_DT slight_JJ extent_NN ._.
Kala-azar_NNP does_VBZ not_RB appear_VB to_TO occur_VB in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, and_CC no_DT case_NN has_VBZ been_VBN met_VBN with_IN in_IN a_DT person_NN belonging_VBG to_TO the_DT City_NNP ;_: but_CC a_DT boy_NN from_IN Bengal_NNP suffering_VBG from_IN Kala-azar_NNP was_VBD admitted_VBN to_TO one_CD of_IN the_DT hospitals_NNS in_IN the_DT City_NNP ._.
The_DT diagnosis_NN was_VBD confirmed_VBN by_IN the_DT finding_NN of_IN Leishman-_NNP Donovan_NNP parasites_VBZ after_IN splenic_JJ puncture_NN ._.
B_NNP 136-40_JJ 158_CD APPENDIX_NNP II_NNP ._.
Note_NNP upon_IN Black-water_NNP Fever_NNP in_IN Bombay_NNP ._.
Occasionally_RB cases_NNS of_IN Black-water_NNP fever_NN are_VBP admitted_VBN to_TO hospitals_NNS in_IN Bombay_NNP ;_: but_CC in_IN the_DT majority_NN of_IN instances_NNS the_DT patients_NNS do_VBP not_RB appear_VB to_TO have_VB belonged_VBN to_TO the_DT City_NNP ._.
During_IN the_DT investigation_NN however_RB ,_, two_CD fatal_JJ cases_NNS of_IN what_WP appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN undoubted_JJ Black-water_JJ fever_NN were_VBD reported_VBN ._.
In_IN neither_DT case_NN was_VBD the_DT disease_NN returned_VBD as_IN Hmo-_NNP globinuria_NN ._.
Unfortunately_RB neither_DT of_IN the_DT cases_NNS was_VBD seen_VBN ,_, but_CC a_DT few_JJ particulars_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT medical_JJ men_NNS who_WP attended_VBD ._.
One_CD case_NN occurred_VBD in_IN the_DT Frere_NNP Road_NNP and_CC the_DT other_JJ in_IN the_DT North_NNP Fort_NNP ,_, both_DT of_IN which_WDT areas_NNS are_VBP intensely_RB malarious_JJ ._.
Both_DT cases_NNS were_VBD children_NNS ,_, one_CD a_DT Jewish_JJ boy_NN aged_VBD 7_CD and_CC the_DT other_JJ a_DT Parsi_NNP child_NN ._.
The_DT Jewish_JJ boy_NN had_VBD two_CD attacks_NNS ,_, a_DT second_JJ one_CD only_RB a_DT month_NN after_IN the_DT 1st_CD ._.
He_PRP had_VBD suffered_VBN from_IN fever_NN and_CC had_VBD a_DT large_JJ spleen_NN ._.
During_IN an_DT attack_NN of_IN fever_NN and_CC after_IN treatment_NN with_IN quinine_NN he_PRP was_VBD suddenly_RB attacked_VBN with_IN persistent_JJ bilious_JJ vomiting_NN ,_, had_VBD a_DT rigor_NN and_CC passed_VBD reddish-black_NN urine_NN ._.
Next_JJ day_NN he_PRP was_VBD seen_VBN to_TO be_VB intensely_RB anaemic_JJ and_CC jaundiced_VBD ._.
He_PRP rallied_VBD rapidly_RB but_CC a_DT month_NN later_RB fever_RB again_RB occurred_JJ and_CC during_IN treatment_NN with_IN quinine_NN a_DT sudden_JJ return_NN of_IN the_DT former_JJ symptoms_NNS took_VBD place_NN ._.
This_DT time_NN he_PRP did_VBD not_RB rally_RB ,_, but_CC sank_VBD with_IN symptoms_NNS of_IN heart_NN failure_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT other_JJ case_NN there_EX was_VBD a_DT similar_JJ history_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT patient_NN died_VBD of_IN suppression_NN of_IN urine_NN during_IN the_DT attack_NN ._.
In_IN another_DT fatal_JJ case_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN which_WDT occurred_VBD in_IN hospital_NN in_IN 1910_CD ,_, all_DT that_DT could_MD be_VB learned_VBN was_VBD the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT patient_NN was_VBD a_DT European_JJ ,_, and_CC had_VBD previously_RB lived_VBN in_IN Burma_NNP ._.
No_DT particulars_NNS could_MD be_VB obtained_VBN as_IN to_TO the_DT length_NN of_IN his_PRP$ stay_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP or_CC his_PRP$ place_NN of_IN residence_NN ,_, A_NNP definite_JJ history_NN of_IN Black-water_NNP fever_NN was_VBD obtained_VBN from_IN a_DT European_NNP who_WP lived_VBD at_IN one_CD time_NN not_RB far_RB from_IN Bombay_NNP in_IN a_DT small_JJ village_NN reputed_VBN to_TO be_VB very_RB malarious_JJ ._.
These_DT facts_NNS are_VBP recorded_VBN ,_, as_IN they_PRP have_VBP a_DT definite_JJ bearing_NN upon_IN the_DT relationship_NN of_IN Black-water_NNP fever_NN to_TO exposure_VB to_TO frequent_JJ infections_NNS by_IN malaria_NNS ._.
